Just go to the hospital and let’s just get that thing…pushed back in.ScenesJoey: Thank you, but it would take me forever to pay you that money back and I don’t want that hanging over my head. Okay? Besides, as soon as my insurance kicks in I can get all the free operations I want! Yeah, I’m thinking I’ll probably start with that laser eye surgery too.Scenes(Phoebe enters.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: What’s going on?ScenesChandler: Oh Joey’s got a really bad hernia, but that’s nothing a little laser eye surgery won’t fix!ScenesJoey: Look, I’m telling you if I put my hand on my stomach right here (He puts his hand down his pants, like Al Bundy on Married…With Children always used to do.) it doesn’t hurt that bad.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Maybe you’ll die!ScenesJoey: Sure, now I’m scared.ScenesPhoebe: No, we can go together! Just don’t wait too long though, okay? ‘Cause I’m outta here sometime before Friday.ScenesJoey: Yeah, but I don’t wanna die!ScenesPhoebe: No-no, it’ll be fun! We can come back and we can haunt these guys!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are having a tug-of-war over the disputed candlesticks.]
rows.Content: Monica: Gimme ‘em!ScenesRachel: No! They are mine!ScenesMonica: You stole them from me!ScenesRachel: You stole them from me!!ScenesMonica: Gimme them!Scenes(With one last mighty tug the combatants lose their grip and split, each holding one candlestick.)ScenesMonica: You just wanna each take one?ScenesRachel: Yeah that seems fair. We never use them.ScenesRoss: (entering) Look, I really need some help, okay? Why? Why did I have to speak in a British accent?! What do I do?ScenesRachel: Well…ScenesMonica: Why don’t you phase it out? Yeah, fade the accent out and people will think you’re, y’know, that you’re adjusting to life in America.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I mean, come on Ross, no one will even notice. I mean they’re probably not even listening!ScenesRoss: They’re not listening too me?ScenesRachel: Of course they’re listening to you! Everybody listens to you.ScenesRoss: Monica you really think I should try this phasing out thing?ScenesMonica: I think you look fine.

rows.Scenes: Casting Director #1’s office, Joey is on his first audition. His partner is an 8-year-old boy.]
rows.Content: Casting Director #1: Whenever you’re ready.ScenesJoey: (in a gravely, painful voice) Okay. "Hey, Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you.ScenesCasting Director #1: Hold it. I’m sorry, the surprise is a new swing set, if you could play it a little less…intense?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure, no problem, I’ll just—hold on one second. (He turns around and puts his hand in his pants and groans in relief.) (In a relaxed voice.) "Hey Timmy, I’ve got a surprise for you!ScenesCasting Director #1: Oh my God!!Scenes(Joey pulls his hand out and reverts back to intense pain.)

rows.Scenes: Casting Director #2’s office, Joey is on his second audition. This one is for Purina One Dog Chow, an actual item. Please note the gratuitous product placement.]
rows.Content: Joey: So that’s why I feed my dog Purina One! Pick up a bag today! (He turns, looks at the bag and realizes he won’t be able to pick it up.)ScenesCasting Director #2: That’s where you pick up the bag.ScenesJoey: Exactly.ScenesCasting Director #2: No, the line is pick a bag, so you need to pick up the bag.ScenesJoey: Or, I could just point to it! Huh? Blah, blah, blah, Purina One, point to a bag today. (She just looks at him.) I didn’t get it, did I?ScenesCasting Director #2: No.ScenesJoey: Yeah, okay. (Leaves)

rows.Scenes: Casting Director #3’s office, Joey is entering.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hi. I’m Joey Tribbiani; I’m here to audition for (Groans) man.ScenesCasting Director #3: You mean dying man?ScenesJoey: Yes!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are playing phone pranks on Ross.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, come on, do it one more time!ScenesRachel: Really? Really?!ScenesMonica: Yes!ScenesRachel: Okay! (Picks up the phone and starts dialing.) (In an Irish accent) "Hello Ross, this is Dr. McNeeley from the Fake Accent University, we’d like you to come on board with us full time! (Hangs up.)ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Listen to this! My reading was wrong, I’m not going die!ScenesRachel: Really?! How do you know?ScenesPhoebe: Because my psychic is dead! She must’ve read the cards wrong!ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Eh, better her than me! Hey, let’s bake cookies!

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, Joey has won the part of dying man and is now able to play the role he was injured for. Chandler is helping to carry him in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Listen, I’m really glad you got the part.ScenesJoey: (barely audible through the pain) Thank you.ScenesChandler: But are you sure you can do this?ScenesJoey: Yeah! And hey, thanks for coming with me. And thanks again for helping me take a shower.Scenes(Chandler steps away quickly.)ScenesChandler: Now, is that never talking about it again?!ScenesJoey: (to the director) Hiya!ScenesThe Director: Hey Joey, we’re ready for ya! (Joey stumbles over) Joey, this is Alex he’s going to be playing your son.ScenesJoey: Hi Alex! (to the director) And uh, as you can see my hands are not in my pants. (Holds them both up.)ScenesThe Director: Okay. (to Alex) All right uh, Alex now when Joey says his line, "Take good care of your Momma son," that’s your cue to cry. Got it? (Alex nods yes.) All right, let’s do this.Scenes(Joey lies down on the gurney.)ScenesA Crew Member: (with that board thingy) Scene 5, take 1.ScenesThe Director: And Action!ScenesJoey: "Take could care of your Momma son." (Alex just looks at him and the director motions for him to continue so he tries it again.) "Take could care of your Momma son." (Alex does nothing.) "Come on son! Your Momma’s good people!ScenesThe Director: Cut! Alex, remember you’re supposed to cry. Can you cry for us this time?ScenesAlex: Okay.ScenesThe Director: All right, from the top.ScenesA Crew Member: Scene 5, take 2.Scenes[Time lapse.]ScenesA Crew Member: Take 36 is up!ScenesThe Director: All right! Let’s try this again! You ready Joe?ScenesJoey: Ah, just one thing umm, is it all right with you if I, if I scream right up until you say action?ScenesThe Director: Uh sure.ScenesJoey: Okay. (Starts screaming.)ScenesThe Director: Action!ScenesJoey: (he stops screaming at action) "Take good care of your Momma son." (Again Alex does nothing.)ScenesThe Director: Cut!!!!!!!!!! (Joey starts screaming again.)Scenes(Chandler decides to help out.)ScenesChandler: I’m sorry! Hey-hey Joe, why don’t you uh, lift up your shirt? (He does.) Take a look at this kiddo. (Alex finally starts crying.) We have a crying child! Roll the damn cameras!

rows.Scenes: Ross and Rachel’s apartment, Rachel is unpacking as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (answering it) Hello?ScenesRussell: (Ross’s divorce lawyer.) Hello, is Ross there?ScenesRachel: Uh no, he’s not. Can I take a message?ScenesRussell: Yes, this Russell, Ross’s divorce lawyer, just tell him that since I haven’t heard from him, I assume he’s decided to give the marriage a try.ScenesRachel: Ross got married again—Nooooooo!!!!!!!!!

rows.Scenes: a NYU lecture hall, Ross is trying to phase out his accent.]
rows.Content: Ross: (in his head) All right, keep going. We are phasing the accent out, phasing it out. So without out re-testing the results in the laboratory (pronounced the British way) the team would never have identified (British) the initial errors in their carbon dating analysis (British). Were there any questions at this point? (One student raises his hand.) Yes. (Points to him.)ScenesA Student: What’s happening to your accent?ScenesRoss: (British) Come again? What’s-what’s this nonsense? (Giggles.) (American.) All right, I’m-I’m not English. I’m from Long Island. I was really nervous and the accent just uh, just came out. I’m sorry. So, if we could just get back to the lecture. Umm, were there any questions? (Everyone raises their hands) About paleontology. (They all put their hands down.) All right, look I was just trying to make a good first impression. Obviously, I screwed up. But what you guys think of me is really important because I’m-I’m hoping to get a permanent job here. So if you just give me another chance to make a good impression…Scenes(At this moment Rachel bursts through the door. Needless to say, she’s not in the best of moods having just found out Ross’s dirty little secret.)ScenesRachel: Ross!! Are you crazy?! I am still your wife!! What, were you just never gonna tell me?!! What the hell is wrong with you?!!!! Ugh, I could just kill you!!!!ScenesRoss: (in the accent again) Well, hello Rachel!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is holding a football helmet; and apparently, in a rather disgusting scene, Joey wants Phoebe to beat him senseless. (Luckily it isn’t a long trip.) Because he’s made a miraculous recovery from his hernia and wants to take advantage of all those free surgeries he can get now since he’s re-established his health insurance.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Have you really done this before?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! You just take a big, big swing. Now, don’t hold back. (He dons his protective helmet (Why, I have no clue.) and Phoebe picks up a wooden baseball bat and starts to swing as Chandler and Monica enter.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey!ScenesChandler: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: We’re just celebrating that Joey got his health insurance back.ScenesChandler: Oh, all right.Scenes(Decided that they are less than human as well, Chandler picks up a golf club and Monica a frying pan, to join in on the fun of beating their good friend to within an inch of his life!)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s PorscheScenesWritten by: Perry Rein & Gigi McCreeryScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there except for Rachel and Ross, who both come storming in. Rachel is still going off about Ross’s secret marriage.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I cannot believe that you didn’t tell me that we are still married!!ScenesRoss: Look I was going to tell you!ScenesRachel: When?! After the birth of our first secret child?! (To All) Ross didn’t get the annulment; we are still married.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: You’re kidding!ScenesPhoebe: (overdoing it) Oh my God!!ScenesMonica: Ross!ScenesRoss: Okay, maybe it wasn’t my best decision. But I just couldn’t face another failed marriage.ScenesChandler: Okay, let me just jump in and ask, at what point did you think this was a successful marriage?ScenesRoss: Rach, come on, if you think about it, it’s actually kinda funny. (He laughs, and he laughs alone.) Okay, maybe it’s best not to think about it.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, this is inexcusable. I am shocked to my very core!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, I told her you already knew.ScenesPhoebe: Another lie. You have a sickness!ScenesChandler: Ross, just for my own piece of mind, you’re not married to anymore of us are ya?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Monica are at the counter getting some more coffee.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh! Hey, somebody left their keys. (Looks at them) Ooohh, to a Porsche! {Transcriber’s note: Oh come on! Who would leave the keys to their Porsche behind? If I had a Porsche, I’d have the keys surgically attached to my hand!} Hey Gunther, these yours?ScenesGunther: Yeah, that’s what I drive. I make four bucks an hour, I saved up for 350 years!ScenesJoey: Na-uh! (To everyone there) Hey did anybody lose their keys?ScenesMonica: Joey, why don’t you put them in the lost and found?ScenesJoey: There’s a lost and found? (Gunther sets the box up on the table.) My shoe! (Grabs it out of the box.)ScenesChandler: You left a shoe here?!ScenesJoey: Well, I didn’t realize until I got home. I wasn’t gonna walk all the way back down here with one shoe! Y’know what? I’m gonna go find that guy’s car and leave a note on the windshield. (Goes to do so.)ScenesChandler: Oh good, when he comes back for his keys, I’ll be sure to give him your shoe.ScenesJoey: Great! Thanks. (Exits.)ScenesPhoebe: (coming in from the bathroom) Oh, good, good, you guys are here! Listen, how would like to spend tomorrow taking care of three incredibly cute little puppies?!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, what a fun day! That sounds great!ScenesChandler: (not enthused) Yeah, all right.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well I’ll bring them by tomorrow morning. Okay, and uh, by the way, they’re not actually puppies, they’re Frank and Alice’s triplets. Okay, see ya! (Exits.)ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa-whoa! What?ScenesPhoebe: (stops) Please! Please! Please! Please! Oh please! Please! Please! Frank and Alice asked me to baby sit the triplets and I’m nervous ‘cause I’ve never done that before by myself!ScenesMonica: Don’t worry about it Phoebe, we’ll absolutely do it.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m gonna pass. ‘Cause I was kinda iffy when it was puppies.ScenesMonica: Come on Chandler, come on! It’ll give us great practice for when—(realizes what she’s about to say and changes)—people with babies come to visit.

rows.Scenes: The street down the block from Central Perk, Joey has found the Porsche and is writing the note.]
rows.Content: Guy #1: Nice car!ScenesJoey: Yeah, it’s not mine.ScenesWoman: (walking up) I love your car.ScenesJoey: Yeah, it’s (looks up and sees the woman) mine.ScenesWoman: I bet it’s fast.ScenesJoey: Me too! Yeah. And comfortable. Do uh, do you like leather seats?ScenesWoman: Yeah!ScenesJoey: (checks in the window to make sure it has them) It’s got ‘em!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Rachel are having tea.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So, I still have boxes here. I still have boxes at Ross’s, and I have nowhere to live! Wow. I could so easily freak out right now.ScenesPhoebe: What about me? I just found out that Denise is leaving town for a while, I don’t have a roommate.ScenesRachel: Well, maybe-maybe I could be your roommate Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe you could be my roommate!ScenesRachel: Well there’s an idea!!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: That would be great! Wait, how long is Denise gone for?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, she said she’d be back December 26th.ScenesRachel: December 26th, huh maybe she’s Santa Clause.Scenes(Phoebe laughs, then stops to think about it. Ross enters.)ScenesRachel: (deadpan) Oh look who it is, my husband. The apple of my eye.ScenesRoss: Okay, I got us a court date for tomorrow at 2:00 and I picked up all the forms. I’ll take care of everything.ScenesRachel: Well sure, if you say you’re gonna take care of everything I have no reason to doubt you. Give me those forms! (Grabs them from him.) All right, now I’m gonna do this my way and I don’t want to hear a peep out of you!ScenesRoss: Okay Rach, but…ScenesRachel: Op! You’re peeping!Scenes(Ross grunts something and hands her the pen he was trying to hand her.)ScenesRachel: Ross! Y’know what, I just got—why? Why did you do this?!ScenesRoss: Look I told you…ScenesRachel: I don’t wanna hear "Three failed marriages!ScenesRoss: Look, if you’d had two failed marriages, you’d understand!ScenesRachel: Well, y’know what? Thanks to you I’m half way there! Ugh! Oh! I am so mad! Ross, I don’t think I have ever been this angry!ScenesRoss: What about the time I said we were on a break?ScenesRachel: Ugh! (Stares at him.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next day, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are baby-sitting the triplets. They each have one baby.]
rows.Content: Monica: Pheebs, how’s it going?ScenesPhoebe: (rapidly) I’m doing okay. I think it’s going well. Do you think they’re having fun? Am I talking to fast?ScenesMonica: Nope, sound like me. Pheebs, it’s going great. Look at Chandler with little baby girl Chandler.ScenesChandler: Little baby girl Chandler, where I have heard that before? Oh right, Coach Ruben. (Tries to get her to drink a little more from the bottle when he suddenly smells something. It’s times like these I’m glad Smell-O-Vision hasn’t been invented.) Do you know what Pheebs? When you’re done over there, we kinda have a situation over here too. (Phoebe is changing hers.)ScenesPhoebe: Na-uh, no, we are all responsible for our own babies.ScenesChandler: See that’s where I think that you’re wrong. We’ve been playing these babies man for man; we should really be playing a zone defense.ScenesMonica: What do you mean?ScenesChandler: I just think that things would go a lot smoother if we each have our own zone. Phoebe, you can be in charge of wiping. And y’know Mon, you can be in charge of diapering and I can be in charge of looking how cute they are when they put their hands around… (He degrades into baby talk, but he means when they grab his finger.)ScenesPhoebe: That sounds really great, but maybe you should be in charge of wiping.ScenesChandler: Okay, I’m a rookie. I should not be in the end zone.Scenes[Time lapse, they have set up a little assembly line for diaper changes. Phoebe wipes, Chandler adds the powder, begrudgingly, and Monica puts the diaper on.]ScenesMonica: This is so great! This is exactly how we set the plates at the restaurant.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah? (Checking the final diaper) Well this is not what I ordered.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey babies! Oh, I’m having the best morning. That uh, that Porsche I’ve got the keys too, still there!ScenesChandler: Shocking! Since you still have the keys.ScenesJoey: You should see the treatment I get when I’m with that car! People are friendly; they-they wanna talk, and not just about the car! One guy gave me advice about my equity investments.ScenesChandler: What equity investments?ScenesJoey: The ones that got me the Porsche! Will you keep up! (Chandler wipes his forehead with a baby wipe, that might have been used. He drops it disgustedly.) But I figured, if-if people keep seeing me just standing there, they’re gonna start to think that I don’t own it. So I figured I’ll wash it. Right? Monica, you got a bucket and some soap I can borrow?ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, I got soap and sponges and rags and Carnuba wax and polishing compound.ScenesChandler: You don’t even have a car!ScenesMonica: I know. But umm, one time there was this really dirty car in front of the building, so I washed it.ScenesChandler: And?ScenesMonica: And six others.ScenesChandler: There you are.

rows.Scenes: The Porsche, Joey is finishing up washing the car and is talking to a guy about the car.]
rows.Content: Joey: Yeah, she tops out at 130.ScenesGuy #2: Wow!ScenesJoey: And that’s just in the city. I get her up to 160 when I take her upstate.ScenesGuy #2: Really! You got a place upstate?ScenesJoey: Sure!ScenesGuy #2: Well, I’ll see you later.ScenesJoey: Okay, take it easy.ScenesThe Porsche Owner: Hey! That’s my car.ScenesJoey: Really? Oh uh, oh just give me five more minutes with it.ScenesThe Porsche Owner: What-what are you doing?ScenesJoey: Oh I-I uh, found the keys and now I’m just polishing her up.ScenesThe Porsche Owner: But it’s my car!ScenesJoey: Yeah, but it’s my wax.ScenesThe Porsche Owner: Listen, I-I-I don’t come to this city much so I don’t know if you’re crazy or this is some kind of street theater, but could I have my keys.ScenesJoey: Sure. Here. (He hands them over.) I’ll uh, save your parking spot.ScenesThe Porsche Owner: I’m not coming back.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesThe Porsche Owner: I live upstate.ScenesJoey: Yeah, so did I.Scenes(The guy gets in and drives off.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the triplets are all in their crib as Monica and Phoebe watch them.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: I don’t know why I was so nervous about this. And I don’t know why Frank and Alice are always complaining. This is so easy.ScenesMonica: Yeah, two hours, a lifetime that’s the same.ScenesChandler: (entering) Check it out! Check it out! When the babies wake up, they can meet Krog! (He holds up this Xena-like warrior action figure.)ScenesMonica: Chandler, what are you doing? That thing can put someone’s eye out!ScenesChandler: He can do more than that! He can destroy the universe!ScenesPhoebe: No Chandler, they can swallow one of those little parts! And also, look at his smooth area, that’s just gonna mess them up.ScenesChandler: They’re not gonna swallow anything, you guys are being way over protective. When I was a kid, my mom used to just throw me into a pile of broken glass!ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesChandler: Glass, sand, whatever. (Walks out as Monica and Phoebe turn to check on the babies again.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, look at little Leslie stretching in her sleep.ScenesMonica: Oh it’s so cute. I wonder what age it is when you stop being able to put both legs over your head.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I can still do that.ScenesMonica: How are you still single?!ScenesChandler: (entering) All right. (Clears throat) I thought about it and maybe you’re right. Maybe Krog is not a safe toy.ScenesMonica: Good. What made you change your mind?ScenesChandler: I swallowed the sonic blaster gun.ScenesPhoebe: How did that happen?!!ScenesChandler: Well, I was trying to prove that I was right. Y’know? And it turns out I was wrong. And now it’s lodged in my throat. (Mimics a cat trying to cough up a hairball.) (He does it again.)ScenesMonica: Damnit! Y’know this whole time we were concentrating on watching the babies and, and no one was watching Chandler! (He does it again.)

rows.Scenes: A judge’s chambers, Rachel and Ross are filing their annulment papers.]
rows.Content: Judge: Okay you two are asking the court for an annulment?ScenesRachel: Yes your honor, and here are, are forms, all filled out.ScenesJudge: So based on your petition you are seeking an annulment on the grounds that Mr. Geller is mentally unstable.ScenesRoss: Fine, I’m mentally unstable.ScenesJudge: And based on the fact that Mr. Geller is intravenous drug user.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Uh yes, heroin and crack.ScenesRoss: Crack isn’t even an intravenous drug!ScenesRachel: Well, you would know.ScenesJudge: Now it also says here that you lied about your sexual preference before marriage?ScenesRoss: Oh, come on!ScenesRachel: (starts to cry) Ross, please, I found the magazines!ScenesJudge: And finally that you were unable to consummate the marriage. Well, that makes sense since you’re gay and addicted to heroin.ScenesRoss: Okay, I’m sorry, this is insane! I-I-I’m not addicted to heroin, I’m not gay, and there is no problem with my ability to consummate anything! Look, I’ll consummate this marriage right here, right now!ScenesJudge: That won’t be necessary.ScenesRoss: And when we were dating we consummated like bunnies!ScenesRachel: Ugh!ScenesJudge: Now if you were two involved in a serious relationship, that really creates a problem.ScenesRachel: Ross! Your honor, rest assured relationship ended like two years ago! (To the stenographer) And could you strike "Consummated like bunnies" from the record?ScenesJudge: Is there, anything in this record that is actually true?ScenesRachel: Well, yes, we got married in Vegas and uh, and the names I think.ScenesJudge: Well, based on what I heard, you two certainly don’t qualify for an annulment. If you two don’t want to be together you’ll have to file for divorce.ScenesRoss: (stands up) That’s great! Are you happy now? Look what you did with your funny, funny form!ScenesRachel: (stands up as well) What?! Me?! What about you and your consummated like bunnies nonsense!ScenesRoss: And what—(notices the stenographer is still typing)—What are you typing that for? Did you hear what she said? We don’t get the annulment. Don’t type that! What?! Stop typing! (He goes over to where the stenographer is typing and in the process pushes Rachel out of his way.) Hey! Stop typing! (He’s still typing.) Stop typing! Stop typing!!ScenesRachel: (to the judge) Okay, do you see, do you see what you’re keeping me married too?!ScenesJudge: You need to get out of my chambers.ScenesRachel: All right look lady here is the deal, I came here for an annulment and I am not leaving here until I get one!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesJudge: Would you like to spend the night in jail?ScenesRachel: And thank you for your time. (They both beat a hasty retreat.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is still doing the hairball thing as Monica and Phoebe are watching the babies. I can’t describe it, you’ll have to see it when it comes on in your area.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering wearing nothing but Porsche clothes) So the Porsche guy took his car back.ScenesChandler: But you found the keys to his clothes?ScenesJoey: No. No, I just uh, I just loved the way it feels when everybody thinks I own a Porsche.ScenesMonica: And people will think you own a Porsche because you’re wearing the clothes?ScenesJoey: Of course! Only an idiot would wear this stuff if you didn’t have the car! Right?ScenesChandler: That is true.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but only a genius would swallow a sonic blaster gun.ScenesJoey: Oh, I’ve been there. Yeah, I am gonna go drive my Porsche. (Starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: Joey, you know you don’t actually have one.ScenesJoey: Come on! What are you doing?! I’m in character! Would you talk to her! (Storms out.)ScenesChandler: Ahh, I think it just moved. It’s really poking me.ScenesMonica: All right, that’s it, we’re going to the emergency room.ScenesPhoebe: What?! No, you can’t, you can’t leave me here with them! We’re baby-sitting!ScenesMonica: The babies are asleep, I’m sure you’ll be okay on your own for a while!ScenesPhoebe: But you-you can’t leave me with them! We-we’re a team! We’re playing a zone! They’re gonna triple team me!ScenesMonica: He’s got something plastic lodged in his throat, we’ve got to go to the hospital.ScenesPhoebe: But no, because a doctor won’t be able to help him, it’s just gonna y’know naturally pass through his system in like seven years.ScenesChandler: I think that’s gum.ScenesPhoebe: I’m pretty sure it’s gun.ScenesChandler: Okay, listen this really hurts. Let’s go.ScenesPhoebe: A real man wouldn’t just run to the hospital! (They don’t stop.) No! What would, what would Krog do? (They ignore her and Phoebe is left alone.)

rows.Scenes: The street, Joey is hanging out wearing his Porsche grab.]
rows.Content: Joey: Why isn’t that valet back with my Porsche?ScenesPasserby: Maybe because you’ve got the keys?ScenesJoey: (to women passing him) Porsche.Scenes(Ross and Rachel approach, they’re still yelling at each other.)ScenesRachel: This is totally your fault!ScenesRoss: My fault?! You threatened the judge!ScenesRachel: Well, you ripped the paper out of the court reporter’s machine!!ScenesRoss: That was the only way I could get him to stop typing!ScenesJoey: Hi! How are the Gellers?ScenesRachel: Don’t call us that! (Storms away)ScenesRoss: The judge wouldn’t let us get an annulment! Now we gotta get a divorce!! Did a Porsch throw up on you? (Walks on.)ScenesJoey: Hey! It’s Porsche!! (He’s right y’know.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is being triple teamed.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Me taking care of you is no problem, huh? You guys feel safe. Right? Okay, I’m gonna take that spit bubble as, "Yeah, I do!" Okay, after I get rid of this dirty diaper Leslie, I’ll set you up with a clean one. (She throws it at the garbage without looking, misses, and knocks over a vase and flowers, which fall to the floor and break.) Okay, I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to scare you. I just have to clean that up. Okay? ‘Cause let’s face it, we’re at Monica’s. (She crawls over, disposes of the diaper, picks up the flowers, and the vase.) I broke it. All right. Well, that’s just the way that goes. (She throws out both the flowers and the vase.) Okay, good. (She turns around and only counts two babies.) Why are there only two of you? Where is Leslie? Well, you can’t answer. (She starts looking for her) Leslie? Where are you Leslie? Leslie, now would be a good time for your first words! (She turns around and finds that Leslie has managed to crawl into the bottom drawer of the TV cabinet.) Well, look at you! Hey! You are a little bit mischievous! My gosh! (She picks her up and notices a surprise is waiting in the drawer.) Oh, you’re a lot mischievous! Well, it’ll dry. (Closes the drawer with her foot.) (To Leslie) Okay, you sit with your brother and sister now—who aren’t there! (They both have disappeared as well.)Scenes[Time Lapse, the babies are finally asleep. Good for Phoebe! The only problem is, Monica’s apartment looks like a tornado, a hurricane, a swarm of locusts, fire, brimstone, hail, and giant man-eating, radioactive ants have torn the place apart. Needless to say, it’s messy enough to cause Monica to die of shock right away. Parents with small children know what I’m talking about.]ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (exhausted) How do you feel?ScenesChandler: Well, let’s just say that Krog will be fully equipped to destroy the universe again in twelve to fourteen hours.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so I totally took care of the babies all by myself! I fed ‘em, bathed ‘em, and put ‘em to bed.ScenesChandler: And protected them from a tornado?Scenes(Monica enters and her jaw drops in horror.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God.ScenesPhoebe: I know, the babies are asleep.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, what, what happened here?!ScenesPhoebe: I did it! I took care of the babies all by myself!ScenesMonica: But my apartment!ScenesChandler: Was the setting of Phoebe’s triumph.ScenesMonica: But the mess!ScenesChandler: Is not as important as the fact that Phoebe took care of the babies all by herself.ScenesMonica: You’re right, you’re right I shouldn’t freak out. ‘Cause this is what will happen when you and I have babies! When will that be?!ScenesChandler: (pause) Phoebe, would you take a look at this mess!!!!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is packing what she still has over there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (deadpan) Oh honey thank God you’re home, I was getting worried.ScenesRoss: I picked up the divorce papers. Uh, I’ve already signed everything and I put little ‘X’s where you need to sign.ScenesRachel: Oh, little ‘X’s! Great! That makes up for everything!ScenesRoss: Y’know, I-I—you’ve done a lot of stupid stuff too! Okay?ScenesRachel: Oh, name one stupid thing that is as stupid as this one!ScenesRoss: Okay, how about you flew to London to stop my wedding! Ah, how about you told me you loved me after I was already married!ScenesRachel: Hey! Wait a minute! That was different! I did those things because I was in love with you!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Right!Scenes(Pause.)ScenesRoss: You’re right. That’s very different. So let’s, let’s just sign the papers. All right? (Sits down and Rachel keeps standing there.) What?ScenesRachel: Nothing. (Sits down.)ScenesRoss: Okay, can we just sign please?ScenesRachel: Uh-hmm. (Just as Rachel finishes signing her name, Ross yanks each page out of the way.)ScenesRoss: Congratulations. (Gets up to leave.)ScenesRachel: Okay Ross, we’re—wait a minute. Umm, I uh, I kinda have a little confession.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Well, y’know this whole marriage thing, kinda my idea.ScenesRoss: Excuse me?ScenesRachel: Well, remember how we were too drunk to remember anything the night we were married?ScenesRoss: Yeah?ScenesRachel: And uh, yeah, I didn’t really, I didn’t want to say anything, but it kinda it just, it kinda kept coming back to me, and umm, remember we were in the casino and for some reason thought it would be funny to eat a lot of grapes. And uh, and I thought it would be funnier if we got married. So as a, as a compromise we decided first to get married, and then (Ross joins in) to eat a lot of grapes. So umm, sorry I got us into this mess.ScenesRoss: So then if-if—I mean if you think about it, this is all (Pause.) your fault.ScenesRachel: Yeah, don’t push it though.ScenesRoss: I’ve got to say; I know I divorce a lot of women, never thought I would be divorcing you.ScenesRachel: I know. I always thought if you and I got married, it would be the one that stuck. And it wouldn’t be a secret, and we wouldn’t have our wedding dinner at Pizza Hut. (They both laugh.)ScenesRoss: Did I, did I even treat?ScenesRachel: No, it was on the house, it was, it was a newlywed special.ScenesRoss: That may be the most depressing thing I’ve heard in my life. I should probably get these to my lawyer’s office.ScenesRachel: Hey, thanks Ross, for taking care of all of this.ScenesRoss: Eh, no problem.Scenes(They hug.)ScenesRachel: I’m gonna need a copy of those.ScenesRoss: Totally. (Exits.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The street, Joey is messing with a car cover and still wearing the Porsche stuff. This guy playing street football catches a pass next to the car cover Joey is fooling around with.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Hey! Be careful around my Porsche!ScenesWoman: (the same one from before approaches) Hi Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey! How you doin’?ScenesWoman: (to her friend) He has the most amazing Porsche under there!ScenesJoey: I’d love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. She’s sleeping. (The women both laugh) Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (Just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. It turns out that Joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a Porsche.)ScenesEndScenesThe One The Last NightScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri ScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesDirected by: David Schwimmer (Yeah, that David Schwimmer.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is balancing a mini hockey stick on his hand as Chandler enters from his room carrying a bunch of bills.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (watches Joey for a moment) Okay! (Joey quickly moves the hockey stick so that he’s scratching his back with it.) Listen, I’m gonna be moving out so you will be in charge of paying the rent.ScenesJoey: Right! And when is that due?ScenesChandler: First of the month.ScenesJoey: And that’s every month?ScenesChandler: No, just the months you actually want to live here.ScenesJoey: Ahhh.ScenesChandler: Okay, here is the phone bill. (Hands it to Joey.)ScenesJoey: (looking at it) Oh my God!!ScenesChandler: That’s our phone number. Now look, I know I kinda sprung this whole me moving out on thing, so why don’t I just—why don’t I just cover you for a while?ScenesJoey: No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity…anymore.ScenesChandler: It’s not charity, Joe…ScenesJoey: No! Forget it! Okay—I mean thanks, but I’m done taking money from you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, what’s next? Come on.ScenesChandler: Okay uh, here’s the electric bill. (Hands it to him.)ScenesJoey: This is how much we pay for electric?!!!ScenesChandler: Uh, yeah.Scenes(Joey runs over and shuts off the lights.)ScenesChandler: So, we’ll do the rest of the bills later then?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about trying to give Joey some money.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So is Joey going to have to give up the apartment?ScenesChandler: No, I hope not! I tried to offer him some money, but he wouldn’t take it.ScenesPhoebe: Well, how much do you think he needs?ScenesChandler: I figure that $1,500 would cover him for a few months, y’know? But I have to trick him into taking it so I won’t hurt his pride.ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t you hire him as an actor? You could have him dress up and put on little skits. Whatever you want.ScenesChandler: Well that would help the pride thing.ScenesMonica: (entering from her room) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Wow! You look great! Wanna move in with me tomorrow?ScenesMonica: (thinks) Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay! (They kiss) So, what do you girls have planned for tonight?ScenesMonica: Well, instead of being sad that tonight is my last night together with Rachel we thought we’d go out to dinner and celebrate the fact that Rachel is moving in with Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: And also, my birthday.ScenesMonica: It’s not your birthday.ScenesPhoebe: What a mean thing to say! I would never tell you it’s not your birthday!Scenes(Joey and Ross enter.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So you guys have anything planned for the big last night?ScenesChandler: Well, instead of just hanging out, we figure we’d do nothing.ScenesRoss: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Knicks season opener tonight. I thought maybe you guys would come over and watch it.ScenesJoey: I don’t know Ross, not if you’re gonna talk about how you gave up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist.ScenesRoss: I did give up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist!ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Pheebs, I was wondering…ScenesMonica: You’re not dressed yet?! We’re supposed to start having fun in 15 minutes!ScenesRachel: Well and clearly not a minute sooner.ScenesMonica: Rachel, you are packed though right, I mean please tell me that you’re packed.ScenesRachel: Of course I packed! Monica relax! I just wanted to ask Phoebe her opinion on what I should wear tonight.ScenesPhoebe: My God, I can’t get a minute of peace around this place.Scenes[Cut to Rachel’s bedroom, Phoebe and her are entering. And it’s obvious that she’s not packed.]ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Monica’s just gonna kill you.ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah, I know.ScenesPhoebe: Well, what you’re wearing is fine for that.ScenesMonica: (entering) Rachel, I need to borrow—You’re not packed!!!! You’re not packed even a little bit!ScenesRachel: Surprise!!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: No, no don’t get mad because look—this is what happened. So I-I started packing, then I realized, "What am I doing? I am lousy at packing!" Right? But you love packing! So, as a gift to you, on our last night, ta-da!ScenesMonica: (grabs a bag of those Styrofoam peanuts) I’ll be coordinator! Oh my God! I’m so sorry, I didn’t get you anything! Okay, look everybody has to help! Okay? You can help, can’t you Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: I have plans.ScenesMonica: You’re plans were with us.ScenesPhoebe: That’s right.ScenesMonica: All right, Chandler can make boxes, Ross can wrap, and Joey can lift things. Now Phoebe, go tell the guys they have to help out!ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay! (To Rachel) Oh my God, thank you!!Scenes[Cut to living room, Phoebe enters and closes Rachel’s door behind her.]ScenesPhoebe: Hurry! Monica’s gonna make you pack! She’s got jobs for everyone! Now, it’s too late for me, but save your selves! (The guys scramble for the door.)ScenesMonica: (entering and interrupting the guy’s escape attempt) Okay! The movers will be here in 11 hours. Rachel has not packed. Now, everybody has to help! Chandler, we’re gonna start with…ScenesChandler: Oh nope, I-I have plans with Joey.ScenesMonica: I thought you said you were going to do nothing.ScenesChandler: Yes, but for the last time.ScenesMonica: Okay fine, now Ross…ScenesRoss: Oh, but-but I can’t do it.ScenesMonica: Why not?ScenesJoey: (quietly) I’ve got Ben.ScenesRoss: Because, because I’ve got Ben.ScenesMonica: It’s almost 8 o’clock, it’s almost past his bedtime. Where-where is he?ScenesChandler: He’s at a dinner party.ScenesMonica: Is he really coming? Because I can see right into your apartment!ScenesRoss: Of course he is! What, do you think I’d just use my son as-as an excuse? What kind of father do you think I am?ScenesMonica: All right, sorry. (Goes back to Rachel’s room.)ScenesRoss: (to the guys) I gotta go make a fake Ben.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is entering carrying two pizzas.]
rows.Content: Joey: Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates.ScenesChandler: Oh, I wish I’d know you were going to do that, I ordered Chinese.ScenesJoey: Oh that’s okay. Hey, actually in a way it’s kinda nice. Me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!Scenes(Chandler stares at him, dumbfounded, then finally agrees.)ScenesChandler: Say, Joe, I had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night. What do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money?ScenesJoey: What, are you crazy? You haven’t beaten me once since my injury plagued ’97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money.ScenesChandler: Yes it would. What do you say to $50?ScenesJoey: Okay, you’re on.ScenesChandler: Okay, let’s play! The big game, Italy vs. China, apparently.Scenes(They start playing.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom, she’s in her closet bringing down her pair of roller blades from a top shelf.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohhhhhh, look it’s the roller blades.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) Oh God!ScenesRachel: You remember when we got these?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRachel: I guess you weren’t there. (They hug.)ScenesPhoebe: You guys, we said we were gonna have fun! Come on, hey, remember the time… (She starts laughing hysterically.) You don’t remember?ScenesRachel: I’m sorry Pheebs, I guess I’m just really said that I’m leaving.ScenesMonica: I’m gonna miss you so much.ScenesPhoebe: Well, this doesn’t have to be so sad though. Y’know? Maybe instead of just thinking about how much you’re gonna miss each other, you should like think of the things you’re not gonna miss.ScenesMonica: I don’t think there’s anything.ScenesPhoebe: Come on, there’s gotta be something.ScenesMonica: Nope, she’s perfect.ScenesRachel: I have one.ScenesPhoebe: Good! Great! You can go first.ScenesRachel: Uh well, I guess I’m not gonna miss the fact that you’re never allowed to move the phone pen. (Laughs. Monica lags behind the laugh a little bit.)ScenesPhoebe: Good that’s a good one. Okay, Monica, anything? Y’know? Does Rachel move the phone pen?ScenesMonica: Aw, sometimes. Always, actually.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, good. There you go. Doesn’t anyone feel better?ScenesMonica: Not just the phone pen. I never get my messages.ScenesRachel: You get your messages!ScenesMonica: Yeah, well I don’t think it really counts if you have to read them off the back of your hand after you fall asleep on the couch.ScenesRachel: So-so, you missed a message from who? Chandler or your mom? Or Chandler? Or your mom?ScenesPhoebe: Great! It worked! No one’s sad.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, they are just finishing up another game of foosball.]
rows.Content: Joey: (scores) Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! That’s like 500 bucks you owe me! Whoo-ho-hoo! (Goes over to the fridge and starts opening and closing the door rapidly.) $500 that is a loooot of electricity! (By the way, there’s nothing in the fridge.) Whoo-ho-ho! (Notices the sparseness of the fridge.) I gotta buy some food.ScenesChandler: Okay, give me a chance to win my money back. Okay? Sudden death, one goal, $1,000.ScenesJoey: You serious?ScenesChandler: Oh yes!ScenesJoey: Okay, get ready to owe me!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: Okay, here we go. Ready?Scenes[In slow motion, as some haunty demonic music plays in the background, Joey throws the ball in, Chandler quits playing and goes for his Chinese food. Joey smacks the ball really hard, shooting it down the table. Chandler slowly takes a bite, the ball bounces off of the wall, heads back up the table, and scores the goal for Chandler.]ScenesChandler: No! No! No! No—(Joey looks at him)—one can beat me.Scenes(In frustration, Joey kicks the table, breaking it.)ScenesChandler: See? Now, that’s why only the little fake men are supposed to do all the kicking.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the phone rings and Monica answers it as Rachel and Phoebe move a box into the living room.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hello? (Listens) Oh, hi Ross! (To Rachel) See? Other people call me!ScenesRachel: Ooh, your brother. Score!ScenesMonica: (on phone) What’s up?ScenesRoss: Oh, I’m just over here with Ben. I thought we’d say hi.ScenesMonica: Oh, put him on!ScenesRoss: Ben, say hi to Aunt Monica. (He holds the phone to the fake Ben he has created out of a pumpkin.) Oh, I guess he doesn’t feel like talking right now. He’s smiling though! Okay, talk to you later.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is entering carrying two glasses of wine. She gives one to Phoebe, keeps one, and completely ignores Monica.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Yeah, I think it was better when you guys were sad. Hey, uh, remember the roller blades?ScenesRachel: You know what else I’m not gonna miss? "I’m Monica. I wash the toilet 17 times a day. Even if people are on it!ScenesMonica: "Hi I’m Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, I’d better wash it and shrink it!ScenesRachel: "I’m Monica, I don’t get phone messages from interesting people. Ever!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! I call her!ScenesMonica: "Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hate Ross!ScenesRachel: "Oh my God, I can’t find a boyfriend! So I guess I’ll just stumble across the hall and sleep with the first guy I find in there!Scenes(Monica picks up one of those boxes of hair curling things, dumps it in a box, and storms out.)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, we should get a move on if we wanna make those dinner reservations. (Phoebe dumps a drawer full of makeup into a box.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is examining the broken foosball table as Chandler enters from his room.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Still broken?ScenesJoey: This sucks man! The last night you’re here and I lose the two most important things in my life, the foosball table and $500.ScenesChandler: Well, there are other ways of winning back your money, how about a little uh, a little Blackjack? (Holds up a deck of cards.)ScenesJoey: Nah, not my game.ScenesChandler: Okay, uh, how about, how about—y’know what? We could play a new game. A new game, it’s fun.ScenesJoey: Well, what’s it called?ScenesChandler: Cups.ScenesJoey: I don’t know how to play Cups.ScenesChandler: I’ll teach ya! Come on, come on, it’s really easy and really, really fun.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesChandler: Okay, here you go. (He deals out two cards each.) I have two queens, what do you have?ScenesJoey: A two and a five.ScenesChandler: Ho-ho, you win! 50 dollars!ScenesJoey: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! Okay, let’s play again. (He deals out two cards each again.) What do you got?ScenesJoey: A four and a nine.ScenesChandler: You’re kidding right?ScenesJoey: No. Why?ScenesChandler: Well that’s a full cup! (Pays him again.)ScenesJoey: Damn! I am good at Cups!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is whining to Phoebe about Rachel.]
rows.Content: Monica: I’m not talking to her!ScenesPhoebe: Well, one of you has to take the first step! And it should be you, because she’s the one who’s leaving. It’s harder for her!ScenesMonica: Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen!ScenesPhoebe: I know, I took it hard too.Scenes(Monica goes into Rachel’s room.)ScenesMonica: Listen Rachel, I feel really bad about—What are you doing? (She sees that Rachel is unpacking.)ScenesRachel: I’m unpacking!ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRachel: I’m not moving! (She re-hangs a picture, crookedly.) Is that picture straight?ScenesMonica: It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left!ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know what? You’re the one who wants to make this big change and move in with Chandler! You should be the one to go! Why should I have to leave?!ScenesMonica: Because it’s my apartment!ScenesRachel: Well it’s mine too! What else you got?!ScenesMonica: How about, you’re moving!! (Grabs a bunch of clothes and throws them into a box. What follows is a brief sequence of Rachel unpacking and Monica packing the same stuff over and over again as Rachel chants "No." and Monica chants "Yes.")ScenesRachel: Look! This is ridiculous. We should be packing you!! (She knocks over Monica, grabs a box, and runs into the kitchen.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, how are you guys doing?ScenesRachel: Great! Monica’s moving!ScenesMonica: (entering) I am not!ScenesRachel: Oh really?! Then how come all your stuff is in this box?! (Monica starts chasing Rachel around the table.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, you guys. You guys I think I know what’s going on here. Okay, you guys… STOP!! (They stop.) I know that, I know that you’re acting mad because you think that it’ll make it easier to leave. But deep down you’re still really sad. Deep-deep down.ScenesMonica: No Phoebe I am mad!ScenesPhoebe: Well, deep-deep-deep down!ScenesRachel: Yeah, I’m just mad!ScenesPhoebe: Then keep running. (They resume the chase.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, they’re still playing Cups.]
rows.Content: Chandler: You win.ScenesJoey: Well, what did you have?ScenesChandler: It doesn’t matter because nothing beats a three and a six. That my friend is D-Cup. Okay, now much have you won so far?ScenesJoey: Uh, (counts the money) wow, 700.ScenesChandler: Not 700 exactly?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Double it! (He does.)ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: Well you see in Cups, once you get $700, you have to double it.ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesChandler: Hey, I didn’t make up the rules. Now, after you receive the doubling bonus, you get uh, one card. Now that one card could be worth $100 bringing your total to 1,500. (Joey gets excited.) Don’t get to excited because that’s not gonna happen unless you get—No way! (He takes the top card, which is the two of clubs. Of course, any card would’ve won. Chandler pays him.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica carries a box out of Rachel’s room.]
rows.Content: Monica: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna label it, "What were you thinking?ScenesRachel: Funny, because I was just gonna go across the hall and write that on Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: Hey you guys, I don’t mean to make things worse, but umm, I don’t want to live with Rachel anymore.ScenesMonica and Rachel: What?!ScenesPhoebe: You’re just so mean to each other! And I don’t want to end up like that with Rachel. I still like you!ScenesRachel: Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving.ScenesMonica: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate.ScenesRachel: Oh really? Like what Monica?ScenesMonica: Y’know she has 147,000 pairs of boots…ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, good start Mon.ScenesMonica: She lets you borrow them.ScenesRachel: Yeah and you stretch ‘em out with your big old clown feet.ScenesMonica: Do you wanna live outside?! Because it’s gettin’ cold! (To Phoebe) She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the things she thinks that I’d like.ScenesPhoebe: What else?ScenesMonica: When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that.ScenesPhoebe: That’s nice. I like having things to read in the bathroom.ScenesMonica: When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with a blanket.ScenesRachel: Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold.ScenesMonica: And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive. (To Rachel) (Starts to cry) You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!! (They both break down in tears.)ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s gonna be fine.ScenesPhoebe: Okay Rachel, I can’t wait to live with you! And you know what we should do? Bring Monica and then we could all live there together! We’ll have so much fun!!ScenesRachel: But honey, I think she’s moving in with Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s right. You’re still set on that?ScenesMonica: Kinda. (She hugs Phoebe and looks out the window. She moves closer to it to get a better look.) Oh my God!Scenes[Cut to Ross’s apartment, he’s watching TV and eating some popcorn as the phone rings.]ScenesRoss: (answering the phone) Hello? (Listens) Hey Mon, how’s the packing going? (Listens) Ben? He’s fine. Yeah, he’s right—Oh my God! (He looks over at the fake Ben and notices that the head has fallen off.) Get your head of your shirt there son! (He tries to push the pumpkin through the neck hole.) What? (Listens) Yeah, it’s a pumpkin. I’ll come pack.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, (Ohh, that’s the last time I’m ever gonna type that line. It’s just so sad.) Joey is entering, angrily.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: What’s wrong?ScenesJoey: Ross and I were helping the girls pack, took a little break, I lost $1,500 to him in Cups!ScenesChandler: Wh-How did you lose at Cups?!ScenesJoey: The same way you lost. I started out with a King and a Queen, bamn! Ross gets a 2 and a 3. Then I get a Jack and a King, boom! Ross gets a 4 and a 5! Ross was getting the Cup card, the D-Cup, the Sittin’ Down Bonus! Meanwhile, I didn’t even get half a cup! Nothin’!!ScenesChandler: Oh man!!ScenesJoey: And he never played before either! Y’know what I think? I think beginner’s luck, very important in Cups.ScenesChandler: All right, let’s play one more hand! One more!ScenesJoey: No, no, no more! I cannot lose another dime! I’m serious this time! In-in fact, look, there’s a—I wanna give you something. And let me give it too you know before I pawn it for Cups money. (He rolls the big white dog over) Now, I want you to have the big white dog as a kinda of a, y’know, thank you for being such a great roommate.ScenesChandler: I can’t take the big white dog! You love it!ScenesJoey: It’s him, not it!ScenesChandler: No, but wait—what if I bought it from you, y’know? And your nice gesture would be giving it to me at a reasonable price, say (Gets choked up) $1,500?ScenesJoey: Wait a second, I see what you’re trying to do here! You-you’re trying to give me money again!ScenesChandler: When did I try to give you money?ScenesJoey: Over there! (Points to the couch) Before, with the bills! You tried to give some charity, I said "No," you dropped it. Okay? Then we had a nice last night together, we had some fun, we gambled, nobody tried to give anybody any money! Now out of the blue, you start with the charity thing again!ScenesChandler: I’m just trying to help you out! Okay? I wanna make sure that you’re okay.ScenesJoey: I will be okay! Look Chandler, you gotta get it out of your head that I can’t take care of myself. Okay? Look, I’m not gonna miss you helping me out with money. The only thing that I’m gonna miss…is you. And now the dog.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, (And that’s the last time for that line, no more Chandler and Joey’s or Monica and Rachel’s, ever!) Joey and Ross are carrying the last table of Rachel’s. Rachel follows slowly, but is stopped by Monica.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay?ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: I’m really gonna miss you.Scenes(They hug.)ScenesRachel: Oh! I have your key. Here you go. (Hands it to Monica.)ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesRachel: Yeah.Scenes(Silence ensues.)ScenesRachel: Oh God! This is silly, I’m gonna see you in a couple of hours! (They hug again.)ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Bye house!Scenes(They break the embrace.)ScenesRachel: Bye Mon.ScenesMonica: Bye.Scenes(Monica closes the door and slowly walks into Rachel’s old and now empty room.)ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey.ScenesMonica: She really left.ScenesChandler: I know. (He kisses her.)ScenesMonica: Thank you.ScenesChandler: No problem roomie. (She turns around and hugs him.)ScenesMonica: Can I ask you a question?ScenesChandler: Sure!ScenesMonica: What the hell is that dog doing here?! (She notices the dog sitting in the living room.)Scenes(And with that, an era ends as Chandler moves in with Monica as Rachel moves in with Phoebe. It ‘tis a sad and happy time for Friends.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Chandler is trying to get Joey’s money back from Ross.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I invented the game of Cups as a way to give Joey money.ScenesRoss: And now you want that money back.ScenesChandler: Exactly.ScenesRoss: Chandler, what kind of an idiot do you take me for? (As he picks up the fake Ben.)ScenesChandler: It’s not a real game! I made it up!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry you lost your money, but I won it fair and square.ScenesChandler: At a fake game!!ScenesRoss: Now, if you wanna try to make some of it back, I’d be glad to play you for it. But I should warn you, I am very good at Cups.ScenesChandler: Okay! Now I assume the Saucer card came up when you played last.ScenesRoss: No.ScenesChandler: Hmm, let’s see if it comes up this time. (He looks at his cards and shrugs.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Phoebe RunsScenesWritten by: Sherry Bilsing-Graham & Ellen PlummerScenesTranscribed by: Kiza AbuzahraScenesWith Minor Adjustments by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel’s new apartment, Rachel and Phoebe are making their answering machine message.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ready?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRachel: Hi...ScenesPhoebe: it's...ScenesRachel: Rachel...ScenesPhoebe: and…ScenesRachel: Phoebe’s...ScenesPhoebe: please...ScenesRachel: leave...ScenesPhoebe: leave…ScenesRachel: Wait, I-I just said "leave.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know because you have all the good words. What do I get? I get "it’s," "and" oh I'm sorry, I have "A." Forget it.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, come on that's silly.ScenesPhoebe: All right, so let's switch.ScenesRachel: No, I have all of the good words. OK, fine, fine, we can switch.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Hi…ScenesRachel: Everybody…ScenesPhoebe: It's…ScenesRachel: Rachel…ScenesPhoebe: and…ScenesRachel: Phoebe’s…ScenesPhoebe: Please...wait, how did you do that?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, you're no ordinary roommate are you?ScenesRachel: Phoebe, come on can we finish this later? Cause I wanna go running before it gets dark. Oh! Why don't you come with me?!ScenesPhoebe: Really?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it'll be fun. We'll run in the park. It'll be like our first y’know roommate bonding thing.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, let's go running!ScenesRachel: Yeah and there's really cute guys there.ScenesPhoebe: Let's run towards them!ScenesRachel: OK!ScenesPhoebe: All right, wait just one more second. Hi, it's Phoebe and Rachel's. Please leave a message, thanks!ScenesRachel: Now wait a minute. You just took all the words!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. You've met your match Rachel Green.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s new apartment, Ross and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, I just finished this fascinating book. By the year 2030, there'll be computers that can carry out the same amount of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically you could download your thoughts and memories into this computer and-and-and live forever as a machine.ScenesChandler: (not amused) And I just realized I can sleep with my eyes open.Scenes[Monica enters]ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRoss and Chandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: (jumps over a box) Honey, that's a great idea nailing the boxes to the floor!ScenesChandler: I didn't nail the boxes to the floor.ScenesMonica: Oh, So you can move them!ScenesChandler: Yes, and while I'm doing that, Ross has a great computer story for you.Scenes[Joey enters with his new roommate who is played by none other than Elle MacPherson.]ScenesJoey: Hey everybody! Uh, I'd like you to meet Janine. She's-she's gonna be my new roommate!ScenesJanine: Hi.ScenesRoss: Hi! (Rushes over to shake her hand instantly.)ScenesJanine: HiScenesJoey: Yeah, she's gonna live with me!ScenesMonica: It's nice to meet you. Janine...?ScenesJanine: Lecroix. Janine LecroixScenesJoey: I didn't know that! Well, what a pretty last name!ScenesChandler: So, uh, wh-where ya from?ScenesJanine: Australia, I just moved here a couple of weeks ago.ScenesJoey: (shocked) From the land down under? I didn't know that either!ScenesRoss: So uh, wha-uh, what do you do?ScenesJanine: I'm a dancer.ScenesJoey: You're a dancer? She-she's a dancer!ScenesJanine: Well, I think I'll go and unpack.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey let me. (Opens the door for Janine and after he closes the door behind her gasps ecstatically.)ScenesMonica: Joey, did you even interview this woman before you asked her to move in?ScenesJoey: Of course I did.ScenesMonica: Uh-huh, what exactly did you ask her?ScenesJoey: "When can you move in?ScenesRoss: Thank you for bringing her into our lives.ScenesChandler: UnbelievableScenesMonica: Oh, so you like her too Chandler?ScenesChandler: Hey, look at all the boxes!ScenesJoey: Ugh, I cannot wait to ask her out!ScenesMonica: Wait a minute...Joey. Joey you can't ask her out, she's your roommate. It-it'll be way too complicated.ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah man don't do it. I mean if you date her, then-then-then I can't date her.ScenesChandler: All right, think about it. Now remember when you were going out with that girl Donna and you guys broke up. Remember how horrible it was when you guys bumped into each other at the supermarket?ScenesJoey: Oh God, yeah.ScenesChandler: Now imagine you live at the supermarket.ScenesJoey: (happily) Okay!ScenesChandler: No-noScenesJoey: Oh, Oh, you're right! I don't want that. I can't date her!ScenesMonica: Yeah and you better watch the flirting too, cause you know, in such close quarters, it could be trouble.ScenesJoey: Well, that's gonna be tough Mon. I mean it's hard for me to be around an attractive woman and not flirt.ScenesMonica: (chuckles) Hmm, well you're around me all the time and you don't flirt.ScenesJoey: You a little sad about that sweetheart?Scenes[Scene, The Park: Phoebe and Rachel are getting ready to go running]ScenesPhoebe: I have to tie my shoe, so you go ahead, I'll catch up.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Runs off.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Starts running crazily with her arms flapping and her legs far apart) Come on! That's not running! Let's go! (Rachel pauses, then follows, embarrassed.)Scenes[Scene, Central Perk: Rachel, Ross and Monica are there]ScenesRachel: You guys, I'm telling you, when she runs, she looks like a cross between Kermit The Frog and The Six Million Dollar Man.ScenesRoss: Monica had such a crush on him. Yeah, she used to kiss his poster every night before she went to bed.ScenesRachel: Oh! I used to do that too!ScenesMonica: Did you also have his album, It's Not Easy Being Green?ScenesRachel: Aw, Mon...(Kisses her on the cheek)ScenesMonica: So, Phoebe runs weird huh?ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah and you know what, I know she's gonna wanna run again, I just don't know how to get out of it, I mean, I live with her.ScenesMonica: Why don't you just be straight with her? Tell her the truth.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: You're right, you're right. I should just tell her the truth.Scenes[Phoebe enters]ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, Monica tripped me, I don't think I can ever run again, ever!ScenesPhoebe: Why? Why would you do that?ScenesMonica: I don't know. Rachel I'm-I'm sorry that I hurt your ankles.ScenesRachel: Ankle.ScenesMonica: We'll see.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s new apartment, Chandler is putting something away under the sink.]
rows.Content: Chandler: OK, I'm officially unpacked. Thanks for helping me man. (Turns around and sees that Joey isn't there.) Joe? (Hears giggling coming from a box) Well, I guess Joey went home. Oh and look, there's still one box that I have to unpack. (Hears the giggling again)ScenesJoey: (jumps out of the box) I Gotcha!!ScenesChandler: (pretending) Oh my God! You-almost-gave-me-a-heart-attack.ScenesJoey: Boy, it was so hard not to laugh, I tell ya. Hey, hey, the place looks great!ScenesChandler: Yeah, not bad right? You know what, Monica’s gonna be working late, so I'm gonna make this place spotless. You know what else I'm gonna do, know what else I'm gonna do? I'm gonna go downstairs, I'm gonna get her some flowers. Now who wouldn't wanna live with me?ScenesJoey: (raises his hand) I don't! No, I wanna live with the super-hot Australian dancer.ScenesChandler: Yeah, now how's that going though? Are you okay with the not-flirting thing?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Well, so far yeah. But it's tough you know? I got all this built up flirting energy and I don't know how to get rid of it. (Gives Chandler the "Joey-love," look.) How you doin?Scenes[Scene Joey and Janine’s new apartment, Janine is there. Joey walks in to see Janine bent over, stretching.]ScenesJoey: (voice cracking) Ohhhh manScenesJanine: Sorry, there's just more room out here.ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no-no, it's-it's uh, you just uh, uh reminded me that uh, I need to do my stretches too. (Starts to stretch, groans painfully)ScenesJanine: (touches his waist) Why don't you try to do-ScenesJoey: (jumps up and yells)ScenesJanine: What's wrong?ScenesJoey: Uh-uh nothing. I-I-I-I didn't want you to touch me cause I'm -I'm all sweaty from the workout. I better hit the shower. (Goes into the bathroom and comes back out quickly) Oh my God!ScenesJanine: Oh, sorry about that stuff hanging in there. It's just my thongs are too delicate for the dryer.Scenes(Joey laughs nervously and goes to his bedroom.)Scenes[Scene, The Park, Rachel is running and Phoebe is hiding behind a tree.]ScenesPhoebe: (jumps in front of Rachel) Hi! Oh yeah, uh-huh, it's me. I saw you grab your running shoes this morning and sneak out. You lied so you could run by yourself.ScenesRachel: No, no Phoebe no, I was...no. You know what, I was, I was actually just checking to, see, if I could run. And I can!ScenesPhoebe: Please Rachel, I am not an idiot. (Runs off)ScenesRachel: No, wait Phoebe.Scenes[Scene, Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is there. Everything is out of its place and Chandler's cleaning.]ScenesRoss: (enters) Wow, couples who live together do start to look alike. So, Mondler...uh, what uh, what ‘cha doin?ScenesChandler: What does it look like I'm doing? I am cleaning!ScenesRoss: Did you get Monica's authorization to move all of her stuff?ScenesChandler: Authorization? I don't need that. I'm gonna put everything back.ScenesRoss: Put it back exactly where you found it?ScenesChandler: Yes I'm gonna put it back (Mocking Ross) exactly where I found it.ScenesRoss: ‘Kay, first of all, this attitude is not helping.ScenesChandler: She's not gonna care if I put her stuff back in the same stupid place.ScenesRoss: Whoa, hello, did you just meet Monica?ScenesChandler: She is gonna recognize that I did a nice thing and-and, appreciate it.ScenesRoss: Hmm -you know, actually this'll work out well. Cause when you have to move back in with Joey, Joey's hot new roommate can come and live with me.ScenesChandler: I see, I see, y-y-you're trying to freak me out.ScenesRoss: Look Chandler, Monica is really weird about this kind stuff all right. Believe me, I lived with her for 16 years. She is going to freak…out. Oh my God, she's going to sit on you.ScenesChandler: No, she's not okay? And I'll prove it to you. I'm gonna call her right now. (Picks up the phone and wipes it off) Phone's done ehh.ScenesMonica: (on phone) Hi!ScenesChandler: Hey Mon, how's it going?ScenesMonica: Terrible. If-if I want something done right, I have to do it myself. Other people just wreck stuff. I really think I might kill someone tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh come on, come on, it can't be that bad.ScenesMonica: It's worse. The only thing that's getting me through is knowing that I'm gonna be seeing you soon. I think I may even try to get out of here early.ScenesChandler: No! No-no-no-no-no-no. It sounds like they really need you down there.ScenesMonica:  Well, are you just hanging out with Ross?ScenesChandler: It's, all good! Okay bye-bye Mon! (To Ross) She's-she's gonna kill me.ScenesRoss: Yeah, the phone was facing the other way. (Chandler fixes it and a picture frame off the table.) And that goes back up there.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Chandler: We should start with the big stuff. Y’know? That'll be the easiest. Uh, let's start with the couch. (He picks up one end and Ross doesn't help) I got it. (He moves it back to where he thinks it goes.)ScenesRoss: Yeah that-that, doesn't look right.ScenesChandler: What are you talking about? The couch is perfectly in line with the carpet. And then I can just walk over here and casually just put my feet right up on the...(Tries to rest his feet on the coffee table but they won't reach) OK, OK, here's what we do, we just uh, move the couch closer to the coffee table.ScenesRoss: Whoa, whoa, but then the back of the couch won't line up with he back of the carpet.ScenesChandler: OK well here, we'll just move the coffee table closer to the couch.ScenesRoss: Whoa, Whoa, Whoa, but then the coffee table won't be centered in the seating area.ScenesChandler: Yes, but the coffee table doesn't match the...blahebdmsdlkhdyslkd;btyds...Rooosss!!!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Look, what am I gonna do? I'm not flirting but still, I'm drawing her to me like - like a moth to a flame! (Tries to put his feet on the coffee table...they won't reach and looks around.) What the hell's going on over here?!?!? (Points to Chandler) Monica's gonna kill you! Look I need your help, I have to do something to-to repel this woman! Wait a minute, wait a minute, you guys repel women all the time.ScenesRoss: Hey, I've been married 3 timesScenes(Chandler gives him a round of mock applause.)ScenesJoey: No-no-no I've seen it happen, you-you get a rapport going with a woman but somehow you manage to kill it. What's your secret?ScenesRoss: Look, we do not repel women OK? That is completely untrue.ScenesChandler: Oh no, yes we do my man. Remember when we were back in college and we went to that spring dance and you walked right up to that girl you liked and you could not stop talking about the Irish potato famine?ScenesRoss: Yeah, well what about you? You weren't you know, so hot in college either. After everything he said, he'd go "ba dum bum chesshScenesChandler: Yeah, Monica doesn't like that either, Maybe I should stop doing that.ScenesRoss: Oh y'know what, girls don't like it when I start talking about science.ScenesChandler: That's not specific to girls.ScenesJoey: This is great, this is great, what else, what else?ScenesRoss: Uh, they don't like it when you correct their grammar.ScenesChandler: And they don't like it when you explain why your jokes are funny.ScenesRoss: They don't like it when you keep asking them if they like you.ScenesChandler: Man, I'm so lucky I have Monica.ScenesRoss: (nonchalantly) I'm never gonna find love again.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?ScenesPhoebe: SureScenesRachel: Okay, um, I...(Phoebe walks into her room.) All right Phoebe look, I just wanted to say that I'm sorry. OK? I handled the situation horribly and I should not have lied to you.ScenesPhoebe: So, what should you have done?ScenesRachel: Well, I-I should've told you the truth.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-Huh, Which is...?ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, the reason I didn't wanna go running with you is because um, well y'know the way that you run is a little...(Starts flapping her arms)ScenesPhoebe: So?ScenesRachel: Well, it's embarrassing. People were looking at us like we were crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Why do you care?ScenesRachel: Because they're people.ScenesPhoebe: But people that you don't know and will never see again.ScenesRachel: Yes, but still. They're people…with eyes.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I didn't get embarrassed running next to Miss (panting). But no, okay. No, no, I can see why running with me would be embarrassing to you. Yeah, okay. You're uptight.ScenesRachel: I-I am not uptight—Hey-hey-hey-oh-oh! Listen, I am not uptight, man.ScenesPhoebe: That's okay Rachel. I'm not judging you; that's just who you are. Me. I'm more free y'know? I run like I did when I was a kid, cause that's the only way it's fun. Y'know, I mean didn’t you ever run so fast you thought your legs were gonna fall off? Y'know, like when you were like running towards the swings or running away from Satan? (Rachel looks confused) The neighbor's dog.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler has the tape measure out and is busy lining up the lamp on the kitchen counter, Ross is supervising the whole operation.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, is this lamp in the same place?ScenesRoss: Who cares? I repel women.Scenes[Monica tries to come in]ScenesChandler: (blocks the door) No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no!!! You can't come in here! R-r-r-r-Ross is naked.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRoss: (whispers) What?!ScenesChandler: (to Ross) I couldn't say that I was naked because she's allowed too see me naked.ScenesRoss: Why does anyone have to be naked?ScenesMonica: Why is Ross naked?ScenesRoss: I-I had to show Chandler something?ScenesMonica: Naked?ScenesRoss: Yeah-yeah I uh, I have a uh, a guy problem.ScenesMonica: Is it the same thing that Chandler had?ScenesChandler: Look, uh, just come later, we'll get everything squared away and you can come back later.ScenesMonica: Okay, listen, there's still some of Chandler's medicine under the sink in the bathroom. Bye!ScenesChandler: Bye! Thank GodScenesRoss: Dude, what'd you have?ScenesChandler: Look, we have no time okay? We must focus. We gotta get everything back into its original place.ScenesRoss: (realizes something) The photo album! There were millions of pictures of the apartment in the photo album. We just go through it and match everything to the pictures.ScenesChandler: That's perfect! That's brilliant! (Starts going through the photo album)ScenesRoss: So really, what'd ya have?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine's, Janine's there. Joey enters]
rows.Content: Janine: Hey Joey, I got some beer for you.ScenesJoey: Uh, don't you mean "for whom?ScenesJanine: Sure, listen I was gonna order some pizza, you wanna share one?ScenesJoey: Pizza, heh, its not like I never had that before...ba dum bum cheshhh.ScenesJanine: Is there something wrong?ScenesJoey: All right, All right, let's just get this out in the open okay? You're hot. I'm lovable. Clearly there's a vibe going on between us. But, we're roommates and it's a huge mistake for us to continue down this road.ScenesJanine: Joey...ScenesJoey: No, no, no, I'm telling ya. Imagine yourself living in a supermarket and you will understand okay? So the question is, what do we do?ScenesJanine: Well, I don't think there is anything to do. I mean I think you're really sweet, but I'm just not interested in you like that.ScenesJoey: Oh!ScenesJanine: No! I mean you're a really nice guy and I'm happy to be your roommate and your friend, I'm just y'know, I just don't feel that way about you.ScenesJoey: Oh! I see what happened. It's because I was trying to repel you. Right? Believe me, you'd feel a lot different if I turned it on.ScenesJanine: I don't think so.ScenesJoey: Oh, I do. (Gives her the Joey-love look.) How you doin?ScenesJanine: I'm OKScenesJoey: What?!?!ScenesJanine: What?ScenesJoey: Oh dear God!

rows.Scenes: The park, Rachel's running by herself and panting. After a little while she decides to run like Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (Runs into Phoebe.) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Oh honey, I'm so sorry, you were right, this feels great!ScenesPhoebe: See? And you don't care if people are staring, it's just for a second cause then you're gone!ScenesRachel: Gone! I mean its amazing Pheebs. I feel so free and so graceful. (Turns and bumps into a mounted policeman and falls) Hey! Look out for the horse! Sorry! (Runs off.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Ross are there. Monica enters]
rows.Content: Monica: Is it okay for me to come in now?ScenesChandler: Uh-huhScenesMonica: Why is everything different?ScenesRoss: Bye! (Runs out)ScenesChandler: No, I don't see anything different other than the fact that the room got so much brighter when you came into it. (Forced laughter)ScenesMonica: Well, the end table is wrong, The couch looks bizarre and don't even get me started on the refrigerator magnets.ScenesChandler: Okay look, don't...don't be mad okay? But after I unpacked the boxes I wanted to do something nice for you, so, I-I-I cleaned the apartment. So I moved everything around and then I forgot where it, where it went back and I'm sorry, I'm very sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.ScenesMonica: It's okay. Chandler, are you afraid of me or something?ScenesChandler: Do you want me to be afraid of you?ScenesMonica: Of course not. I mean gosh, Chandler what you did, it's, it's a wonderful thing and I really appreciate it. I know I have this weird thing where I want everything to be in the perfect place, but I'd never expect you to worry about that.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesMonica: Of course!ScenesChandler: Oh well you're the best. You come here to me.ScenesMonica: All right, hold on okay? First thing's first. (Gets her cleaning gloves on) Okay, now did Ross sit anywhere while he was naked?ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Janine and Chandler are there]
rows.Content: Ross: So it said that by the year 2030, there'll be computers that can carry out the same number of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically we could download our thoughts and our memories into this computer...ScenesJanine: ...and live forever as a machine!ScenesRoss: That's so Janine, you-you-you know what, do you know we're doing right now? You and I, we're interfacing.ScenesJanine: Yeah, I gotta go.ScenesChandler: Ba dum bumb cheshhh!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Ross’s TeethScenesWritten by: Perry Rein and Gigi McCreeyScenesTranscribed by: Aaron D. Howard-Miller

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s, Chandler knocks on the front door. Joey answers the door.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hi, my name’s Chandler. I just moved in next door and I was wondering if you would be interested in battling me in a post-apoplectic world for control of the galaxies last remaining energy source?ScenesJoey: Sure, neighbor come on in.ScenesChandler: So, is Janine around?ScenesJoey: Uh, no, she’s at dance class.ScenesChandler: Can I check out what she did to my room?ScenesJoey: Yeah, but, hey look, don’t go through her stuff. She gets really mad.(Chandler gives him a look and walks to the door of his old room.)ScenesChandler: (The room is filled with flowers and a floral print sheet on the bed.) Oh my God. What is th… it’s like a guy never lived in here. Look, you’ve got to be careful. This girl thing is dangerous. (Looking around the living room.) It’s spreading already.ScenesJoey: (Looking around the room.) It is???ScenesChandler: (Picking up a pillow.) Yeah, is this your pretty pink pillow on the couch?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesChandler: (Pointing to the table and picking up the box.) Is that your tiny little box, that’s too small to put anything in?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesChandler: No! Ok, this is not good. You are a guy. Ok? This is a guys place. If you let this go, you’re going to be sitting around with your fingers soaking in stuff.ScenesJoey: (With Big Eyes.) All right, you’re right. I’ll talk to her.ScenesChandler: Yes talk to her. Be a man.ScenesJoey: I’m a man.ScenesChandler: Defend yourself.ScenesJoey: (Grunting) Hmm. (Monica opens the front door and comes in.)ScenesMonica: Chandler come on. We have to hem the new dust ruffle.ScenesChandler: Be right there sweetums. (Monica leaves. To Joey.) A totally different situation.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, The gangs all here. Monica is walking in.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys.ScenesChandler: Hey, how was your breakfast with Hillary?ScenesMonica: It was okay. She’s still kind of depressed because she broke up with her boyfriend.ScenesChandler: Ohh, yeah.ScenesRoss: Well, is this Hillary your HOT assistant chef Hillary?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRoss: The one that always stares at me when I come in?ScenesMonica: No, the one who looked at you once because you got in her way.ScenesRoss: Still I could tell. She was into me. (Joey rolls his eyes.) Well, why don’t you set us up?ScenesRachel: Ohh, are you setting Ross up with someone? Does she have a wedding dress?ScenesPhoebe: (Walking over and Sitting down.) Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: I’m, uhh, making up flyers trying to get new massage clients.
