(Does so.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Chandler is such an idiot!ScenesRichard: (standing up quickly) Drink?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’ll have a scotch…ScenesRichard: …on the rocks with a twist? I remember. (Goes to make her drink.)ScenesMonica: (moving over to the couch) Still smoking cigars?ScenesRichard: Uh, no! No! That’s…art! If it bothers you I can put my art out.ScenesMonica: No that’s, that’s okay.ScenesRichard: So Monica let me ask you a question. Y’know, since we broke up do you ever, think about me?ScenesMonica: Uh yeah, I-I actually I thought about you a couple months ago.ScenesRichard: Oh really?ScenesMonica: Yeah but it was because I-I had an eye exam and I don’t like my new eye doctor.ScenesRichard: Who is it?ScenesMonica: Edward Nevski?ScenesRichard: Yeah he’s no good. Do you ever (pause) think about me in a (pause) non-eye doctor way?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRichard: Ahh.ScenesMonica: But getting over was the hardest thing that I’ve ever had to do. And I never let myself think about you.Scenes(Richard mouths, "Wow!")

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is reading as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Phoebe! You picked Joey and Ross?! You can not have two backups!ScenesPhoebe: Of course I can! It’s just good sense to backup your backup! Look, I’ve already lost Chandler!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Phoebe! We’re both (points at Ross and himself) your backup?!ScenesRoss: Phoebe, how could you do this to me?!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t—Look I don’t know what you’re complaining about now? You were both aware of the situation!Scenes(At the same time.)ScenesJoey: No we weren’t!ScenesRoss: I was not!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, this kind of back talk is not gonna fly when we’re married!ScenesRachel: Phoebe you can’t have both of them! You have to pick one!ScenesJoey: Pick me!!ScenesRoss: No! Pick me! I don’t want to end up an old maid!ScenesPhoebe: All right well let’s see, Ross is a good father, but Joey has a boat—This is hard!ScenesJoey: This is crazy! Hey look, I wanna switch to Rachel!ScenesRoss: Ooh, I wanna switch to Rachel too!Scenes(Rachel gets all happy.)ScenesPhoebe: No wait! Just—Okay—Just wait! You guys! Wait you guys! Don’t make any rash decisions, okay? Just remember my promise, when we get married, three times a week.ScenesRachel: Oh God, Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) I’m talking about massages.ScenesRachel: Oh.Scenes(She turns her head away and when she’s not looking, Phoebe shakes her head and mouths, "No, I’m not." Both Joey and Ross smile, look at each other, and then stop smiling.)ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know what?! I know-I know how to settle this! All right here, this is what we’re gonna do! I’m gonna write Joey on one napkin (does so) and I’m gonna right Ross on the other napkin (does so) and we are going to pick one! And that person is going to be our backup! Okay?ScenesJoey: Okay that’s fair.ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Good!Scenes(Rachel mixes them up in her hands, moves them all around, and puts her hands behind her back.)ScenesRachel: Pick one.ScenesPhoebe: Left! (Rachel hands her the napkin in her left hand and they both unfold and read them.) Thank you.ScenesRachel: You’re welcome.ScenesPhoebe: (reading) Ross!ScenesRachel: (reading) Joey! (Pause) We should just switch.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah absolutely! (They both switch.)ScenesJoey: Yeah.

rows.Scenes: Richard’s Apartment, Monica is looking around and notices an African mask hanging on the wall.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to the mask) I missed you-you ugly, flat faced old freak!ScenesRichard: Excuse me?ScenesMonica: Oh! (Laughs and points at the mask.) Him.ScenesRichard: Oh. (Laughs.) Whew!ScenesMonica: I missed this apartment! Now, this is a grown-up’s apartment! Y’know, I-I should be with a grown-up, do you know what I mean?!ScenesRichard: Yeah! You’re saying, you need to be with someone more mature. Maybe someone with, a license to practice medicine. Or a mustache.ScenesMonica: Y’know, let’s face it, I’m not a kid anymore! I-I need to be with someone who-who wants the same things that I do! I mean coming to my place of work and telling me that you love me, I want that! Talking about pig sex over lunch, I don’t want that!ScenesRichard: I think that’s fair.ScenesMonica: Fair? Please don’t even talk to me about fair! Fair would’ve been you wanting to marry me back then! Or fair would’ve been Chandler wanting to marry me now! Believe me, nothing about this is fair! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing! Nothing!ScenesRichard: It’s okay! Shh! Hey. Hey. (Hugs her) Shhhh.ScenesMonica: Nothing. (She backs away a little bit but is still in his arms and looks up at his eyes.) I don’t kn—Umm. I don’t know. Umm…ScenesRichard: I know. (Backs away.)ScenesMonica: Y’know, I-I… I have to figure…some st—Y’know, some stuff before I can…ScenesRichard: Yeah, I understand. Take as much time as you want. (Pause) Ten, even twenty minutes if you need it. I’ll be here. Not smoking. (Monica leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Richard’s Apartment, time lapse. Richard is smoking as he hears a knock on the door. He quickly puts out his cigar and opens the door.]
rows.Content: Richard: Chandler.ScenesChandler: Where is she? I’m not scared of you! (Averts his eyes and walks in.)ScenesRichard: She’s not here and please come in.ScenesChandler: (examining the coffee table) Scotch on the rocks, with a twist, on a coaster? Ha-ha, Monica! Monica!ScenesRichard: Okay, she was here, but she left.ScenesChandler: Well where did she go?ScenesRichard: Well she said she had to think things over.ScenesChandler: Oh my God, I can’t believe this! Y’know, I thought…I thought you were a good guy.ScenesRichard: Oh, hey look nothing happened.ScenesChandler: Nothing happened? Nothing? So you didn’t tell my girlfriend that you love her?ScenesRichard: Well all right, one thing happened?ScenesChandler: Y’know what? I can’t believe this! Do you know what you did? My girlfriend is out there thinking things over! You made my girlfriend think!!ScenesRichard: Well I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: And what does she have to think about? I love her!ScenesRichard: Well, apparently I’m willing to offer her things that you are not.ScenesChandler: But I am willing to offer her all those things. This was just a plan, y’know? A way to throw her off course so that when I offered her all these things, she’d be surprised!ScenesRichard: Well if it helps, it worked very well.ScenesChandler: It was working until you showed up, you big tree! I mean, this isn’t fair. You had your chance with her! You had your chance and you blew it! And this is my chance and I am not going to blow it because we are meant for each other! And this is all just been one stupid mistake! (Sits down heavily.) I was gonna propose tonight.ScenesRichard: You were gonna propose? (Sits on the arm of the couch.)ScenesChandler: Yeah I even (pause) got a ring. (Puts in on the center cushion.) Did you get a ring?ScenesRichard: No I don’t have a ring! (Pause) You go get her Chandler. (Pause) And can I give you a piece of advice? If you do get her, don’t let her go. Trust me.ScenesChandler: Y’know Richard…you are a good guy.ScenesRichard: I know. (Pause) I hate that!Scenes(Chandler gets up and runs out, but as soon as the door closes behind him he opens it, runs back in, picks up his ring Richard is holding up for him, and runs back out.)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Chandler is running up the stairs and towards his apartment, but Joey is taking out the garbage at the same time and stops him in the hall.]
rows.Content: Joey: Dude!ScenesChandler: I can’t talk to you now, I gotta find Monica!ScenesJoey: She’s gone.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: She’s gone. She had a bag and she left.ScenesChandler: What are you talking about?ScenesJoey: She was all crying. She-she said you guys want different things, and that and that she needed time to think.ScenesChandler: Well why didn’t you stop her?! Why didn’t you just tell her it was a plan?!ScenesJoey: I-I did! I told her everything, Chandler! But she wouldn’t believe me.ScenesChandler: Well where… Where did she go?ScenesJoey: To her parent’s I think and she said you shouldn’t call her. But if I were you I would.ScenesChandler: I can’t believe I ruined this.ScenesJoey: I am so sorry man.Scenes(He walks dejectedly into his apartment to find it lit with about a thousand candles and Monica standing in the living room.)ScenesMonica: You wanted it to be a surprise.Scenes(He turns to look at Joey who smiles slyly and closes the door leaving them alone.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God.Scenes(Monica gets down on one knee.)ScenesMonica: Chandler… In all my life… I never thought I would be so lucky. (Starting to cry.) As to…fall in love with my best…my best… There’s a reason why girls don’t do this!ScenesChandler: Okay! (He joins her on one knee) Okay! Okay! Oh God, I thought… (Starting to cry, pauses) Wait a minute, I-I can do this. (Pause) I thought that it mattered what I said or where I said it. Then I realized the only thing that matters is that you, (Pause) you make me happier than I ever thought I could be. (Starting to cry again.) And if you’ll let me, I will spend the rest of my life trying to make you feel the same way. (Pause as he gets out the ring.) Monica, will you marry me?ScenesMonica: Yes.Scenes(The crowd goes wild as he puts the ring on her finger. They hug and kiss this time as an engaged couple.)ScenesMonica: I knew you were likely to take a wife!Scenes(They hug again.)ScenesJoey: (yelling through the door) Can we come it yet?! We’re dying out here!ScenesMonica: Come in! Come in! (Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe burst through the door.) We’re engaged!!!Scenes(Everyone screams and has a group hug.)ScenesRachel: Ohhh, this is the least jealous I’ve ever been!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no wait no, this is wrong! Ross isn’t here!ScenesMonica: Oh…ScenesRachel: Oh hell, he’s done this three times! He knows what its about!ScenesJoey: Yeah!Scenes(They all hug again.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, it’s just Monica and Chandler dancing to Wonderful Tonight on the Slowhand album by Eric Clapton. And you can buy that album from the CFSI, just click on the CDNow link.]
rows.Content: EndScenesThe One After VegasScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: The Wedding Chapel, continued from last season. Chandler and Monica are about to get married.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay! (Stands up) This is it! (Claps his hands) We're gonna get married!ScenesMonica: Are you sure you wanna do this?Scenes(Suddenly the doors burst open, and ROSS AND RACHEL COME OUT ARM-IN-ARM!!!!! And Rachel's carrying a bouquet!!! THEY GOT MARRIED!!!!)ScenesRoss: Well, hello, Mrs. Ross! (Throws some rice.)ScenesRachel: Well, hello, Mr. Rachel! (Throws some more rice.)Scenes(They storm out into the street.)ScenesRachel: Wait! (Gets her bearings) Okay!Scenes(She goes one way; he goes the other. The camera pans back to Chandler and Monica, and needless to say, they're standing there dumbstruck.)ScenesMonica: Whoa!ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: (entering with Phoebe) Come on Pheebs! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry! Hurry!ScenesPhoebe: Okay! Okay! Okay! (They run into the chapel.)Scenes(Chandler and Monica are stunned again.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God!! Is everybody getting married?!!Scenes(Phoebe and Joey run back out and head towards the street.)ScenesAttendant: (scolding them) N-No running in the chapel!ScenesPhoebe: (to her) Hey! Don’t you give me any of your—Hey! (Sees Chandler and Monica standing there.)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: What are you guys doing here?ScenesJoey: Ross and Rachel left us a message saying they were getting married! Isn’t that why you guys are here?ScenesChandler: Yes! Well that-yes.ScenesMonica: Why else would we be here?ScenesJoey: Well! What happened?! Did we miss it?ScenesChandler: We actually missed it.ScenesPhoebe: Well, maybe you wouldn’t have had you (turns to the attendant) run in the chapel!ScenesMonica: This is insane!ScenesPhoebe: What’s the big deal, y’know? It’s not like it’s a real marriage.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, if you get married in Vegas, you’re only married in Vegas.ScenesMonica: What are you talking about? If you get married in Vegas you’re married everywhere.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) Really?!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!—Eh! Well…ScenesOpening CreditsScenes{Transciber’s note: In case you haven’t heard, Courteney Cox got married to David Arquette during hiatus and changed her name to Courteney Cox Arquette. But David was a busy boy during the off season for not only did he marry but everyone else as well. For they’re all listed as Jennifer Aniston Arquette, Lisa Kudrow Arquette, in an interesting twist Matt LeBlanc Arquette, Matthew Perry Arquette, David Schwimmer Arquette, and even the creators of the show are now David Crane Arquette and Marta Kauffman Arquette. I just wonder what the new sleeping arrangements are…}

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s hotel room, she’s waking up with a horrendous hangover.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohhh! (Looks in the mirror and sees that she still has her mustache and groans.)Scenes(Suddenly, there’s movement beside her, startling her. It’s Ross! He wakes up and they both start screaming in terror. Then they both grab their heads having aggravated their hangovers.)ScenesRoss: Why are we in bed together?ScenesRachel: I don’t know. Do-do you have any clothes on?ScenesRoss: (checks) Yeah.ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesRoss: No! But we-we didn’t have…sex-uh, did we? I mean, I don’t remember much about last night, it was such a blur.ScenesRachel: Oh! I remember laughing! I laughed a lot.ScenesRoss: And we didn’t have sex.Scenes(Rachel agrees with him and starts to get out of bed.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, I mean, we were really drunk. I’m just glad we didn’t do anything stupid.ScenesRoss: (getting up) Tell me about it. (He sits up on the edge of the bed and has "Just Married" written on his back.)

rows.Scenes: The breakfast buffet, Phoebe is already sitting at the table as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Mornin’ Pheebs. (Sits down.) Well, my movie has officially been canceled.ScenesPhoebe: Oh Joey, I’m so sorry. You want some of my breakfast?ScenesJoey: Nah, I’m too depressed to eat. I’ll probably eat in like 5 minutes. So I guess I’ll just fly home with you guys, what time’s your flight?ScenesPhoebe: What about my cab?ScenesJoey: I don’t need that anymore.ScenesPhoebe: No, Joey! You borrowed my cab; you have to drive it back.ScenesJoey: I don’t want to drive all the way back by myself, I get so lonely. (Gets an idea.) Oh—ooh! How about you come with me?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, it’s such a long trip.ScenesJoey: It’ll be great! We-we could talk, and play games! Huh? This could be our chance to like renew our friendship.ScenesPhoebe: Are you asking me to have a frenaissance?ScenesJoey: Sure?ScenesPhoebe: All right. Although I don’t think we need one, I never stopped loving you.Scenes(Chandler and Monica enter.)ScenesChandler: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesChandler: So, has anyone talked to Dr. and Mrs. Geller yet?ScenesPhoebe: Um-hmm, yeah. They left me a message; they should be here any minute.ScenesJoey: Where is the waitress?! I’m starving!ScenesChandler: It’s a buffet man.ScenesJoey: Oh, here’s where I win all my money back! (Gets up and heads for the buffet table with Chandler in tow.)ScenesChandler: Listen, I gotta talk to you.ScenesJoey: Sure! What’s up? (He grabs a plate and proceeds to load it with a huge pile of scrambled eggs. Chandler just stares at him and Joey reluctantly gives him a spoonful.)ScenesChandler: Monica and I almost got married last night.ScenesJoey: Oh my God! That’s huge! (Hugs him.) Wait a minute, why come I wasn’t invited? And who was going to be your best man? Don’t say, "Ross." Do not say, "Ross.ScenesChandler: Look, I just don’t think Monica and I are ready to get married yet! Y’know? I mean, I love her and everything but seeing Ross and Rachel coming out of that chapel was like a, like a wake-up call that Monica and I are moving so fast. Y’know? And, how do I tell her without crushing her?ScenesJoey: Oh! Tell her she’s not marriage material.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Girls say it to me all the time! And believe me, if she’s anything like me, she’s just gonna be relieved.Scenes[Pan to Monica and Phoebe having the same conversation.]ScenesMonica: How do I tell Chandler that it’s too soon. It’s gonna break his heart, he’s not gonna think that I don’t love him anymore.ScenesPhoebe: Well you don’t.ScenesMonica: Yes I do!ScenesPhoebe: Good! Good! I was just testing you.ScenesChandler: (returning with Joey) Hi.ScenesMonica: Oh hi! Hi! Y’know, we were just talking about bacon.ScenesPhoebe: No, we were talking about tennis. Tennis is more believable.Scenes(Ross and Rachel enter.)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesThe Girls: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!Scenes(They both sit down and Rachel pours them both some coffee. They’re acting like nothing’s happened and everyone is just staring at them.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: Are we gonna talk about what you guys did last night? Or…ScenesRachel: (To Ross) I don’t know. (To the gang.) What do you mean last night? Nothing, nothing uh, happened last night.ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh! Ross invited us all to watch.Scenes(Rachel turns to Ross stunned.)ScenesMonica: Rach! We weren’t gonna miss our friends getting married!ScenesRachel: (gasps) Who got married?! (Ross is as surprised to hear this as she is.)ScenesChandler: (not quite sure) You did.ScenesRoss: What?! Hello! We didn’t get married.ScenesRachel: No, we didn’t get married! That’s ridiculous!Scenes(They turn to look at each other and suddenly remember that they did in fact get married.)ScenesRoss: We-we-we—I remember being in a chapel.ScenesRachel: Oh my God.ScenesRoss: I—They would not let us get married when we were that drunk!ScenesRachel: No!ScenesJoey: They let you get married when you’re drunk! Most people who get married in Vegas are drunk!ScenesPhoebe: Hell, I’m drunk right now! (They all turn and look at her.) What? I can’t have a mimosa with breakfast?! I’m on vacation!ScenesMonica: What are you guys gonna do?ScenesRachel: Well, I guess we just find a divorce lawyer? (Looks at Ross.)ScenesChandler: Well, I think, I think, Ross already has one. Now, this one’s free, right? Because you paid for the first two, so the third one’s free.ScenesRoss: Laugh it up, but the joke’s on you. Because we don’t need to get divorced, okay? We we’re just gonna get an annulment.ScenesJoey: An annulment? Ross! I don’t think surgery’s the answer here.ScenesPhoebe: Oh-oh, that’s your thing.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: You’re thing. You’re thing. Y’know? You’re the guy who gets divorced.ScenesAll: Oh yeah!ScenesRoss: No-no, that’s-that’s not my thing! I do not love getting divorced!ScenesPhoebe: Yes you do! This is your third divorce! You love divorce so much you’re probably gonna marry it! Then it won’t work out and you’re gonna have to divorce it, divorcing guy. (Pause) I’m so drunk.

rows.Scenes: The casino floor, Chandler and Monica are walking through it.]
rows.Content: Monica: So, what do you think we should do?ScenesChandler: I don’t know. But I-I-I know I love you!ScenesMonica: I know I love you! (They hug.)ScenesChandler: So where are we on the whole going back to the place where they have all the marriages thing? I love you.ScenesMonica: That’s a good question. Look umm, last night we let the dice decide. Maybe we should leave it up to fate again. I love you!ScenesChandler: Yes, we don’t get married unless there’s a sign! Okay, so say uh, say you roll another eight (motions to the craps table) then there’s a definite sign that we should get married.ScenesMonica: All right, eight we get married, but 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 11, 12 we don’t get married.ScenesChandler: Sounds great.ScenesMonica: Okay. (They approach the craps table.)ScenesCroupler: Coming in, we got a shooter! Money please.ScenesMonica: Ready?ScenesChandler: Ready!ScenesMonica: (sarcastic) Come on eight.ScenesChandler: (deadpan) Yes, yes eight.Scenes(Monica rolls the dice.)ScenesCroupler: Eight! Easy eight. (She rolls a 3 and a 5 and they’re stunned.)ScenesMonica: Wow! I can’t believe I actually rolled an eight.ScenesChandler: That was so unlikely. Well, let’s get married! I guess.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute. That wasn’t a hard eight! Last night I rolled a hard eight.ScenesChandler: That’s right! It was the wrong kind of eight, no wedding! Damnit!ScenesMonica: I wanted it so bad! (Pause) Wanna go pack?ScenesChandler: Yeah. (They go pack.) We’re doing the right thing, right?ScenesMonica: Ohh, of course we are! (They walk up to the elevators.) We left it up to fate. (Pushes the elevator button.) If we were supposed to get married there would be a clear-cut sign. (The elevator door opens to a priest reading from a bible with Chandler and Monica standing side-by-side holding each other’s hands.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s cab, Phoebe and Joey are driving back. Phoebe is driving while Joey is sleeping.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, you have 19 questions left. Use them wisely. (Joey groans.) Come on Joey! You can’t win if you don’t ask any (sees that he’s asleep) QUESTIONS!!!ScenesJoey: (wakes up) What?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, you promised me a fun road trip! We’ve been on the road six hours and you’ve been asleep for five and a half! We are switching at the next rest stop and you are going to drive all the way back! That will be your punishment, you greedy sleeper!ScenesJoey: All right. All right.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! And until then you are going to sing to me because the radio’s broken and you are selfish but have a nice voice.ScenesJoey: Really? I don’t…ScenesPhoebe: Sing!!ScenesJoey: (starts singing) I wanna rock and roll all night! (Falls asleep.)Scenes[Time lapse, Phoebe is asleep, Joey’s driving and having a hard time staying awake.]ScenesJoey: (to himself) Man, this is a long drive! Are my eyes open? No! (He opens his eyes and sees a hitchhiker.)Scenes[Time lapse, Phoebe is still asleep only Joey is now passed out next to her and the car’s still moving. She wakes up, sees Joey, and screams.]ScenesHitchhiker: (driving) Morning! (Phoebe screams again.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is on the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, hubby!ScenesRoss: Yeah. Yeah, actually um, I wanted to talk to you about that whole annulment thing?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: I’m not going to do that. (Rachel glares at him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier. Rachel starts laughing.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay! So, we’ll just stay married.ScenesRoss: Yes, exactly!ScenesRachel: And I will make everyone call me Mrs. Geller!ScenesRoss: Wow! This is so amazing. I uh, I really thought I’d have to talk you into this more.ScenesRachel: Okay, see now I’m scared because I don’t actually think you’re kidding.ScenesRoss: I’m-I’m not kidding. Look I-I, I can’t have three failed marriages. I can’t. Okay? I-I am not gonna be that guy!ScenesRachel: What-wh-what so we’ll just stay married forever?!ScenesRoss: Okay, look, how is this gonna affect you? Really? I mean you fill some form out once and a while and instead of checking the box that says Ms you check the box that says Mrs.! It’s right next to it!ScenesRachel: Ohh, okay, I’m sorry. You’re right. Y’know what? We absolutely can stay married, because I was under the impression that the boxes were far away from each other. All right, look, just please, take a moment here and think about what you’re asking of me.ScenesRoss: I’m asking you to do me a favor.Scenes{Note: Does anyone else want to smack Ross right about now? Raise your hands. Okay, put them down before you stink out the person next to you.}ScenesRachel: You are asking me to be your wife!ScenesRoss: And as my wife I think you should grant me this favor.

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Chandler is helping Monica to the door.]
rows.Content: Monica: That kid really kicked me hard on the plane.ScenesChandler: Well you did pull his hair.ScenesMonica: He took my snack!ScenesChandler: I’m not getting into this again!ScenesMonica: Okay! Oh God, y’know what? It’s really bad.ScenesChandler:  Well, I told you not to walk. Here. (Picks her up.) There. Okay. (He opens the door, carries her across the threshold, stops, backs out, and lets go of Monica who is only holding on by his neck.)ScenesMonica: This doesn’t mean anything, does it?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesMonica: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s cab, she’s driving, Joey’s in the back seat, and the hitchhiker is riding up front with Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (To Joey) How could you pick up a hitchhiker?! He could be a rape—(She holds her hand in front of the hitchhiker’s face), a rapist or a killer or something!ScenesJoey: Don’t you think I asked him that before he got in?!ScenesPhoebe: Y’know what? I’m not talking to you! You go back to sleep! (To the hitchhiker) And you, are you a rapist?!ScenesHitchhiker: No!ScenesPhoebe: Do you like car games?ScenesHitchhiker: Yeah, y’know the license plate game?ScenesPhoebe: I love the license plate game!ScenesJoey: Ooh, I’ll play! I’ll play!ScenesPhoebe: No-No! You need your sleep. Night-night! Shh! (She closes the partition.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: Listen, I know you wanted to talk to me, but I have an idea that may make you want to stay married. (Rachel shakes her head.) We register, and you get to keep all the presents!ScenesRachel: (thinks about it for a second) No! Ross, come on! No! Listen, look I thought a lot about how to tell you this and the bottom line, Ross, is we can not stay married.ScenesRoss: I don’t know if it’s true.ScenesRachel: Oh b-b-but it is!ScenesRoss: Oh, okay, y’know what this is? This is a difference of opinion. And when that happens in a marriage...ScenesRachel: Oh Ross, come on! This is not, this is not a marriage!! This is the world’s worst hangover! Ross, listen, if you do not get this annulment, I will!ScenesRoss: All right. All right, I’ll do it.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (He goes to leave.) Hey-hey umm, uh, is there, is there any such thing as an annulment shower?Scenes(Ross turns and leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s cab, it’s the same arrangement as before.]
rows.Content: Hitchhiker: Wait! Wait! There is the train station!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay.ScenesHitchhiker: This is where I get off. Well, I have your address and phone number.ScenesPhoebe: And I have your name and the fact that you’re a drifter, so the ball’s pretty much in your court.ScenesHitchhiker: All right, see ya Pheebs. (Gets out and Phoebe drives away.)ScenesJoey: Come on Pheebs! I can’t take this anymore! Let-let me make it up to you. Huh? (Starts singing.) Ground control to Major Tom. Commencing countdown, engines on. Take your protein pills and put your helmet on!ScenesPhoebe: Stop it! Stop it no! That’s not fair! Y’know I can’t resist that beautiful voice!ScenesJoey: Pheebs, I am so sorry! I know I promised you a fun road trip with your friend and I didn’t deliver. But-but-but now I know that you think being awake is an important part of friendship! So, so, so I will strive to-to stay awake for as long as I know you.ScenesPhoebe: You can still sleep at night and stuff.ScenesJoey: Well, thank you. So, can we play 20 Questions now? I’ve got a really good one! I’ve been thinking about it since Kansas.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Is it a kind of hot sandwich?ScenesJoey: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Is it a meatball sub?ScenesJoey: That is incredible! You are the master!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are there and Rachel is arranging a bouquet of flowers, pricks her finger on a thorn, throws the bouquet over her head, and those you who are quicker than some already know that Monica is the one who catches it.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Huh, that’s funny. You look like you’re gonna be the…ScenesMonica: No, don’t say it! Don’t even think it!ScenesRachel: All right. Okay Chandler, enjoy your handful. (Exits.)ScenesChandler: All right, should we just, should we just get married? Y’know? I mean should we just do it? All the signs are telling us to do it.ScenesMonica: I’m sick of the signs! It’s too fast, I’m happy the way things are!ScenesChandler: Me too!ScenesMonica: I don’t want things to change! Do you?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesMonica: All right then, then nothing changes! Everything is great! Everything stays the same! And you go unpack because it’s been three days and it’s driving me insane!ScenesChandler: Jeez, relax! It’s not like we’re mar-ah-ah!! (Runs out.)ScenesChandler: (entering, slowly) Y’know I was thinking, what if I uh, unpack here?ScenesMonica: Then all your stuff would be here.ScenesChandler: Well, what if all my stuff was here?ScenesMonica: Then you’d be going back and forth all the time, I mean it doesn’t make any sense.ScenesChandler: Okay. What if we lived together and you understand what I’m saying?ScenesMonica: Live together? There have been no signs for that.ScenesChandler: Me asking is kind of a sign.ScenesMonica: YES!!!!!!!!ScenesChandler: Okay!!!!!Scenes(And the crowd goes wild! Well, at least the live studio audience.)ScenesMonica: Yes! Okay! Okay! Wait-wait-wait!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Here’s your key (Gets him one.)ScenesChandler: Oh thanks.ScenesMonica: Here’s your key. All right, you have to christen it! Now, go out and come back in!ScenesChandler: The door hasn’t been locked in five years, but okay! (Runs out.) Ready?!ScenesMonica: Ready!Scenes(He tries, but something happens.)ScenesChandler: Okay, a little problem. The key broke in the lock and I can’t get in!ScenesMonica: Wait! Oh my God! I can’t get out!ScenesChandler: This is not a sign!ScenesMonica: No, it’s not a sign! It’s a very old key!ScenesChandler: It’s an old key!ScenesMonica: Oh my God it’s old!ScenesChandler: I love you!ScenesMonica: I love you!ScenesChandler: Are you hugging the door right now.Scenes(Pause)ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Yeah-yeah, me neither.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are on the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, so did everything go all right with the annulment?ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, no problems. It’s all taken care of.ScenesRachel: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, why not?ScenesRachel: Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: No thanks, I’ve already seen one.ScenesRachel: Okay, umm, I’m gonna get my sweater. (Walks away.)ScenesRoss: Okay. (Sits down next to Phoebe.) You uh, you wanna hear something weird?ScenesPhoebe: Always.ScenesRoss: I didn’t get the annulment.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: We’re still married! Don’t tell Rachel. See you later. (He gets up leaving Phoebe in shock.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Joey is coming up the stairs and sees Chandler trying to open the lock.]
rows.Content: Joey: What are you doing?ScenesChandler: The key’s stuck in the lock.ScenesJoey: I can fix it. Hold on. (He goes and gets a screwdriver from his apartment) Look out. Look out. (Pries at the door a little bit.)ScenesChandler: (trying the handle) It still doesn’t work.ScenesJoey: I’m not finished.ScenesChandler: Oh.Scenes(Joey goes back into the apartment, runs back into the hallway, throws his shoulder against the door, and knocks it down off it’s hinges.)ScenesChandler: Nice job Joe! You’re quite the craftsmen.Scenes(Joey pats him on the stomach and heads to bed.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Ross Hugs RachelScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, it’s the same scene from the end of last week’s show. Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, so did everything go okay with the annulment?ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, no problems. It’s all taken care of.ScenesRachel: Ross, thank you. Hey, do you guys wanna go see a movie?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, why not?ScenesRachel: Okay, umm, I’m gonna get my sweater. (Walks away.)ScenesRoss: Okay. (Sits down next to Phoebe.) You uh, you wanna hear something weird?ScenesPhoebe: Always.ScenesRoss: I didn’t get the annulment.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: We’re still married! Don’t tell Rachel. See you later. (He gets up leaving Phoebe in shock.)Scenes[Cut to outside Central Perk.]ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Hey, do you have any gum?ScenesRachel: Oh? Yeah! Sure!ScenesPhoebe: (running out) Wait! Wait! Hi! Listen, Ross can I just talk to you for just a second?ScenesRachel: Oh but Phoebe, we’re gonna be late for the movie.Scenes(A cab pulls up.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, there’s a cab! Taxi!! (The cab stops and she opens the door.) Good timing, my God, huh? Here you go. (Pushes Rachel in and closes the door.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, we’re, we’re actually just gonna walk ‘cause it’s right up there at the Angelica.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, the Angelica!! Go! Go! (She bangs on the cab’s roof and it pulls away.) (To Ross) You didn’t get the annulment?!!ScenesRoss: I know.ScenesPhoebe: Ross?!ScenesRoss: Well, I tried! But when I got to my lawyer’s office all I could hear was, "Three divorces. Three divorces!" Look, I just don’t want my tombstone to read, Ross Gellar, Three Divorces.ScenesPhoebe: Don’t be worried about that! Your tombstone can say whatever you want it to say! It could say, Ross Geller, Good at Marriage! Y’know? Mine’s gonna say Phoebe Buffay, Buried Alive.ScenesRoss: Look, all I know is I-I can’t have another failed marriage!ScenesPhoebe: So okay what? You’re gonna be married to a girl who doesn’t even know about it?!—Op, woman! Sorry.ScenesRoss: Well, okay so, I don’t have it all worked out quite yet. Just don’t say anything to Rachel, please?ScenesPhoebe: Rachel is one of my closest friends. (Pause) Although, being the only one who knows anything about this does makes me feel special. Okay!Scenes(Rachel’s cab backs up.)ScenesRachel: (to the driver) Okay, stop-stop! Phoebe?!ScenesPhoebe: Hey Rach!ScenesRachel: What was that?!ScenesPhoebe: Sorry, mix up. Hey, how was the movie?ScenesRachel: I haven’t seen it yet!ScenesPhoebe: Well then you’d better hurry! The Angelica! Go! Go! (Bangs on the roof again and off they go.)ScenesRachel: Noooooooo!!ScenesOpening CreditsScenes{Transciber’s note: In case you’re wondering, and I know you are. Their names are all back to normal. Just in a slightly smaller font than usual to allow Courteney Cox Arquette to fit on one line and not be smaller than the rest of their names. Now, on with the show…}

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are cuddling on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Y’know when we move in together, can I get a gumball machine?ScenesMonica: Of course! Joey wouldn’t let you have one?ScenesChandler: No. When it comes to sweets, he’s surprisingly strict.ScenesMonica: Hey, have you figured out a way to tell him you’re moving out?ScenesChandler: No, no, I keep trying, y’know? I can get out, "Joey, I have too…" but then I lose my nerve and I always finish with, "…go to the bathroom." He may think I’m sick.ScenesMonica: Y’know, I really have to tell Rachel, but I… We just have to get it over with! Y’know, the next time we see them we’re just gonna tell them. Okay? That’s it.ScenesChandler: Oh, so that’s this is gonna work now? You’re just gonna order me around all the time?ScenesMonica: Pretty much.ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey Monica!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Hey man, you feeling any better? (Chandler answers him with some guttural sounds that only he can make and that no human can transcribe.)ScenesMonica: Joey, we have something to tell you.ScenesJoey: Oh my God! You’re pregnant!ScenesChandler: No-o-o! (To Monica) No? (She nods no.) No-o-o! Look Joey, here’s the thing, Monica and I have decided to live together, here. So, I’m gonna be moving out man.ScenesJoey: Wow! (Tearing up) Well, uh… Hey! I’m really happy for you guys! Congratulations! (Kisses Monica on the cheek) See you later. (Starts for the door on the verge of tears as Monica stops him.)ScenesMonica: Wait! Joey! Joey! Are you okay?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, I gotta go! I got an acting job. (Turns towards the door, pauses, and turns back.) Like you’d believe that. This sucks!ScenesChandler: Look, I-I’m just gonna be right across the hall and I promise you, the minute Monica and I break up I’m moving right back in with you!ScenesJoey: (To Monica) Okay! Look-look-look, uh, if you’re gonna be moving in with him I feel it’s my responsibility to tell you the truth about him! Okay? He’s a terrible roommate! Terrible! He uh, forgets to umm… Oh-oh he always, he always umm—Oh, who am I kidding! He’s the best roommate ever! (Hugs Chandler.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey, have you seen Rachel?ScenesPhoebe: No, why?ScenesMonica: I have some pretty exciting news!ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) You’re pregnant!ScenesMonica: No! Chandler and I are moving in together!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! That’s good! Wow! But now if you were pregnant, what would you name it? Hint: Phoebe.Scenes(Ross returns from getting some coffee.)ScenesRoss: Hey! Hi!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRoss: What’s up?ScenesMonica: Well umm, Chandler and I are moving in together.ScenesRoss: Oh my God. Ohh, my little sister and my best friend…shaking up. Oh, that’s great. That’s great. (Kisses and hugs her.)ScenesPhoebe: Guys, I’m happy too.ScenesMonica: Okay, come here! (Phoebe joins them in the hug.)ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Big day huh? People moving in, people getting annulled… (Winks at Ross.)ScenesMonica: Okay, I gotta go find Rachel but umm, if you guys see her could you please try to give her some really bad news so that mine doesn’t seem so bad? (Exits.)ScenesRoss: Bye.ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, something bad to tell Rachel… Bad news for Rachel, what could that be?!ScenesRoss: Could ya just, could ya just lay off, please? All right? My life is an embarrassment! I should go live under somebody’s stairs!ScenesPhoebe: Ross, it’s not that big a deal! So you’ll been divorced three times, you’ll still have a life, you’ll go on dates…ScenesRoss: (interrupting) No! No, I won’t! I’ll be at the bottom of the dating barrel now. The only guys below me will be Four Divorce Guy uh, Murderer Guy, and-and, Geologists.ScenesPhoebe: Ross, you’re being ridiculous! Okay? You are cute and smart and sweet and that is much more important than three stupid divorces!ScenesRoss: Oh yeah? Have you ever dated anyone who has been divorced three times?ScenesPhoebe: Y’know that’s really fair. Y’know? Most guys who have been divorced three times are like 60. Ross, nobody cares about this except you! This-this embarrassment thing is all in your head! Here, I’ll show you! Come here.ScenesRoss: What?! Why?Scenes(She grabs his arm and drags him over to a table where three beautiful women are sitting. Now, I’m going to go out on a limb and say that their names are Stephanie, Karin, and Meg. Okay, so I looked at the credits. Of course, only Meg is named later on, so I’ll have to guess who is Stephanie and who is Karin. But, we’ll cross that bridge when we come to it.)ScenesPhoebe: (to the girls) Hi! Hi! Listen, my friend Ross is about to be divorced for the third time, but wouldn’t you date him?ScenesRoss: And if you wait right here, I’ll go get Ross. (Phoebe grabs his arm and prevents him from escaping.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is pacing anxiously waiting for Rachel.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Ugh, I thought you were Rachel!ScenesChandler: (looking down) What gave me away?ScenesMonica: I just tell her, I have to get it over with. I told Ross and Phoebe and she’s the only one left!ScenesChandler: Okay, so that’s it, everybody knows! It’s official, we’re moving in together. No turning back. Are ya scared? Are ya?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Wow that was my scariest voice! You’re very brave.Scenes(They hug as Rachel enters.)ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Ugh, the worse day! Y’know, you think you’re making progress at work and then your boss calls you Raquel.ScenesChandler: Hey listen, for the first four years of my work everybody called me Sha-la-lap. (Awkward silence ensues.) Seriously.ScenesRachel: I believe you. So, it was right in the middle of a staff meeting so of course no one else wants to correct her so everyone else is calling me Raquel! By the end of the day, the mailroom guys were calling me Rocky!ScenesChandler: Well, I-I still think you’re very-very nice and very pretty…ScenesRachel: What?ScenesChandler: (To Monica) All yours babe. (Walks away.)ScenesMonica: Have a seat. (They sit at the table.) Okay, listen umm, Chandler and I are going to live together, here.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! That’s so great! I’m so happy for you guys!ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesRachel: And that was so sweet of you to ask! Oh my God, the three of us are gonna have such a good time living together!ScenesMonica: Yes, we are. (Chandler is frantically trying to get Monica to correct her.)ScenesRachel: And Chandler, you’re gonna have to watch those long showers you take in the morning because you know Raquel can’t be late.ScenesChandler: Rach…ScenesMonica: Yeah, he’s gonna work on that.ScenesRachel: Ohh! This is so exciting! Oh God… (Gasps and starts to sing) Come and knock on my door…ScenesMonica: (singing) We’ll be waiting for you…Scenes{Transciber’s note: I’ll finish that one for those of you who don’t know what they’re talking about. Where the towels are Hers and Hers and His, Three’s Company too! Yeah, that’s the theme song for Three’s Company.}ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is hosting an impromptu roundtable discussion with Stephanie, Karin, and Meg about Ross’s three divorces.]
rows.Content: Ross: …once you know the stories, it’s not that bad. First marriage, wife’s hidden sexuality, not my fault. Second marriage, said the wrong name at the altar, a little my fault. Third marriage, well they really shouldn’t allow you to get married when you’re that drunk and have writing all over your face, Nevada’s fault.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so what do you think ladies? Who wouldn’t be interested? Who wouldn’t want to date him?ScenesStephanie: Well the divorces don’t bother me, I’d date him. But, not while he’s still married.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, what about you? (Points to Karin) Wouldn’t you want a date?ScenesKarin: Actually, I’m dating at all anymore. See, I figured out that I was only dating guys that were like y’know bad for me, so until I work that out…ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting) Whatever! What about you Meg?ScenesMeg: Well, I don’t care about the divorces either, but I wouldn’t date him. It’s just that he’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl.ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesPhoebe: (leaning to him) She said, "He’s obviously still in love with this Rachel girl." (He glares at her.)ScenesRoss: This is crazy! I mean, yes-yes Rachel is my good friend and I-I have loved her in the past, but now, she is just my wife! Phoebe, will you-will you help me out here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I thought you loved her when you-when you married her.ScenesRoss: We were drunk! I would’ve married uh, Joey with that amount of alcohol!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! You could do a lot worse than Joey Tribbiani!!ScenesRoss: (to the panel) Look, I’m sorry, but you guys are wrong. I just don’t want to be divorced three times.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, and now he’s using this three divorces reason because he wants to stay married to her because he loves her. I must say, "Well done!" Bravo Meg.ScenesRoss: (getting up) Okay! Fine! Fine! If-if this is what you think, forget about the whole three divorce thing! Okay, I-I’ll go to my lawyer’s office right now and get this marriage annulled! Okay?! Because she means nothing to me! Noth—(leans down to Meg’s ear)—Nothing!!ScenesMeg: Okay now I wouldn’t date you because you seem a little creepy.ScenesKarin: I am so attracted to him right now.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are still debating about how to tell Rachel that Chandler’s moving in and she’s moving out.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, when are we gonna tell Rachel what is actually gonna happen?ScenesMonica: Soon! I-I just couldn’t before. You saw how upset Joey got! I couldn’t do that to her, she’s my best friend!ScenesChandler: Well, Joey’s my best friend.ScenesMonica: I’m not your best friend?ScenesChandler: You just said… Of course you’re my best friend. Would you please tell Rachel though?ScenesMonica: All right, all right, at least I’m prepared.ScenesChandler: Okay. (She grabs a tin of freshly baked cookies) Oh yes. (He reaches for one.)ScenesMonica: (slapping his hand) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey!ScenesMonica: These aren’t for you! Are you upset?ScenesChandler: I am now!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey roomie!ScenesChandler: Okay, bye! (Exits.)ScenesMonica: Rach, there’s something uh, important I have to tell you.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Are you pregnant?!ScenesMonica: No! But, I’m throwing this shirt away! I think there was a little misunderstanding before.ScenesRachel: Um-hmm.ScenesMonica: Umm, when I said that uh, that Chandler and I wanted to umm, live together we meant alone together.ScenesRachel: (laughs) Oh my God! Oh, that’s funny, I can’t believe I did that.ScenesMonica: Oh no sweetie, no! This is my fault, I wasn’t clear! I’m really sorry. And listen, you take as much time as you need to move out okay? There’s absolutely no rush.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Sits back and resumes her reading.)ScenesMonica: Okay. Don’t you want a cookie?ScenesRachel: Sure? (Monica hands her one.) Thanks.ScenesMonica: Maybe, do you need a tissue?Scenes(Rachel mumbles uh-huh and spits the half-eaten cookie out onto the tissue.)ScenesRachel: Monica, where did you get these?!ScenesMonica: I made them!ScenesRachel: Ooh, good God, they’re so yummy! (She re-ingests the previously expelled cookie matter from the tissue.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is packing some books and Joey is watching him.]
rows.Content: Joey: God, it’s gonna so weird like when I come home and you’re not here. Y’know? No more Joey and Chan’s. No more J and C’s. "You wanna go over to Joey and Chandler’s?" "Can’t, its not there.ScenesChandler: Look, I’m just gonna be across the hall, we can still do all the same stuff.ScenesJoey: Yeah but we won’t be able to like get up in the middle of the night and have those long talks about our feelings and the future.ScenesChandler: Not once did we do that.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi.ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hi.ScenesMonica: So I, I told Rachel it was just gonna be the two of us.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah? Well, how’d she take it?ScenesMonica: Really well. Yeah. Surprisingly well. Yeah, she didn’t cry. She wasn’t angry or sad. (Sits down, slightly disgusted.)ScenesChandler: And you’re upset because you didn’t make your best friend cry?ScenesMonica: I mean, all I’m asking for is just a little emotion! Is that too much to ask after six years?! I mean what? Are-are-are Rachel and I not as close as you guys?! I mean do we not have as much fun?! Don’t I deserve a few tears?!! I mean we-we told Joey, he cried his eyes out!ScenesJoey: Hey! I did not cry my eyes out!! Come on! It’s like the end of an era! No more J-man and Channie’s!!ScenesChandler: Okay, I gotta ask, who calls us that?!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s lawyer’s office, his name is Russell and has just been told by Ross about his current situation.]
rows.Content: Russell: You got married again.ScenesRoss: Yes.ScenesRussell: So that’s your second marriage in two years.ScenesRoss: Yes, second in two years. Third overall.ScenesRussell: Ross, I have been a divorce attorney for 23 years and never had I so much business from one client. Why don’t you tell me what happened.ScenesRoss: Basically, Rachel and I were in Vegas and we got drunk…ScenesRussell: (interrupting) I’m sorry, is this the same Rachel who’s name you said at the altar in the second marriage?ScenesRoss: Yes-yes-yes! But, I-I do not love her.ScenesRussell: Oh, that’s better then.ScenesRoss: This was just a drunken mistake and I need to get it annulled.ScenesRussell: I see. Have you considered therapy?ScenesRoss: I think just the annulment for today.ScenesRussell: There are a couple of forms to fill out.ScenesRoss: Easy.ScenesRussell: And we’ll need to have witnesses who can testify that you were not of uh, sound mind.ScenesRoss: No problem.ScenesRussell: And we’ll need you and Rachel to testify before a judge.ScenesRoss: Ooh! There’s no way to do this without her? ‘Cause I kinda all ready told her uh, it was, it was already taken care of.ScenesRussell: Of course you did. Look Ross, you can’t get an annulment unless you and Rachel are both there.ScenesRoss: Uh-ha, what about someone who looks like Rachel? (Russell glares at him.) I will think about the therapy.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is painting her toe nails as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey. So um, I was thinking that maybe we should start dividing up our stuff.ScenesRachel: Okay!ScenesMonica: Y’know, no point in dragging it out. Dragging out the long process of you moving out and us not living together anymore.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, what about this? (She holds up a chrome 5-point star.) Huh? Who-who gets this? See, I don’t know if I want it because it might be y’know, too many memories!ScenesRachel: (grabbing the star) What the hell is that?ScenesMonica: I don’t know. (Picks up a big plate from the coffee table.) Hey, Rachel, you want the big plate? I want you to have the big plate.ScenesRachel: Wow! Mon, thanks! I love this plate!ScenesMonica: Something to remember me by!ScenesRachel: Mon, honey you’re not dying. I’m just moving out. Y’know, I mean we’re gonna see each other all the time.ScenesMonica: But still, it’s a big change. The end of an era, you might say!ScenesRachel: Are you okay? You’re not blinking.ScenesMonica: I’m fine! I just, I’m thinking how much it’s an end of era.ScenesRachel: Oh, all right. But y’know I gotta say, I don’t, I don’t think six years counts as an era.ScenesMonica: An era is defined as a significant period of time. Now, it was significant to me, maybe it wasn’t significant to you!ScenesRachel: What is the matter with you?!ScenesMonica: What is the matter with you?!! Why aren’t you more upset?! Aren’t you gonna be sad that we’re not gonna be living together anymore?! I mean aren’t you gonna miss me at all?!ScenesRachel: All right, fine, but don’t get mad at me. It’s-it’s just a little hard to believe.ScenesMonica: What’s hard to believe?ScenesRachel: Well y’know, it’s you guys. You-you do this kind of stuff! Y’know? I mean, you-you were gonna get married in Vegas and then you backed out! I guess I’m not upset because I don’t see you guys going through with it. I’m sorry.ScenesMonica: Rachel, it’s going to happen. Chandler is gonna move in here.ScenesRachel: But I…ScenesMonica: No-no, wait! Just let me finish, okay? This isn’t something that we just, we just impulsively decided in-in Vegas, this is something we both really want. And it is going to happen.ScenesRachel: It is? Really?ScenesMonica: Yeah, sweetie.ScenesRachel: (starting to lose her composure) I mean we’re not, we’re not gonna live together anymore?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRachel: What? Oh my God! I’m gonna miss you so much! (Starts to cry.)ScenesMonica: I’m gonna miss you! (They hug.)ScenesRachel: I mean it’s the end of an era!ScenesMonica: I know!

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Ross is coming up the stairs as Phoebe leaves Joey and Chandler’s.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Joey and Chandler) Okay, bye!ScenesRoss: Oh no.ScenesPhoebe: So? Did you get the annulment?ScenesRoss: I couldn’t.ScenesPhoebe: I knew it! Because you love Rachel.ScenesRoss: It’s not that. Okay? Annulments are more complicated than I…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, complicated ‘cause of the love.ScenesRoss: I… I do, I do not love Rachel. I’m gonna tell her right now about the whole thing so we can get this marriage annulled as fast as possible. Okay? Would I do that if I loved her?ScenesPhoebe: I’ve never been more convinced of your love for her.ScenesRoss: I do not have feelings for Rachel! Okay?! (He goes into her apartment.)Scenes[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s as Ross walks through the door. Rachel is holding the chrome star and crying.]ScenesRoss: Ohh, what’s wrong?!ScenesRachel: Monica and Chandler are really moving in here and I have to move out and everything is changing.ScenesRoss: Oh my—Come here! Come here! (He hugs her.) It’s okay. Everything’s gonna be okay.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesRoss: Of course.Scenes(Ross suddenly realizes something.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Phoebe are talking.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, Ross and Rachel got married, Monica and Chandler almost got married, do you think you and I should hook up?ScenesPhoebe: Oh we do, but not just yet.ScenesJoey: Really?! Well, when?ScenesPhoebe: Okay umm, well, first Chandler and Monica will get married and be filthy rich by the way. Yeah. But it won’t work out.ScenesJoey: Wow.ScenesPhoebe: I know. Then, I’m gonna marry Chandler for the money and you’ll marry Rachel and have the beautiful kids.ScenesJoey: Great!ScenesPhoebe: But then we ditch those two and that’s when we get married. We’ll have Chandler’s money and Rachel’s kids and getting custody will be easy because of Rachel’s drinking problem.ScenesJoey: Oh-oh, what about Ross?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t want to go into the whole thing, but umm, we have words and I kill him.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Ross’s DenialScenesWritten by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Monica, and Phoebe are there as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Check it out! This is unbelievable! Joey has been holding his breath for almost four minutes!Scenes(We see Joey who has puffed up his cheeks and Chandler nonchalantly reaches down and pinches Joey’s nose shut. In a few seconds, Joey has to move because he’s now forced to actually hold his breath.)ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Dude! What are yo—you trying to kill me?!ScenesRachel: (entering from her room) Pheebs, I wanna ask you something.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, what?ScenesRachel: Well since I’m movin’ out and-and you’re so beautiful…ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesRachel: …how about I move in with you?ScenesPhoebe: Well, that would be great but then what do we do about Denise?ScenesMonica: Who’s Denise?ScenesPhoebe: My roommate.ScenesRachel: You have a roommate?!ScenesPhoebe: Yes, Denise. Denise!ScenesJoey: Hey, what is with the secrecy Phoebe? Huh? And what about this Denise, is she cute?ScenesChandler: Pheebs, I don’t understand. How can you have a roommate that none of us know anything about?ScenesPhoebe: Maybe because you never listen to anything that I say. I talk about her all the time! DENISE!!!!!ScenesJoey: Hey Rach, listen I was thinkin’ uh, I’m gonna have an extra room over at my place…ScenesRachel: Oh, that’s true.ScenesJoey: Yeah, why don’t you move in with me? It’ll be great! We could stay up late, watch movies, and you know about Naked Thursday’s right?ScenesRachel: Yeah, yeah I think I’m gonna find my own place.ScenesChandler: Hey-hey! I thought Naked Thursday’s was just our thing man!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is reading a magazine, eating a cookie, and drinking some coffee as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: So, what did Rachel say when you told her you were still married to her?ScenesRoss: Oh, that. Umm, she took it really well.ScenesPhoebe: You didn’t tell her did you?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesPhoebe: Of course not, because you’re in love with her.ScenesRoss: I am not in love with her. She was very upset about having to move out so I eh, didn’t tell her we were still married because she would only get more upset. I-I just comforted her, as a friend.ScenesPhoebe: What do you mean, comforted her?ScenesRoss: It’s nothing, I just gave her a hug.ScenesPhoebe: Ah-ha! A classic sign of love, the hug!ScenesRoss: It’s also a sign of friendship.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, not in your case Lovey Loverson. (Tries to take a bite out of Ross’s cookie.)ScenesRoss: (grabs back his cookie) It was a hug!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, just tell me this, did you or did you not smell her hair?ScenesRoss: S-s-smell her hair? What if I did?ScenesPhoebe: Ninety percent of a women’s pheromones come out the top of her head! That’s why, that’s why women are shorter. So that men will fall in love when they hug them! (Ross is staring at her dumbfounded.) Oh come on Ross, you’re a scientist.ScenesRoss: I was hugging her as a friend. It’s not my fault her-her hair got in my face, she’s got a lot of it and it smells all-all uh…coconutty. (Phoebe raises her eyebrows.) What?! Oh, that doesn’t mean I have feelings for Rachel! Maybe it means I have feelings for coconuts!ScenesPhoebe: (taking his coffee) Okay, whatever you say. But just be careful, all right? Rachel’s not in the same place you are.ScenesRoss: (grabbing back his coffee) If the place you are referring too is being in love, then she is in the same place as me because I am not in that place!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I didn’t understand that, but y’know, maybe that’s ‘cause you were speaking the secret language of love!Scenes(She goes for his magazine and he grabs it away before she reaches it. But she was only using the magazine as a decoy because she grabs his cookie and coffee, takes a bite out of the cookie and drinks some of the coffee.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are there as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! (To Chandler) Dude, some guy just called for you.ScenesChandler: Who was it?ScenesJoey: I don’t know! How about, "Thanks for taking the message." Jeez! (Exits.)ScenesMonica: Okay listen, y’know when you move in Rachel’s room is gonna be empty, you wanna talk about what we want to do with it?ScenesChandler: Sure!ScenesMonica: Okay, I was thinking we should have a beautiful guest room, right? With a mahogany sleigh bed and bedside tables with flowers on them all the time! And we could have a roll top desk with comment cards on them so people could say how much they loved staying here!! Okay, whatever, I really haven’t thought about it that much.ScenesChandler: Well, I like that idea. Obviously! I was thinking maybe-maybe-maybe it could be a game room, y’know? I mean you can buy old arcade games like uh, like Space Invaders and Asteroids for $200, the real ones! The big-big ones!ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Okay so you mean no as in, "Gee Chandler, what an interesting idea. Let’s discuss it before we reject it completely.ScenesMonica: Oh, I’m sorry. Of course I mean that. Interesting idea, umm, talk about it, but no.ScenesChandler: So, that’s it?ScenesMonica: I just don’t think arcade games go in the beautiful guest room. The beautiful guest room is gonna be filled with antiques.ScenesChandler: Which is why Asteroids is perfect! It’s the oldest game!ScenesMonica: What do you have against the beautiful guest room?ScenesChandler: I don’t have anything against the beautiful guest room, especially since everybody we know lives about 30 seconds away!ScenesMonica: Are you mocking me?ScenesChandler: No, I’m not mocking you, (in a mocking voice) or you beautiful guest room. (Exits.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is coming from across the hall.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, what’s up?ScenesChandler: Nothing, Monica and I had a stupid fight.ScenesJoey: But you’re still moving in together, right? Because my ad came out today. (Shows him the paper.)ScenesChandler: (reading the ad) "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." Nice!ScenesJoey: Yeah? I just figured y’know, after living with you it’d be an interesting change of pace to have a female roommate, y’know? Someone I can learn from, someone-someone who’s different than me. And what’s more different than me; a guy who’s not 19 than say a girl who is 19? Enh? (Points to his head.) Not just a hat rack my friend!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is on the couch staring off into space as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Pheebs, I have to ask you…ScenesPhoebe: Shhhhhh! I’m swamped right now.ScenesRachel: You’re just staring into space.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I’m trying to move that pencil. (There’s a pencil lying on the table.)ScenesRachel: This one? (Picks it up.)ScenesPhoebe: It worked!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, this whole apartment thing is just a nightmare! Every place I can afford comes with a roommate who is a freak. I mean, look at this; (Points to one and starts to read it.) "Wanted. Female roommate, non-smoker, non-ugly." It’s just, there is nothing! The city’s full!ScenesPhoebe: Wait, no, look at this! (Points to one.) (Reading) "Two bedroom, two bath, must be non-smoker, Satan worshipers okay…" Oh, yeah, but it’s on the ground floor.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: Rach, uh, you still looking for a place?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Why?ScenesRoss: Okay, there’s this guy, Warren, from the museum and he’s going on a dig for like two years and he’s got this great place he needs to sublet. So uh, you interested?ScenesRachel: That sounds great! I’d love to live at Warren’s!! I love Warren! Thank you!ScenesRoss: Don’t thank me! If you wanna thank something, thank the volcano that erupted thousands of years ago, killing but perfectly preserving an entire civilization. (Rachel just looks at him.) Here’s Warren’s number.ScenesRachel: Oh, this is great! I am gonna call him right now! (Jumps up.) Oh, thank you!Scenes(She hugs him and he starts to hug her back but notices the look Phoebe is giving him and pushes her away.)ScenesRoss: Okay, you go grab it!ScenesPhoebe: I saw it.ScenesRoss: I don’t know what you’re talking about.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I’m talking about that which you already know but won’t admit. You love her again; you re-love her!ScenesRoss: Look, I do not re-love her.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe you won’t just admit it! (Pause) Okay, just promise me that you won’t do anything stupid.ScenesRoss: Look, we’re just friends now! Okay? Why would I do anything stupid?ScenesRachel: (returning from calling Warren) Ugh!!! Well, the apartment is already subletted! I mean, this is just hopeless. I’m never gonna find anything.ScenesRoss: You can live with me.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God! Are you serious?!ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. (Phoebe grunts.)ScenesRachel: I would love to live with you Ross; that’s-that’s great! Thank you!ScenesRoss: Well, I’m-I’m just glad I could, y’know, help you out.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! I’m-I’m so happy for you guys. (To Ross) This is so-so, not stupid.ScenesRachel: Ross-Ross, you have no idea what this means to me! I mean, I mean I was gonna be homeless. You just saved me! You’re my hero!ScenesRoss: Hero, I uh, I don’t know—well, all right.ScenesRachel: Oh, I have to go tell Monica what a wonderful brother she has! (Kisses him on the cheek and exits.)ScenesRoss: Oh please! (He sits down.) (To Phoebe) You’re gonna say things now, aren’t ya?ScenesPhoebe: No. No, I won’t. But I should tell you this, this exact same thing happened to my roommate Denise. She moved in with a guy who was secretly married to her and he said he didn’t love her, but he really did, and it just blew up! And that’s how she ended up living with me! (Ross looks at her.) (Pause) Okay, that’s a lie.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is in the kitchen as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesChandler: Hi, listen, I’m sorry about before. I don’t need to have a game room. I mean when I was a kid I only played those games because I couldn’t get girls, and now I can ‘em—Now, I have you. (Monica glares at him.) Not-not that I think that I have you or think of you as property in any sort of way, I see women…ScenesMonica: Stop it Chandler. (Chandler is relieved) I’m sorry too.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesMonica: Yeah! Oh yes!ScenesChandler: Ohh.ScenesMonica: Listen, we don’t have to make that a guest room, we can think of something to do with the room together.ScenesChandler: That’s a great idea! We can easily think of a way for us both to enjoy the room.ScenesMonica: Totally!Scenes(They start thinking.)ScenesChandler: We don’t have to come up with this now.ScenesMonica: Oh good.ScenesChandler: Hey, y’know what? Why don’t we think about changes we can make in the living room?ScenesMonica: Changes?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I mean we’re gonna have to move around some furniture to make room for my chair. (Kisses her and heads into the living room.)ScenesMonica: You’re-you’re-you’re gonna bring the Barca Lounger over here?ScenesChandler: Is that a problem?ScenesMonica: Well, it’s a set and they should probably stay together.ScenesChandler: Oh, that’s cool. Then I’ll just bring them both over.ScenesMonica: See now-now you’re taking them away from their home.ScenesChandler: Okay, I get it. So, I get nothing! Nothing here is mine! Everything here is yours! I’ll get up in the morning put on your clothes, and head off to work!ScenesMonica: Yeah-yeah, y’know what? Yeah, that’s it-that’s it, everything will be mine! Nothing will be yours! That’s-that’s what I said! Oh come on, Chandler! I’m talking about the barca lounger! It just, it doesn’t match! Where is it gonna go?!ScenesChandler: In the game room!ScenesMonica: Look it is not my fault that your chairs are incredibly ugly!ScenesChandler: All right! That’s fine! That’s fine! I won’t bring over the chairs! I won’t bring anything over! I wouldn’t want to ruin the ambiance over here at Grandma’s place!! (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is interviewing a potential roommate. And yes, she’s a female, non-smoker and very non-ugly.]
rows.Content: Joey: (exiting from Chandler’s room with the new roommate) Everything on your application looks really good—Ohh! Just one last question umm, are you and your friends gonna be over here all the time like partying and hanging out?ScenesThe Potential Roommate: Oh don’t worry, I’m not really a party girl.ScenesJoey: Whoa!! Now look, don’t be just blurtin’ stuff out. I want you to really think about your answers. Okay?ScenesChandler: (entering) You can call off the roommate search! (To the potential roommate) Hi! I’ll be living here. (Heads for the bathroom.)ScenesJoey: Oh don’t listen to him, he’s just some guy who really wants the apartment, but I don’t think he’s gonna get it.ScenesChandler: Why did you take the shower curtain down?ScenesJoey: That thing was a hazard! (To the potential roommate) I’m very safety conscious.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Apartment, Rachel is entering and Ross is making some room on the shelves for his stuff.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey! Oh listen, I was just clearing some space for your stuff.ScenesRachel: Oh thanks, but listen, I was just at Monica’s and she and Chandler had a big fight and they’re not moving in.ScenesRoss: What do you mean, they’re not moving in? They-they’re still moving in right?ScenesRachel: No-no, they just had a big blowout over what to do with my room.ScenesRoss: What?! Over a stupid room!ScenesRachel: Yeah, I feel kinda bad for them, but I’m also really psyched ‘cause I don’t have to move in here!ScenesRoss: Oh no, yeah no, that part’s great!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering, dragging Chandler, to mediate the argument between Chandler and Monica.]
rows.Content: Ross: What’s all this about you guys fighting?! Is this really over a room?! I mean, that is so silly!ScenesMonica: Ross, we can handle this.ScenesRoss: Well, apparently not, and I can’t just stand by and watch two people I care about very much be hurt over something that is so silly. I mean, enough of the silliness!ScenesChandler: Well, why don’t you tell her to stop being silly! (Monica mocks him and he joins in.)ScenesRoss: (stopping them) Okay-okay! Two very good points, look I’ve known you both a long time, and I’ve never seen either of you one/millionth as happy as you’ve been since you’ve got together. Do you really want to throw that all away over a room? That is so silly. Now wh-what is more important, love or silliness?ScenesChandler: Well, we are fond of the silliness, but we also have a soft spot for the love.ScenesMonica: Love is the best medicine.ScenesChandler: That’s laughter.ScenesMonica: Why do you do it?ScenesChandler: I don’t know.ScenesRoss: Okay! All right! Now, Chandler you-you wanna live with Monica, right?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I do.ScenesRoss: And Mon, you wanna live with Chandler, don’t ya?ScenesMonica: Yes.ScenesRoss: (jumping up) Good! A verbal contract is binding in the state of New York! (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting at the counter waiting for Gunther, yep Gunther’s back, to refill her coffee.]
rows.Content: Gunther: So I understand you’re looking for a place.ScenesRachel: No-no, I’m staying put.ScenesGunther: Oh, I was going to offer you my apartment.ScenesRachel: Why, where are you going?ScenesGunther: I don’t know.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: You’re never gonna believe it uh, Monica and Chandler are moving in again. That’s great news right—I mean for them. Right?ScenesRachel: Oh wow.ScenesRoss: Yeah but, on the bright side, we get to be roommates again.ScenesRachel: Yeah. Y’know umm, uh, umm, about that, umm, Ross I really appreciate your offer to let me move in and everything, but don’t you think it’s gonna be weird?ScenesRoss: Wh-why?! Why-why-why would it, why would it be weird?ScenesRachel: Well, because of us! Because of our history.ScenesRoss: No!ScenesRachel: No?ScenesRoss: No! No! It would be weird if we were still in that place, I mean are you still in that place?ScenesRachel: No! Not at all!ScenesRoss: Good! Me neither! So it’s not a problem. We’re just two friends who happen to be roommates.ScenesRachel: Okay, but Ross, eventually you and I are gonna be dating.ScenesRoss: Really?! We are?ScenesRachel: Yeah! I’m gonna have a boyfriend, you’re gonna have a girlfriend…ScenesRoss: Ohh! That would be great.ScenesRachel: But y’know what, if you think it’s gonna be okay we’ll just work out a system. Y’know, it’ll be like college, I’ll hang a hanger on the door and put a sign, "Come back later, I’m gettin’ lucky." (Laughs.)ScenesRoss: (laughs as well, but for a different reason) Yeah, I didn’t think of that.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is once again being dragged in by Ross so he that he can try to manipulate the situation so that it’s best for Ross, not necessarily what’s best for Monica and Chandler.]
rows.Content: Ross: So are you sure about this whole moving in thing?! I mean it’s a really big step! And-and what’s the rush?!Scenes(They both start laughing at him.)ScenesMonica: That’s very funny!ScenesChandler: He’s being silly, because he knows that we enjoy the silliness!ScenesRoss: No, I-I-I’m serious, okay? I mean, think about it. You move in, you start fighting over stupid game rooms, next thing y’know you break up!ScenesMonica: Ross, you were right before, it was just a stupid fight about a room.ScenesRoss: Okay, there are no stupid fights!! This isn’t about the room, this is about what the room…represents! And unfortunately, this room (Points to Rachel’s room) could destroy you!!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I'm not so worried.ScenesMonica: Yeah, no, me neither.ScenesRoss: Fine! It’s your life! (Starts to storm out mad about his failed attempt at the manipulation of his best friend and sister, but stops and tries one last time.) I just don’t want to see you guys break up! Which you will do if you move in together, (Monica and Chandler just stare at him.) but that’s what you want, there’s nothing I can do. (Opens the door and tries one more time.) DON’T DO IT!!!!! (Finally leaves.)ScenesMonica: You still want to move in together right?ScenesChandler: Of course!ScenesMonica: Ross didn’t scare you?ScenesChandler: Scared me out of ever wanting to live with him.ScenesMonica: Come here, I want to show you something!ScenesChandler: Okay!Scenes(They run to the living room where Monica has moved the chair back (Towards the step), the coffee table forward (Towards the TV), and taped a square outline on the floor.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God! Someone’s killed Square Man!ScenesMonica: This is where I thought the barca lounger could go! You see you could see the TV and it’s still walking distance to the kitchen.ScenesChandler: Oh that’s so sweet! I want to show you something too!ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesChandler: Y’know those big-big uh, road signs that say "Merge?ScenesMonica: Uh-hmm.ScenesChandler: Y’know? So I was thinking that we could get one of those signs and hang it over our bed. Because, that’s you and I together! Merge!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! I love that!ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesMonica: Uh, no!!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing a new song. Yep, the first new Phoebe song of season six, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are also there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) I found you in my bed! Scenes                          How’d you whined up there? Scenes                          You are a mystery!Scenes                          Little black curly hair!Scenes                          Little black curly hair!Scenes                          Little black, little black, little black, little black, little black curly hair…………Scenes(Applause.)ScenesPhoebe: Now if you want to receive e-mails about my upcoming shows, then please give me money so I can buy a computer.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) So umm, where are the other guys?ScenesRachel: Umm, well let’s see Monica and Chandler are occupied.ScenesRoss: Fighting?!ScenesRachel: No, the other thing. I really think it’s great they work things out.ScenesRoss: Yeah. There’s no breaking them up, is there?ScenesRachel: Hey, can I borrow the key to your house so I can run across the street and make a copy?ScenesRoss: Sure! Here. (Hands her his keys.)ScenesRachel: Thank you. (Gets up) Now are you sure? Because once I make a copy, there’s no turning back.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I’m-I’m sure. (Deadpan) Yeah, get out of here before I change my mind. (She exits)ScenesJoey: Umm, listen, Ross do you really think this moving in with Rachel is a good idea?ScenesRoss: I’ve been back and forth.ScenesJoey: Yeah well, maybe you should go back! Okay? Rachel moves in, and before you know it you’re right where you don’t want to be! Back together!ScenesRoss: Ehh, I don’t, I don’t think so. She’s already talked about y’know, dating other guys.ScenesJoey: That’s not gonna work out! Then she’s gonna come home all weepy and you’ll be tellin’ her, "Oh that’s okay. You’ll find someone." And then, bamn! She finds you!ScenesRoss: Yeah, well, m-maybe you’re right.ScenesJoey: I am telling you Ross, she is definitely gonna fall in love with you again! Now, is that what you want?ScenesRoss: Is that what I want?ScenesPhoebe: (on the microphone, accidentally) Yes.Scenes(Rachel enters.)ScenesJoey: Here she comes. Hold on, I’m gonna make your life much easier.ScenesRachel: All right, well the place was closed. I’ll just copy it later.ScenesJoey: Or not. Uh, Rach, why don’t you just move in with me? (Rachel sighs.)ScenesRoss: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa, Joey!ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no… It’s okay, I mean I—look Rach, I know I scared you off with that whole Naked Thursday’s thing, but we don’t have to do that!ScenesRachel: Well, it would be easier to move just right across the hall. Wait a minute, unless you’re thinking about Naked Wednesday’s.ScenesJoey: Thursday’s clearly not good for ya, pick a day!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey has The Potential Roommate back for another interview.]
rows.Content: Joey: (opening the door to The Potential Roommate) Hi!ScenesThe Potential Roommate: Hi!ScenesJoey: Come in. Thanks for comin’ back, umm, okay there have been a lot of people interested in the room, but I have narrowed it down and you are one of the finalists!ScenesThe Potential Roommate: Great!ScenesJoey: Okay now, before I make my final decision I uh, I just want to make sure our personalities match. Okay, so I made up a little test. Now, I’m gonna say a word and then you say the first thing that comes to mind.ScenesThe Potential Roommate: I can do that.ScenesJoey: Okay! Here we go. Pillow.ScenesThe Potential Roommate: Fight.ScenesJoey: Very good! Okay. G.ScenesThe Potential Roommate: String?ScenesJoey: Excellent! Okay umm, doggy.ScenesThe Potential Roommate: Kitten?ScenesJoey: Ooh, sorry! No-no-no, so close though, but—bye-bye! (He ushers her out the door.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Joey Loses His InsuranceScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is packing her belongings to move to Ross’s. She’s standing in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So, which of this kitchen stuff is mine?ScenesMonica: This bottle opener. (She grabs it off of the freezer door.)ScenesRachel: And?ScenesMonica: And it’s a magnet!ScenesRachel: Look at that!ScenesRoss: How weird is that? Y’know? You’re moving in with me and have the one thing I don’t have. It’s like uh, in a way you-you complete me (Phoebe glares at him) kitchen.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: (in an Australian accent) You complete me kitchen, matey!ScenesPhoebe: Ross, I know what you’re thinking.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: That she’s gonna move in with you and maybe then she’ll fall in love with you and then when she finds out you’re already married, she’ll just be happy. Y’know? You’re just, you’re very sad.ScenesRoss: Oh…my…God! I-I see what this is! You are in love with Rachel!ScenesPhoebe: What?!!ScenesRoss: Of course! It all adds up! I mean you you’re obsessed with her. It’s always, "Ross, what are you gonna do about Rachel?" "Ross, why-why are you moving in with Rachel?" "When are you gonna confess your secret marriage to Rachel?" You want her!ScenesPhoebe: No! (Ross’s phone rings.)ScenesRoss: (answering it) Uh-oh, saved by the bell. (On phone) Hello?Scenes[Cut to the living room where Monica is helping pack a box.]ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, aren’t these candlesticks (holds up a pair) mine?ScenesRachel: No-no, I bought those.ScenesMonica: Ohh! Yeah, I forgot.ScenesRachel: Yeah. (Rachel walks away.)ScenesMonica: (under her breath) That you’re a liar. (Hides the candlesticks in a drawer.)ScenesRoss: (on phone) No-no-no, that’s great! I’ll be there Monday. And thank you again! (Listens) Okay. (Hangs up) (To All) Umm, that was the head of the Paleontology department at N uh, Y, uh U!ScenesMonica: Wow! Uh what, did he uh, say?ScenesRoss: Well remember that paper I had published last year on sediment flow rate, huh? They loved it.ScenesRachel: Well, who wouldn’t?!ScenesRoss: I know! Anyway, they asked me to be a guest lecturer! I mean it’s temporary, but uh, if they like me it could lead to a full time job. How great would that look great on a mailbox, huh? "Professor Geller.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, Professor and Mrs.ScenesRachel: And Mrs.?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Yeah, y’know you and Ross are still married.ScenesRachel: What?!!ScenesPhoebe: Just kidding!ScenesRachel: Ohh! Oh God! (Laughs her way into the living room.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Ross) Saved your ass.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are all there as Phoebe enters dejectedly.]
