After everything he said, he'd go "ba dum bum chesshScenesChandler: Yeah, Monica doesn't like that either, Maybe I should stop doing that.ScenesRoss: Oh y'know what, girls don't like it when I start talking about science.ScenesChandler: That's not specific to girls.ScenesJoey: This is great, this is great, what else, what else?ScenesRoss: Uh, they don't like it when you correct their grammar.ScenesChandler: And they don't like it when you explain why your jokes are funny.ScenesRoss: They don't like it when you keep asking them if they like you.ScenesChandler: Man, I'm so lucky I have Monica.ScenesRoss: (nonchalantly) I'm never gonna find love again.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Rachel is there as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?ScenesPhoebe: SureScenesRachel: Okay, um, I...(Phoebe walks into her room.) All right Phoebe look, I just wanted to say that I'm sorry. OK? I handled the situation horribly and I should not have lied to you.ScenesPhoebe: So, what should you have done?ScenesRachel: Well, I-I should've told you the truth.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-Huh, Which is...?ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, the reason I didn't wanna go running with you is because um, well y'know the way that you run is a little...(Starts flapping her arms)ScenesPhoebe: So?ScenesRachel: Well, it's embarrassing. People were looking at us like we were crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Why do you care?ScenesRachel: Because they're people.ScenesPhoebe: But people that you don't know and will never see again.ScenesRachel: Yes, but still. They're people…with eyes.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I didn't get embarrassed running next to Miss (panting). But no, okay. No, no, I can see why running with me would be embarrassing to you. Yeah, okay. You're uptight.ScenesRachel: I-I am not uptight—Hey-hey-hey-oh-oh! Listen, I am not uptight, man.ScenesPhoebe: That's okay Rachel. I'm not judging you; that's just who you are. Me. I'm more free y'know? I run like I did when I was a kid, cause that's the only way it's fun. Y'know, I mean didn’t you ever run so fast you thought your legs were gonna fall off? Y'know, like when you were like running towards the swings or running away from Satan? (Rachel looks confused) The neighbor's dog.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler has the tape measure out and is busy lining up the lamp on the kitchen counter, Ross is supervising the whole operation.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, is this lamp in the same place?ScenesRoss: Who cares? I repel women.Scenes[Monica tries to come in]ScenesChandler: (blocks the door) No-no-no-no-no-no-no-no!!! You can't come in here! R-r-r-r-Ross is naked.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRoss: (whispers) What?!ScenesChandler: (to Ross) I couldn't say that I was naked because she's allowed too see me naked.ScenesRoss: Why does anyone have to be naked?ScenesMonica: Why is Ross naked?ScenesRoss: I-I had to show Chandler something?ScenesMonica: Naked?ScenesRoss: Yeah-yeah I uh, I have a uh, a guy problem.ScenesMonica: Is it the same thing that Chandler had?ScenesChandler: Look, uh, just come later, we'll get everything squared away and you can come back later.ScenesMonica: Okay, listen, there's still some of Chandler's medicine under the sink in the bathroom. Bye!ScenesChandler: Bye! Thank GodScenesRoss: Dude, what'd you have?ScenesChandler: Look, we have no time okay? We must focus. We gotta get everything back into its original place.ScenesRoss: (realizes something) The photo album! There were millions of pictures of the apartment in the photo album. We just go through it and match everything to the pictures.ScenesChandler: That's perfect! That's brilliant! (Starts going through the photo album)ScenesRoss: So really, what'd ya have?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine's, Janine's there. Joey enters]
rows.Content: Janine: Hey Joey, I got some beer for you.ScenesJoey: Uh, don't you mean "for whom?ScenesJanine: Sure, listen I was gonna order some pizza, you wanna share one?ScenesJoey: Pizza, heh, its not like I never had that before...ba dum bum cheshhh.ScenesJanine: Is there something wrong?ScenesJoey: All right, All right, let's just get this out in the open okay? You're hot. I'm lovable. Clearly there's a vibe going on between us. But, we're roommates and it's a huge mistake for us to continue down this road.ScenesJanine: Joey...ScenesJoey: No, no, no, I'm telling ya. Imagine yourself living in a supermarket and you will understand okay? So the question is, what do we do?ScenesJanine: Well, I don't think there is anything to do. I mean I think you're really sweet, but I'm just not interested in you like that.ScenesJoey: Oh!ScenesJanine: No! I mean you're a really nice guy and I'm happy to be your roommate and your friend, I'm just y'know, I just don't feel that way about you.ScenesJoey: Oh! I see what happened. It's because I was trying to repel you. Right? Believe me, you'd feel a lot different if I turned it on.ScenesJanine: I don't think so.ScenesJoey: Oh, I do. (Gives her the Joey-love look.) How you doin?ScenesJanine: I'm OKScenesJoey: What?!?!ScenesJanine: What?ScenesJoey: Oh dear God!

rows.Scenes: The park, Rachel's running by herself and panting. After a little while she decides to run like Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (Runs into Phoebe.) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Oh honey, I'm so sorry, you were right, this feels great!ScenesPhoebe: See? And you don't care if people are staring, it's just for a second cause then you're gone!ScenesRachel: Gone! I mean its amazing Pheebs. I feel so free and so graceful. (Turns and bumps into a mounted policeman and falls) Hey! Look out for the horse! Sorry! (Runs off.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler and Ross are there. Monica enters]
rows.Content: Monica: Is it okay for me to come in now?ScenesChandler: Uh-huhScenesMonica: Why is everything different?ScenesRoss: Bye! (Runs out)ScenesChandler: No, I don't see anything different other than the fact that the room got so much brighter when you came into it. (Forced laughter)ScenesMonica: Well, the end table is wrong, The couch looks bizarre and don't even get me started on the refrigerator magnets.ScenesChandler: Okay look, don't...don't be mad okay? But after I unpacked the boxes I wanted to do something nice for you, so, I-I-I cleaned the apartment. So I moved everything around and then I forgot where it, where it went back and I'm sorry, I'm very sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry.ScenesMonica: It's okay. Chandler, are you afraid of me or something?ScenesChandler: Do you want me to be afraid of you?ScenesMonica: Of course not. I mean gosh, Chandler what you did, it's, it's a wonderful thing and I really appreciate it. I know I have this weird thing where I want everything to be in the perfect place, but I'd never expect you to worry about that.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesMonica: Of course!ScenesChandler: Oh well you're the best. You come here to me.ScenesMonica: All right, hold on okay? First thing's first. (Gets her cleaning gloves on) Okay, now did Ross sit anywhere while he was naked?ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Janine and Chandler are there]
rows.Content: Ross: So it said that by the year 2030, there'll be computers that can carry out the same number of functions as an actual human brain. So theoretically we could download our thoughts and our memories into this computer...ScenesJanine: ...and live forever as a machine!ScenesRoss: That's so Janine, you-you-you know what, do you know we're doing right now? You and I, we're interfacing.ScenesJanine: Yeah, I gotta go.ScenesChandler: Ba dum bumb cheshhh!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Ross’s TeethScenesWritten by: Perry Rein and Gigi McCreeyScenesTranscribed by: Aaron D. Howard-Miller

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s, Chandler knocks on the front door. Joey answers the door.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hi, my name’s Chandler. I just moved in next door and I was wondering if you would be interested in battling me in a post-apoplectic world for control of the galaxies last remaining energy source?ScenesJoey: Sure, neighbor come on in.ScenesChandler: So, is Janine around?ScenesJoey: Uh, no, she’s at dance class.ScenesChandler: Can I check out what she did to my room?ScenesJoey: Yeah, but, hey look, don’t go through her stuff. She gets really mad.(Chandler gives him a look and walks to the door of his old room.)ScenesChandler: (The room is filled with flowers and a floral print sheet on the bed.) Oh my God. What is th… it’s like a guy never lived in here. Look, you’ve got to be careful. This girl thing is dangerous. (Looking around the living room.) It’s spreading already.ScenesJoey: (Looking around the room.) It is???ScenesChandler: (Picking up a pillow.) Yeah, is this your pretty pink pillow on the couch?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesChandler: (Pointing to the table and picking up the box.) Is that your tiny little box, that’s too small to put anything in?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesChandler: No! Ok, this is not good. You are a guy. Ok? This is a guys place. If you let this go, you’re going to be sitting around with your fingers soaking in stuff.ScenesJoey: (With Big Eyes.) All right, you’re right. I’ll talk to her.ScenesChandler: Yes talk to her. Be a man.ScenesJoey: I’m a man.ScenesChandler: Defend yourself.ScenesJoey: (Grunting) Hmm. (Monica opens the front door and comes in.)ScenesMonica: Chandler come on. We have to hem the new dust ruffle.ScenesChandler: Be right there sweetums. (Monica leaves. To Joey.) A totally different situation.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, The gangs all here. Monica is walking in.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey guys.ScenesChandler: Hey, how was your breakfast with Hillary?ScenesMonica: It was okay. She’s still kind of depressed because she broke up with her boyfriend.ScenesChandler: Ohh, yeah.ScenesRoss: Well, is this Hillary your HOT assistant chef Hillary?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRoss: The one that always stares at me when I come in?ScenesMonica: No, the one who looked at you once because you got in her way.ScenesRoss: Still I could tell. She was into me. (Joey rolls his eyes.) Well, why don’t you set us up?ScenesRachel: Ohh, are you setting Ross up with someone? Does she have a wedding dress?ScenesPhoebe: (Walking over and Sitting down.) Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: I’m, uhh, making up flyers trying to get new massage clients. So, can I come to Bloomingdale’s and use the copy machine.ScenesRachel: Well, sure, but they might think it’s kinda weird considering I don’t work there anymore.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God. What happened?ScenesRachel: I-I, got a job at Ralph Lauren.ScenesPhoebe: Well that’s great! Congratulations!! (She hugs Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Yeah. (chuckling) A year ago..ScenesPhoebe: (Hugging her again.) You’ve lasted a whole year. Good for you.ScenesRachel: But, Pheebs, you can still use the copy machine where I actually work. But, just come by at lunch so my boss doesn’t see you. Cause Kim will just freak out and she already doesn’t like me very much.ScenesChandler: That’s weird. I don’t think my boss likes me either.ScenesMonica: I don’t think mine likes me either.ScenesRoss: Maybe it’s a universal thing?ScenesJoey: Or maybe, it’s because you’re hanging around here at 11:30 on a Wednesday. (Everybody gets up.)ScenesChandler: Yeah let’s head off to work.ScenesMonica: We should go.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, Phoebe hands Rachel a key card.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Sure.ScenesPhoebe: Now you will not believe this. But, I was in the copy room, making copies, and Ralph Lauren came in.ScenesRachel: Oh my God. Did you talk to him?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah a little. He seems really nice. Good kisser.ScenesRachel: What? What!?! You kissed him?ScenesPhoebe: Totally.ScenesRachel: (Gasps) Phoebe are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I was just in there. He introduced himself and the next thing I know, we’re making out. You know.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, I mean, you do know he’s married?ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesRachel: Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: What am I supposed to do? Ask every guy I make out with if he’s married? (Rachel looks at her.) No, yeah, I should.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s apartment, Joey stares at a picture of a bay on the wall. Janine comes out of her room.]
rows.Content: Janine: Hey Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey. Uh, can I talk to you for a second? This, uh, kid in this picture. Do you, uh, know this kid? Is that like a relative or something?ScenesJanine: No, I just thought it was cute.ScenesJoey: Yeah, that’s what I was afraid of.. Okay, uhh…Look Janine I really want you to feel at home here, but some of this new stuff. It’s…too girly.ScenesJanine: Ohh. Like what?ScenesJoey: Like this. (pointing to the picture) Pictures of cute babies we don’t know. We..we can’t have that.ScenesJanine: Joey, it’s Anne Geddes. She’s a famous artist.ScenesJoey: Look I don’t know this baby. I don’t know if she’s a famous artist or not. You know, and I don’t want to be a jerk but you’re changing too much around here.ScenesJanine: Well, I’m sorry. I just thought I’d try to make the place a little nicer.ScenesJoey: Yeah but it’s too much stuff. You know like, you got the candles and the foofy schmoofer thing here and over here you got a picture of a watering can.ScenesJanine: Well I just thought…ScenesJoey: I’m sure it’s a famous watering can, okay. But, come on…and what is with the really hot stick in the bathroom?ScenesJanine: It’s a curling iron.ScenesJoey: Ohh, well, that’s ok then. But, okay my towels for instance. I come in to the bathroom here and my towel is not on the floor where keep it. It’s up here on some hook..and…smells different.ScenesJanine: It’s clean.ScenesJoey: Yeah, well, it feels different.ScenesJanine: It’s dry.ScenesJoey: Alright, I can make my peace with the clean dry towels…Also what is with these chips you bought?ScenesJanine: No no no no, it’s potpourri. You’re supposed to smell it. (Joey takes a big whiff of the potpourri.)ScenesJoey: (Voice cracking) Well that’s like summer in a bowl.

rows.Scenes: Elevator at the Ralph Lauren offices, Rachel gets on her boss Kim is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Kim, Hi. (Kim doesn’t even look up from her report.)ScenesKim: Uhh-huh.ScenesRachel: So you know, I…I handed in that marketing report and I never got to hear what you thought.ScenesKim: I didn’t read it.ScenesRachel: Ahh….So…Wow…The spring line, it’s really going to be great this year, huh?ScenesKim: Yeah.ScenesRachel: So I hear the Ralph Lauren fooled around with someone in the copy room. (Kim stops the elevator and turns to Rachel.)ScenesKim: Tell me everything.Scenes[Scene; Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are on the couch. Ross walks in.]ScenesRoss: Hey guys.ScenesChandler and Monica: Hey.ScenesRoss: What’s up? (He smiles. His teeth are freakishly white.)ScenesChandler: You know…Oh My God.ScenesMonica: What happened to your teeth.ScenesRoss: I whitened them.ScenesChandler: (Sarcastically) Really.ScenesRoss: Yeah. What do you think.ScenesMonica: Well, I think I shouldn’t look directly at them.ScenesRoss: Come on, seriously.ScenesMonica: Ross they’re really, really, really white.ScenesChandler: Yeah, what was wrong with your old…human teeth.ScenesRoss: Ahh, I-I did leave the gel on a little longer then it said to.ScenesMonica: How much longer?ScenesRoss: A-A day.ScenesMonica: Ross you know that tonight is your date with Hillary?ScenesRoss: I know. That’s why I did it. (With a big smile) Come on, are they really that bad?ScenesChandler: No, no no no. You’ll be fine. (turning to Monica) Hillary’s bind, right?ScenesMonica: She will be after tonight.ScenesChandler: Yeah. (Rachel walks in.)ScenesRoss: Oh, hey, hey Rach, do you notice anything..ahh…ScenesRachel: Yeah. Your teeth? Yes, I saw them from outside. (Sitting down on the couch.) You guys are never going to believe this. But, Phoebe made out with Ralph Lauren.ScenesChandler: What???ScenesMonica: Oh my god.ScenesRachel: Yeah I know. She ran into him at my office and they just…made out. And the craziest thing is, now my boss likes me because I told her about it and she said it was the best gossip she’d heard all year.ScenesChandler: I am proud of all my friends today.ScenesMonica: My God, Rachel, I can’t believe Phoebe made out with Ralph Lauren. Ohh, I’m so jealous. (Chandler looks at her.)ScenesChandler: Hi, I’m Chandler. Your live-in boyScenesMonica: Chandler, please, come on. Look at him. (Pointing to a picture of Ralph on a magazine,.)ScenesChandler: Oh, I am no women, but that is one tasty dish. (Phoebe walks in.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey. Here. (Hands Chandler a copy of her flyer and sees the picture of Ralph.) Ohh, who’s the silver fox?ScenesRachel: That-that is your make out buddy. Don’t you recognize him? (Holding up the magazine in front of her face.) Oh wait. Ohh, Phoebe I love you. Kiss me please.ScenesPhoebe: That’s not Ralph Lauren. Sounds like him though.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, no, Ralph doesn’t look anything like that guy. He’s-he’s young and he’s got long hair and a beard and a hacky sack.ScenesRachel: Oh My God, Phoebe, that’s not Ralph Lauren. That’s Kenny the copy guy.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: Oh..Go..Oh..and I told my boss that someone made out with Ralph Lauren. If she finds out that I lied to her, she is going to hate me even more. Phoebe!!ScenesPhoebe: Why would the copy guy say he was Ralph Lauren?ScenesRachel: To get you to make out with him!!!ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Apartment, Ross and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Monica: (Holding a shirt in front of Ross.) Okay, maybe this will make your teeth look less white. (Ross has a big smile.) Nope. Okay, colors that don’t work are blue, yellow, green, red, black, white, orange, and purple.ScenesRoss: I don’t know what I’m going to do. That date starts in like an hour.ScenesMonica: Hey Ross, maybe if your skin was lighter. Your teeth wouldn’t look so bright.ScenesRoss: Oh great. So all I need to do is get some new skin. Thank you.ScenesMonica: I’m just saying, if we put just a little bit of makeup on you.ScenesRoss: Whoa. Whoa. Whoa. We’re not 13 anymore.ScenesMonica: Ross this is the only thing left that has a shot at working.ScenesRoss: But, won’t she notice I have makeup on?ScenesMonica: Please. Half the guys out there have makeup on.ScenesRoss: What??ScenesMonica: All right, half the people. I mean, just try it and see.ScenesRoss: No. I am not putting on makeup. (Knock at the door. Phoebe enters.)ScenesPhoebe: Hello. Oh good. Ross could you put up some of these flyers for me? (He smiles at her.) OH!! Demon!! Demon!!

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s and Monica’s apartment, Chandler and Monica are sitting at the kitchen table making potpourri sachets.]
rows.Content: Monica: Now are drawers will smell nice and we didn’t waste these pantyhose.ScenesChandler: Yes, God forbid we throw out old underwear. You-you know what? I’m going to go over to Joey’s.ScenesMonica: Wait, we’re supposed to organize the wrapping paper drawer.ScenesChandler: Yes, but I feel like I’ve really gotten in touch with my feminine side enough today. You know. In fact I think we’re two sachets away from becoming a lesbian couple.ScenesMonica: You know what? This has been kind of a girlie day. You’re right, I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: Nah, Nah, it’s okay. I feel like I need to be in guy place. You know, do kind of like a man thing.ScenesMonica: Yeah. Go over to Joey’s. Go over to Joey’s and drink some beer and hammer up some drywall.ScenesChandler: You know when guys hang out they don’t just drink some beer and hammer up drywall?ScenesMonica: When girls hang out, we don’t have pillow fights in our underwear. (Chandler gets a hurt look on his face.) I’m sorry. We do. We do. I don’t know why I said that.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s apartment, Chandler walks in. Joey and Janine are knitting at the kitchen counter.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Chandler. Come on in. We’re knitting pot holders.ScenesChandler: No thanks, Josephine.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Chandler enters. Ross is putting on makeup.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey Ross, I was wondering if… Oh my God!! Where are all the men???

rows.Scenes: Elevator at the Ralph Lauren offices, Kim’s waiting for it. The door opens and Rachel is inside.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh, hi, Kim.ScenesKim: Hi Rachel.ScenesRachel: Yeah, remember that thing I told you that happened yesterday? Well it didn’t happen.ScenesKim: You didn’t cancel the fabric order from Taiwan?ScenesRachel: Okay, two things didn’t happen. Remember I told you that someone made out with Ralph Lauren in the copy room? Well, it turns out that’s not true.ScenesKim: That’s not true?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesKim: Oh that’s interesting? Because I checked and only one keycard was used to access the copy machine yesterday during lunch and that keycard belonged to you, Rachel.ScenesRachel: Oh no, no, no. Oh God, you think I made out with him.ScenesKim: Listen to me. If you think sleeping with Ralph is going to get you my job. You are sadly mistaken.ScenesRachel: I-I don’t want your job. I-I don’t. Ohh this is such a mistake. I did not make out with him. Nobody made out with him. I did not use my keycard yesterday. I don’t even know how to use my keycard. (The elevator stops. Ralph steps on.)ScenesKim: Hi Ralph.ScenesRalph Lauren:: Hi Kim. (Dead silence until Ralph gets off the elevator.)ScenesKim: Yeah, nothing happen. You could cut the sexual tension in here with a knife.

rows.Scenes: Hillary’s apartmen,. Hillary and Ross are having dinner. He is avoiding opening his mouth.]
rows.Content: Hillary: And after that, what could I do except become a chef.ScenesRoss: Mmm-Hmm.ScenesHillary: And someday soon, I hope to open my own restaurant.ScenesRoss: Mmm.ScenesHillary: You know, you’re a really great listener. Most guys I go out with, they just talk and talk.ScenesRoss: Mm-Hmm.ScenesHillary: After a while it’s like, shut your mouth, you know?ScenesRoss: (Chuckling) Hmm-Hmm.ScenesHillary: I’ve probably been talking too much. Why don’t we talk about you a little bit?ScenesRoss: Mmm-Unmm.ScenesHillary: Come on. I want to know.ScenesRoss: Hmm-Hmm-Hmm. (Putting his hand up to block his mouth.) Okay. I, uh, am from Long Island. I-I came to the city for college. Um, I, um, have a 5 year old son and in my spare time I like to read spy novels. But, but, let’s talk more about you. Hmm.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s apartment, Joey and Monica are arranging flowers. Chandler walks in.]
rows.Content: Joey: So what’s really neat. If you sear the stems of the flowers first in a frying pan, your arrangement will look fresh much longer.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, Joey, that is such a great tip.ScenesChandler: Monica, could you excuse us for a second? I need to talk to the girl with the flowers.ScenesMonica: Okay. Oh but Joey, come over later because I’m going to teach you to make a bird feeder out of just a pine cone and some peanut butter.ScenesJoey: Ohh, I love birds. (Monica leaves. Chandler shuts the door.)ScenesChandler: What is the matter with you ?!?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: You’re arranging flowers! (Pointing to the dish on the table.) You got dead flowers! You got a picture, a picture, of a baby dressed like flowers! This is not Joey!!ScenesJoey: Hey. Hey look I am still Joey, okay. Flowers they’re just, you know, they’re nice to look at. And that happens to be a picture by a famous artist. Of a famous baby.ScenesChandler: You’re turning into a women.ScenesJoey: No I’m not. Why would you say that? That’s just mean.ScenesChandler: Now I’ve upset you? What did I say?ScenesJoey: It’s not what you said. It’s the way you said it….Oh My God, I’m a women!!!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Now, she thinks that I made out with him and I did it to get her job.ScenesPhoebe: But why didn’t you just tell her the truth.ScenesRachel: I did but she doesn’t think anyone would be stupid enough to confuse Kenny the copy guy with Ralph Lauren.ScenesPhoebe: Well, hey, what if Kenny were the real brains behind the whole company? You know. What if Kenny hired that Ralph Lauren guy to be the pretty front man? Huh, did she ever think of that?ScenesRachel: You were with Kenny today, weren’t you?ScenesPhoebe: Just for a second.ScenesRachel: Ohh, Phoebe, what am I going to do?ScenesPhoebe: Well, the only thing you can do. Sleep with Ralph Lauren.ScenesRachel: I’m not going to sleep with Ralph Lauren. I mean, I could, but I wouldn’t.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, sleep with Kenny.ScenesRachel: That wouldn’t help me.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, yes it would.

rows.Scenes: Hillary’s apartment, Hillary and Ross are finishing up their date.]
rows.Content: Hillary: I’ve had a really good time tonight.ScenesRoss: Mmm.ScenesHillary: You know, I rarely connect with someone this much on the first date.ScenesRoss: (Giggling) Hmm-Hmm-Hmm. (Picking up a piece of bread and covering his mouth.) Me, neither. I’ve had a really good time too, you know. (Putting the bread down.)ScenesHillary: Are you going to eat that bread?ScenesRoss: (Putting the bread up to his nose.) Ohh, I just like the smell. (Sniffing it.) Mmmm.ScenesHillary: (Laughing) You make me laugh.ScenesRoss: Hmm-Hmm.ScenesHillary: Would you like to move over to the couch?ScenesRoss: Mmm-Hmm. (Picking up their wine glasses.)ScenesHillary: Maybe I’ll just turn the lights down a little.ScenesRoss: (Covering his mouth with the glass.) How about all the way.ScenesHillary: Okay. (She goes to turn the lights off and Ross sits on the couch. She has some black light posters on the wall.)ScenesRoss: (Looking at the posters.) Wow, cool poster. Or should I say groovy poster? (They sit down on the couch. Ross smiles and the black light fluoresces his teeth.) So, ahh, where were we?ScenesHillary: Are those your teeth??ScenesRoss: Ohh, you can see them, huh?ScenesHillary: Yes. They’re insanely white.ScenesRoss: I-I, did that for you.ScenesHillary: What’s a matter with you?ScenesRoss: What’s a matter with me? You’ve got a black light. It’s 1999!

rows.Scenes: Elevator at the Ralph Lauren Offices, Rachel gets in . Kim is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Kim, hi.ScenesKim: Hi Rachel. Ohh, I’ve been meaning to ask you. Have you seen the new Ralph Lauren sheets? Ohh, what am I thinking. Of course you have.ScenesRachel: Okay..Okay.. Look. I’m sorry that I lied to you before. You were right. Ralph and I were an item but were not anymore.ScenesKim: Oh, really?ScenesRachel: (Faking crying.) Yeah, he dumped me. He said, "Rachel, I can’t do this. Even though you are a very, very, very beautiful women. I can’t do this. I’m married and I’m sorry." And then I don’t know why but he said, "and you will never get promoted. Especially not above Kim, who is an integral cog in the Ralph Lauren machine.ScenesKim: You expect me to believe..(Doors open, Ralph steps in.) Hi Ralph.ScenesRalph Lauren:: Hi Kim. (Dead silence again until he gets off.)ScenesKim: Oh my God. He just gave you the coldest look I have ever seen. It’s like he hates you. Then it is true.ScenesRachel: Of course it’s true and it hurts so bad.ScenesKim: Ohh honey come here. (Hugging Rachel.) Ohh it will be ok. We’ve all been there.ScenesRachel: You and Ralph?ScenesKim: Kenny the copyboy.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s apartment, Joey paces the floor waiting for Janine. She walks in.]
rows.Content: Janine: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey, uhh, I need to talk to you.ScenesJanine: What’s the matter? Are you upset?ScenesJoey: I’m sorry but we’ve got to get rid of all this girlie stuff in here. I, uh, I got to be a man! Okay. The living room has to remain a guy place, okay? That’s just the way it has to be.ScenesJanine: Well, if that’s what you want. I’ll just put it all in my room.ScenesJoey: Great…Great…and thanks for being so understanding. I mean, I didn’t want to make a big deal out of this, you know. (She starts to collect all the girlie stuff up.) You could, uh, put the picture of the famous baby in my room. I mean, if you want to.ScenesJanine: Okay.ScenesJoey: And, uhh, maybe the watering can there.ScenesJanine: Sure.ScenesJoey: And a couple of these little tiny boxes.ScenesJanine: Joey? Do you want me to put it all in your room?ScenesJoey: (Smiling) Okay.ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Ross Got HighScenesWritten by: Greg MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is mixing some Thanksgiving treat (I’m assuming mashed potatoes) in a bowl.]
rows.Content: Monica: (on phone) Okay, great!  Bye. (Hangs up as Chandler enters.) So guess who’s coming to Thanksgiving dinner?ScenesChandler: Sydney Portier? Hehheh.Scenes[Chandler throws his coat on the couch]ScenesMonica: (not amused by Chandler’s joke) I miss Rachel. (To Chandler) No, my parents.ScenesChandler: Oh! That’s great, they haven’t seen the place since I moved in!Scenes[Monica goes to fiddle with something on the table.]ScenesMonica: Yeah, and y’know, if you could not mention to them that we live together, that would be great! (Quickly trying to change subjects), I was thinking we would eat around four.Scenes[Monica goes to the stove.]ScenesChandler: (shocked at the news) Why can’t I tell them that we live together?ScenesMonica: Because they don’t know we’re dating. (Again, trying to quickly change subjects.) Do you think we should eat in the kitchen? (Goes to the sink and the stove to cook.)ScenesChandler: Why haven’t you told them?!ScenesMonica: Um, well, I was going to, I-I-I really was. But um, then somewhere, just out of nowhere, I didn’t.ScenesChandler: Why haven’t you told them?! Wouldn’t they be happy?!ScenesMonica: (trying to change subjects, excitedly) So! Dinner in the kitchen around four! I’ll see you then. (Pats Chandler on the shoulder and goes into the living room.)ScenesChandler: Why wouldn’t they be happy?ScenesMonica: Well, um, because mainly, um, they don’t like you. I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: What? What? Why?!ScenesMonica: Maybe because you used to be aloof, or that you’re really sarcastic, or that, y’know, you joke around all the time. Or that you take off your clothes and throw them on the couch.ScenesChandler: Is this why they don’t like me or why you don’t like me?ScenesMonica: Look, I know that I should’ve told them. I know I shouldn’t care what they think. I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: Y’know, it’ll be okay. It’ll be okay. Because when they come over, I will be all charming, I will make them fall in love with me, and then we’ll tell ‘em.ScenesMonica: You really think that’ll work?ScenesChandler: Hey, I can be pretty charming, babe, I won YOU over, didn’t I?ScenesMonica: (hugging Chandler) I don’t think you’ll ever get my parents that drunk!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s, Joey and Ross are playing Sony Playstation. Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! (Sees Ross is there) Oh, good, Ross! You’re parents like me, right?Scenes[Chandler goes to stand to the side of the TV.]ScenesRoss: (only half-paying attention) Yes, of course they like you!ScenesChandler: Well Monica just told me that they don’t.ScenesRoss: (not paying attention) Yeah, they don’t like you.ScenesChandler: (annoyed) Do you know why?ScenesRoss: I dunno, maybe it’s because you’re really sarcastic. Or maybe it’s cause you uh-ScenesChandler: (angry) Well if people don’t know they shouldn’t just guess!Scenes[Joey and Ross get annoyed with Chandler's outburst.]ScenesChandler: This is great, another Thanksgiving with nothing to give thanks for.ScenesJoey: Maybe I could give thanks for you shuttin’ up, eh?ScenesChandler: Maybe I could give thanks by taking my Playstation over to my new apartment.ScenesJoey: Well maybe I love ya’.ScenesChandler: [mocks that last comment].Scenes[Chandler starts to leave as Janine enters]ScenesJanine [to Chandler]: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.Scenes[Chandler exits]ScenesJanine: Hey guys!Scenes[Joey and Ross drop their video game controllers.]ScenesRoss: (trying to act manly in front of Janine) No I don’t want to play video games, Joey!ScenesJanine: Are you guys going to Chandler’s for Thanksgiving?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah, why? What’s up?ScenesJanine: Well, me and my dancer friends are thinking of doing Thanksgiving uptown. I thought you guys might like to come.ScenesRoss: For real?ScenesJanine: No, but you should go to Chandler’s. Because none of us knows how to cook, we’ll probably just end up drinking all day.ScenesJoey: Ye-ye, we go to yours!ScenesRoss: Yeah, see, we-we-we have to stop across the hall, because it’s my sister. But, uh, uh y’know actually, growing up with a sister was nice because it really helped me understand women. Yeah, you-you should tell your friends that.ScenesJanine: (not sure of what to make of that) Okay.Scenes[Janine leaves]Scenes[Ross looks at Joey coyly.]ScenesJoey: How you got three women to marry you, I’ll never know.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Phoebe enters with a paper turkey.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey! Hey, Pheebs, check it out. Yeah, for my desert, I have chosen to make a traditional English truffle!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, that sounds great! And what are you making Monica, in case Rachel’s dessert is...[about to say “bad”] so good that I eat all of it. There’s none left for anybody else!Scenes[Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel laugh]ScenesMonica: Nothing.ScenesRachel: (worried) Nothing?ScenesMonica: No, sweetie, I-I trust you.ScenesRachel: So, if-if I mess this up, there’s nothing else for dessert?ScenesMonica: You’re not gonna mess it up.ScenesRachel: Wow, Monica, I love that, you really have faith in me. Thank you. Technical question, how do you know when uh, the butter’s done?ScenesMonica: Well, it’s done about two minutes before it looks like that.Scenes[Joey and Ross enter.]ScenesJoey and Ross: Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: Oh, ooh the food smells great, Mon!ScenesRoss: And the place looks so nice!ScenesJoey: Yeah, hey hey, Happy Thanksgiving everybody!ScenesRoss: Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesThe Girls: Happy Thanksgiving!ScenesJoey: Well, this has been great!ScenesRoss: See ya!Scenes[Joey and Ross go to the door, ready to leave.]ScenesMonica: Whoa whoa whoa! Where’re you goin’?ScenesRoss: Oh, oh, we did say we’d stop by this little thing Joey’s roommate is having.ScenesMonica: Oh, Janine, the really hot dancer girl?ScenesRoss: Some would say she’s attractive, yes.ScenesPhoebe: And who else is going to be there?ScenesJoey: Uh, some of her friends, yeah.ScenesRachel: Her dancer friends?ScenesJoey: (frustrated) Yes, all right? All of her hot dancer friends are gonna be there and they’re gonna be, be drinkin’ and dancin, and we really wanna go!ScenesRoss: (to Joey) Dude, we were good!ScenesMonica: You’re not gonna go anywhere, you said you were gonna eat here, and you’re gonna eat here!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and-and leaving us to go see hot dancer girls is not very Thanksgivingy.ScenesRoss: Oh, but-but it is, uh, it’s just like the first Thanksgiving, when the Indians and the Pilgrims uh, sat down to dinner.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, and the Indians taught the Pilgrims what it meant to be hot in the new world!Scenes[Enter Jack and Judy Geller]ScenesMrs. Geller: Hello everybody!ScenesMr. Geller: Hi!ScenesAll: Hi!Scenes[Kisses and hugs are exchanged.]ScenesMonica: Dad [kisses Jack], Mom [kisses Judy]. Look! Look who it is it’s Chandler!ScenesMrs. Geller: (less than pleased) Oh yes of course, hello Chandler.ScenesChandler: Mr. and Mrs. Geller, you look wonderful, it is great to have you hear, let us take off your coats!Scenes[Chandler goes to take off Jack’s coat. He then notices little white flakes on Jack’s shoulders. He begins to wipe them off.]ScenesChandler: Whoa, snowing out there?ScenesMr. Geller: (angry) No.Scenes[Time lapse. The gang is sitting down for Thanksgiving dinner. Chandler is at the head of the table, Mr and Mrs Geller are to his right. Joey and Ross are to his left. Monica is serving things. Phoebe is in the living room and Rachel is at the sink.]ScenesMr. Geller: Monica, all this food looks wonderful, you should think about doing this for a living.Scenes[Chandler, trying to make nice with Jack, laughs at his joke and points at Jack.]ScenesMr. Geller: Ok, I have dandruff. There’s no need to laugh and point.Scenes[Monica rushes over to Chandler’s side.]ScenesMonica: Dad, Chandler was just laughing at your joke.ScenesMr. Geller: My joke wasn’t funny.Scenes[Phoebe walks from the living room to the kitchen and talks quietly to Rachel.]ScenesPhoebe: Rach, Rach, I just remembered. I had a dream about Mr. Geller last night.ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I dreamt that he saved me from a burning building and he was so brave and so strong! And it’s making me look at him totally differently. Y’know, I mean he used to be just, y’know “Jack Geller Monica and Ross’s dad” and now he’s he’s “Jack Geller, dream hunk.Scenes[We see a shot of Jack stuffing his face with food. Some dream hunk!]ScenesRachel: I dunno. Y’know to me he’ll always be “Jack Geller, walks in while you’re changing.”Scenes[Time lapse. Ross and Joey are cleaning the table while Judy and Phoebe talk by the window. Jack and Chandler are sitting on the couch while Monica sits on the coffee table.]ScenesMonica: Y’know dad, Chandler is one of Ross’s very best friends!ScenesChandler: Yeah, Ross sure is a great guy, y’know I’ve always felt that how a young man turns out is a reflection on his father.ScenesMr. Geller: I always thought that too. Tell me, what does your father do?Scenes[Chandler and Monica exchange worried looks.]ScenesChandler: (worried) He’s the headliner of a gay burlesque show.Scenes[Rachel is in the kitchen fiddling with her English truffle. Joey and Ross, anxious to leave and go to Janine’s party, are egging her on to hurry up.]ScenesJoey: Rach, you’re killin’ us here, will ya serve the dessert already? Those drunken dancers are waiting!ScenesRachel: (looking at her truffle) Look at it, isn’t it beautiful?ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah, what is it?ScenesRachel: It’s a truffle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch, [Joey and Ross make impressed faces] then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sauteed with peas and onions, [Joey and Ross look like something’s wrong.] then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!Scenes[Joey and Ross make confused faces.]ScenesRoss: W-What was the one right before bananas?ScenesRachel: The beef? Yeah, that was weird to me, too. But then, y’know, I thought “well, there’s mincemeat pie,” I mean that’s an English dessert, these people just put very strange things in their food, y’know. [To Joey] Oh! by the way, can I borrow some Rum from your place?ScenesJoey: Y-sure!ScenesRachel: (teasingly) And while I’m gone don’t you boys sneak a taste.ScenesJoey and Ross: (faking dissapointment) Okay.Scenes[Rachel leaves]ScenesRoss: Beef in a dessert?! I- no no no, there is no way!Scenes[Ross goes to look in the magazine Rachel got her recipe from.]ScenesJoey: I know, and only one layer of jam?! What is up with that?Scenes[Ross looks up as if saying that Joey was weird. He begins flipping through the pages, only to find that they are sticky. So one page is overlapping another, making two recipes look like one.]ScenesRoss: Oh my God, the pages are stuck together!ScenesJoey: (turning to Chandler in a scolding tone) Chandler!ScenesRoss: Oh My God, she-she made half a English Trifle, and half a...Sheperd’s Pie!ScenesJoey: (sad) Oh man! Now she’s gonna start all over! We’re never gonna get to introduce the hot girls to the new world!ScenesRoss: No, no, we will. We just won’t tell her she messed up.ScenesJoey: Just let her serve the beef-custard thing?ScenesRoss: Yeah, it’ll be like a funny Thanksgiving story!ScenesJoey: (shrugging his shoulders to go along with it) Vomiting stories are funny...Scenes[Rachel enters]ScenesRachel: Joey, God, your apartment is like a hundred degrees!ScenesJoey: Did-did it make you wanna walk around in your underwear?ScenesRachel: No!ScenesJoey: (frustrated) Still not hot enough!Scenes[Joey leaves]Scenes[Phoebe walks over to talk to Rachel.]ScenesPhoebe: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, look at him. Look at those strong hands. Oh what I wouldn’t give to be that can of (looks closer to see what Jack is drinking) condensed milk.Scenes[We see a shot of Jack drinking condensed milk on the couch.]Scenes[Ross and Judy enter the living room. Judy and Ross sit down on the couch beside Jack. Monica and Chandler are sitting on the coffee table.]ScenesMonica: Mom, uh, Chandler was just saying how beautiful your sweater is.ScenesMrs. Geller: Oh, thank you Chandler! I just bought it.ScenesChandler: Oh, yes. Well it’s very beautiful. It’s cream-colored and tight [Realizes what he just said and looks worried. Monica and Ross also looked shocked. Judy and Jack give Chandler a very dirty look.] I don’t mean tight, I mean it’s not too tight, not that I was looking at-[giving up all hope, he puts his head into his hands.]ScenesMr. Geller: What’s the matter with him?ScenesMrs. Geller: (whispers to Jack a little loudly) I think he’s stoned again.ScenesChandler: (shocked) What?ScenesMonica: (shocked) What?ScenesRoss: (worried) Dude, I need to talk to you a sec.Scenes[Ross and Chandler get up and go into Rachel’s old room.]

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s old room. It’s pretty much empty except for a few boxes against the walls. Ross and Chandler enter.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, I think I might know why my parents don’t like you.ScenesChandler: You do? Why?ScenesRoss: Okay, remember, we were young. Hey, Spring break, sophomore year, I got high in my bedroom and my parents walked in and smelled it and so I told them that you had gotten stoned and jumped out the window.ScenesChandler: What?! Why did you do that?ScenesRoss: I don’t know, aheh, your’s was the first name that-that popped into my head, I’m I’m sorry. I-I didn’t think it would matter.ScenesChandler: How could it not matter?!ScenesRoss: How was I supposed to know we’d end up being friends after college, let alone you-you would be living with my sister?ScenesChandler: What about all that “friends forever” stuff?ScenesRoss: I don’t know, I-I was all high.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Old Bedroom, Continued from earlier. Monica enters the room.]
rows.Content: Monica: Mom and dad just sent me in here to find out if you (points to Chandler) were trying to get Ross stoned!ScenesChandler: Your parents caught Ross smoking pot in college and he blamed it on me!ScenesMonica: Ross, I can’t believe you’d do that!ScenesChandler: The reason we haven’t told them we’re together is because they hate me, okay? So will you fix this?ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, I’ll tell ‘em it wasn’t Chandler who got high. Now who should I say it was?ScenesMonica: You! It’s not like it’s a big deal! You-you don’t still do it or anything!ScenesRoss: Alright, alright, now-now who should I say tricked me into doing it?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Time lapse. Jack is still on the couch, picking his teeth with his feet on the table. Phoebe and Judy are sitting on the table looking at him. Ross and Chandler are sitting by the window talking. Rachel and Joey are in the kitchen fooling with Rachel’s trifle. Monica walks into the living room from the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Monica: Dad, please don’t pick your teeth out here! Alright, and if you’re gonna put your feet up, why don’t you sit on the-ScenesPhoebe: Monica, leave him alone!Scenes[Monica gives Phoebe a surprised expression and goes over to Ross and Chandler.]ScenesJoey: (to Rachel) Will you hurry up? Did you not hear me before when I told you that all of Janine’s friends are dancers?! And that they’re going to be drinking alot!?ScenesRachel: (sarcastically) No, I did, but tell me again, because it’s so romantic.ScenesJoey: Well you’re whippin’ so slow! Can’t you do it any faster?ScenesRachel: Joey! Come on! I don’t wanna make any mistakes, alright? This is the only dessert and if I screw it up everybody's gonna be like “Oh, remember that Thanksgiving when Rachel screwed up the trifle?”Scenes[Joey gives her an understanding look.]ScenesRachel: So why don’t you just let me worry about making the trifle and you just worry about eating it, alright?ScenesJoey: Oh I am!Scenes[Chandler and Monica are by the window pressuring Ross to tell his parents the truth.]ScenesMonica: Ross, if you don’t tell them, then I will!ScenesRoss: Okay, fine!Scenes[Ross gets up to go tell his parents.]Scenes[Joey rushes over.]ScenesJoey: Ross! Can I talk to you for a second?ScenesRoss: Oh, uh, can it wait a second Joey? I have to tell my parents something. No it can’t? Okay.Scenes[Monica and Chandler make “What was that?” gestures. Joey and Ross go into Rachel’s old room.]

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s old room, Ross and Joey enter.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, look, I think we have to tell Rachel she messed up her dessert.ScenesRoss: What?! What is with everybody? It’s Thanksgiving, not...Truth-Day!ScenesJoey: Look, when everyone eats that...that...Banana-Meat thing, they’re all gonna’ make fun of her, do you want that?ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, we’ll just get everyone to act like they like it. That-that way noone makes fun of her and we still get to go to Sweet Potatoe Pie! (Referring to the dancers.)ScenesJoey: (scolding) Dude, they’re not objects.Scenes[Ross makes a sorry face.]ScenesJoey: Just kiddin,’ I’ll talk to them, you distract Rach.Scenes[Joey and Ross go back out into the main area.]ScenesRoss: Hey Rach, can I talk to you outside for a second?ScenesRachel: Okay...Scenes[The hallway. Rachel and Ross go out and they just stand there for a few seconds.]ScenesRachel: What’s up, Ross?ScenesRoss: So um...Thanksgiving. The holiday season is upon us, hm?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: And um...You look nice today.ScenesRachel: Oh no. No Ross, don’t do this.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I just- I don’t think us getting back together is a good idea.ScenesRoss: (shocked) Eh?ScenesRachel: I thought this might happen today. Ross, I know the holidays can be rough. Y’know? And it’s probably really hard for you to be alone right now.ScenesRoss: (cutting her off) You’re alone.ScenesRachel: No, I-I live with Phoebe. I mean you’re [pity-tone] alone, alone. And I just-it’s just not the time for us. I’m sorry.ScenesRoss: (just trying to get out of the conversation) Ah well, can’t blame a guy for trying!Scenes[Inside Monica and Chandler’s. Joey is almost done explaining the situation to everyone.]ScenesJoey: Oh and (Ross begins to open the door and Joey says some gibberish word to indicate to Ross that he’s not done yet. Ross closes the door again.) Okay, and uh if anyone needs help pretending to like it, I learned something in acting class, try uh, rubbing your stomach (Rubs his stomach) or uh, or saying “mmm” and uh, oh oh! And smiling (Smiles while pretending to stir a bowl), okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m not gonna pay for those acting classes anymore.Scenes[Ross and Rachel re-enter.]ScenesJoey: Rachel, there you are! Come on, let’s serve that dessert already!ScenesRachel: Joey, you’re gonna have to stop rushing me, you know what? You don’t get any dessert.ScenesJoey: (happily) Really?ScenesRachel: No, I’m just kidding I would never do that to you! Okay, everybody, it’s trifle time!ScenesPhoebe: So, now, Rach, this is a traditional English trifle, isn’t it?ScenesRachel: It sure is.ScenesPhoebe: Wow. So then did you make it with beef or Eggplant?ScenesRachel: Beef.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t have any. You know I don’t eat meat. (Faking dissapointment.) Ohhh no.Scenes[Phoebe gets up and goes into Rachel’s old room, a smile on her face.]ScenesRachel: Alright, Monica, I want you to have the first taste.ScenesMonica: Really?Scenes[Rachel hands Monica a plate. Monica takes a spoonful of the whipped cream portion.]ScenesRachel: Oh oh oh, wait! You only got whipped cream in there! Ya gotta take a bite with all the layers!ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes[Monica takes a bigger spoonful and a pea falls off]ScenesRachel: Op! Wait, you dropped a pea.Scenes[Monica puts the pea on top of the spoonful and takes a bite.]ScenesRachel: Well?ScenesMonica: (faking joy. Rubbing her stomach and smiling at the same time, like Joey said) Mmmm! It’s good!ScenesRachel: Really? How good?ScenesMonica: It’s so good, that I feel really selfish about being the only one who’s eating it, that I think we should have everyone taste how good it is. Especially Ross.Scenes[Ross glares at Monica.]Scenes[Everyone takes a bite of their trifle.]ScenesAll: (faking enjoyment) Mmm.ScenesChandler: (clearly lying and hating the dessert) Yeah, this is so good, that I’m gonna go enjoy it on the balcony so that I can enjoy the view whilst I enjoy my dessert.Scenes[Chandler exits to the balcony.]ScenesMrs. Geller: (lying) I’ve gotta call my friend Mary and tell her how good this is, from Monica’s room.ScenesMr. Geller: (also lying) I’ll help you dial.Scenes[Jack and Judy exit to Monica’s room.]ScenesMonica: (again, lying) I’m gonna go into the bathroom so I can look at it in the mirror, as I eat it.Scenes[Monica exits to the bathroom.]ScenesRachel: Okay, now what was that all about? Is it-does it not taste good? Let me try it.Scenes[Rachel reaches for Ross’s plate]ScenesRoss: Wha? No no! Ah! (Ross scarfs all of his trifle down in about a second. He looks like he’s going to throw up.) (Lying) All gone! So good! Maybe Chandler has some left.Scenes[Rachel leaves to the balcony.]ScenesRoss: It tastes like feet!ScenesJoey: I like it.ScenesRoss: Are you kidding?ScenesJoey: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Gooooood.Scenes[Rachel and Chandler re-emerge from the balcony.]ScenesRachel: ...So a bird just grabbed it, and then tried to fly away with it and, and then just dropped it on the street?Scenes[Chandler makes a fake "I know I couldn’t believe it either" gesture.]ScenesChandler: (lying) Yes, but if it’s any consolation, before the bird dropped it, he seemed to enjoy it.Scenes[Phoebe comes back from Rachel’s old room.]ScenesPhoebe: Rachel, come here. (Rachel walks over to Phoebe. Chandler sits down on the lounge-chair.) Okay, I was just starting to take my Thanksgiving nap, and I had another dream about Jack.ScenesRachel: Oh, Phoebe, do I wanna hear this?ScenesPhoebe: I dunno, let’s see! So, okay, I dreamt that we were gonna get married, and he left, becuz he had to go fight a fire. And, um, so okay, I went to a night club, and I saw him making out with a girl.ScenesRachel: (humoring Phoebe) Oh my God, he dream-cheated on you!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but then Jacques Cousteau came and he kicked his ass for betraying me! It was soo cool! Then, he took me diving and he introduced me to his pet seahorse, who, by the way, was totally coming on to me, and please, that is not gonna happen.Scenes[Jack and Judy come out of Monica’s room and sit down on the couch.]ScenesMr. Geller: Boy, I’m glad I wore the big belt today.ScenesPhoebe: Five minutes ago, a line like that would’ve floored me. Now nothing. Well, not nothing, I am still a woman.Scenes[Rachel and Phoebe walk into the kitchen. Monica comes out of the bathroom and goes over to Ross.]ScenesMonica: Ross? Let’s go.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, about telling Mom and Dad, I was thinking about maybe writing a letter.ScenesMonica: Alright, you know what? That’s it. You’ve had your chance.ScenesRoss: Wha-what?ScenesMonica: (out loud, to her parents) Mom! Dad! Ross smoked pot in college!ScenesMr. and Mrs. Geller: What?!ScenesRoss: (in a 5 year old’s tone) (To Monica) You are such a tattletale! Mom, Dad, you remember that-that time you walked in my room and smelled marijuana?ScenesMr. and Mrs. Geller: Yes. (They look at Chandler angrily.)ScenesRoss: Well I told you it was Chandler who was smoking the pot but it was me. I’m sorry.ScenesMrs. Geller: It was you?ScenesMonica: And Dad, y’know that mailman that you got fired? He didn’t steal your Playboys! Ross did!Scenes[The Gellers stare at Ross. Ross looks at his parents with an afraid, shocked look.]ScenesRoss: Yeah, well, Hurricane Gloria didn’t break the porch swing, Monica did!Scenes[The Gellers glare at Monica.]Scenes[Joey, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting at the table, looking at the Geller siblings like they’re weirdos.]ScenesMonica: Ross hasn’t worked at the museum for a year!Scenes[The Gellers glare at Ross.]ScenesRoss: Monica and Chandler are living together!Scenes[The Gellers glare at Monica, shocked]Scenes[Monica and Chandler both are shocked. Ross gives Monica a “take that!” look.]ScenesMonica: Ross married Rachel in Vegas! And got divorced! Again!!!!Scenes[The Gellers glare at Ross.]ScenesPhoebe: (joining in) I love Jacques Cousteau!ScenesRachel: (reading the recipe magazine, finally figuring out that...) I wasn’t supposed to put beef in the trifle!ScenesJoey: (pounding the table) I wanna gooooooo!ScenesMrs. Geller: (rubbing her temples) That’s alot of information to get in in thirty seconds! Alright Joey, if wanna leave, just leave. Rachel, no you weren’t supposed to put beef in the trifle. It did not taste good. Phoebe, I’m sorry, but I think Jacques Cousteau is dead. (Phoebe makes a sad face.) Monica, why you felt you had to hide the fact that you were in an important relationship is beyond me.ScenesMr. Geller: And we kinda figured about the porch swing.ScenesMrs. Geller: Ross, drugs? Divorced? Again?ScenesMr. Geller: What happened son?ScenesRoss: I-I uh, I got tricked into all those things!ScenesMrs. Geller: Chandler! You’ve been Ross’s best friend all these years, stuck by him during the drug problems. (Ross gets disgusted.) And now you’ve taken on Monica as well. Well, I don’t know what to say. You’re a wonderful human being.Scenes[Chandler is mega shocked!]ScenesChandler: Thank you!ScenesMr. Geller: No! Thank you! (Hugs Chandler) Monica, and Ross! I don’t know what I’m gonna do about the two of you!ScenesChandler: (In a parent-like tone) I’ll talk to them!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s, Everyone is helping clean the table.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You guys! It was bananas, cream, and beef! I-I just cannot believe that you ate that so that I wouldn’t feel bad!ScenesMonica: Well actually, I-I didn’t eat mine. It’s still in the bathroom.ScenesJoey: No it isn’t, I ate that.ScenesMrs. Geller: (pointing to herself and Jack) Well we left ours in Monica’s bedroom.ScenesJoey: Nope, got it and I got yours (Pointing to Jack) too.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The RoutinueScenesWritten by: Brian BoyleScenesTranscribed by: Samantha Stein

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, everyone except Ross is decorating the tree.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Let me ask you, why is everybody using these tiny lights nowadays? I remember when people used to use big lights.ScenesRachel: That’s a good story, Grandpa.Scenes(Ross enters)ScenesRoss: HeyScenesAll: HeyScenesRoss: Wow, Monica’s letting other people help decorate her tree! Did someone get her drunk again or?ScenesMonica: Having a perfectly decorated tree is not what Christmas is about. It’s about being with the people that you love.ScenesPhoebe: That is nice and we’re done. TADA!Scenes(Her side of the tree looks a complete mess)ScenesChandler: I dunno what it is, it just doesn’t quite feel like Christmas to me.ScenesMonica: Oh, here.Scenes(She turns the tree around so that her side, which is perfectly decorated, is showing)ScenesChandler: See now it feels like Christmas!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe and Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: … and that’s the story of the dreidle. Now, some people trace the Christmas tree back to the Egyptians, who used to bring green palm branches into their huts on the shortest day of the year, symbolising life’s triumph over death. And that was like 4000 years ago.ScenesRachel: So, pretty much around the same time that you started telling this story.Scenes(Joey enters)ScenesJoey: Hey you guys.ScenesChandler: Hey Joe what’s up?ScenesJoey: I had to get out of the apartment. Janine is like stretching all over the place. Y’know, everywhere I look she’s like… (He imitates her stretching)ScenesChandler: I can see why that’s hard to resist.ScenesJoey: I like her so much!ScenesMonica: Aw, I’m sorry sweetie that she doesn’t feel the same way.ScenesJoey: I know. And she’s so sweet. I just wanna feed her grapes and brush her hair.ScenesChandler: You are aware that she’s not a monkey, right?ScenesRoss: I am so over Janine. I mean, yeah, at first I thought she was hot, but now she’s like OLD NEWS!Scenes(Janine enters)ScenesJanine: Hey guys!ScenesRoss: Hi Janine!ScenesJanine: I just got a call to be a dancer on a television special for New Year’s Eve. It’s called some sort of Dick’n Rock’n Dickie Eve.ScenesMonica: Hold it! Are you talking about Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve?ScenesJanine: Yeah, that’s what I said.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! We love that show! I mean Ross and I have been watching it since I can remember!ScenesChandler: Ah, you’re still just a little fat girl inside aren’t you? (He kisses her on the cheek)ScenesJanine: Well I’m gonna be on it this year. I’m gonna be one of the party people.ScenesRoss: You’re gonna be a party person! Those guys rock the most!ScenesJanine: Well they said I should bring someone. (To Joey) Do you wanna be my dance partner?ScenesJoey: Totally! I would love to spend New Year’s with you.ScenesJanine: Well actually they’re taping tomorrow. I don’t really understand why.ScenesRoss: Oh, well you see how it works is, the part with Dick Clark in Times Square is actually live, but they tape some of the party stuff ahead of time. Yeah, not a lot of people know that.ScenesJanine: Yeah well, do you guys wanna come too?ScenesRoss: Are you serious?ScenesMonica: We are there!Scenes(Rachel laughs)ScenesChandler: What, what are you laughing at?ScenesRachel: Well, I used to date him, but you’re still going out with her!Scenes(Gunther brings Janine a coffee)ScenesJanine: Thanks. (To Monica and Ross) Great so we can all go together! I gotta run. Catch you later!Scenes(Janine leaves)ScenesAll: Bye!ScenesRoss: Bye Janine!ScenesJoey: Did she just ask me out on a date?ScenesChandler: I don’t think so.ScenesMonica: What are you talking about? She just invited him to the biggest party of the millennium!ScenesRachel: Yeah, but she also invited you and Ross. Yeah, honey, I’m sorry, but I don’t think that was a romantic thing.ScenesJoey: Oh. Maybe. But hey I know how I can find out. We’re going to a New Year’s Eve party, right? So at midnight, I can kiss her. And if she kisses me back, great! Y’know? But if she says ‘Dude, what the hell are you doing?’ I can say ‘It wasn’t me, it was New Years!’ScenesRachel: Well, that’s a lot better than Ross trying to kiss me in High School, and saying that he did it because he needed chapstick.ScenesRoss: It was a dry day.ScenesMonica: We are going to Dick Clark’s New Year’s Rocking Eve!ScenesRoss: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) Oh my God!

rows.Scenes: The Set, Joey, Janine, Ross and Monica are walking in.]
rows.Content: Joey: OK, listen I’ve been on sets before, so let me give you a little advice, alright? It’s a show, but we’re just dancing, OK? It’s no big deal. The important thing to remember – stay cool.ScenesRoss: Got it!Scenes(They get to the main stage)ScenesRoss: Oh my God it’s just like I dreamed it!ScenesDirector: OK, everyone gather up.Scenes(Monica and Ross push to the front)ScenesMonica and Ross: ‘Scuse usScenesDirector: Here’s what’s gonna happen. The music’s gonna start, you’re gonna dance, we’re gonna tape, you don’t look at the camera. Any questions?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I have a question. When is this gonna air?Scenes(He and Monica laugh)ScenesDirector: Uh, yeah. Now you guys dance over there, you guys over there, and I want you two right around here, and everyone else spread out.ScenesJoey: Ross! So when is it gonna air?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, Chandler is there. Phoebe and Rachel enter.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.ScenesChandler: I can save you time ladies, I’m right here.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, Chandler why don’t you take a walk? This doesn’t concern you.ScenesRachel: We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.ScenesChandler: What? That’s terrible!ScenesPhoebe: No-no, we do it every year!ScenesChandler: Oh well, that makes it not terrible.ScenesPhoebe: No, yeah, we never find them! She’s always best at us that wily minx.ScenesRachel: Don’t worry, we’re just gonna search here for an hour, them we’re gonna go over to Joey’s and search, OK?ScenesChandler: No not okay, you can’t look for Monica’s presents!ScenesPhoebe: But we have to!ScenesChandler: No, you don’t have to, and you can’t because I live here too.ScenesPhoebe: Well then, you should look with us.ScenesChandler: Why?ScenesRachel: Chandler, aren’t you worried about what to get Monica for Christmas?ScenesChandler: No, I have a great idea for a present for her.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, that’s it? (Mimics Chandler) A great idea!ScenesRachel: Chandler, that’s not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you’ve just gotten her one great present? I mean that’s just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do that to her Chandler? Why? Why?ScenesChandler: If I help, we can find ‘em faster!ScenesRachel: That’s right!Scenes(Phoebe looks under the couch)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh ooh, we have a live one!ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s a Macy’s bag!Scenes(Phoebe tips it upside down, and a shoe falls out)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, who’s it for?ScenesRachel: (Reading) Dear losers, do you really think I’d hide presents under the couch? P.S. Chandler, I knew they’d break you.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-oh. She may be onto us.ScenesRachel: We are so gonna find them this year.ScenesChandler: Y’know when you guys said you were gonna go across the hall and look, you don’t, you don’t do that every year do you?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesChandler: You don’t, like go into the back of my closet, and look under my gym bag or anything?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: No, we never do thatScenes(They turn away.)ScenesChandler: Because that’s where Joey gave me some stuff to store that I’ve never seen before in my life! Okay, that did not just happen! (He does a weird clicky motion with his fingers, that kinda hard to describe.)

rows.Scenes: The Set, everyone is dancing.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, here comes another camera.ScenesRoss: Right. No biggie. Stay loose.Scenes(As the camera passes by, they start to dance really rigid, but the camera is facing the other way.)ScenesRoss: Why do they keep doing that?ScenesMonica: If we wanna get on camera, I think we have to get up on one of those platforms. They’ve been taping those people up there all day.ScenesRoss: Right.Scenes(They move towards a platform, dancing really strangely as they go)ScenesRoss: Hey, what’d you guys do to get up on there?ScenesGirl: We learned how to dance.ScenesMonica: Oh yeah? Well when you learned how to dance did you forget how to put on underpants?ScenesRoss: Yeah!Scenes(Camera pans to Joey and Janine)ScenesJanine: Hey! You’re a good dancer!ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesJanine: Yeah, well you’d be better if you just loosened your hips a little.ScenesJoey: What do you mean?ScenesJanine: Like this.Scenes(She pulls Joey towards her and dances really close to him.)ScenesJanine: That’s it, feel the rhythm. That’s better.ScenesJoey: Uh-huh.ScenesDirector: (To Joey) Okay, you’re dancing with that girl over there.ScenesJoey: No-no-no-no-no we came together!ScenesDirector: I don’t see it. (To Janine) You are dancing with the tall guy over there. Tall guy, raise your hand! (He does. Janine goes over to him.)ScenesJoey: No-no hey buddy, please let me dance with that girl, I really like her and I think I have a shot.ScenesDirector: Really, y’think so? I don’t..Scenes(He leaves, and this girl grabs Joey and starts dancing really wild.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment, Phoebe and Rachel are there and Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I couldn't find anything at Joey--Hey-hey, oh hey!ScenesRachel: Yeah, we found them. There were in the guest room closet behind some coats.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and you have nothing to worry about 'cos they're all crap!ScenesChandler: Those are my gifts, I got them for you.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh. Thanks Chandler they're great!ScenesRachel: Well Chandler, what is this very weird, metal A Z thing?ScenesChandler: Those are book ends! That's a great gift!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, I'm sorry, thank you for my azzz.ScenesRachel: Ha!ScenesChandler: Make sure you put all that stuff back in the closet, okay?ScenesRachel: Yes, okay, oh, by the way, I just gotta say, I think it's really nice of you that even after you've moved, you still keep storing that stuff for Joey!Scenes(Chandler does the weird clicky thing again.)

rows.Scenes: The Set, the girl is still dancing with Joey.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey-hey dancer girl! Can I go to the bathroom? I just.. (The girl starts dancing really close to him, so he picks her up, twirls her round, and puts her against a platform) Here we go. (He walks away to find Monica and Ross doing a really out of place dance) Looking good Gellers!ScenesRoss: We know!ScenesMonica: Hey, see that snippy guy over there? He’s the one who decides who gets up on the platform. We should go dance by him.ScenesRoss: Okay.Scenes(They dance over to him.)ScenesDirector: Okay, everybody hold!Scenes(Ross and Monica high-five)ScenesDirector: Next on the platforms are… (He points to the right of Ross and Monica, so they dance over to where he’s pointing to. He points away from them) …you two! And… (He points the other way, and Ross and Monica follow his arm. Again he points away.) …You two!ScenesMonica: Excuse me, sir, would it help if I weren’t wearing underpants?ScenesRoss: Monica! (Pause) Would it?Scenes(The director shakes his head.)

rows.Scenes: The Men’s Bathroom, the tall guy is there as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Tall guy! Hey, listen, I wanted to talk to you about that girl that you’re dancing with.ScenesTall Guy: She’s nice, huh? To think I almost brought my wife to this!ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, okay. Uh, look buddy, I came with that girl, and I had this plan to kiss her at the new years countdown – I’m trying to win her over, so I was wondering if..ScenesTall Guy: No I don’t think so.ScenesJoey: Oh come on man, you can dance with my partner, she’s real, uh, mellow!ScenesTall Guy: Look, are you dating this girl you came with?ScenesJoey: Well, I was hoping after tonight that maybe I could you know…ScenesTall Guy: No, no. She’s fair game if you ask me, sorry buddy!ScenesJoey: Alright, alright, hey y’know fair is fair, (he pretends to wash his hands) if you’re right, you’re right, what can I say, but hey oh no! (He throws water on the guy’s pants)ScenesTall Guy: God! What are you, in second grade?ScenesJoey: Hey, now you’re the one who wet his pants. (He throws another handful on him and runs out)

rows.Scenes: The Set, Monica and Ross are dancing.]
rows.Content: Monica: Man, this sucks! Y’know if Mom and Dad don’t see us on TV after we made them so jealous, I mean, who’s gonna be the losers then?ScenesRoss: Hey, I know what’ll get us up on a platform!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: The routine!ScenesMonica: Ross, we haven’t done the routine since middle school.ScenesRoss: Hey, when the snippy guy sees the routine, he’ll wanna build us our own platform!ScenesMonica: Was it really that good?ScenesRoss: We got honourable mention in the brother/sister dance category! Look, it’s almost fake midnight, do we really have any other choice?ScenesMonica: Okay, let’s do it. Mom and Dad are gonna be so faced!Scenes(They move into a space, and Ross points to his eyes and then to hers)ScenesMonica: 5 6 7 8!Scenes(They start the routine. However hard I try, I really cannot describe it. You will have to watch it. I’m sorry.)Scenes(When they finish, they walk over to the director)ScenesRoss: So, do we really have to ask who’s going up on the platform next?ScenesDirector: Oh no! You get up there and do that again exactly like that!ScenesMonica: Yes! (They run over to a platform)ScenesDirector: (To Cameraman) Make sure you get this, they’re gonna want it for the bloopers show. (To everyone) Alright cut! Listen up everyone, when we start again it’s gonna be the countdown to new years, so I wanna see everybody’s excitement.Scenes[Cut to Joey and Janine]ScenesTall Guy: Hey, pal, you have about three seconds to get away from my partner.ScenesDirector: What’s going on over here?ScenesJoey: Uh, take a look at the guy’s pants! I mean, I know you told us to show excitement, but don’t you think he went a little overboard?ScenesDirector: What’s the matter with you? Get out of here!ScenesJoey: Yeah, take a hike wetpants!Scenes(The director pushes the Tall Guy away)Scenes[Cut to Ross and Monica, who are finally on a platform!]ScenesRoss: Can you believe this? We’re gonna be on the platform for the Millennium moment!ScenesMonica: I know! Hey, you haven’t been practising the routine, have you?ScenesRoss: No!ScenesMonica: Me too!ScenesRoss: Hey, when the music starts up again, I was thinking of maybe goind into the robot, y’know? (He mimics a robot)ScenesMonica: Ross, I think we should stick to the routine, we don’t wanna look stupid!ScenesDirector: Alright we’re back! Ten seconds left here we go! Ten! Nine! Eight! Seven! (He continues to count as we hear Joey think)ScenesJoey’s Head: Okay, it all comes down to this. Whatever happens, happens. Destiny.ScenesAll: Three, Two, One!ScenesDirector: Cut!ScenesJoey: No! Year! Happy No Year!ScenesDirector: Okay, here’s where we go to the live shot of Times Square, nice work everyone that’s a wrap!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s apartment, Chandler and Rachel are there, and Phoebe enters with the Chick and the Duck.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! Look who I found!ScenesChandler: Oh, hey guys!ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, birds have a very good sense of direction, and I thought maybe they could help us find where the presents are hidden.ScenesChandler: Yes, if the presents are hidden south for the winter.ScenesPhoebe: Or we could just follow your clever jokes – any ideas? No! Didn’t think so! Okay, c’mon guys, show us where the presents are!ScenesChandler: Oh, the duck seems to think that Monica got me garbage! Hmm, I wonder what I could get Monica that’s as good as garbage?ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, how about my azzz?Scenes(Rachel sits on the window seat, and knocks against it)ScenesRachel: Hey, this is hollow.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRachel: This bench, it’s hollow! I can’t believe I never knew that! (She pushes all the pillows off it and opens it up) Oh, the presents!!!ScenesPhoebe: No, don’t look directly at them!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: Alright, no, we could look at them!ScenesRachel: Oh, this one’s for me!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, this one’s for Chandler. Here.ScenesChandler: Oh great!ScenesPhoebe: And the big one’s for me!ScenesRachel: Ooh, let’s open them!ScenesChandler: Okay! Okay! Okay!ScenesPhoebe: Hee hee!ScenesChandler: Wait, we can’t do this.ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Why?ScenesChandler: I don’t wanna know what Monica got me. Y’know? I mean, look, I’m sure she worked really hard at getting you a present, and wanting to surprise me, and you guys are gonna ruin that, and I, look we have to put these back, this is not what Christmas is about.ScenesRachel: Whatever Linus, I’m opening mine.ScenesChandler: Nobody is opening anything ok? Look, I don’t know about you guys, but I wanna see the look on Monica’s face when I give her my present, and I’m sure she wants to see the look on my face when I get mine. So please, please, can we just, can we put them back?ScenesPhoebe: Will you get us better gifts?ScenesChandler: Fine!Scenes(Monica enters, and they throw the gifts behind them.)ScenesMonica: Hey guys! You found the presents? Chandler, you let them find the presents? Great! Do you know how long it took me to find you that water purifier?ScenesChandler: That’s what you got me?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yes, I see what you mean. That look is priceless.Scenes(Rachel leans over to look at him.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s apartment, they both enter.]
rows.Content: Joey: Home sweet home, huh? Nice to, uh, get back to reality. Plus we know how the New Year’s gonna go off. I guess there’s no reason for all that Y2K panic, y’know? Anyway, g’night!ScenesJanine: Joey.ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesJanine: (She takes his hands) 3, 2, 1. (She kisses him) Happy New Year.ScenesJoey: Oh, yoii. What was that for?ScenesJanine: Well, I don’t know tonight when they yelled cut and we didn’t get to kiss, I was really, really, disappointed, and I just, really wanted to kiss youScenesJoey: Really? In the moment, I really wanted to kiss you too. In the moment.ScenesJanine: In the moment, yeah.ScenesJoey: But only in the moment. So do ya wanna kiss again?ScenesJanine: Sure, New Year’s Eve is only two weeks away. Can you wait?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesJanine: Me neither.ScenesJoey: 3, 2,ScenesJanine: Joey, you don’t have to count down every time we kiss.ScenesJoey: Uh, yeah, okay. Except I sorta felt like I needed a couple of seconds to get ready.Scenes(They kiss to the music of Auld Lang Syne)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's apartment, everyone except Joey is there.]
rows.Content: Monica: We were on the platform, ready to dance the world into the new Millennium, and the guy yelled ‘CUT!’ScenesRachel: Uh, wait, so you guys are telling me you actually did the routine from eighth grade?ScenesMonica: Yeah. But of course we had to update it a little bit. (To Ross) Hey, by the way, great thinking about catching me!ScenesRachel: ‘Cos I was gonna say there’s no way you could’ve done the end the way you guys did it back then!ScenesMonica: What? We could do it!ScenesRoss: I don’t know, I mean you were a lot bigger, I mean, stronger back then.ScenesMonica: I can do it, okay? Come on, let’s go. (She and Ross get up)ScenesMonica and Ross: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 (Ross runs to be caught by Monica, but she moves out of the way)ScenesMonica: I can’t do it! (Ross falls into Monica’s room)ScenesChandler: Now you do that, you’re on TV.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Apothecary TableScenesTeleplay by: Brian BoyleScenesStory by: Zachary RosenblattScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, everyone is there as Joey enters happily.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: Listen, do you guys think I have a chance with Janine?ScenesMonica: Honey, we have been through this before!ScenesRachel: Yeah. Don’t do this to yourself.ScenesPhoebe: She’s made it pretty clear, it is not going to happen.ScenesJoey: Well all right then, I guess I shouldn’t get to excited about the fact (excitedly) that I just kissed her!ScenesMonica: You serious?!ScenesChandler: That’s great!ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, we’ll see.ScenesRoss: You kissed her.ScenesJoey: Oh we kissed it up real nice.ScenesChandler: So you kissed her, so what happened after that?ScenesJoey: I came over here to tell you guys.ScenesChandler: So she’s just waiting over there for ya?Scenes(Joey nods yes, but suddenly realizes what he did and runs out of the apartment and back to his place.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Janine are pretty much making out at one of the tables as Monica and Rachel look on from the couch.]
rows.Content: Janine: I gotta go.ScenesJoey: Okay. (They kiss.)ScenesJanine: I’m gonna be really late for dance class!ScenesJoey: Okay. (They kiss.)ScenesJanine: Okay, now I’m really late. (Gets up.)ScenesJoey: Okay, I’m all right, okay, but hey, could you just leave your lips? (She kisses him on the cheek and starts to leave.)ScenesJanine: (to Monica and Rachel) Bye.ScenesMonica: Bye. (Janine exits.)ScenesJoey: Have you kissed her yet? It’s awesome! I could do it forever! Y’know what? She-she kisses better than my mom cooks!ScenesMonica: I am so glad you said cooks.ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesChandler: (entering) Oh hey Rachel, sweetheart? You have got to tell the post office that you have moved. Okay? We are still getting all your bills and stuff. (Hands her all of her bills and stuff.)ScenesRachel: Oh-oh, Pottery Barn! (Grabs the aforementioned catalog and holds the rest back out to Chandler.) You can throw the rest away.ScenesChandler: I’m not your garbage man. I’m your mailman.ScenesRachel: Monica look! Look-look-look! Here is that table that I ordered. (Shows her the picture.)ScenesMonica: You got it from Pottery Barn?!ScenesRachel: Yeah! It’s an apothecary table. Does anyone even know what an apothecary is?ScenesChandler: A pharmacist. (Rachel mocks him.)ScenesMonica: Rach, Phoebe hates Pottery Barn.ScenesJoey: I hate Pottery Barn too. They kicked me out of there just because I sat on a bed!ScenesChandler: You took off your pants and climbed under the sheets!ScenesJoey: (indignant) I was tired!ScenesRachel: Phoebe hates Pottery Barn?!ScenesMonica: Yeah, she hates all mass produced stuff. She thinks her furniture should have a history, a story behind it.ScenesRachel: Well this has story behind it! I mean they had to ship it all the way from the White Plains store.ScenesMonica: It’s gotta be one of a kind. Y’know like umm, y’know uh, what’s that God awful ceramic fruit bowl she has on her counter?ScenesJoey: Hey! I made that for her!ScenesChandler: You made pottery?ScenesJoey: Yeah! I made it of this fruit bowl I found in the garbage.ScenesMonica: I’m telling—If you put that in her apartment you’ll never hear the end of it.ScenesRachel: Okay fine! I’ll-I’ll just tell her it’s an antique apothecary table, she doesn’t have to know where it came from. Oh! Look at this little drawers! Oh look-look it says that it holds 300 CDs.ScenesChandler: Ahh, just like the apothecary tables of yore…

rows.Scenes: The Hallway between the apartments, Joey, Janine, Chandler, and Monica are returning from a double date. Chandler is telling a joke.]
rows.Content: Chandler: …so then the farmer says, "That’s not a cow and you’re not milking it." (Everyone laughs.)ScenesMonica: I am so glad you guys got together, Chandler and I are always looking for a couple to go out with and now we have one!ScenesChandler: Look at us, we’re a couple of couples!ScenesJanine: I had so much fun tonight, and what a great restaurant.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesJoey: And Chandler I can’t believe I let you pay for this one. (They hug and he whispers in his ear.) Thanks man.ScenesMonica: So do you guys gonna come over tomorrow? I’ll make that pasta thing I was telling you about.ScenesJanine: Oh that would be great!ScenesJoey: Oh, but hey look, at least let us bring the wine.ScenesMonica: Joey, you don’t have too!ScenesJoey: Nope-op! I insist! (He hugs Chandler again and whispers to him.) You get the wine right?ScenesChandler: Yeah all right. (They part.) Okay, good night guys.ScenesJoey: See ya tomorrow!ScenesMonica: Tomorrow!ScenesJanine: Can’t wait! (They each go into their respective apartments.)Scenes[Cut to Joey and Janine’s.]ScenesJanine: How are we gonna get out of that one?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesJanine: I can’t handle two nights in a row with them.ScenesJoey: What-what’s wrong with Monica and Chandler?ScenesJanine: I don’t know, they’re just a little blah!ScenesJoey: Blah?!ScenesJanine: Well y’know, he’s blah, she’s just—she’s very loud for such a small person.ScenesJoey: Uh, they’re like my best friends.
