Are you saying we can’t hang out with them? ‘Cause that would kinda be a problem.ScenesJanine: No! Of course we can still hang out with them. Just y’know, not two nights in a row. Okay?ScenesJoey: I guess.ScenesJanine: Thank you. (They kiss.)ScenesJoey: If you want, I’ll sell my friends and use the money to buy you presents.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, Rachel is placing CDs into her antique apothecary table as Phoebe returns home.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (sees the table) Ooh, what a great table! Where-where did you get it?ScenesRachel: Guess!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, a flea market?ScenesRachel: Ha! See, I knew, I knew you’d get it on the first guess. Isn’t it cool! It’s an apothecary table.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Oh you can just imagine that this is where (She’s opening and closing the drawers) they kept all the stuff to make their potions.ScenesRachel: Ohh, yes.ScenesPhoebe: Y’know? Ooh, you can almost smell the opium.ScenesRachel: Almost.ScenesPhoebe: How much was it?ScenesRachel: It was only 500 bucks.ScenesPhoebe: 500 bucks at a flea market?!ScenesRachel: Oh, okay see I thought, I thought you meant how much was it when it was new, y’know like back then.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no.ScenesRachel: Yeah no, I mean it was at a flea market, so it was y’know, it was like a dollar.ScenesPhoebe: A dollar?ScenesRachel: And fifty. So it was like one and fifty dollars.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, okay, they gave you the old time pricing.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Well, what period is it from?ScenesRachel: Uh, it’s from yore. Like the days of yore. Y’know?ScenesPhoebe: Yes, yes I do. God, oh it’s just perfect! Wow! I bet it has a great story behind it too. Did they tell you anything? Like y’know where it was from or…ScenesRachel: Yes! That I know, this is from White Plains.ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) White Plains. Oh, it sounds like such a magical place.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Rachel is entering as Ross comes out of the kitchen carrying popcorn.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey! We’re here!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: (seeing his new table) Ohh! Oh my God!ScenesRoss: You like it?ScenesRachel: Oh no!ScenesRoss: It’s my new apothecary table!ScenesRachel: Ross! Phoebe’s gonna be here any second, she cannot see this!ScenesRoss: Well why not?! She’ll-she’ll love it! It’s the real thing! I got it at Pottery Barn.ScenesRachel: I know you did! I bought the same one! And if she sees your table she’s gonna know that I lied to her. I told her ours was an original.ScenesRoss: Why did you do that?ScenesRachel: Because she hates Pottery Barn.ScenesRoss: She hates Pottery Barn?!!ScenesRachel: I know! I know, she says it’s all mass-produced, nothing is authentic, and everyone winds up having the same stuff. (Ross looks at his table.) So come on, she’s gonna be here any second! Can we please just cover this up with something?! Please?ScenesRoss: What? No! No! I am not gonna hide it from Phoebe—Ooh, although I did get some great Pottery Barn sheets! (Gets them.)ScenesRachel: Ooo! Oh, I forgot they made sheets!ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah! I still can’t believe she hates Pottery Barn!ScenesRachel: Ross, get over it! It’s not like she hates you.ScenesRoss: Yeah but Pottery Barn! Y’know what I think? It’s just she-she’s weird. Y’know it’s because she’s a twin. Twins are weird.ScenesRachel: Ross, she’s not weird, she just wants her stuff to be one of a kind.ScenesRoss: Huh. Y’know what’s not one of a kind? A twin!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: Ooh, Phoebe’s here! Okay, let’s turn out all the lights and we’ll just watch the movie!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Hey—Ooh, cool sheets! (Notices the sheet over the table.)ScenesRoss: Oh, you like it? You wanna know where I got it?ScenesPhoebe: Sure!ScenesRachel: He got it a flea market!ScenesPhoebe: You bought your sheets at a flea market? Ross come on, you gotta loosen the purse strings a little.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s, Joey is pacing around as Chandler and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesMonica: The dinner will be ready in twenty minutes. This is so exciting.ScenesChandler: And here is the bottle of wine for you to bring over tonight. (Hands it to him.) You were also going to buy Monica flowers but you couldn’t afford it, because you paid dinner last night.ScenesJoey: Thanks. Thanks, but uh actually it’s just gonna be me again tonight.ScenesMonica: What happened to Janine?ScenesJoey: Oh, she’s uh-uh really sick.ScenesChandler: Oh that’s too bad.ScenesJoey: Yeah, she’s been in there all day (Points to her room), uh high fever, a nose problem… Phlegm! Phlegm! Phlegm-phlegm-phlegm!ScenesJanine: (entering from her room) Monica! Chandler! I’m really-really sorry about tonight. I don’t know if Joey told you; I just couldn’t get out of going to this play. I’m sorry. Have a great time.ScenesJoey: ‘Kay!ScenesJanine: Bye. (Exits)ScenesChandler: That’s funny, I saw no phlegm.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Janine’s, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Joey: No-no, she really is sick!ScenesChandler: Then why-why is she going to a play?!ScenesJoey: Uh, y’know, starve a fever, go to a play for a cold.ScenesMonica: Joey! Why is Janine not coming over for dinner?!ScenesJoey: Well uh, she didn’t want to hang out with you guys two nights in a row. I’m so sorry.ScenesChandler: Well, why does she not want to hang out with us?!ScenesJoey: Because she uh, she-she thinks that you are blah and that you, Monica, are too loud.ScenesMonica: (loudly) What?!! (Quietly) What?ScenesChandler: So she was just pretending to have a good time last night? She was lying to our faces?!ScenesMonica: Ugh, I can not believe this! I mean, who is she to judge us? We could not have been nicer to her!ScenesChandler: And I am not blah, I am a hoot!ScenesJoey: I know! I know! Come on, please-please you guys, don’t-don’t be mad. I’m sure she just, she just said that stuff because she was nervous and you guys are like my best friends! Y’know? And it was our first date! Plus, she’s really sick!ScenesChandler: No, you sh—No you said you made that up!!ScenesJoey: I know, but don’t you think the sick thing is way better than the play thing?ScenesChandler: Eh, they’re both good. I generally just go with, Monica’s drunk again. (Monica glares at him.)ScenesJoey: Come on you guys, come on please-please just give her another chance, huh? She’ll come around I promise.ScenesMonica: Of course we will, come on we gotta make dinner.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(They exit and close the door.)ScenesMonica: (from the hallway) I do not like that woman!ScenesJoey: (shouting) I can hear you!ScenesMonica: I am loud!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are watching a movie.]
rows.Content: All: Aww! (They all laugh.)ScenesRachel: That’s funny. (Phoebe puts her feet up on Ross’s table.)ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, could you please not put your feet up on my new…(On Rachel’s glare)…old sheet?ScenesPhoebe: Oh sure! (She goes to take her feet off, but drags the sheet with her which spills the wine.) Noo!ScenesRachel: Ohh!!ScenesRoss: My apothecary table!!!ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRachel: Noooooo!! (Phoebe lifts up the sheet to discover the exact same apothecary table they have.)ScenesPhoebe: Ross, where did you get this?!ScenesRoss: I got it at Pottery Barn!! Okay?!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Phoebe, Pottery Barn has ripped off the design of our antique!ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Oh my God, well if they’ve ripped off our table ours must be much more than one and fifty dollars!ScenesRachel: Oh yes.ScenesPhoebe: Well this doesn’t even smell like opium.ScenesRoss: Of course not, it smells like wine, which you spilled! And thanks for wrecking my sheet by the way.ScenesPhoebe: Oh Ross, calm down, I’ll give you the 80 cents. (Ross glares at Rachel)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Chandler are sitting at the kitchen table.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, one more time.ScenesMonica: Chandler, would you like some more orange juice?ScenesChandler: Perfect decibel.ScenesMonica: (loudly) I know!!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: So uh, what are you guys doing?ScenesChandler: Oh nothing, we’re just talking. Y’know, blah-blah-blah.ScenesJoey: Look, come on you guys, you said you were gonna try! All right look, I came over here to invite you guys to a movie with me and Janine.ScenesMonica: Well, I’d like to but, (extremely quietly) I’m not sure we have time to go.ScenesJoey: Ha-ha, very funny—Look! I don’t know what to do! I really want you guys to get along. Just please come to the movie with us. I mean you owe me!ScenesMonica: We owe you?!ScenesJoey: That’s right! I helped you guys out a lot in the start of your relationship. Huh? I helped you guys sneak around for like six months, and I looked like an idiot! And I was humiliated. And I only made 200 dollars!ScenesMonica: We didn’t give you any money! (Chandler is motioning, "No!")ScenesJoey: You don’t think I know that!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, Rachel is showing Ross around the newly decorated living room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: …see I can’t decide whether it would go better next to the new wicker dining chair, the Sahara desk, or the Parker console table.ScenesRoss: Wow! I didn’t know that there was a Pottery Barn up here.ScenesRachel: I know, I know. I went a little crazy.ScenesRoss: A little? Your place looks like page 72 of the catalogue. Oh look at that! The ornamental bird cage! Large!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: (sees Ross) Oh Ross no. Be careful, that is very old! Okay? Early Colonial bird merchants used to bring their birds to market in that.ScenesRoss: (glaring at Rachel) Fascinating.ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Another amazing find! Wow! Oh I bet this has a great story too!ScenesRachel: Oh it does, it does! It is a room separating apparatus from Colonial times.ScenesPhoebe: Ah!ScenesRoss: Hmm, a lot of this stuff is from Colonial times. Hey, what are some other time periods Rachel? (She glares at him.)ScenesRachel: Well there’s yore. And uh, y’know, yesteryear.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah no, I’m telling you Rachel has such a great eye for this stuff. Ross, y’know if you ever decide you need to redecorate—And I think that you should. You should, you should ask Rachel to help.ScenesRachel: Oh honey he doesn’t need my help.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, come on! I think he’s ready to get rid of, what did you call it? The cheap knock-offs and dinosaur junk.ScenesRoss: Really?! (To Rachel) Hey, y’know what? Since you have such a great sense of what I need, uh ooh, here’s-here’s 60 bucks, why don’t you take Phoebe down to that Colonial flea market of yours and get me some stuff.ScenesRachel: (not sure of what to do) Y’know what? I don’t, I don’t think Phoebe really wants to come.ScenesPhoebe: No! I do want to!ScenesRachel: Oh, she does want to.ScenesRoss: She does want to.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: The Street, Phoebe and Rachel are heading back from that Colonial flea market.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Pheebs, I don’t know what to say. I guess the flea market was just better last time.ScenesPhoebe: Well at least I got these sheets for Ross.ScenesRachel: Yeah.Scenes(They walk by a Pottery Barn window display.)ScenesPhoebe: Uck, look at this! Pottery Barn, yuck!ScenesRachel: Yeah, y’know what? Don’t look at it. (Realizes the display is their living room) Seriously, don’t look at it. (Tries to pull Phoebe away.)ScenesPhoebe: No! Look-look! There’s the coffee table they stole from us!ScenesRachel: Ugh, those bastards! Let’s go.ScenesPhoebe: That fan kinda looks like ours. And the birdcage and the…wait a sec! This is our exact living room!ScenesRachel: No! No! No! No it’s not! No it’s not! Come on! Phoebe, ours is totally different! I mean we don’t have the… (Looks desperately for something different.) We don’t have the…that lamp! And-and that screen is y’know, on the other side.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God. This is where you got all our stuff, Pottery Barn! Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Okay! Okay-okay look—no I did, I just wanted this stuff and I know how you feel about Pottery Barn. Just… Come on don’t be mad.ScenesPhoebe: No-no-no, but I am mad! I am mad! Because this stuff is everything that is wrong with the world! And it’s all sitting up in my living room and all I can think about is how I don’t have that lamp!ScenesRachel: Well then honey, buy the lamp! Hey, we have that 60 bucks from Ross.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t! I can’t! Unless… Well are you saying that-that you would move out if-if I didn’t buy that lamp?ScenesRachel: What?! No! I’m not gonna move out!ScenesPhoebe: But are you saying that you would move out if I didn’t buy that lamp?ScenesRachel: (gets it) Oh. Yes! I would so move out!ScenesPhoebe: Okay then I don’t have a choice! I have to buy that lamp!ScenesRachel: That’s right!Scenes(They start to go inside.)ScenesPhoebe: But at least the apothecary table is real.

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Joey, Janine, Monica, and Chandler are returning from their second date.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well, this-this-this was great. Didn’t everybody have a great time?ScenesJanine: Well I did. I really did. And you guys, I’ve got to say, I’m sorry if I was a little weird after the last time we went out. I guess I was just nervous or something.ScenesChandler: That’s totally understandable.ScenesMonica: Don’t worry about it.ScenesJanine: So we can go out again?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah!ScenesMonica: Absolutely!ScenesJanine: Oh good.ScenesJoey: Oh well then, good night!ScenesMonica: Good night! (They go into their respective apartments.)Scenes[Cut to Joey and Janine’s, they’re entering.]ScenesJoey: See? Eh, wasn’t that fun?ScenesJanine: We have got to move!ScenesMonica: (bursting in) I knew it!! Y’know, you’re not so quiet yourself, missy!ScenesChandler: And I’m blah? Listen, the only thing more boring than watching modern dance is having to listen to you talk about it, (Imitating her) "Oh Chandler, I just lost myself in the moment.ScenesJanine: Y’know, I know you’re talking, but all I hear is, "Blah. Blah. Blah-blah-blah.ScenesMonica: (steps up and points at her) All right! You and me! Let’s go! Right now!ScenesJoey: All right! All right! Enough! Enough! Enough!! Enough! (To Chandler and Monica) You two go home! I-I-I gotta talk to Janine! (They start to leave.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Y’know I think you can take her.ScenesMonica: (to Janine) You’d better hope I don’t see you in the hallway!! (They exit.)ScenesJoey: All right, uh, we’ve got a little bit of a problem here. These people are my friends; you can’t treat them that way.ScenesJanine: They said stuff to me too, y’know!ScenesJoey: I know! I know! And I’m going to talk to them about it. They mean so much to me. They… They’re like my family. If you guys are gonna be fighting all the time, I-I… I don’t think we can be together. It just, it just can’t work. It can’t. (Starts to break up) I’m very upset.ScenesJanine: Okay. Okay. Would, would it help if I went over and apologized?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! That would be very helpful! Yeah. (He opens the door for her and she exits into the hallway.)Scenes[Cut to the hallway, Janine is entering as Monica is taking out the garbage.]ScenesMonica: What did I tell you about the hall?!ScenesJanine: I was just coming over here to apologize for my behavior! I’d really like it if we could be friends.ScenesMonica: Well, I know that would make Joey happy, so, I would like that too.ScenesJanine: Great.ScenesMonica: Now come on. (They hug like men.) Well, I’m glad we worked things out.ScenesJanine: Me too.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesJanine: I’ll see you.ScenesMonica: Bye. (Leaves to resume her garbage removal task.)ScenesJanine: (muttering to herself) Or I’ll hear you.ScenesMonica: (hearing that) That’s it big girl! (Hits Janine in the butt with the garbage bag) Come on!ScenesJanine: Wait! (Janine pauses, then runs down the stairs.)ScenesMonica: (chasing her) You’d better run!Scenes(Joey and Chandler both come into the hallway.)ScenesChandler: Did you hear that?ScenesJoey: Yeah uh, what am I gonna do?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m sorry man. (Pause) You wanna go watch?ScenesJoey: Yeah! (They head downstairs.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Chandler, and Monica are there as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: How ya doin’?ScenesChandler: Hey so, did uh, did she move out?ScenesJoey: Pretty much, yeah.ScenesMonica: I cannot believe you broke up with her just like that.ScenesJoey: Well, when it’s not right, you know it.ScenesChandler: You okay?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah. I’ll be all right.ScenesRoss: Y’know what would cheer you up?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: I’m giving this lecture on erosion theories tomorrow night, I think you should come.ScenesJoey: (laughing hysterically) You’re right! That did cheer me up!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The JokeScenesTeleplay by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesStory by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, Rachel and Monica are there. Ross walks in with a magazine in his hand.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, you’re not going to believe this. I made up a joke and sent it in to Playboy. They printed it!ScenesPhoebe: I didn’t know Playboy prints jokes.ScenesRoss: Yeah, they print jokes, interviews, hard-hitting journalism. It’s not just about the pictures.ScenesMonica: That didn’t work on mom, it’s not going to work on us.ScenesRoss: (showing them the page) Here, check it out. It’s the first one, too.Scenes(They all laugh indifferently, except Chandler, who’s a little angry.)ScenesChandler: That is funny. It was also funny when I made it up.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: I made that joke up.ScenesRoss: Uh, oh-oh, no you didn’t. I did.ScenesChandler: Yes, I did. I told it to Dan at work, and he said it was the funniest joke he’d ever heard.ScenesRoss: Hey, tell Dan, ‘Thanks.’Scenes(Rachel is looking at the magazine and laughing.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, I was just reading the joke below it. Man, that one is funny. (Ross grabs the magazine away from her.)ScenesChandler: Monica, you remember me telling you that joke, right?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesChandler: Seriously?ScenesMonica: Well, you tell a lot of jokes!ScenesRoss: Look, Chandler, it’s my joke. But, hey, if it makes you feel any better they don’t print the name, so it doesn’t really matter who gets credit, right?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I guess.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys.ScenesChandler: (jumping up from his chair) Hey, Joey, Playboy printed my joke.ScenesRoss: No, it’s my joke, it’s mine. You can call them, they’ll tell you.ScenesChandler: It’s my joke.ScenesRoss: It’s my joke.ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-whoa. Jokes? You guys know they have naked chicks in there, right?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey’s apartment, Joey is sitting at the counter as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Dude, you have got to turn on Behind the Music. The band Heart is having a really tough time, and I think they may break up.ScenesJoey: Let’s go watch it at your place.ScenesChandler: Nah, Monica’s watching some cooking show. Come on, I don’t want to miss when they were skinny.ScenesJoey: Chandler, Chandler, y’know what we should do? You and I should go out and get some new sunglasses.ScenesChandler: What? No, I want to watch this. (He turns on the television and the screen is completely covered in snow). Did your cable go out?ScenesJoey: No, that’s VH-1. I gotta tell you, the music these kids listen to today . . . It’s like a lotta noise to me. I don’t know…ScenesChandler: Joey, why is your cable out?ScenesJoey: I uh, oh! Because, uh, I haven’t really paid the billScenesChandler: If you need money, will you please-please just let me loan you some money?ScenesJoey: No, Chandler. Look, forget about it, okay? Look, I know things have been a little tight since Janine moved out. Oh, was she hot.ScenesChandler: Whoa ho.ScenesJoey: I know! Yeah, but, look I can handle it. All right? Look, I can listen to the radio, huh? And Ross gave me this great book (holds up the Playboy magazine).ScenesChandler: (picks up the phone) All right, you want to see if the joke stealer will let us watch the show at his place?ScenesJoey: Sure.ScenesChandler: (with phone to ear, obviously hearing no dial tone) Paid your phone bill?ScenesJoey: Not so much.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica and Rachel are on the couch looking at the Playboy magazine. When they hear someone coming, Monica goes to hide it under the sofa cushions.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesMonica: (relieved) It’s only you.ScenesPhoebe: Wh-wh-what are you doing?ScenesRachel: We are looking at a Playboy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I want to look too! (She runs over and sits down and checks out a picture). Yikes!ScenesMonica: So do you think that these pictures—Are, are they trying to tell a story?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, sure. I mean, like in the case of this young woman, she has lost her clothes, so she rides naked on the horse, she’s crying out, ‘Where are they, where are they?’ScenesMonica: Well, she’s not going to find them lying in the grass like that.Scenes(They flip through the pages to another picture.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah. Aw, remember the days when you used to go out to the barn, lift up your shirt, and bend over?ScenesRachel and Monica: Yeah.ScenesRachel: You see, now, I would date this girl. She’s cute, she’s outdoorsy, you know, and she knows how to build a fire. I mean, that’s got to come in handyScenesMonica: Okay, I’ve got a question. If you had to pick one of us to date, who would it be?ScenesRachel: (thinks) I don’t know.ScenesMonica: Me neither.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. (Pause) Me neither.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, and Ross are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Joey: You forget how many great songs Heart had.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: You know, Barracuda was the first song I learned to play on the keyboard.ScenesChandler: So, you heard it, you repeated it, so that must mean you wrote it.ScenesJoey: Oh, you guys, with this joke. I gotta say, I know I cracked up, but I’m not even sure I got it.ScenesRoss: What, you didn’t get it? The doctor is a monkey.Scenes(He and Chandler crack up.)ScenesChandler: And monkeys can’t write out prescriptions.Scenes(He and Ross crack up again. Joey just sits there)ScenesChandler: (stops laughing, to Ross) You are not allowed to laugh at my joke.ScenesRoss: Your joke? Well, I think ‘the Hef’ would disagree, which is why he sent me a check for one hundred ah-dollars.ScenesChandler: So, you stole my joke, and you stole my money.ScenesRoss: Well, I was going to stick it in the ATM, but now I think I’ll show the sexy teller that I am a published writer.ScenesChandler: Well, she is going to know that you stole the joke.ScenesRoss: Oh, what are you going to do, follow me down there?ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Well, I’m not going to go now anyway (he goes to sit down).ScenesChandler: Okay (he goes to sit down).Scenes(Ross leaps out of his chair and runs out the door, with Chandler in hot pursuit.)ScenesGunther: (handing Joey the bill) Here you go.ScenesJoey: Ah, Gunther, I can’t pay for this right now because I’m not working, so I’ve had to cut down on some luxuries like uh, payin’ for stuff.ScenesGunther: Well, if you want, you can work here.ScenesJoey: Uh, I don’t know. Ya see, it’s just, see I was a regular on a soap opera y’know? And to go from that to this, I just… Plus, I’d have to wait on all my friends.ScenesGunther: Okay, but the money’s good, plus you get to stare at Rachel as much as you want.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesGunther: Flexible hours.ScenesJoey: Maybe I could be a waiter. Could I use the phone?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are in bed together.]
rows.Content: Monica: (visibly upset) She picked Rachel. I mean, she tried to back out of it, but it was obvious. She picked Rachel.ScenesChandler: (visibly upset) He took my joke, he took it.ScenesMonica: It’s wrong. You know what else is wrong? Phoebe picking Rachel.ScenesChandler: You know who else picked Rachel? Ross, and you know what else Ross did? He stole my joke. You know what? I’m going to get a joke journal. Y’know? And document the date and time of every single one of my jokes.ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea.ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Do you know what’s a bad idea?ScenesChandler: Picking Rachel.ScenesMonica: That’s right. (A noise comes from the living room.) Did you hear something?ScenesChandler: Maybe it’s the sound of Ross climbing into my brain and stealing my thoughts.ScenesMonica: It’s coming from the living room.Scenes(They go out to investigate, and find Joey wrapped in a blanket watching their television.)ScenesJoey: (sheepishly) I finished my book. (Chandler and Monica slowly retreat back to bed.)Scenes[Scene, Phoebe and Rachel’s, they’re sitting together on the couch.]ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey, you guys.ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Hey.ScenesMonica: (laughing) Oh, don’t you guys look cute. You guys make such a cute couple.ScenesRachel: Monica, what are you doing?ScenesMonica: (laughing harder) Nothing, I’m just trying to recreate some of the fun that we had at my place the other day. (To Phoebe) Remember, when you picked Rachel over me? That was funny.ScenesPhoebe: I guess it was kinda funny.ScenesMonica: (angrily) It wasn’t funny at all! Why would you do that? Why didn’t you pick me?ScenesPhoebe: Fine. The reason that I was leaning a little bit more toward Rachel than you is just that you’re … just … kinda high maintenance—Okay let’s go to lunch!ScenesMonica: That is completely untrue. You think I’m high maintenance? Okay, prove it. I want you to make a list and we’re going to go through it point by point!ScenesPhoebe: No, okay, you’re right. You’re easy-going. You’re just not as easy-going as Rachel. She’s just more flexible and-and mellow. That’s all.ScenesRachel: (To Monica) Well, people are different.ScenesPhoebe: Ya, you know, Rachel … she’ll do whatever you want. Y’know, you can just walk all over her.ScenesRachel: What? Wait a minute. What are you saying, that I’m a pushover? I’m not a pushover.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, (laughing) you’re not a pushover.ScenesRachel: Oh my … you think I’m a pushover. Well wait, watch this, you know what? You’re not invited to lunch. What do you think of that? I think that’s pretty strong, that’s what I think. Come on, Monica, let’s go to lunch. (She leaves)ScenesMonica: (to Phoebe) You start working on that list. (She grabs her coat and leaves, too.)Scenes[Cut to the hallway.]ScenesRachel: I cannot believe her.ScenesMonica: I know. Where do you wanna go eat?ScenesRachel: Oh, oh, I love that Japanese place.ScenesMonica: I’m sick of Japanese. We’re not going there.ScenesRachel: All right, wherever you wanna go is cool.ScenesMonica: All right.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are there as Ross enters and sees Gunther.]
rows.Content: Ross: (showing the Playboy magazine to Gunther) Oh, hey, Gunther, check this out.Scenes(Gunther looks at the joke and laughs.)ScenesGunther: Yeah, that-that Chandler cracks me up.Scenes(Ross begins to say something, realizes what Gunther just said, turns, and glares at Chandler. Chandler just shrugs it off.)ScenesJoey: Hey Ross, listen, you want anything to drink, ‘cause I’m heading up there.ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah, I’ll take a coffee. Thanks, man.ScenesJoey: Sure. (To Monica and Rachel) Coffee? ‘Cause I’m going up there.ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMonica: No, thank you.ScenesJoey: (to a table of strangers) You guys need anything, ‘cause I’m heading up there.ScenesWoman: I’d love an ice water.ScenesJoey: You got it.ScenesMonica: Joey, what are you doing?ScenesJoey: Just being friendly. (He gives Monica a ‘what’s wrong with you?’ look and proceeds to walk behind the counter.)ScenesRachel: Joey, honey, I don’t think you’re supposed to go back there.ScenesJoey: Nah, it’s okay. Right, Gunther? (Winks at him as if they’re in on a secret together.)ScenesGunther: Don’t wink at me. And put on your apron.ScenesJoey: Okay, but I don’t see you asking any other paying customers to put on aprons.ScenesMonica: Joey, do you work here?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesCustomer: Hey, waiter.ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: Joey, what’s going on. What didn’t you tell us you work here?ScenesJoey: It’s kind of embarrassing, y’know. I mean, I was an actor and now I’m a waiter. It’s supposed to go in the other direction.ScenesChandler: So is your apron. You’re wearing it like a cape.ScenesJoey: I mean, the job’s easy and the money’s good, you know? I guess I’m going to be hanging out here anyway. I might as well get paid for it, right? I just feel kind of weird serving you guys.ScenesRachel: Come on, Joey, I did it and it was fine.ScenesRoss: Yeah, why would it be weird? Hey, Joey, can I get some coffee?ScenesJoey: Okay, I guess it doesn’t seem that weird.ScenesRoss: Seriously, I-I asked you before and you still haven’t gotten it.ScenesJoey: See, now it’s weird again.ScenesChandler: I think it’s great that you work here. You’re going to make a lot of money, and here’s your first tip: Don’t eat yellow snow. (He laughs, then picks up a pen, glares at Ross, and writes in his journal). Ah ha ha, 2:15, coffeehouse.ScenesRachel: Well, you know what? This is great. Finally, I have someone I can pass on my wisdom too. Let me tell you about a couple of things I learned while working at the coffeehouse. First of all, the customer is always right. (Joey nods.) A smile goes a long way. (Joey smiles) And if anyone is ever rude to you? Sneeze muffin.ScenesJoey: Thanks, Rach. Look, you guys are just terrific. Y’know? Now, how about clearing out of here so I can get some new customers. It’s all about turnover.ScenesRoss: Joey, seriously, can I get my coffee?ScenesJoey: Oh, I’m sorry, Ross. I’ll get it for you right now. And since I made you wait, I’ll toss in a free muffin.Scenes(He looks at Rachel and winks, she gives him the thumbs-up sign.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel’s, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Rachel and Monica enter.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Phoebe. We would like to talk to you for a second.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesMonica: So, maybe I am a little high maintenance. And maybe Rachel is a little bit of a pushover. But you know what we decided you are?ScenesRachel: Yes, we are very sorry to tell you this, but you, Phoebe, are flaky.ScenesMonica: Hah!ScenesPhoebe: That true, I am flaky.ScenesRachel: So, what, you’re just, you’re just okay with being flaky?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, totally.ScenesMonica: Well, then, I’m okay with being high maintenance.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and I am okay with being a pushover.ScenesPhoebe: That’s great. Good for you guys.ScenesMonica: I am not high maintenance!ScenesRachel: I am not a pushover!ScenesPhoebe: Who said you were?ScenesMonica and Rachel: You did!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’m flaky. I’ll say anything.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is coming back from using the phone.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, Gunther. Can you uh, can you cover for me? I just got an audition.ScenesGunther: No, I’m leaving to get my hair dyed.ScenesJoey: Really?! I like your natural color. Come on man, it’s a great part. Look, check it out. I’m the lead guy’s best friend and I wait for him in this bar and save his seat. Listen-listen. ‘I’m sorry, that seat’s saved.’ScenesGunther: That’s the whole part?ScenesJoey: Okay, maybe he’s not his best friend, but …ScenesGunther: Okay, I’ll see you in an hour.ScenesJoey: Oh, man, I could totally get that part. ‘I’m sorry, that seat is taken.’ScenesPatron: Oh, excuse me.ScenesJoey: No, no, I didn’t mean you. But, you believed me, huh?ScenesPatron: I believed you were saving this seat for someone.ScenesJoey: So, you’d hire me, right?ScenesPatron: For what?ScenesJoey: Exactly! All right, everybody, listen up. The coffeehouse is going to be closed for about an hour.ScenesCustomers: Huh? What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, it’s for the kids. To keep the kids off drugs. It’s a very important issue in this month’s Playboy. I’m sure you all read about it.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler and Ross are both pouting and sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: It’s my joke.ScenesChandler: It’s my joke.ScenesRoss and Chandler: It’s my joke.ScenesRoss: Y’know, I don’t think we’re going to settle this.ScenesChandler: Let’s have Monica decide.ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Hey Mon.ScenesChandler: Mon, get out here!ScenesRoss: Monica! (She appears, not sure why she was summoned.)ScenesChandler: Okay, okay. You have to help us decide whose joke this is.ScenesMonica: Why do I have to decide?ScenesChandler: Because you’re the only one that can be fair.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: I can’t be fair. You’re my boyfriend.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but I’m your brother. We’re family. That’s the most important thing in the world.ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Don’t try to sway her. (To Monica) (Softly) I’m your only chance to have a baby. Okay, let’s go.ScenesRoss: We’ll each tell you how we came up with the joke and then you decide which one of us is telling the truth—me.ScenesMonica: Okay, Chandler, you go first.ScenesChandler: Okay, I thought of the joke two months ago at lunch with Steve.ScenesMonica: Oh, wait, is he the guy I met at Christmas?ScenesChandler: Can I finish my story?!ScenesMonica: Do you want me to pick you?!ScenesRoss: See, I would never snap at you like that.Scenes(Chandler motions to Monica that he’ll give her two babies.)ScenesMonica: Continue.ScenesChandler: So Steve said he had to go to the doctor. And Steve’s doctor’s name is Doctor Muppy. So I said, ‘Doctor Monkey?’ And that is how the whole Doctor Monkey thing came up. (He slams his feet up on the table to emphasize his point.)ScenesRoss: Are you kidding? Okay, look. I-I studied evolution. Remember, evolution? Monkey into man? Plus, I’m a doctor, and I had a monkey. I’m Doctor Monkey!ScenesChandler: I’m not arguing with that.ScenesMonica: All right, I’ve heard enough. I’ve made my decision.Scenes(Both Chandler and Ross are eager to hear her decision.)ScenesMonica: You are both idiots. The joke is not funny, and it’s offensive to women, and doctors, and monkeys! You shouldn’t be arguing over who gets credit, you should be arguing over who gets blamed for inflicting this horrible joke upon the world! Now let it go! The joke sucks!Scenes(Monica leaves the room)ScenesRoss: It’s your joke.ScenesChandler: Is not.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is sitting at a table and Phoebe is on the couch. Chandler and Monica can be seen outside, she’s lecturing him, and pushes him inside. He then nods to Rachel, and is obviously counting off the seconds in his head and then Monica makes a grand enterance.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi, Chandler. There you are.ScenesChandler: Hi, oh hi.ScenesMonica: Hey, it’s Phoebe and Rachel. Um, why don’t you tell them what you were telling me earlier about me not being high maintenance?Scenes(Rachel and Phoebe exchange looks.)ScenesChandler: (starts to recite a rehearsed speech) Monica is a self-sufficient, together lady. (Pause.) Being with her has been like being on a vacation. And what may be perceived as high maintenance is merely attention to detail and—(He falters and Monica prompts him.)—generosity of spirit.ScenesRachel: Wow, you know what? That is the best fake speech I think I’ve ever heard.ScenesPhoebe: Really? I’ve heard better.ScenesMonica: Wait, wait, he came up with that himself. Tell them, Chandler.ScenesChandler: (To Chandler) I’m out of words. Should I just say the whole thing again?ScenesMonica: Look, I am not high maintenance. I am not. Chandler!ScenesChandler: (pauses as he struggles with what he has to say) You’re a little high maintenance.ScenesMonica: Ahhh! You are on my list.ScenesChandler: I’m sorry. You’re not easy-going, but you’re passionate, and that’s good. And when you get upset about the little things, I think that I’m pretty good about making you feel better about that. And that’s good too. So, they can say that you’re high maintenance, but it’s okay, because I like … maintaining you.ScenesMonica: (embarrassed) (To Phoebe and Rachel) I didn’t even tell him to say that. (They hug). All right you’re off my list.ScenesChandler: (happily) I’m off the list. (Sits on the couch.)ScenesMonica: (sits next to him) Phoebe, it’s okay that you don’t want me to be your girlfriend because I have the best boyfriend.ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Y’know, suddenly I find you very attractive.Scenes(Joey enters.)ScenesChandler: Hey, buddy boy, how’d the audition go?ScenesJoey: Not good, no. I didn’t get the part, and I lost my job here, so …ScenesPhoebe: Wow! That is a bad audition.ScenesRachel: How-how did you lose your job here?ScenesJoey: Well, I had the audition but Gunther said I had to stay here and be in charge so he could go get his hair dyed. So, I went anyway, and then he fired me.ScenesRachel: He left work in the middle of the day to do a personal errand and left you in charge when you’ve been working here two days? That’s not, that’s not right.ScenesJoey: Yeah, what are ya gonna do?ScenesRachel: Joey, you can’t let him get away with that. Ya know what, I’m not going to let him get away with that. I’m going to say something to him—No, I really shouldn’t say anything—No, I should say something to him. (Goes to the counter) Gunther, I want you to give Joey his job back. That is really not fair that you have to fire him…ScenesGunther: Okay.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesGunther: He can have his job back.ScenesRachel: That’s right, he can have his job back. I’m glad we got that all straightened out. There you go, Joey, you got your job back.ScenesJoey: That’s great. Thanks Rach.ScenesRachel: Yeah, pretty nice, huh? Now who’s a pushover?ScenesPhoebe: (returning from the bathroom) Rach, you’re in my seat.ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry. (Gets up and moves.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting at the kitchen table, talking.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey, I never got to hear who you guys would pick to be your girlfriend.ScenesMonica: I pick you, Phoebe.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah. Definitely you, Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well, I kinda thought.Scenes(Phoebe gets up from the table, and while her back is turned, Rachel and Monica indicate via sign language that they each would have picked the other.)Scenes(Joey, Chandler and Ross enter.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey. Oh, I have a question. If-if-if one of you had to pick one of the other two guys to go out with, who would you pick?ScenesRoss: No way.ScenesJoey: I’m not answering that.ScenesChandler: Joey! (Pause as they all stare at him.) No way. I’m not answering that.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s SisterScenesTeleplay by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesStory by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is giving Rachel, Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross their bills.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay Rach, that muffin and espresso, $4.50. Ross, double latte, $2.75. Chandler, coffee and a scone, $4.25. And Pheebs, herbal tea, $1.25. So, all together that’s (pauses to figure the total) $12.75.ScenesChandler: This coming from the man who couldn’t split our 80 dollar phone bill in half.Scenes(A good-looking woman approaches.)ScenesWoman: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hi!ScenesWoman: How much do I owe you for the muffin and the latte?ScenesJoey: Oh that’s on the house courtesy of Joey Tribbiani.ScenesWoman: Oh great! Well, tell him thanks. And since uh, Joey seems like such a nice guy, maybe we could go on a date sometime?ScenesJoey: Well, he’s not used to women being so forward with him; but uh, I good check with him—He says it’s okay. (She hands him her card.) Great! Thanks! Bye-bye!ScenesRoss: Hey Joey, how come our stuff isn’t free?ScenesJoey: It will be when you look like that in a tight skirt! This is great! I’m getting more dates than ever!ScenesRachel: Wait a minute, you’re only giving free stuff away to the pretty girls?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah Joey that is so gross!ScenesJoey: How about a scone on the house baby?ScenesPhoebe: (giggles) I’m pretty.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, everyone but Monica is there playing Monopoly.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey does anyone have any gum?ScenesPhoebe: Oh I do! (She grabs her huge purse and starts rummaging through it and taking out various items in a futile search for the gum.) Oh, y’know what? No. (Pause) Wait a second. (She removes a bag filled with water that has a goldfish swimming in it.) I know it’s in here somewhere.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? I’m good! I’m good!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, what are you doing here? Shouldn’t you be at work?ScenesMonica: (congested) Ugh, they sent me home. They said I can’t work if I’m sick.ScenesAll: Ohh!ScenesChandler: I’m so sorry you’re sick.ScenesMonica: I’m not sick!! I don’t get sick! Getting sick is for weaklings and for pansies!ScenesRachel: Honey, no one thinks you’re a pansy, but we do think you need a tissue. (She notices something hanging from Monica’s nose, as does Joey.)ScenesMonica: (wiping her nose) I have not been sick in over three years! (Sneezes.)ScenesChandler: I’m gonna grab you some tissue.ScenesMonica: I don’t need a tissue! I’m fine-d!ScenesRoss: When you put a ‘D’ at the end of ‘Fine’ you’re not fine.ScenesMonica: I’m fine-d. I’m fine-d! Y’know, it’s a really hard word to say.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door. The gang is stunned and Phoebe counts to make sure that everyone is there. Out of curiosity Chandler goes and answers the door.)ScenesChandler: Yes?Scenes(A woman enters.)ScenesWoman: Hi, is Rachel here? I’m her sister.ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Jill!ScenesJill: Oh my God, Rachel!Scenes(They run and hug each other.)ScenesChandler: Oh my God, introduce us!ScenesRachel: This is Chandler. (Points at him.)ScenesJill: Hi!ScenesRachel: And you know Monica and Ross!ScenesRoss: Hi Jill.ScenesRachel: And that’s Phoebe (points), and that’s Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey, (in the Joey voice) how you doin’?ScenesRachel: Don’t!! (Joey backs away frightened.) (To Jill) Honey, what are you doing here?!ScenesPhoebe: (To Ross) Which-which sister is this? Is this the spoiled one or that’s bitter?ScenesJill: (To Rachel) Daddy cut me off.ScenesPhoebe: Never mind, I got it.ScenesJill: And y’know what I said to him? "I’m gonna hire a lawyer and I’m gonna sue you and take all your money. Then I’m gonna cut you off!ScenesRachel: Wow! What did he say?ScenesJill: That he wouldn’t pay for my lawyer! Then he told me to come here and learn about the value of money from the one daughter he’s actually proud off.ScenesRachel: Oh! Did you hear that?! My dad’s proud of me! My dad’s proud of me.ScenesMonica: Rach? (Points to Jill.)ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, sorry. Wait honey, so what did you do that made dad cut you off?ScenesJill: Okay, I bought a boat.ScenesMonica: You bought a boat?ScenesJill: Yeah but it wasn’t for me, it was for a friend.ScenesChandler: Boy did we make friends with the wrong sister! (Rachel glares at him.)ScenesRachel: Jill, honey, I think this is the best thing that could’ve ever happened to you. I mean you needed to get out on your own anyway! And you know when I did it, I-I-I at first I was scared, and look at me now! I’m the only daughter dad is proud of! Okay, well this is, this is what you’re gonna do. You’re gonna get a job, you’re gonna get an apartment, and then I’ll help you and you can stay with us. Right Pheebs, she can stay with us?ScenesPhoebe: Of course, yeah!ScenesJill: Oh, that’s so great! Okay, I’m really gonna do this! I don’t know how to thank you guys.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I like cards.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is working as Phoebe and Ross are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Joey: (to a customer) Are you all finished here?ScenesCustomer: Yes.ScenesJoey: Great! (Joey takes his cookie and finishes it.)ScenesGunther: Okay, here are the tips for this morning. Jen gets 50, 50 for me, and Joey owes eight dollars.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesGunther: For all the free food you gave away.ScenesJoey: Well if it’s free food, how come you’re charging me for it?ScenesGunther: We don’t give anything away unless it’s someone’s birthday.ScenesJoey: Well, what if they came in third in a modeling contest?ScenesGunther: No!ScenesJoey: (to a woman who came in third in a modeling contest) Sorry! (He grabs her muffin away and returns it to the serving tray.)ScenesJill: (entering, carrying a bunch of shopping bags) I just had the hardest day. Those bags are so heavy. (Sets them down.)ScenesRoss: Jill, how did you pay for all this? I thought your dad took away your credit card.ScenesJill: Oh please, I memorized those numbers when I was 15. But look at all the cool make-it-on-my-own stuff I got! (Holds up a red sweater) This is my "Please, hire me" sweater. (Holds up a pair of black pants) And these are my, "Don’t you want to rent me this apartment?" pants.ScenesRoss: I don’t think charging new clothes too your dad qualifies as making it on your own.ScenesJill: Oh, Mr. Scientist has to get all technical!ScenesPhoebe: Seriously, I don’t Rachel’s gonna think it’s a good idea.ScenesJill: So who made her queen of the world?ScenesPhoebe: I would love that job!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! What’s goin’ on?ScenesJill: Hey!ScenesRachel: (notices Jill’s bags) Jill! Did you shop?!ScenesJill: No! They did! (Points to Phoebe and Ross)ScenesPhoebe and Ross: Yeah, we went shopping!ScenesRachel: You went shopping?! What, and then you just came in here and paraded it right under Jill’s nose when you know she’s trying to quit. Wow, you guys are terrible!ScenesPhoebe: Sorry Jill.ScenesRoss: Sorry-sorry Jill.ScenesRachel: What’d you get?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, all right, I got (Ross hands her a bag) (To Ross) thank you, I got uh, this y’know "I want a job sweater." (Holds up the same sweater.)ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: And, and then I got uh, these are apartment pants.ScenesRachel: Apartment pants?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, you never heard of them?ScenesRachel: No, of course, of course I’ve heard of them! Ross, what did you get?ScenesRoss: Huh? Oh, I got this—(Holds up this pink frilly thing)—this!ScenesRachel: A pajmena?ScenesRoss: Yeah! Oh, I-I love this babies!ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesRoss: Ross, wants a pajmena?ScenesRoss: It’s a rug. (Jill winces.)ScenesRachel: Jill?ScenesJill: (covers her eyes and starts crying) I’m sorry Rachel, I’m sorry…ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! You think that’s gonna work on me?! I invented that!ScenesJill: Right! But, I am sorry.ScenesRachel: All right, it’s okay. One little setback is okay, just don’t let it happen again, all right? Now since daddy paid for all this stuff, I should take it all away. But I’m just gonna take the-the pajmena. (Ross hands it to her.) And the uh, and the uh pants. Y’know what, I’m just gonna take it all away, ‘cause that way you’ll just really learn the lesson. Okay? All righty, I’m gonna run a couple of errands and I will see you at dinner. (Leaves with all of Jill’s stuff.)ScenesJill: She took all my stuff.ScenesRoss: Yeah. Everything but, the little blue one. (Holds it up for her.)ScenesJill: (gasps) That’s the best one! Oh my God, (hugs him) thank you so much!ScenesRoss: Well. Hey…ScenesJill: Oh my gosh, that was so lame. Like a pajmena could be a rug!ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, how about you and the, (mimics her fake cry) "I’m sorry!ScenesJill: (hits him) Shut up! I did not sound like that at all!ScenesPhoebe: What about, what about when I said y’know about the apartment pants, how dumb was I?Scenes(They both look at her.)ScenesJill: Were you this cute in high school?ScenesRoss: Oh stop.ScenesJill: No you stop!ScenesRoss: No, you stop!ScenesJill: You stop!ScenesPhoebe: (gets up and sits between them) Okay-okay, why don’t I sit here and you’ll both stop it!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is still very sick and is entering the living room from the bathroom wearing a robe. Chandler is reading a magazine.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, so what do you, what do you want to do? Let’s do something crazy!ScenesChandler: I know, let’s rest and drink lots of fluids. (Holds up a glass of orange juice.)ScenesMonica: Okay, I’ll rest. But y’know if I’m going to bed, then you’re coming with me.ScenesChandler: That would be impossible to resist if you weren’t all drippy here. (Points to his nose.)ScenesMonica: (wiping her nose) Are you saying that you don’t wanna get with this? (Tries to do a little sexy body rub, but it doesn’t work all that well with the big robe.)ScenesChandler: Yeah, I don’t you should say that even when you’re healthy.ScenesMonica: (in a sexy voice) Come on. (Coughs loudly.)ScenesChandler: Don’t take this personally okay? It’s just that I just can’t have sex with a sick person.ScenesMonica: I’m with you Chandler! I mean I can’t have sex with a sick person either, that’s disgusting! But I’m not sick! Let me prove it to you. We are two healthy people in the pribe of libe.ScenesChandler: That’s the thing, see I would like to stay in the pribe of mwha-ah-libe.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, Rachel is putting away her new clothes as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesRachel: What’s up?!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, I think there’s something you should maybe know.ScenesRachel: Well, it’d better not be about the apartment pants, because I just pitched the idea to my boss at Ralph Lauren and she loved it.ScenesPhoebe: No. No. It’s just I was umm, I was with Ross and Jill after you left and umm, I’m pretty sure I saw a little spark between them.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I mean it’s probably nothing, but I just wanted to warn you that there might be something there.ScenesRachel: With Ross and Jill?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesRachel: With Ross and my sister?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: With my sister Jill and my ex-boyfriend Ross?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Oh there is no way.ScenesPhoebe: Okay then.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! I can not believe that! I mean I don’t really like it when Ross goes out with anyone, but my sister isn’t that like incest or something?! Oh my God, and they’re gonna have sex! Oh! Oh no what if he marries her too?! Oh this is just terrible, this is just terrible. And I can’t stop it! I can’t—I don’t own Ross! Y’know? And Jill, she should be able to do whatever it is that she wants to do! And oh my God, I can’t believe Ross is marrying my little sister, this terrible. Oh my God, this is just the worst thing that could have ever happened to me.ScenesPhoebe: But great news about the apartment pants, huh?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is giving the bill to the same beautiful woman from before.]
rows.Content: Joey: That’ll be $3.85.ScenesWoman: What do you mean? Yesterday you said I was too pretty to pay for stuff!ScenesJoey: It’s just I can’t because my manager said I… (Gets an idea) (Starts singing) "Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you. Happy birthday dear Annie…ScenesWoman: Amy!ScenesJoey: (still singing) "…Amy! Happy birthday to you!ScenesA Male Customer: Hey, that’s weird, today’s my birthday too!ScenesJoey: Yeah, not it here it isn’t.ScenesJill: (entering) Sorry I’m late, what’s up?ScenesRachel: (on the couch) Oh hi! Y’know, I just wanted to see if there were any leads on the old job front.ScenesJill: Oh no! But I just walked past three sales and I didn’t go in. How strong am I?ScenesRachel: That is great. Hey, y’know who doesn’t have to job hunt? Ross. He works at the university.ScenesJill: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Oh so you know that, you guys talked about that, so you get along, so you think you’re gonna go out?ScenesJill: Me go out with Ross?! No! God no! What would make you think that?ScenesRachel: I just, Phoebe, said y’know thought she saw something between you guys.ScenesJill: No! I mean he’s nice.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJill: He’s the kind of guy you’re friends with, y’know? But he’s not the kind of guy you date. He’s the kind of guy you’d date because you did. Me, not so much.ScenesRachel: Oh not-not so much. Umm, what-what do you, what do you mean is there something wrong with Ross?ScenesJill: Oh no-no-no, he’s just I don’t know, he’s just a little bookish.ScenesRachel: Are-are you saying he’s a geek?ScenesJill: You think so too?ScenesRachel: No! No I, no Ross is not a geek!ScenesJill: Fine, then let’s just say he’s not my type.ScenesRachel: What handsome is not your type? Smart? Kind? Good kisser? What those things aren’t on your list? Ross is a great guy! You would be lucky to be with him!ScenesJill: Well okay, if it means that much to you, then I’ll ask him out.ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no, no-no-no, that’s not what I meant.ScenesJill: No! Y’know what Rachel? You’re right, y’know he has been really nice to me.ScenesRachel: Yeah but, he’s not your type.ScenesJill: Yeah but maybe that’s a good thing. Y’know I’m doing all these different sorts of things, and maybe I should try dating a geek too!ScenesRachel: Yeah but, you don’t, you don’t, you don’t want to try to much too fast. Y’know? I mean, you do remember what happened to the little girl that tried to much too fast don’t you?ScenesJill: What?ScenesRachel: She-she died Jill.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler has fallen asleep reading a book. Monica calls from the bedroom and wakes him up.]
rows.Content: Monica: (still sick) Chandler!ScenesChandler: Oh what is it honey, you need some tea? Some soup? (He gets up from the couch and goes into the bedroom to find Monica, still in the robe, lying seductively on the bed. Or at least she’s trying too and as he enters the room, she takes the robe off on of her legs.) Oh-ohhhh!ScenesMonica: (trying to be seductive) Calling Dr. Big, Dr. Big to the bed.ScenesChandler: Oh Jeez honey, I thought, I thought you were asleep.ScenesMonica: How could I be asleep knowing that you were in the next room.ScenesChandler: I was asleep. (She takes off her robe and starts to shiver) Oh no! No-no honey! Y’know what’s sexy? Layers. Layers are sexy. And blankets are sexy. And oh! Hot water bottles are sexy.ScenesMonica: Come on, get into bed! I want to prove to you that I’m not sick! I wanna make you feel, as good as I feel. (Sneezes.)ScenesChandler: Would you please get some rest!ScenesMonica: I’m fine. (She goes into one of those half sneezing, half-coughing fits that you get with a bad cold or flu.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is singing Happy Birthday to yet another good-looking woman. Gunther is watching and is not very happy.]
rows.Content: Joey: (singing) "Happy birthday to you!ScenesGunther: You’re paying for that.ScenesJoey: What? No-no it’s her birthday!ScenesGunther: You’ve sung Happy Birthday to 20 different women today!ScenesJoey: But it really…ScenesGunther: You are no longer authorized to distribute birthday muffins.ScenesJoey: Damnit! (Storms off.)ScenesRoss: (entering) Rach? Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: Did you tell your sister to ask me out?ScenesRachel: Well yeah…ScenesRoss: Oh wow! I mean, wow! I mean, I-I-I think she’s cute but I-I would never have thought of going out with her, never!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesRoss: Yeah but after you said it was okay, I figured, "Why not?!ScenesRachel: Oh so-so not really never.ScenesRoss: I have to say you are a much bigger person than I am. I mean after all we’ve been through, I just—y’know I wish I had a brother to reciprocate. Hey, if you ever want to go out with Monica, you have my blessing.ScenesJoey: (overhearing them) Oh-ho, and mine!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is still sick and is hobbling out into the living room for some help from Chandler who’s on the couch reading.]
rows.Content: Monica: (entering) Chandler, I think I’m sick.ScenesChandler: Really? Struck down in the pribe of libe!ScenesMonica: Okay, fine I admit it! I feel terrible! Would you please rub this on my chest? (She hands him some of that Vicks Vap-O-Rub to put on.)ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no-no-no-no, you are not getting me this way.ScenesMonica: Come on! I really need your help!ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no-no!ScenesMonica: Fine, I’ll rub it on myself.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(To start this task, she lowers the top of her robe to reveal that she is naked from the waist up, well at least her back is, and starts to rub on the gunk. Chandler notices this, and has something start happening. I’ll let you fill in the blank here.)ScenesChandler: So you’re just, kinda rubbing it on yourself?ScenesMonica: Yeah?ScenesChandler: It’s nice.ScenesMonica: Are you kidding me?! Is this; is this turning you on?ScenesChandler: Yes! (Hangs his head in shame.)ScenesMonica: I can’t believe it! What is it? Is it the rubbing or the smell?ScenesChandler: It’s all very, very good. (She covers up and sits down.) So you wanna go uh, mix it up?ScenesMonica: Not now, I’m sick!ScenesChandler: Oh come on you big faker!ScenesMonica: What happened to your rule about never sleeping with sick people?ScenesChandler: Well that was before all the vaporizing action.ScenesMonica: Okay, if you really wanna have sex…ScenesChandler: Okay! (Runs into the bedroom.)ScenesMonica: Worked like a charm.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is there as Jill enters to start her date with Ross.]
rows.Content: Jill: (entering) Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! Wh-what are you doing here?ScenesJill: This is where Ross and I are meeting for our date. So, what do you think? (She spins to show Rachel the outfit she’s wearing.)ScenesRachel: Well, I-I don’t like it.ScenesJill: Really?!ScenesRachel: It’s kinda slutty.ScenesJill: It’s yours!ScenesRachel: Yeah well, I’m-I’m a slut.ScenesJill: (laughs) Me too.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hi Jill!ScenesJill: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi (sees Rachel and forgets her name for a moment).ScenesRachel: Rachel.ScenesRoss: Rachel! Well, you-you’re not at home, you’re-you’re-you’re right here.ScenesRachel: Yeah I know, and I bet you thought it would be weird. But it’s not!Scenes(There’s an awkward silence.)ScenesRoss: Okay. So well I’ll umm, (To Rachel) I’ll have her home by midnight.Scenes(Rachel laughs a little too hard as Ross and Jill leave for their date. After they have left, Rachel starts to break down.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel enters and walks quickly over to the window to watch Ross’s apartment. We see that Ross’s apartment is empty.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Why aren’t you home yet?!ScenesMonica: (calling from the bathroom) Is someone there?ScenesRachel: Oh yes, it’s me! Sorry!ScenesChandler: (calling from the bathroom) What are you doing here?ScenesRachel: Uh, I’m just, I’m just looking out your window. At-at the view. What are you guys doing?ScenesChandler: We got some Vap-O-Rub in some places.Scenes(We see that Ross is returning to his apartment with Jill.)ScenesRachel: (gasps) Oh, he brought her back to his apartment.ScenesMonica: (entering with Chandler) Who? (She looks out the window at Ross’s apartment) Is that your sister?ScenesRachel: Ugh, she is a slut!ScenesMonica: God, Ross is on a date with your sister! How weird is that?!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, look-look he’s taking off her clothes!ScenesChandler: He’s taking off her coat!Scenes(We see that Ross is taking off Jill’s coat.)ScenesRachel: Oh, this is just terrible.ScenesMonica: Oh no it’s not, no it’s not. It’s a first date. I’m sure that nothing is gonna…(as she is talking we see Ross close his drapes.)ScenesRachel: Oh. (Squeaks again.)ScenesChandler: Ho-oh, he’s gonna get some! (Rachel looks at him.) Of the glare from the streetlight out of his apartment. Y’know so umm, he’s closed the drapes there so he can have a nice, pleasant conversation with your little sister. (Pause) Well, I’m off to bed! (Goes to bed.)ScenesTo Be ContinuedScenesEnding CreditsScenes(There is no credits scene, just a preview of the next couple of episodes.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Can’t CryScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel is still looking out the window as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: (sees Rachel) Oh, uh, hey Rach. I uh, I was just coming over here to uh… Oh wait, I don’t have to lie to you, you don’t live here anymore. Uh, I’m eating their food. What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Ross is on a date with my sister and they shut the drapes two and a-half-hours ago.ScenesJoey: Whoa, I didn’t know we could date your sister!Scenes(Chandler and Monica enter from their room and Joey quickly hides the bag of potato chips behind his back.)ScenesMonica: Joey we know you steal our food.Scenes(Joey offers them some potato chips.)ScenesChandler: I’m good.ScenesMonica: (To Rachel) Oh, are the drapes still closed hon?ScenesRachel: Yeah. And y’know who should’ve shut their drapes? Is that perverted old couple two doors over.ScenesChandler: (looking) Is that a swing?ScenesRachel: Oh don’t even ask!ScenesChandler: Yuck!ScenesJoey: I can’t believe Ross went out with Rachel’s sister! When Chandler made out with my sister I was mad at him for 10 years.ScenesChandler: That was like 5 years ago.ScenesJoey: Yeah you got 5 years left!ScenesChandler: Joey…ScenesJoey: You wanna make it 6?!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is on the couch reading as Rachel enters. It’s the next day.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh Ross, hi! Hey, how are ya? There you are!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: (to Gunther) I’ll take a coffee. (To Ross) So how was your big date last night?ScenesRoss: Uhh, it was okay. Yeah, it was fun.ScenesRachel: Yeah fun? Great! So uh, so did you guys hit it off?ScenesRoss: I guess so.ScenesRachel: So uh, so did anything happen? Because rumor has it you guys shut the drapes!ScenesRoss: No. No. Nothing happened. I shut the drapes to uh, show her slides of my favorite fossils.ScenesRachel: Oh, slides. (Laughs.) So really nothing happened.ScenesRoss: Something could’ve happened. All right? She-she really dug my slides. And-and she was definitely giving me the vibe.ScenesRachel: Right. Was it the, "Please don’t show me another picture of a trilobite vibe?ScenesRoss: Anyway, if she, if she wasn’t in to me, why-why would she ask me out again?ScenesRachel: She asked-asked you out again?ScenesRoss: Yeah-uh-huh. Tomorrow night, Valentine’s Day, the most romantic day of the year. Who knows what could happen? I might not be shutting my drapes to show her my slides, if you know what I mean.ScenesRachel: Okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay-okay! I got it! I got it! I got it! I can’t! I can’t! I can’t! I cannot go with you and my sister thing. Okay? I just can’t. It’s just too weird, all right? I imagine the two of you together and I freak out. It freaks me out. I can’t do it! I can’t do it.ScenesRoss: (while Rachel is finishing her rant) Okay! Okay! Okay! It’s okay. (Rachel stops.) It’s okay. Hey, it’s too weird for you, I won’t see her again.ScenesRachel: Thank you. I…yeah.ScenesRoss: I mean after tomorrow night.ScenesRachel: No-no-no! No-no-no! Please Ross, I can’t! I can’t do it! (Starts to freak out.) It’s just gonna freak me out!!!ScenesRoss: Okay! Okay! Ooh-hey-hey-hey! Okay! Okay! Okay! I’ll-I’ll tell her tonight I can’t see her anymore.ScenesRachel: Ross thanks.ScenesRoss: You want me to call her right now?ScenesRachel: Oh no! No! No-no-no-no! No, I mean come on that’s-that’s crazy—I mean that’s crazy. So what’s-what’s going on with you? What is going on with you?ScenesRoss: Well umm, oh! I might be teaching another class this semester!ScenesRachel: Yeah do it now, call right now.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are watching ET.]
rows.Content: Monica: (crying) This is my favorite part.ScenesPhoebe: (crying) Yeah me too.Scenes(We see the TV and it’s the last scene where ET is saying goodbye.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh y’know what’s sadder than this? Bambi. I cried for three days with that movie. No wait two! Because on the third day my mother killed herself so I was partly crying for that.ScenesChandler: (totally not crying) Well see now that I can see crying over, but Bambi is a cartoon!ScenesJoey: (crying) You didn’t cry when Bambi’s mother died?ScenesChandler: Yes it was very sad when the guy stopped drawing the deer!ScenesMonica: Chandler there’s nothing wrong with crying! I mean you don’t have to be so macho all the time.ScenesChandler: I’m not macho.ScenesMonica: Yeah you’re right. I don’t know what I was thinking.ScenesChandler: No, I guess I just never really cried. Y’know? I’m not a crying kind of guy.ScenesJoey: Come on man there’s gotta be something that gets you choked up! Like uh, uh oh, what if you saw a three-legged puppy?ScenesChandler: I’d be sad sure, but I wouldn’t cry.ScenesJoey: Okay, what if the puppy said, "Help me Chandler. All the other puppies pick on me.ScenesChandler: Cry?! I just found a talking puppy, I’m rich!ScenesMonica: Oh, I’ve got it! I have got it! (Gets up and gets something from the dresser underneath the TV.) Pictures from your childhood. This will get you going good!Scenes(Chandler starts paging through the album.)ScenesPhoebe: All right, what’s going on there? (Points to a picture.)ScenesChandler: Oh, that’s Parent’s Day, first grade. That’s me with the janitor Martin.ScenesMonica: Where were your parents?ScenesChandler: Oh they didn’t want to come!ScenesPhoebe: Oh Chandler!ScenesMonica: Poor thing!ScenesPhoebe: So that story doesn’t make you cry?ScenesChandler: No! Look, I don’t cry! It’s not a big deal! Okay?!ScenesJoey: No! It’s not okay! It’s not okay at all!! You’re dead inside!!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is putting away her guitar as a man approaches.]
rows.Content: The Fan: Excuse me.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesThe Fan: Are you Phoebe Buffay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesThe Fan: Can-can I get your autograph, I’m your biggest fan. (Holds out a napkin and a pen.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh you’re my biggest fan? I’ve always wanted to meet you! Hi! (Shakes his hand.) Sure! Yeah! (Signs the autograph)ScenesThe Fan: Wow! Wow, thanks a lot! I just wanna say, I think you’re really talented.ScenesPhoebe: You’re just saying that because you’re my biggest fan. (The fan leaves and Joey approaches.) (To Joey) Joey listen, take good care of that guy, okay? (Points) He’s a fan. (To the fan as she’s leaving) Bye! (Exits)ScenesJoey: (to the fan) So, you saw me on Days Of Our Lives huh? Want me to, want me to do a little Dr. Drake Remoray for ya?ScenesThe Fan: I have no idea what you’re talking about. But I, but I just got Phoebe Buffay’s autograph!ScenesJoey: Oh, you’re Phoebe’s fan!ScenesThe Fan: Oh yeah! I’ve seen all her movies.ScenesJoey: Movies?ScenesThe Fan: That was Phoebe Buffay, the porn star.ScenesJoey: (laughs) I don’t think so.ScenesThe Fan: No-no, it was! She was in Sex Toy Story 2, Lawrence of Alabia, and I got her autograph! The guys at the comic book store aren’t gonna believe this! (Exits.)ScenesJoey: Hey Gunther, don’t let that guy in here anymore! He just said Phoebe’s a porn star!ScenesGunther: Well, I wouldn’t call her a star, but she’s really good. You should check out Inspecther Gadget.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, time lapse, Rachel is at the counter as Jill enters.]
rows.Content: Jill: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJill: You’ll never believe what just happened, Ross just totally blew me off and he didn’t even tell me why!ScenesRachel: Ohhh well. Y’know what honey? The best thing to do to get over a guy is to start dating someone else. Oh! There is this great guy you will love at work named Bob! He’s a real up-and-comer in Human Resources.ScenesJill: Y’know, thanks for trying to cheer me up, but I’m not gonna date some random guy from your work.ScenesRachel: It’s not random, it’s Bob.ScenesJill: It’s probably because not mature enough. Or smart enough. Maybe he doesn’t like the way I dress—No that can’t be it. It’s really gotta be the smart thing. Oh I’m so stupid! I’m just like this incredibly pretty stupid girl!ScenesRachel: No honey, okay, okay, you wanna know why Ross canceled the date? Because I asked him to.ScenesJill: You asked him too?!ScenesRachel: Hm-mmm.ScenesJill: Why?!ScenesRachel: Because you are my sister and Ross and I have this huge history…ScenesJill: I don’t understand, do you want to go out with Ross?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesJill: You don’t want him, but you don’t want me to have him?ScenesRachel: (changing the subject) Y’know Bob in Human Resources…ScenesJill: Ugh! I cannot believe you did this too me! You had me doubting how smart I was! (Gasps) You had me doubting my fashion sense!ScenesRachel: Look, this is not that big of a deal! You just don’t date Ross! There’s a million other guys out there, you just…ScenesJill: Hey! You have no right to tell me what to do.ScenesRachel: I’m not telling you what to do! I am telling you what not to do!ScenesJill: Why are you so jealous of me?ScenesRachel: Jill this is not about me being jealous of you! This is about you being a brat! Wanting what you can’t have!ScenesJill: Can’t have?! Excuse me, the only thing I can’t have is dairy! (Starts to storm out.)ScenesRachel: All right, all right, well you just blew your chances at dating Bob!ScenesJill: Who?!ScenesRachel: In Human Resources!!!!!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Rachel is ranting about Jill to Chandler and Monica.]
rows.Content: Rachel: …I am jealous of her?! I mean who does she think she is?! Princess Caroline?!ScenesMonica: You’re jealous of Princess Caroline?ScenesRachel: Do I have my own castle?Scenes(Joey and Ross enter.)ScenesRoss: Hey! Uh, Phoebe’s not here is she?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMonica: (noticing the bag Joey’s carrying) Oh great! Did you get a movie?ScenesJoey: Uhhh, yeah. Yeah. But uh, I don’t think it’s the kind you’re gonna like.ScenesChandler: You didn’t get more movies that are gonna have us reaching for the tissues all night did you?Scenes(Joey and Ross exchange looks.)ScenesJoey: Sort of…ScenesMonica: Guys, what’s going on?ScenesJoey: (holds up the movie) Phoebe’s a porn star!ScenesAll: What?!!Scenes(They all run over to Joey and Ross, Chandler grabs the movie and reads the title.)ScenesChandler: Phoebe Buffay in Buffay: The Vampire Layer.ScenesRachel: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: That’s Phoebe! Where did you get that?ScenesJoey: Well down at the adult video place down on Bleaker.ScenesRoss: And-and I, and I saw that Joey was about to go in, so I ran in ahead of him to-to surprise him and, and then I pretended I didn’t know he was in there. (They all kinda look at him.)ScenesRachel: Wow! I mean, I just—I can’t, I can’t believe this. Y’know, I mean you think you know someone even, even Phoebe who’s always been somewhat of a question mark.ScenesMonica: This is so bizarre. I guess it kinda makes sense though, y’know she had such a terrible childhood.ScenesChandler: Hey, I had a terrible childhood and I don’t do porn.ScenesMonica: Yes, but you are dead inside.ScenesJoey: All right well, I’d better take that back.ScenesMonica: Wh-what, why?ScenesJoey: We can’t watch that! I mean that’s Phoebe!ScenesMonica: Yeah you’re right, we can’t—we shouldn’t watch this.ScenesRachel: Absolutely not.ScenesMonica: (hands the tape back to Joey, but doesn’t let him grab it) Y’know maybe a little bit!ScenesRachel: Probably just the first half.ScenesJoey: No! Hey no! This is wrong you guys! Phoebe’s our friend! Well, I’m not gonna watch it!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Good for you Joe!ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Ross stands next to him for a second, then goes and watches the movie.)Scenes(The movie starts, it’s a vampire’s lair and Buffay, The Vampire Layer enters dressed in leather and carrying a wooden stake. Suddenly, the vampire opens his coffin and sits up.ScenesBuffay, the Vampire Layer: Ah, I thought I’d find you here, Nasforatool.ScenesThe Vampire: Buffay, are you going to plunge your stake into my dark places?ScenesBuffay, the Vampire Layer: Actually, I was kinda hoping it would be the other way around.Scenes(At this point, Buffay, the Vampire Layer and Nasforatool start to get it on. Of course, since this is network TV, we can only see the reactions of the gang to the film playing off screen.)ScenesMonica: Hold on a second! What is that on her ankle?ScenesChandler: Her ankle is what you’re watching?ScenesRachel: Well it’s hard to tell… (Rachel gets up to get a closer look, only she’s having some trouble.) Oh God, if she would just stop moving.ScenesChandler: She’s just doing her job!ScenesJoey: (sitting at the kitchen table with his back to the TV) You sick bastards!ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s a tattoo! That’s weird, Phoebe doesn’t… Wait that’s Ursula! That’s not Phoebe that is Ursula!Scenes(Upon hearing this, Joey can’t turn his chair around fast enough and knocks it over.)ScenesJoey: Re! Re! Then I can watch that! Rewind it! Rewind it!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey! What’s up? (Sees the TV) Oh my God! What am I doing?!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is reading Chicken Soup for the Soul as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey sweetie!ScenesChandler: Hey! (He quickly tries to hide the book by throwing it under the couch, only the couch has no back and it slides into the kitchen.)ScenesMonica: (picking up the book) Chicken Soup for the Soul?ScenesChandler: There’s no back to this couch!ScenesMonica: Why are you reading this? You hate this kind of stuff.ScenesChandler: Yeah I know, but I figured a shot y’know? Maybe one of those stories would make me cry and then you wouldn’t think I was y’know, all dead inside.ScenesMonica: Oh that’s so sweet! Look Chandler I don’t care if you can’t cry, I love you.ScenesChandler: Oh that makes me feel so warm in my hollow tin chest.ScenesMonica: Stop it!ScenesChandler: No, I mean, come on, seriously think about it, we get married, we’re up at the altar and I’m like this. (Makes a bored face.)ScenesMonica: I won’t care, because I know you will be feeling it all in here. (Points to her heart.)ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Yeah! And if, and if we have a baby one-day, and the doctor hands it to you in the delivery room and you don’t cry, so what! And-and-and, and if we take him to college and come home and see his empty room for the first time, and you got nothing, it won’t matter to me.ScenesChandler: Okay, well I won’t uh, worry about this anymore then.ScenesMonica: And-and-and if I die, from a long illness. And you’re writing out my eulogy and you open a desk drawer and you find a note from me that says, "I will always be with you," and you still can’t shed one tiny tear, I know you’ll be crying a river inside.ScenesChandler: Aww, I love you so…ScenesMonica: What is wrong with you?!!!ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesMonica: What?! You can’t shed a tear for your dead wife!! Now, I left you a note from the beyond!ScenesChandler: So you didn’t mean any of that?!ScenesMonica: No you robot!!

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, his doorbell is ringing and he’s running to answer it while doing up his pants.]
rows.Content: Ross: You damn kids! You ring my bell one more time, I swear to… (Opens the door to find Jill standing there.) Ohh, uh Jill. Umm, that-that’s just a little game I play with the kids down the hall. Umm, they’ve really taken a liking to me. (Quickly looks out to see if they’re watching.) Uhh what’s-what’s-what’s the matter?ScenesJill: Rachel and I had a really big fight, can I come in? I-I mean I know we’re not supposed to see each other anymore and I’m okay with that, it’s just that I don’t know anybody in the city and I really need somebody to talk to about it.ScenesRoss: Of course, what happened? (Lets her in.)ScenesJill: (entering) I don’t want to talk about it.ScenesRoss: Okay, umm…ScenesJill: But you know what might really cheer me up?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJill: Seeing some more of your super-cool slides.ScenesRoss: Wow! Really?!ScenesJill: Totally, I love them! And, maybe you could finish telling me about all the different kinds of sand.ScenesRoss: Well, I’d love to! Here, you wait right here and I’ll go get the projector and my notes!ScenesJill: Oh great! Thanks Ross, you’re such a good friend!ScenesRoss: Ohh!Scenes(He goes into another room to get his projector and notes. While he’s gone, Jill quickly checks her makeup.Scenes[Cut to Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel is entering.]ScenesRachel: Hey! Have you guys seen Jill? I can’t find her anywhere.ScenesMonica: No, I haven’t.ScenesRachel: Well, is Ross home? Maybe I’ll just call him to see if he’s actually seen her.Scenes(She goes to look out the window at Ross’s apartment and sees Jill staring at her and closing the drapes with an evil look on her face. Rachel is stunned into silence.)

rows.Scenes: Ursula’s apartment, Phoebe is going to confront her twin about her new porn career.]
rows.Content: Ursula: Who is it?ScenesPhoebe: It’s Phoebe! Phoebe!Scenes(Ursula opens the door and is all dressed up with big hair and lingerie.)ScenesUrsula: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (seeing her dress) Oh God. So-so you’re making porn movies.ScenesUrsula: No I’m not.Scenes(Someone calls out from her apartment.)ScenesMan’s Voice: We’re still rolling!ScenesPhoebe: You’re making one right now!ScenesAnother Man’s Voice: Let’s go Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: And-and you’re using my name!ScenesUrsula: Yeah, can I help you with something?ScenesSame Man’s Voice: Phoebe, come on!ScenesPhoebe: Look, I’m talking right now! You’re—you mean her.ScenesUrsula: Y’know, twin stuff is always a real big seller.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesUrsula: Yeah, I can talk them into giving you like, 30 dollars.ScenesPhoebe: No!! No way! No! And stop using my name! And shame on you! (Yells into the apartment) And shame on all of you! You’re disgusting! Especially you (points to someone) with that! (Storms away.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is setting up for the slide show.]
rows.Content: Ross: Slides are almost ready.ScenesJill: Yeah. Ooh, I know what this is missing! Alcohol!ScenesRoss: Uh okay, well there’s-there’s wine in the kitchen.ScenesJill: Oh great! (Goes to get it as the phone rings.)ScenesRoss: (answering it) Hello?ScenesRachel: (on phone) What is my sister doing there?! And why are the drapes shut?!ScenesRoss: O-okay, Rach calm-calm down, okay? She-she’s really upset we’re just talking.ScenesRachel: Ross! I think she is trying to make something happen with you to get back at me!ScenesRoss: So that’s the only reason she could be here huh? It couldn’t have anything to do with the fact that-that maybe I’m a good listener and I uh I put on a great slide show!ScenesRachel: Ross, I am telling you that she is using you to get back at me!ScenesRoss: Y’know what? I think I can take care of myself, I’ll talk to you later. Good-bye. (Hangs up the phone and turns to find Jill sitting really close to him.) Whoa! Uh, that was your sister actually. She-she thinks that you’re just using me.ScenesJill: So? (Kisses him passionately.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is reading a paper as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: So, I just came from the company Ursula works for.ScenesJoey: Oh no, not you too!ScenesPhoebe: No! No! I just went to pick up Phoebe Buffay’s checks; there were a lot of them.ScenesJoey: Nice!ScenesPhoebe: Um-mmm, and I won’t have to go there anymore because I gave them my correct address.ScenesJoey: That’s great, but isn’t it gonna bother that people still think you’re a porn star?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! No! I know how to handle it.ScenesJoey: You do?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. (She notices some guy putting a coat on his girlfriend is trying to remember where he’s seen her before.) (To him) You’re trying to figure out where you know me from? All right, I’ll give you a hint. From porn! Okay? (He tries to rush his girlfriend out.) Yeah your pervert boyfriend watched me in a porno movie! (To Joey) See?ScenesJoey: Yeah.
