rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, time lapse, Ross is entering. Chandler and Monica are at the kitchen table. Rachel is on the couch reading.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) You uh, you may have been right about Jill.ScenesRachel: Oh! I knew it! What happened?ScenesRoss: Umm, she kissed me.ScenesRachel: What?! You kissed!ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Maybe we should give them some privacy.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Shhhh!!!ScenesRoss: Look, I uh, I tried not to kiss her, okay?ScenesRachel: Well, it doesn’t sound like it! I mean, it’s pretty easy not to kiss someone, you just don’t kiss them! See look at us, right now, not kissing!ScenesRoss: Let me finish, okay? She started kissing me and-and I didn’t stop it. I guess I-I just wasn’t thinking…ScenesRachel: Yeah that’s right you weren’t thinking! Y’know what? Let me give you something to think about! (She pulls up her sleeves and steps towards him.)ScenesRoss: Oh wait—hold it! But then I started thinking and I stopped the kissing.ScenesRachel: Oh, well thank you for taking your tongue out of my sister’s mouth long enough to tell me that.ScenesRoss: Look I-I realize if anything were to happen with me and Jill then nothing could ever happen with us!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: No, I mean, look I don’t know if anything is going to happen with us, again. Ever. But I don’t want to know that it-it never could. So I stopped it and she got mad and broke my projector.ScenesRachel: Wow. I, I don’t even know what to say. Thank you. (Gently kicks him.)ScenesRoss: You’re welcome. (Gently kicks her back.)Scenes(Chandler starts crying.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Are-are you crying?ScenesChandler: (crying hysterically) I just don’t see why those two can’t work things out!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Jill enters.]
rows.Content: Jill: All right, I’m leaving! Because I’m not going to spend one more day with someone whose out to sabotage my every move. That’s you Rachel!ScenesRachel: Yeah, I got that.ScenesJill: (To Ross) And you! I throw myself at you and you say no, how gay are you?ScenesRoss: You take care Jill.ScenesJill: (happily) Okay, see ya! (Exits.)ScenesRachel: Bye-bye-e!ScenesMonica: Bye.ScenesChandler: (starts crying) I-I can’t believe Jill’s gone. (They all look at him.) I can’t help it, I opened a gate.ScenesEndScenesThe One That Could Have BeenScenesPart I Written by: Greg Malins & Adam ChaseScenesPart II Written by: David Crane & Marta KauffmanScenesParts I & II Transcribed by: Eric AasenScenes{Transcriber’s Note: This is an hour-long special episode. Which means that the first part of this episode is episode 615. The second part of this episode is episode 616. Since episodes 615 and 616 are combined into one file, that’s why there is no episode 616 in the season 6 table of contents and the numbers jump from episode 615 to 617.}

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone is there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey, you guys! Guess what? Barry and Mindy are getting a divorce!ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: Wow!ScenesJoey: (To Ross) What is the matter with you?!ScenesPhoebe: No! Barry and Mindy.ScenesJoey: Oh sorry, I hear divorce I immediately go to Ross. (To Rachel) Who-who’s Barry and Mindy?ScenesRachel: Barry was the guy that I was almost married and Mindy was my best friend.ScenesJoey: Ohh-oh, wasn’t he cheating on you with her?ScenesRachel: Yeah, but that just means that he was falling asleep on top of her instead of me.ScenesMonica: Why did they get divorced?ScenesRachel: Well, apparently she caught him cheating on her with someone else. Isn’t that sad? (Giggles.) God, could you imagine if I actually married him?! I mean how different would my life be?ScenesRoss: I know what you mean, I’ve always wondered how different my life would be if-if I’d never gotten divorced.ScenesPhoebe: Which time?ScenesRoss: The first time! No seriously, imagine if Carol hadn’t realized she was a lesbian.ScenesJoey: (starts to imagine it) I can’t. I keep seeing it the good way.ScenesRoss: I’d bet I’d still be doing my kara-tay. (That’s karate, he’s just saying it that way.) Towards the end of our marriage I was doing a lot of kara-tay as a way of releasing the tension from y’know, not doing anything else physical.ScenesChandler: Maybe the problem was you were pronouncing it kara-tay.ScenesMonica: And what if I was still fat? (To Chandler) Well, you wouldn’t be dating me, that’s for sure.ScenesChandler: Sure I would!ScenesAll: (simultaneously) Oh yeah! Come on! Yeah right!ScenesChandler: What, you guys really think that I’m that shallow?ScenesRoss: No, I just think Monica was that fat.ScenesJoey: Hey, imagine if I never got fired off Days Of Our Lives! (Closes his eyes to do so.) Oh-hey, there’s Carol again!ScenesChandler: What if I had had the guts to quit my job? I’d probably be writing for the New Yorker, getting paid to be funny. But my job’s fun too! I mean tomorrow, I-I don’t have to wear a tie.ScenesPhoebe: What if I had taken that job at Merrill Lynch?ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Merrill Lynch?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I had a massage client who worked there and-and he said I had a knack for stocks.ScenesRachel: Well why didn’t you take the job?ScenesPhoebe: Because at that time you see, I thought everything that rhymed was true. So I thought y’know that if I’d work with stocks, I’d have to live in a box, and only eat lox, and have a pet fox.ScenesRoss: Hey, do you guys think that if all those things happened, we’d still hang out?ScenesOpening CreditsScenes{Transcriber’s note: This is where the opening credits are, but they’re not the usual opening credits. Oh no! These credits are based on the world that would have been created had all of the above actually happened. It starts out with all of them at the fountain sitting on the couch as Fat Monica runs up and sits on the arm of the couch, tilting the whole thing towards her. It then goes on to show Rachel’s still a shop-aholic and with Barry. Fat Monica is sweating while cooking and dancing while eating a donut. Phoebe as the Wall Street shark smoking while on two cell phones. Then they’re dancing in the fountain. Joey entering as Dr. Drake Remoray and meeting a groupie. Chandler trying to write as a bird does its business on his shoulder and falling asleep while typing. Ross doing some kara-tay and trying to get Carol into bed. And finally, some more dancing in the fountain, them all flexing, and the turning out the lamp and shutting off all the lights bit from the first season. Just remember one thing, this is an alternate universe. Everything from every other episode doesn’t apply, for instance, Ross and Rachel have no history. And in fact have not seen each other in years in this world.}

rows.Scenes: A newsstand, Ross is buying a magazine and gets in line behind a woman.]
rows.Content: Ross: (recognizing her) Oh my God! Rachel Green?ScenesRachel: (gasps) Rob Tillman!ScenesRoss: No-no. It’s-it’s me, Ross!ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry. Ross Tillman.ScenesRoss: No, no-no, Ross Geller.ScenesRachel: Ohh, of course Monica’s brother!ScenesRoss: Yeah. Right.ScenesRachel: Wow! How are you?!ScenesRoss: Good-good, I’m-I’m married. (Shows her his ring.)ScenesRachel: Ohh! Me too!ScenesRoss: Is-isn’t it the best?ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s the best! (They both exhale contemplating the joys of marriage.) So, umm how’s Monica?ScenesRoss: Oh really, really great! Yeah! A-actually she’s right down the street, umm, do-do you know what? You should stop bye and say hi.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I would love too.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Oh-oh, she’d be so excited!ScenesRachel: Ohh! Okay!ScenesRoss: Come on! (They start to leave.)ScenesRachel: Oh wait, don’t you have to pay for your, (looks at his magazine) Busty Ladies?ScenesRoss: No, it’s okay. Some-some kid asked me to pick it up for him, but I don’t…ScenesRachel: (laughs) Oh yeah? Okay.ScenesRoss: (putting the magazine back and holding the money for it) Okay.ScenesRachel: But! Don’t you have to give him his money back?ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. (Steps to a random kid nearby and hands him his money.) Hey, here you go buddy. Sorry, no porn for you. (To Rachel) Okay, let’s go see Monica!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Fat Monica, and her boyfriend are sitting on the couch. Monica’s boyfriend is getting up to get something. For future reference, for the rest of this episode Monica’s fat, I won’t be calling her Fat Monica throughout.]
rows.Content: Joey: So Monica, still going out with Dr. Boring huh?ScenesMonica: He’s not boring! He’s just-he’s just low key.ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: (returning) Here we go, one Hazelnut Latte. (Hands it to Monica and sits down.)ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: Yeah. Y’know, the hazelnut actually not a nut, it’s a seed.ScenesJoey: (not impressed) Wow!!ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: Can anyone else name a well known seed that’s been masquerading as a nut?ScenesJoey: Oh dear God, let me think. (Starts to sarcastically think about it.)ScenesChandler: (entering, depressed) Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesMonica: Oh no! What’s the matter?ScenesChandler: Oh I just got another rejection letter. They said my writing was funny, just not "Archie Comic funny.ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: Y’know what honey? I got to get back to the hospital.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: (kisses her) Okay.ScenesMonica: Bye.ScenesMonica's Boyfriend: Bye-bye. (Gets up to leave.) Oh uh, by the way, the answer is, the Brazil nut. (Exits.)ScenesChandler: Was his question what’s more boring than him?ScenesJoey: Hey man, look sorry about that Archie thing. Do uh, do you need me to give you some money?ScenesChandler: Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.ScenesJoey: Really?ScenesChandler: Ehh.ScenesMonica: Maybe Joey doesn’t have to give you the money, TV stars have assistants right?ScenesJoey: That’s an idea! (To Chandler) Hey, if I hired an assistant, would-would you take money from her?ScenesMonica: No Joey! Chandler could be your assistant! See, he could answer all of your fan mail and stuff!ScenesJoey: That’s great! That would be great! Let’s do that!ScenesChandler: I could use the money; it could give me time to write.ScenesJoey: Oh right great! Welcome aboard!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesJoey: All right! Now hey, I need to use the bathroom. Since I don’t need any assistance in there, take a break!ScenesChandler: All right!Scenes(As Joey goes to the bathroom, Corporate Phoebe enters. She’s wearing a business suit and carrying a briefcase.)ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey Phoebe! Guess what?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesMonica: Joey just hired Chandler to be his assistant!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh that’s so sweet! (Her cell phone rings.) Oh! Hang on! (Quickly grabs a cigarette and starts to light it as her phone rings.) Hang onnnnnn!!! (Gets the cigarette lighted and answers the phone.) (On phone.) Go!! No! No-no! I said sell when it hits 50! 5-0, it’s a number! It comes after 4-9!! No, it’s okay. It’s okay, you’re allowed one mistake. Just kidding, you are of course fired.Scenes(She hangs up as Ross and Rachel enter.)ScenesRoss: Hey Mon!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Mon, look who I ran into! (Gestures towards Rachel.)ScenesMonica: (gets up and gasps) Oh my God! Rachel!! (Rachel is stunned to see that her long lost friend is still fat.) (Monica goes over and gives Rachel a big bear hug, which is quite easy for her.) You look terrific!ScenesRachel: Ohh, so do you! Did you lose weight? (She’s not quite sure of that one.)ScenesMonica: You are so sweet to notice! Yes, I lost three and a half pounds!ScenesRoss: And, and uh, you-you remember my friend Chandler. (Points to him.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah.ScenesRoss: And that’s Phoebe over there! (Points to her.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, sit down! Sit down! How long as it been since we’ve seen each other?ScenesRoss: (answering it) 1987, the day after Christmas, at Sean McMahon’s party. I played you one of my songs, y’know Interplanetary Courtship Ritual.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah. Right. So now, are—do you, do you still do music?ScenesRoss: Sometimes, you should come over (Joey returns from the bathroom) sometime! I’ll play you one of my other…ScenesRachel: (interrupting him and seeing Joey) Oh my God! Joey Tribbiani from Days of Our Lives, just walked in here!ScenesMonica: Rach, he’s a friend of ours.ScenesRachel: (stunned) You are friends with Dr. Drake Remoray?ScenesChandler: Well it’s kinda hard to be friends with Drake because of his busy schedule and the fact that he’s not real.ScenesRoss: (To Rachel) Hey-hey, or I could bring my keyboard over here sometime!ScenesRachel: He’s coming over! He’s coming over!ScenesMonica: (getting up) Joey!ScenesJoey: (holding a plate of what looks like Rice Crispies Treats) I know, here-here!! (Hands her the plate.)ScenesMonica: Ohhh! (Takes the plate.) No! This is my friend Rachel, we went to High School together.ScenesRachel: (giggles and can’t look at him) Hi!ScenesJoey: (shaking Rachel’s hand) Hi!ScenesRachel: (still not quite able to look at him) Hi! I love you on that show! I watch you everyday! I mean, when you took out your own kidney to save your ex-wife even though she tired to kill you…ScenesJoey: Well, it’s always nice to meet the fans.ScenesRachel: Ah!ScenesJoey: (turning and whispering to Monica) She’s not crazy is she?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) So uh, how you doin’?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe are there. Phoebe’s cell phone rings and she goes through her little routine of lighting a cigarette before answering the phone.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hang on! Hang on! Hang on! (Answering the phone.) Go!! Who’s this? (Listens) Oh okay, you’re gonna like working for me. What’s your name? (Listens) What kind of name is Brendy? I… Whatever… Stop talking! All right, from now on your name is Joan. You can pick your own last name.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey there you are!ScenesChandler: Uh-oh, it’s my boss!ScenesJoey: All right, here’s a list of things for you to do today. Man, this going to be so great! Thank you so much! All right, I got to go to work I’m delivering twins today, but only one of them is mine! (Exits.)ScenesChandler: (reading the list) Drop off my dry cleaning. Pick up my vitamins. Teach me how to spell vitamins. Wear in my new jeans.ScenesMonica: (laughs) You realize what you are don’t you?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: You’re his bitch.ScenesPhoebe: (yelling from Monica’s room) No-no!! No!!ScenesMonica: (panicked) Oh wait! You didn’t just sit on my Kit-Kats did you?!!ScenesPhoebe: No! There-there was a little, a little diff in the market and I lost 13 million dollars.ScenesChandler: But the Kit-Kats are all right?!ScenesPhoebe: What am I gonna do?! What am I gonna do?! I can’t call my office they’ll kill me! I can’t call my clients they’ll kill themselves! Great, now my chest hearts.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: (louder) My chest hurts! Oh, and now I-I can’t breathe.ScenesChandler: Phoebe, are you having a heart attack?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, if I were, would-would I have shooting pains up and down my left arm?ScenesMonica: Yes!!ScenesPhoebe: Then yes that is what I’m having. (Takes another puff of the cigarette.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: A hospital, Phoebe is recovering from her heart attack as Ross, Monica, and Chandler are there to comfort and support her.]
rows.Content: Ross: Come on Pheebs, it’s not that bad! Y’know most people would be excited if they didn’t have to work for a couple of weeks.ScenesPhoebe: Most people don’t like their jobs, I love my job! I have not been working for three hours and I’m already going crazy. I miss Joan.ScenesMonica: Honey, having a heart attack is nature’s way of telling you to slow it down.ScenesChandler: I always thought having a heart attack was nature’s way of telling you to die! (Phoebe glares at him.) But you’re not gonna die. I mean, you are going to die, but you’re not gonna die today. I wish I was dead.ScenesMonica: Let’s take a walk. (They start to leave.) Y’know maybe you should consider writing for Talking Out of Your Ass magazine! (They exit.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Ross) So what’s going on with you?ScenesRoss: Well umm, I’ve been doing a lot more of my kara-tay.ScenesPhoebe: Still going through that dry spell with Carol?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: How long has it been since you had sex?ScenesRoss: Well, last weekend…ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s not so bad.ScenesRoss: …will be two months…ScenesPhoebe: That is.ScenesRoss: …since I stopped trying.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe you need to spice things up a little.ScenesRoss: What-what do you mean?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. You could tie her up, she could tie you up; you could eat stuff off each other…ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, dirty talk, m�nage � trois, toys…ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesPhoebe: Roll playing… You could be the warden; she could be the prisoner. You could be the pirate; she could be the wench!ScenesRoss: Okay, I think I got it.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Or too, you could be two stockbrokers and you’re-you’re-you’re rolling around naked on the trading floor and everybody’s watching! (Ross looks at her.) It never happened.

rows.Scenes: A hospital hallway, Chandler is sitting on a gurney with his hands spread out behind his back. Then Monica comes and plops down on the gurney and one of his hands. Chandler immediately recoils in extreme pain.]
rows.Content: Monica: Sorry. So how’s it going with Joey?ScenesChandler: Oh just great. He beeps me now with codes. One is, "Bring me food." Two is, "I’m with a girl, bring us food." Three is, "I’m lost and I can’t find food.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! Is uh, is she gonna be all right?ScenesMonica: Yeah! She’s right in there! (Points to Phoebe’s room.)ScenesJoey: Oh great. (Starts to go in.) (To Chandler) Hey! Go take off those pants, they look ready!

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, Joey is showing Rachel around the set.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, and over there is Brady’s Pub where I like to unwind after a long day of surgeoning.ScenesRachel: Wow! This is so amazing! What else? What else?ScenesJoey: Well, that is a large piece of television equipment. (Points at a large piece of television equipment as an old man walks by.) And uh that is an old man! Hey old man!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesJoey: All righty, what do you say we head back to my place?ScenesRachel: (laughs) Wow! Umm, y’know, I-I would really love to, but I-I shouldn’t.ScenesJoey: Why? (In Drake’s voice.) Why can’t the world stop turning, just for a moment? Just for us?ScenesRachel: (awestruck, then not) Isn’t that a line from the show?!ScenesJoey: Uh, yeah but uh, (In Drake’s voice) I may have said those things before but, I never truly meant them. Until now.ScenesRachel: That’s a line from the show too!ScenesJoey: Okay, you watch too much TV.ScenesChandler: (approaching) Here you go Joe, here’s the freshly squeezed orange juice you asked for. (Hands it to him.)ScenesJoey: Thanks! (Looks at it.) Yeah, there’s pulp in that. (Hands it back.)ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesJoey: I thought we talked about this. I don’t like pulp. No pulp. Pulp isn’t juice. All juice, okay?ScenesChandler: I’m sorry, I guess I just like the pulp.ScenesJoey: Oh my God, I’m sorry, I’m being so rude. (Turns to Rachel.) Rachel, would like a soda or something? Because Chandler would run right out and get it.ScenesRachel: Yeah sure, iced tea would be great.ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Iced tea.ScenesChandler: Okay, anything for you sir?ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Did I not just tell him?ScenesRachel: (mouthing it to him) Yes, you did.ScenesJoey: (To Chandler) Okay look, Chandler, if this (Motions back and forth indicating the arrangement.) you have got to listen! (Tugs on his ear.) (Chandler glares at him.) You’re gonna throw that juice at me, aren’t ya?ScenesChandler: It’s not all juice! (Rachel quickly gets out of the way.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Carol's, Ross is trying to talk to Carol about what Phoebe told him.]
rows.Content: Ross: So honey, this morning was fun, huh? Me hopping in on you in the shower there.ScenesCarol: Yeah! And maybe someday we could get a place with two bathrooms.ScenesRoss: Look Carol umm, I was, I was thinking maybe uh, maybe we can spice things up a little.ScenesCarol: What do you mean?ScenesRoss: Carol our sex life is—it’s just not working…ScenesBen: (entering) Dad!! (Runs and hugs him.)ScenesRoss: Hey there little fella! Hey, uh-hey, why don’t we get some shoes on ya, huh? Hey, why don’t you show dad how you can put your shoes on, in your room! Yay!!ScenesBen: Yay! (Runs off.)ScenesRoss: Yay! (To Carol) Seriously, our sex life… I was thinking, maybe I don’t know, we could try some-some new things. Y’know? For fun?ScenesCarol: Like what?ScenesRoss: Well I don’t know umm, (Pause) what if we were too tie each other up? (Carol’s shocked and obviously doesn’t like that idea.) Umm, some people eat stuff off one another. (Carol doesn’t like that idea either.) Nah! Umm, y’know we-we could try dirty talk? (Carol still says no.) Umm, we could, we could have a threesome.ScenesCarol: (quickly) I love that idea!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Monica is eating breakfast as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Who sold a story to Archie Comics?!ScenesMonica: Oh my God! That’s great! Oh wow! (Hugs him.) You’re a published writer! I wish I had a present for you!ScenesChandler: Aww.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute! (Quickly checks her pockets and pulls out…) My last Kit-Kat bar!Scenes(Chandler tries to take it, but Monica won’t let go. He tugs harder, and she still doesn’t budge.)ScenesChandler: You wanna share it?ScenesMonica: Okay!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! Hey Chandler look, I know you’re mad, but I just want to say I’m sorry. I-I was a total jerk. Completely o-over the line. Uh, I just I hate pulp! Y’know? I mean, y’know how Monica feels about low fat mayonnaise?ScenesMonica: It’s not mayonnaise!!ScenesJoey: Yeah, o-o-o-o-okay anyway, I just wanted to say I’m sorry. Here. (Hands him a cup.)ScenesChandler: What’s this?ScenesJoey: Fresh squeezed orange juice, with pulp! Just the way you like it.ScenesChandler: Aww, thanks man. (They hug.)ScenesMonica: Hey Joey, Chandler sold a story to Archie Comics!ScenesJoey: Oh my God! That’s great! Congratulations! What’s the story?!ScenesChandler: Oh you wouldn’t uh, care. It’s just a stupid comic book story.ScenesJoey: Are you kidding me?! I love Archie! And the whole gang!ScenesChandler: Well uh, Archie needs money to fix his jalopy (Joey laughs), uh but he doesn’t want Reggie to just give him the money. So Reggie hires him as his assist—as his butler. And then makes him do all these crazy things like bring him milkshakes that can’t have lumps in them.ScenesJoey: Wait a minute. That sounds a little familiar! Did they already do that one? ‘Cause I think I read it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh Mon, listen I have to ask! Okay, Joey Tribbiani invited me back to his apartment, now does he do this with a lot of girls?ScenesMonica: Yeah, a lot. A lot, a lot!ScenesRachel: Ohh! And I’m one of them!! Wow! Oh, I just cannot believe this! I mean, Joey Tribbiani!ScenesMonica: Well, y’know it’s none of my business, but aren’t you married?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Oh I just wish we could not be married for a little bit! Y’know I just wish we could be like on a break!ScenesMonica: Well, you’re not.ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s so easy for you I mean, you’re not married, you get to have sex with who ever you want!ScenesMonica: Yeah I can! (Laughs) And don’t think I don’t, because I do! I mean all the time, you betcha! (Laughs.)ScenesRachel: Monica. You’ve, you’ve done it right?ScenesMonica: (giggles) Of course I have! What do you think, I’m some 30 year old virgin?ScenesRachel: Oh my God! You’re a 30 year old virgin!ScenesMonica: Say it louder, I don’t think the guy all the way in the back heard you!ScenesGuy All the Way in the Back: Yeah, I heard it.ScenesMonica: It’s not like, I haven’t any opportunities. I mean, y’know, I’m just waiting for the perfect guy. I’m seeing this guy Roger, all right? He’s not perfect, but umm, I think maybe I should just get it over with. Y’know, give him my flower.ScenesRachel: Oh my God!! Do it!! Honey, you’ve waited long enough!!ScenesMonica: Y’know what? You are right?!ScenesRachel: Yes!! I mean sex does not have to be a big deal! There shouldn’t be all this rules and restrictions! Y’know, people should be able to sleep with who ever they want, whenever…ScenesMonica: Rachel! I’m never gonna think it’s okay for you to cheat on your husband!ScenesRachel: Oh what do you know? Virgin!

rows.Scenes: The hospital, Ross and Monica are in Phoebe’s room. Phoebe is in the bathroom and Monica notices smoke coming out from underneath the door.]
rows.Content: Monica: Phoebe, why is smoke coming out of the bathroom?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, the doctor said that could be one of the side effects.ScenesMonica: Phoebe! Put that cigarette out!ScenesPhoebe: No! It’s not a cigarette! The smoke is coming out of me!ScenesMonica: Put it out!!ScenesPhoebe: Okay! Okay! (Puts it out and comes out of the bathroom.) I’m so glad you’re here.ScenesRoss: Come on. (Helps her into bed as her phone rings.) I got it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, give it to me.ScenesRoss: I got it!ScenesPhoebe: Give it!Scenes(He does a kara-tay move to silence her, then answers the phone.)ScenesRoss: (on the phone) Hello? (Listens.) No she can’t come to the phone right now. (Listens.) Oh, right no problem. Okay, bye-bye. (Hangs up.)ScenesPhoebe: Was it my work? Were they mad? Was it Jack? Did he yell?!ScenesRoss: J-j-just relax, nobody yelled. Jack just was calling to make sure that you were getting better.ScenesPhoebe: Thank God.ScenesRoss: (To Monica) Yeah, she’s fired.

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Barry’s bedroom, Rachel is watching Days of Our Lives. Of course it’s a Dr. Drake Remoray scene. It’s set in a hospital room, and Dr. Wesley and a nurse are talking about a female patient with a bandage around her head.]
rows.Content: Nurse: You’ve done all you can Dr. Wesley. You have got to let her go.ScenesDr. Wesley: Good-bye and God speed, Hope Brady.Scenes(He goes to turn off a machine. Suddenly, Dr. Drake Remoray appears at the door with two cops!)ScenesDr. Drake Remoray: Not so fast Wesley! (Rachel does a silent clap.)ScenesDr. Wesley: (with evil dripping off his tongue) Remoray!ScenesDr. Drake Remoray: That’s right Wesley! I just stopped by to say that, you’re not a real doctor! And that woman’s brain, is fine!ScenesRachel: (very relived) Oh! Thank God!Scenes[Cut back to the TV, the cops are leading Dr. Wesley out, and as they pass Remoray and Wesley exchange evil glances.]ScenesDr. Drake Remoray: Hope! Hope!ScenesHope: (sleepily) Drake!ScenesDr. Drake Remoray: You’re not dying Hope, you’re gonna live a long, healthy life. With me.ScenesHope: Oh Drake.Scenes[Drake and Hope kiss.]ScenesRachel: Okay! (She picks up the phone, Joey’s phone number, and starts to dial.) Here we go! Okay! (On phone.) Hi, Joey! It’s Rachel! Umm, I am free tomorrow night. Yeah, sure, sure I can bring some sandwiches.ScenesCommercial BreakScenes{Transcriber’s Note: This is where Part II begins, which means this is now episode 616.}

rows.Scenes: Ross and Carol's, Carol is working on something at the table and Ross is reading a newspaper on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: So honey this uh, this threesome thing umm, I mean how-how are you gonna start to find…ScenesCarol: Ooh, actually I’ve been making a list of all the women I know who might be into doing this!ScenesRoss: Oh. (He takes the notepad she was using and looks at it.) Wow! (Flips to another page.) Huh. (Flips another page.) Boy! (Flips another page.) Well, someone’s been doing their homework. (Flips two more pages.)ScenesCarol: Yeah. Ooh, and I know Gail Rosten is in there twice, but she is so…ScenesRoss: Oh, I know. (Laughs) Y’know, just-just talking about it is getting me kinda…ScenesCarol: Oh, me too.ScenesRoss: Yeah? Well, I-I think Ben’s asleep.ScenesCarol: Oh umm, y’know I think it would be better if we just save it.ScenesRoss: Yeah. Right. Save it. I can do that. (Gets up and does a little kara-tay.)

rows.Scenes: The hospital, Chandler and Monica are there with Phoebe as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey, how’s it going?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I’ve got to get out of this bed, I’m going crazy here. Crazy!ScenesMonica: (handing her a cup) Here you go sweetie.ScenesPhoebe: What the hell is this, herbal tea? I hate herbal tea!ScenesMonica: But, I put some honey in it.Scenes(Phoebe mocks what Monica just said. Ross pulls Chandler aside.)ScenesRoss: She doesn’t know she was fired yet, does she?ScenesChandler: No, the doctors say it may kill her.ScenesPhoebe: What are you two girls whispering about over there?!ScenesChandler: (To Ross) But I think we should tell her.ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, maybe this whole heart attack thing is a sign, that-that you should start think about getting a different job.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, what is this? A stupid contest? Because we got a winner here! (Points at Ross.)ScenesChandler: Listen Phoebe, he’s right. People are not supposed to have heart attacks at 31.ScenesPhoebe: I know! But if I didn’t work there, what else would I do?ScenesMonica: Well, you used to like playing the guitar.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah that was lucrative! Smart like your brother!ScenesChandler: Uh, what about y’know the massage thing? That never gave you a heart attack.ScenesPhoebe: Hmm, pulling in a salary in the high six figures or rubbing gross naked people for chump change—ooh, what do I do?! What will I do?!

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, (The one he had when he was Dr. Drake Remoray, because he still is.) Rachel is there and admiring the big ceramic fake dog.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh, I mean it’s just so realistic!ScenesJoey: I know. (Joey is sitting in this tall chair that is made up of balls on polls. You’ll have to see it to know what I mean.) Yeah, his name is Pat.ScenesRachel: Pat the dog. Oh! Oh! I get it!! (Laughs and finishes her drink.)ScenesJoey: (climbing down from his chair) Do you uh, do you—ready for a refill?ScenesRachel: Oh, I probably shouldn’t—so I will! (Joey starts making her refill and Rachel notices that rain thing Joey has.) Oh! Wow! It’s like it’s raining!ScenesJoey: Pretty cool, huh? But if you’re thinking you can put a fish in there and it wouldn’t get sucked up into the mechanism, well you’d be wrong.ScenesRachel: Umm, can I use your bathroom?ScenesJoey: It’s uh, right through there. (Points.)ScenesRachel: Okay. (Starts to go.) God y’know, if someone told me a week ago that I would be peeing in Joey Tribbiani’s apartment…ScenesJoey: Yeah, life’s pretty great isn’t it?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it sure is!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Monica is pouring wine for her boyfriend, Dr. Roger.]
rows.Content: Monica: I hope you’re hungry, we’re starting with oysters. And y’know what they say about oysters, don’t you?ScenesDr. Roger: They have parasites?ScenesMonica: No! Umm well, some people say that Oysters are an aphrodisiac.ScenesDr. Roger: What people?ScenesMonica: People! People say it! Come here! (She grabs him and kisses him.)ScenesDr. Roger: So oysters, huh?ScenesMonica: And then we’re gonna have a little Middle Eastern cous-cous. Something we can eat, with our hands.ScenesDr. Roger: Y’know, it’s funny, but when we were studying communicable diseases…ScenesMonica: No-no-no, no! It’s sensual!ScenesDr. Roger: Ohh! Didn’t know! Okay!ScenesMonica: Okay! (They kiss again and his beeper goes off.) Ohhh no!ScenesDr. Roger: I’m sorry sweetie, it’s the hospital. The food looks great, maybe save me some?ScenesMonica: I can’t promise anything. (She starts to dig in.)

rows.Scenes: Ross and Carol's, Ross and Carol are waiting anxiously for their new partner to arrive.]
rows.Content: Ross: We’re really gonna do this, huh?ScenesCarol: Looks like it.ScenesRoss: Y’know, if, if this is too weird for you, we can still back out at… (A knock on the door interrupts him.)ScenesCarol: (jumping up to get it) I got it!ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesCarol: (opening the door) Susan! Hi! (Who’d you think it was gonna be?)ScenesSusan: Hey! (They hug.)ScenesCarol: Thank you so much for coming.ScenesSusan: Oh, I wouldn’t miss it for the world.Scenes(They start moving towards the bedroom, never taking their eyes off each other. They move past Ross and stop.)ScenesRoss: I’m-I’m Ross by the way.ScenesSusan: (not taking her eyes off Carol) Hello Ross. (Takes off her coat and hands it to him.) I love what you’ve done with this space.ScenesCarol: Thank you so much.Scenes(They disappear into the bedroom leaving Ross standing in the living room holding Susan’s coat.)ScenesRoss: How hot is this?!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Chandler and Monica are eating Monica’s dinner.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I’m sorry you’re here with me instead of Roger.ScenesMonica: Yeah, me too.ScenesChandler: Well, I could make it seem like he’s here. (Imitates him.) "Here’s some little known facts about cous-cous. They didn’t add the second cous until 1979." (Mumbles something further.)ScenesMonica: Stop it!! That’s not funny!!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: I’m sorry, okay? It just—tonight was supposed to be y’know, it was supposed to be a big deal.ScenesChandler: What was tonight?ScenesMonica: You don’t want to know what tonight was.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Pause.) What was tonight?ScenesMonica: Well, tonight was—was going to be my first time.ScenesChandler: With Roger? (Monica shyly looks away.) Not just with Roger?! (Monica shrugs.) Oh my God!ScenesMonica: All right relax Mr. I’ve Had Sex Four Times!ScenesChandler: Four different women! I’ve had sex way more times!ScenesMonica: How many?ScenesChandler: Nine.ScenesMonica: I was just waiting for the perfect guy.ScenesChandler: Well good, good for you. You really think that Roger is the perfect guy?ScenesMonica: No. He’s not a horrible guy.ScenesChandler: Hey that’s what I tell girls about me.ScenesMonica: Chandler, I’m gonna die a virgin!ScenesChandler: No you are not! You are sweet and wonderful and this is gonna happen for you.ScenesMonica: Oh really? When? Do you wanna do it with me?ScenesChandler: Okay. (They both realize what he just said.)ScenesMonica: I was kidding.ScenesChandler: So was I.

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Rachel is now three sheets to the wind and Joey is watching her.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Joey, you’re such an amazing actor! (He smiles.) How do you know where Dr. Drake Remoray leaves off and Joey Tribbiani begins?ScenesJoey: Well, with Dr. Drake they always tell me what to say. And with Joey, I pretty much have to make it up on my own.ScenesRachel: Wow! Tell me something Joey—(She falls off the couch)—Whoa! I just fell right off the couch there.ScenesJoey: Yeah you did.ScenesRachel: Okay. (She climbs back onto the couch.)ScenesJoey: Here you go. Let me ask you a question.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoey: When was the last time someone told you just how beautiful you are?ScenesRachel: Wow! I can’t, I can’t feel my hands.ScenesJoey: Come, come here.Scenes(He takes her hands in his and kisses each one, then kisses her on the lips. When the break the kiss, Rachel starts to get nauseous and throw up. Joey backs away in horror.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, continued from earlier. Monica and Chandler are still discussing the previous question.]
rows.Content: Chandler: We can’t do this.ScenesMonica: No! (They both laugh.) Oyster?ScenesChandler: Yeah! (Takes it.) If-if-if we did do this there would be a lot of pressure on me, y’know? Because you’ve been waiting a very long time and I wouldn’t want to disappoint you.ScenesMonica: Yeah but see I have nothing to compare it too. So even if you’re horrible, how would I know?ScenesChandler: I do like that.ScenesMonica: It’s harder for me! I have those four other women to compete with!ScenesChandler: Well, if it helps there were only three. So it would just be for tonight, right?ScenesMonica: Absolutely! It would just be one friend (Points at Chandler) helping out another friend. (Points at herself.)ScenesChandler: Stop it! We’re doing this! Let’s do it!ScenesMonica: Noo!! Okay!!ScenesChandler: Okay! (They both get up.)ScenesMonica: Umm, do you have any uhh, moves?ScenesChandler: I have some moves.ScenesMonica: I have no moves. (He moves in to kiss her and she laughs and backs away.) Okay, whatcha doin’ there?! (Giggles.) Oh y’know what? I’m sorry, this is just too weird.ScenesChandler: Yeah, let’s just forget it.ScenesMonica: What if I turn out the lights? (Runs to shut them off.)ScenesChandler: Okay!Scenes(She turns out the lights and in the darkened room Chandler starts to moan.)ScenesChandler: Oh yeah.ScenesMonica: Chandler?ScenesChandler: (sexily) Yeah?ScenesMonica: That’s the couch.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica’s bedroom, she has just lost her flower to Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: I know! I’ll tell you something, we are gonna do that again!ScenesChandler: Oh, okay! (He rolls over to do that again.)

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, the next morning, Rachel is passed out on the couch.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Morning!ScenesRachel: (wakes up suddenly and realizes where she is) Oh right.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRachel: (groans) Oh God. Oh I can’t believe Joey Tribbiani heard me throw up!ScenesJoey: Well he actually saw you a little bit too.ScenesRachel: Noo! Oh God we did—we didn’t, we didn’t uhh…ScenesJoey: No! No! No, not after seeing that.ScenesRachel: God I’m just a horrible person.ScenesJoey: Wh-why?ScenesRachel: Because I’m married. That’s right, I am a married woman! And I came to a TV star’s apartment to have an affair! Uck!ScenesJoey: That’s ridiculous! I’m not a "Star," just a regular famous actor.ScenesRachel: Yeah and I’m a horrible, horrible person.ScenesJoey: Rachel, would you stop saying that?! Hey-hey look, remember on the show when-when Caprice was dying and she gave me…ScenesRachel: The ring from the cave, yeah.ScenesJoey: Wow! Uh okay, well uh… (He gets up, opens a drawer, and pulls out the ring.)ScenesRachel: (seeing the ring and gasping) Oh my God, they let you keep that stuff?!ScenesJoey: Sure! As long as they don’t find out you can keep whatever you want! And I want you to have it.ScenesRachel: No! No-no-no…ScenesJoey: Yes! Yes!! And every time you look at it, I want you to remember that you are a good person. Okay, you’ve had the chance to cheat, and with me, but you didn’t. And that’s what this ring stands for.ScenesRachel: But I thought that ring stood for Caprice’s undying love for her brother.ScenesJoey: Look, do you want the ring or not?!ScenesRachel: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s hospital room, Joey and Ross enter as Phoebe comes out of the bathroom wearing her robe.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Look at you! You’re up!ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesPhoebe: I thought I’d try to take a walk. Would you pour me some water? I’ll be back soon.ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-whoa! You’re not gonna use the pay phone to call work, are ya?ScenesPhoebe: No. I’ve learned my lesson.Scenes(She goes out into the hall and when she’s there and the door is closed; she rips off her robe to reveal her work clothes.)ScenesPhoebe: Let’s go! Come on! Move it! (Grabs her coat.) Come on! (To an old man who’s holding her shoes and briefcase.) Shoes! Briefcase! (Takes them both.) Thanks Lou, good luck with the gall bladder. (She leaves.)Scenes[Cut back to her room, Joey and Ross are sitting there waiting for her.]ScenesRoss: Hey Joe did… Did you ever have a threesome?ScenesJoey: (not quite sure of how to answer that) Well uh, look Ross I uh, I think Carol’s great and I’m sure you’re a very attractive man, but I….ScenesRoss: No! The reason I’m asking is that… I sorta had one last night.ScenesJoey: You?ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Wow!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesJoey: All right! So, was it amazing?ScenesRoss: It was, it was okay.ScenesJoey: Just okay—Did you do it right?!ScenesRoss: Look, it’s just did, did you ever go to a party and think, "Would really anyone miss me if I weren’t here?ScenesJoey: Huh. But still Ross, you’re worst day with two women, pretty much better than any other day! Y’know what I mean?ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, absolutely!Scenes(They both laugh.)ScenesRoss: It’s just, my part seemed to be over pretty quickly and then, and then there was a lot of waiting around.ScenesJoey: But you got to be with both of them, right?ScenesRoss: Not-not really. Th-th-there was just Carol.ScenesJoey: Not the other one?ScenesRoss: No, she kept kicking me away!ScenesJoey: Yeah, you don’t want that.ScenesRoss: No!ScenesJoey: Well hey, at least you got to see a lot of stuff, right?ScenesRoss: Oh I a lot of stuff!ScenesJoey: You got a little bored?ScenesRoss: A little. Yeah. I made a snack.ScenesJoey: Yeah? What did ya have?ScenesRoss: Just a sandwich. Turkey, a little mustard…ScenesJoey: Sounds good.ScenesRoss: It really was!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Monica is making a sandwich as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Let me tell you about this chick I scored with last night! Oh no wait a minute that was you!ScenesMonica: Hey, check me out, I’m a slut!ScenesChandler: So you uh, want to do something tonight?ScenesMonica: Oh I can’t. Dr. Roger is coming over again.ScenesChandler: Oh. Oh right! Right! Because you’re still seeing him and uh, he’s a good guy. I mean, I remember a time when… (He fakes falling asleep.)ScenesMonica: Are you okay?ScenesChandler: Yeah! Totally! Totally, and you?ScenesMonica: Great! It’s so amazing! I mean, last time Dr. Roger came over, I was so nervous, but then after being with you I’m all like, "Can the doctor see me now?ScenesChandler: I bet he can.ScenesMonica: Y’know, I don’t have an appointment, but I sure could use a physical. (He laughs halfheartedly) Are you sure you’re okay?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! Yeah! Don’t worry about me, I’ll be fine! (Does a kara-tay move.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Barry’s bedroom, Rachel is returning from her disastrous attempt at an affair to find that Barry was much, much more successful with his.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh! My God! Barry!!ScenesBarry: You-you-you said you were gonna be away all weekend!ScenesRachel: Oh that’s right! I’m sorry! I-I am early! Finish! Please!!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s office, she is arriving without the knowledge that she’s been fired.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Surprise! Look who’s back!ScenesArthur: Hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesArthur: (To another coworker) Call security. (To Phoebe) Pheebs, didn’t you get fired?ScenesPhoebe: Uh, I don’t think so!ScenesJack: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: Jack!! Hey!ScenesJack: What are you doing here?ScenesPhoebe: All better! Back to work! Except this clown from research told me I was fired. He should do his research, huh?ScenesJack: Well, you were fired.ScenesPhoebe: Nu-uh!ScenesJack: I told that guy who answered your phone.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay I didn’t get that message. So this doesn’t count—Anyway, I’ll be in my office.ScenesJack: Uh, Phoebe you-you don’t have an office.ScenesPhoebe: That’s all right, I’ll work here. This is goo, next to this plant. (She picks a place in the lobby next to a plant.)ScenesJack: (approaches her) Phoebe, listen…ScenesPhoebe: You’re in my office! Look, I have made a lot of cash for this company! Okay? I am talking big bucks! Pesos! Yen! Rubles! You make one little mistake…ScenesJack: You lost 13 million dollars.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, so this is all about money! Y’know it’s bad enough that—Ow! Oh, you have got to be kidding!ScenesJack: Are you all right?ScenesPhoebe: I’m having another heart attack!ScenesJack: What?!ScenesPhoebe: I’m having another heart attack!! Call 9-1-1!!ScenesJack: Take it easy. (Sits her down.)ScenesPhoebe: (to Arthur, he’s the guy calling 9-1-1) Dumbass!ScenesWoman: Hey Pheebs! How’s it going?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, they fired me and I’m having heart attack.ScenesWoman: Wow! Well, welcome back!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is there as Rachel storms in.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi Ross!ScenesRoss: Hey Rachel.ScenesRachel: Is Joey Tribbiani here?ScenesRoss: Umm, no.ScenesRachel: Well, if you see him, will you please tell him that I’m looking for him and that this I am not gonna throw up!ScenesRoss: That-that’s always good news. Are you okay?ScenesRachel: Me? I’m great! I’m fine! I’m sooo good!! But, you know who’s not great?! Men! You’re a man right Ross?!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Sit down!ScenesRoss: Okay. (He does so.)ScenesRachel: Let me uh, let me ask you something, do wedding vows mean squat to you people?! And why is it that the second we tell you we’re going out of town, bamn there you are in bed with the neighbor’s dog walker?!ScenesRoss: We’re sorry.ScenesRachel: No seriously! Seriously! What has happened to the sanctity of marriage?ScenesRoss: Didn’t you spend last night at Joey’s?ScenesRachel: Aw what are you?! A detective?ScenesRoss: Look I-I don’t know what’s going on with you and your husband and what is hopefully an adult dog walker, look can I just say not all men are like that.ScenesRachel: Oh. (Doesn’t believe it.)ScenesRoss: Hey! There are some men who will do whatever it takes to make their marriage work! Okay? There are some men who will stand by and-and watch as their wives engage in-in what only can be described as a twosome with some-some woman she barely knows from the gym!ScenesRachel: Who are these men?ScenesRoss: Men. I guy I know.ScenesRachel: Well, you might want to tell him it sounds like his wife is (whispers) gay.ScenesRoss: She is not… (Realizes) She’s gay. Oh my God. She is so gay! I can’t believe this.ScenesRachel: Good day for married people huh?ScenesRoss: I’m sorry your husband cheated on you.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry your wife is gay. I guess women aren’t that great either.ScenesRoss: Try telling my wife that.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe's, Monica is blowing out a candle as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (sticking his head in the door) Okay to come in?ScenesMonica: Yeah, come on, eat, whatever you want. Dr. Roger got beeped again.ScenesChandler: Yeah I know, guess who beeped him?ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesChandler: I’m the ruptured spleen. (Laughs.)ScenesMonica: Why would you do that?ScenesChandler: Because you shouldn’t be with him. (Pause.) You should be with me.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! When you were talking about Roger, that was killing me! Look, things like last night they don’t just happen. Y’know? Or at least not to me. Or with the other two women, in the morning y’know I was just lying there and I couldn’t wait to just go hang out with my friends, but with you I always y’know with a friend.ScenesMonica: Chandler!ScenesChandler: I know you probably don’t want to go out with me, y’know because I make too many jokes and I’ve never been in a serious relationship and I guess I’m not technically a "doctor…Scenes(Monica runs over and kisses him.)ScenesMonica: There was just one woman, wasn’t there?ScenesChandler: No, there were two.ScenesMonica: Including me?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah.ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing a new song as the gang looks on.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing)ScenesIt only takes two heart attacks to finally make you see…ScenesOne of them won’t do it, but the second one will set you free…ScenesTell all your hate and anger, it’s time to say good-bye…ScenesAnd that is just what I will do, soon as those bastards I work for die!ScenesLa, la-la-la, la-la-la-la, la-la-la, la-la-la……ScenesEndScenesThe One With The UnagiScenesTeleplay by: Adam ChaseScenesStory by: Zachary RosenblattScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Chandler, and Phoebe are there. Joey is working.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, remember when I had a monkey?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Yeah, what, what was I thinking?ScenesJoey: (he’s just picked up their bill) Hey! So, what’s with the 20 percent tip? Did I do something wrong?ScenesChandler: Twenty percent is a pretty generous tip Joe.ScenesJoey: Y’know what’s more generous than that?! Fifty percent! Y’know what’s even more generous than that?!!ScenesChandler: I see where you’re goin’!ScenesRoss: What’s up with the greed Joe?ScenesJoey: All right, look I’m sorry you guys, but it’s just that I gotta get these new head shots made. And they’re really expensive, y’know? I’m down to like three! Well, actually two ‘cause one of ‘em I kinda blackened in some teeth—Why did I do that?! (Hits himself in the head.)ScenesRoss: Well isn’t there something you can do to earn a little extra money? I mean, can’t-can’t you pick up, I don’t know, an extra shift here?ScenesPhoebe: Or, y’know, I used to beg for money. Of course it helps if you’ve got y’know a little of this (she sticks her chest out and shakes it) goin’ on. Wow! I still have it!ScenesRoss: Oh, wait! Wait! Don’t you have an audition today? Yeah! Maybe you’ll get that job!ScenesJoey: Oh, ha-ha-ha! Ooh! Wait a minute, I used to get medical experiments down on me all the time!ScenesChandler: (reminiscing) Ah, finally an explanation.ScenesJoey: No-no! I used to get paid for all kinds of medical stuff, remember? Let’s see uh, well I don’t want to donate sperm again. (To Ross) I really prefer doing that at the home office y’know? (Ross nods his head.) Ooh-ooh, maybe they want like some of my blood or-or spit or something, huh?ScenesGunther: (approaching with a tray with an order on it) Joey!ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesGunther: What did I tell you about talking to your friends while you’re working?ScenesJoey: Uhh do it?ScenesGunther: That guy (points) has been waiting for his coffee for ten minutes! He’s complained about you three times! (He hands the coffee cup to Joey, assuming that Joey will deliver it and walks away.)ScenesJoey: Well, where was I? (Takes a sip of the coffee.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter wearing workout clothes.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, what have you guys been up to?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! We went to a self-defense class today!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: Yeah, kicking a guy in the crotch all morning really takes it out of ya!ScenesJoey: Takes it out of you? (Laughs.)ScenesPhoebe: Now, we can kick anybody’s ass!ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: After one class? I don’t think so.ScenesRachel: What? You wanna see me self-defend myself?! Go over there (points) and pretend you’re a sexual predator! Go on! I dare ya!!ScenesRoss: Well, of course you can defend yourself from an attack you know is coming, that’s not enough. Look, I studying kara-tay for a long time, and there’s a concept you should really be familiar with. It’s what the Japanese call (he holds two fingers up to his temple, and he does this every time he says this word) unagi.ScenesRachel: Isn’t that a kind of sushi?ScenesRoss: No, it’s a concept!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah it is! It is! It’s freshwater eel!ScenesRoss: All right, maybe it means that too…ScenesRachel: Ohh! I would kill for a salmon skin roll right now!ScenesRoss: Y’know what? Fine! Get attacked! I don’t even care!ScenesPhoebe: (deadpan) Come on Ross. We’re sorry. Please tell us what it is.ScenesRoss: Unagi is a state of total awareness. Okay? Only by achieving true unagi can you be prepared for any danger that may befall you!ScenesPhoebe: You mean in case someone is trying to steal your bamboo sleeping mat or your kettle of fish?Scenes(Rachel laughs and Ross mocks her.)ScenesRoss: (moves closer) All I’m saying is, it’s one thing being prepared for an attack against like each other; whole another story being prepared for an attack, I don’t know, like a (turns and puts his face close to Rachel’s and screams) surprise!!Scenes(Rachel calmly wipes the spittle off her face.)ScenesRoss: All right, you know that one was coming, but that doesn’t mean you have unagi. (Does the finger thing.)ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) Ooh! Y’know what? If we made reservations, we could have unagi in about a half-hour.ScenesRoss: Y’know what… (Moves away as Chandler enters, panicked.)ScenesChandler: Hey-hey, is Monica here?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesRoss: No.ScenesChandler: Okay, look I need your help, I don’t know what to get her for Valentine’s Day.ScenesRachel: Well, Valentine’s Day was like two weeks ago, so I wouldn’t get her a calendar!ScenesChandler: (laughs) She was working on Valentine’s Day so we’re celebrating it tonight.ScenesJoey: Ohh, hey! Why don’t you book a date for both of you at one of those romantic spas?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, Joey, that’s actually a really good idea!ScenesJoey: And of course, crotchless panties.ScenesChandler: Well appealing as that does sound to her boyfriend (pause) and her brother, (the camera pans to Ross flashing Joey a very evil look; Joey gets scared) I can’t do that we promised we’d make each other gifts this year.ScenesRachel: Aw, I love that.ScenesPhoebe: You guys!ScenesJoey: You can’t make crotchless panties? You take, you take a pair of scissors and you just cut…ScenesRachel: (interrupting him) Okay-okay-okay! So, making things. That sounds like so much fun.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I thought so to until I paper mached one of my eyes shut.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I love paper mache! What did you make?ScenesChandler: I made a… (Does one of those gibberish words.)ScenesPhoebe: What is that?ScenesChandler: Nothing!ScenesRoss: So what are you gonna do?ScenesChandler: Well, have you guys made anything that maybe I can take credit for?ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! I have! I have! I started making these little sock bunnies! (She takes out a sock that’s been made into a bunny with eyes, nose, mouth, whiskers, and two other socks sown onto it for ears.) Oh for crying out loud!ScenesRachel: Hey, wait a minute! That is my sock!ScenesPhoebe: Now, it’s you little bunny friend. (She sticks it in Rachel’s face and they both laugh.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is desperately trying to make his Valentine’s Day gift. He takes a paper cup, turns it upside down, sticks two pencils into the top, and hangs a coat hanger from the bottom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (admiring his work) This, this actually is a… (Does the same gibberish word from before.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Honey, can I ask you a question about the Valentine’s Day gifts?ScenesMonica: Oh, yeah.ScenesChandler: Do we have to make the entire thing?ScenesMonica: Yes! Why, did you—you forget to make yours?ScenesChandler: Of course, of course not. I just have to uh, go over to the place where I-I made it and pick-pick it up.ScenesMonica: Okay. (They kiss.) Okay, I can’t wait! This is going to be the best Valentine’s Day ever! (Chandler giggles and exits.) I can’t believe it! Make the presents! Make the presents!ScenesChandler: (sticking his head back in) What?ScenesMonica: I’m just so excited to make the presents! (Chandler does another sarcastic/scared laugh and leaves.) Shoot!

rows.Scenes: A Medical Research Office, Joey is there to sign up for an experiment, any experiment.]
rows.Content: Joey: (to the receptionist) Hi uh, I’m Joey Tribbiani and with all do respect I’d like to donate some fluids.ScenesReceptionist: We’re actually at the end of one of our research cycles, so we’re not looking for applicants right now.ScenesJoey: Oh that’s too bad. I’ve kinda been saving up. (She just looks at him in horror.) Uh, are you sure there’s no studies I can participate in?ScenesReceptionist: Well, here’s a schedule of what’s coming up. (Hands it to him.)ScenesJoey: Thanks. (Starts to read it.) Well but this one starts now. (Points to one.)ScenesReceptionist: Oh that one is available now, but only identical twins are eligible. It’s a twins study.ScenesJoey: But it’s $2,000.ScenesReceptionist: Sorry.ScenesJoey: Well how about this one? Testing the effects of Joey Tribbiani on attractive nurse receptionists.ScenesReceptionist: We already got the results back on that on, and they’re not good. (Joey beats a hasty retreat.)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway between the Apartments, Ross is hiding behind that bump out on Monica’s side waiting for Phoebe and Rachel. As they come up the stairs, he jumps out and yells…]
rows.Content: Ross: DANGER!!! DANGER!!!!!Scenes(They both scream and jump away.)ScenesPhoebe: Ross!!!ScenesRachel: What the hell was that?!ScenesRoss: A lesson in the importance of unagi. (He starts doing the finger thing every time now.)ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you’re a freak!!ScenesRoss: Perhaps. Now I’m curious, at what point during those girlish screams would you have begun to kick my ass?ScenesRachel: All right, so we weren’t prepared!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry I had to take such drastic measures to make my point, but I—look, I just want you guys to be safe. (Monica comes out to throw out the garbage and Ross screams…) DANGER!!!!! (She completely ignores him and keeps walking.) Ahhh, huh? Unagi.

rows.Scenes: Cole-Geddes Casting Agency, Joey is there on his audition and thinking about that 2,000 bucks for the twins study.]
rows.Content: Joey: (in his head) 2,000 bucks is a lot of money. Oh, I wish I had a twin. Where could I find someone who looks exactly like me? (The camera widens its shot to reveal a room full of Joey look-a-likes. Joey looks at the guy next to him and then back at his script.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is coming in from doing his laundry. He starts folding it as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesRoss: (not turning around) Chandler. I sensed it was you.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesRoss: Unagi. I’m always aware.ScenesChandler: Okay, are you aware unagi (does the finger thing) is an eel?ScenesRoss: What’s up?ScenesChandler: I can’t figure out what to make Monica.ScenesRoss: Oh, why don’t you make her one of your little jokes.ScenesChandler: I’m going crazy! Okay? Do you have any thing around here that looks homemade?ScenesRoss: Y’know what? She’d-she’d love this. (Picks up a model of the Saturn V rocket, that’s the one that took man to the moon.) Uh, it’s an exact replica of Apollo 8. I made it in the sixth grade.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I guess I could use that. I could say that your love sends me to the moon.ScenesRoss: Yeah-yeah, except Apollo 8 didn’t actually land on the moon. But you-you-you could write that umm, your love lets me orbit the moon twice and return safely. (Apollo 8 was the first one that orbited the moon and the one that read the Christmas Story from the orbit of the moon on Christmas Eve, 1968. They also took the famous Earthrise picture of the Earth rising over the moon.)ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, I can’t give this to her.ScenesRoss: Why not?ScenesChandler: Because it says "Captain Ross" on the side and "I hate Monica" on the bottom.ScenesRoss: Oh.Scenes(Chandler leaves dejectedly. When the door closes Rachel and Phoebe jump out from behind the curtains and scream…)ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: DANGER!!!!!Scenes(Ross screams like a little girl.)ScenesRachel: Ahhhhh, salmon skin roll. (She does the finger thing.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, he’s still trying to figure out what to make Monica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay. Okay. (He goes to the closet, moves the clothes out of the way, and notices an empty hanger. He takes the empty hanger and bends it all out of shape. Then he holds it out as if he’s giving it to her.) Yes honey, I made it myself. (He throws it down and goes to her chest, grabs something, goes to the bed table, and takes out a pair of scissors. He turns around and holds the scissors to the crotch of the panties he just removed.) I can’t do it. I can’t do it. (He throws them both down and continues looking. He opens another closet door and finds a tape.) Oh! Oh! A mixed tape! A mixed tape!! (He runs out into the living room.)Scenes[Cut to the living room, Chandler is entering as Monica finishes wrapping her present for him on the kitchen table.]ScenesChandler: Hey! Hi! You uh, ready to exchange gifts?ScenesMonica: Sure! Okay, you go first.ScenesChandler: Okay, come here! Come here.ScenesMonica: Okay! (She takes her present for him and they move over to sit on the couch.)ScenesChandler: Now, it’s not wrapped because I just, just finished it.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesChandler: But I made you a tape of what I think are all romantic songs.ScenesMonica: Oh, what a great gift! Is The Way You Look Tonight on it?!ScenesChandler: (momentarily terrified) Maybe we’ll have to listen and see!ScenesMonica: Oh, I love it! Thank you so much!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesMonica: Okay, you ready to open yours?ScenesChandler: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Okay.Scenes(He opens his present to find Phoebe’s sock bunny from earlier.)ScenesChandler: It’s a sock bunny.ScenesMonica: Yeah-yeah, you remember how I call you bunny?ScenesChandler: Not really.ScenesMonica: Well, I did one time, and-and I want to start doing it more. See that’s what this is about.ScenesChandler: I see. Y’know umm, Phoebe makes sock bunnies.ScenesMonica: No! No, she doesn’t. Uh Phoebe, what she makes—that’s uh—they’re sock rabbits. They are completely different—Okay! Okay! Okay! I didn’t make it! I’m sorry! I totally forgot about tonight and the fact that we’re supposed to make the presents!ScenesChandler: Oh, it’s okay. I don’t…ScenesMonica: No-no, it’s not okay! It’s not! I mean you were just… You’re so incredible! You went through all this time and effort to make this tape for me! Y’know I’m just gonna—I, I am gonna make this up to you! I will! I-I am going to cook anything you want in here (points to the kitchen), and I am going to do anything you want in there! (Points to the bedroom.)ScenesChandler: (thinking it over) Well, I did put a lot of thought in the tape. (They both run into the bedroom.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler’s bedroom, they are relaxing in sexual bliss.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Wow! (To the sock bunny still on his hand.) You are way to young to have seen that!ScenesMonica: Oops! (Covers its eyes.) Y’know, your birthday is in a month-and-a-half, what do you say I forget to get you a present for that too?ScenesChandler: You are totally and completely 100% forgiven.ScenesMonica: We have got to wash that! (Referring to the sock bunny.)ScenesChandler: Yeah! (Takes it off his hand and throws it behind the night-stand.)ScenesMonica: Do you remember that jacket that you love so much, that you thought was too expensive?ScenesChandler: You have done enough!ScenesMonica: I wanna wake up early and go get it for you!ScenesChandler: No you don’t—get it in black, not brown.Scenes(The oven dings.)ScenesMonica: Oop, your cake is ready!ScenesChandler: Oop!Scenes(They both get out of bed and go get some cake.)ScenesChandler: Well, it’s like that old saying, have some sex, eat some cake.Scenes(As they approach the kitchen, the door opens and in walks in a Joey look-a-like.)ScenesJoey's Look-A-Like: Hey Mon! Hey Chann! (He goes to the fridge) Just gettin’ a soda! (Does so.)ScenesMonica: Who the hell are you?!ScenesJoey's Look-A-Like: I’m Joey! How are you doin’?!ScenesJoey: (entering) No! No! No! No! No! How you doin’?! How you doin’—Damnit Carl! Go wait in the hall! (Goes into the hall.)ScenesJoey: Look, I got to apologize on the behalf of Carl.ScenesChandler: Who the hell is Carl?!ScenesJoey: Oh, did I not mention? Carl is a guy I hired to be my identical twin for a medical research project.ScenesChandler: Y’know sometimes the good ideas are just right in front of you, aren’t they?ScenesJoey: Okay, I know it sounds crazy, but I think it might work. Y’know? The only problem is, Carl’s acting is… (Does the international hand symbol for so-so.)ScenesMonica: The only problem!ScenesJoey: Yeah, he’s the reason I didn’t get that big Minute Maid commercial a couple of years ago remember? We were supposed to be brothers, but he messed it up.ScenesCarl: (sticking his head back in) Hey, uh can I get a little piece of that cake?ScenesJoey: (to Carl) Pizza!! We like Pizza!! Get out!!! (Carl does so.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, Phoebe and Rachel are returning.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Pat Sajak?ScenesRachel: Yep!ScenesPhoebe: Alex Trebek?ScenesRachel: Oh, of course!ScenesPhoebe: Chuck Woolery?ScenesRachel: Definitely! Phoebe, you will not find a single game show host, who’s ass I cannot kick.Scenes(They start to walk into the living room and notice someone’s head sticking up from behind a chair. The camera cuts to the other side and we see it’s Ross.)Scenes[Time lapse. The girls have Ross pinned face down. Phoebe is sitting on his back and arms while holding his head down and facing Rachel. Rachel is sitting on his knees and holding his lower legs vertically, causing Ross pain.]ScenesRachel: Say it!ScenesPhoebe: Say we are unagi!ScenesRoss: It’s not something you are! It’s something you have!ScenesRachel: Say it!ScenesRoss: Y’know what? I can easily get out of this, but there is a chance you can get very, very hurt!Scenes(Rachel yanks on his legs again and he groans in pain.)

rows.Scenes: The Medical Research office, Joey is there with Carl in the waiting room. Two identical twins come out and both wave by at the same time.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right Carl, we’re next. Now remember, what is not gonna be?ScenesCarl: Another Minute Maid fiasco.ScenesJoey: That’s right! And what are you not gonna do?ScenesCarl: Well, I’m not gonna talk because…ScenesJoey: (gets very angry) Damnit Carl! (Carl goes to say something more, and Joey silences him with a grunt.)ScenesThe Doctor: (entering) (To the receptionist) Can I have the next one please? (Takes the form.) Joey and Tony Tribbiani. (Joey and Carl stand up.)ScenesJoey: That’s us.ScenesThe Doctor: (seeing they’re not identical) But uh, this is a study for identical twins.ScenesJoey: That’s right, $2,000.ScenesThe Doctor: But, you’re not identical twins.ScenesJoey: Damnit Carl!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is getting ready for Chandler’s arrival. He enters and finds the place lit with candles and dinner on the table.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh my good God.ScenesMonica: Hey! Continuing the countdown of your favorite meals. Tonight, No. 3, macaroni and cheese with cut up hot dogs.ScenesChandler: Look, you have done enough! Okay? You have to stop this now.ScenesMonica: I will! But not tonight. For dinner music, I thought we could listen to that tape you made me.ScenesChandler: Oh, the mixed tape.Scenes(Monica pushes play and The Way You Look Tonight starts to play.)ScenesMonica: The Way You Look Tonight is on here! Dance with me?Scenes(He hesitates, then goes over to dance with her.)ScenesMonica: You are just the sweetest. (They kiss.)Scenes(Suddenly, a strange and familiar voice comes out of the tape player. Here’s a hint, OH…MY…GAWD!! That’s right, it’s Janice!)ScenesJanice: I love the way you look every night Chandler! (Monica breaks the kiss and Chandler freezes in terror.) That’s why I made you this tape! Happy Birthday! Love Janice!ScenesChandler: No! You’re the sweetest! (He tries to kiss her but Monica backs away with a look that could kill on her face.)

rows.Scenes: A women’s self-defense class, the instructor is just finishing a class.]
rows.Content: The Instructor: Okay ladies, that ends today’s class, and let’s remember, let’s be safe out there.Scenes(The women all clap and start to leave as Ross comes up to the instructor. Apparently he was hiding in the back.)ScenesRoss: It’s a great class.ScenesThe Instructor: Thanks.ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah, I was watching. (The instructor just nods and walks away.) Umm, hey, a couple of questions though. Umm, about that-that-that last move where the woman tripped you and then pinned you to the floor, what-what-what-what would you do next?ScenesThe Instructor: Well, she would take her keys and try to jam them…ScenesRoss: No. No-no. No. What would you do next?ScenesThe Instructor: Who? Me the attacker?ScenesRoss: Yes that’s right.ScenesThe Instructor: Why?ScenesRoss: I tired attacking two women, did not work.ScenesThe Instructor: What?!ScenesRoss: No, I mean it’s okay, I mean, they’re-they’re my friends. In fact, I-I-I was married to one of them.ScenesThe Instructor: Let me get this straight man, you attacked your ex-wife?!ScenesRoss: Oh, no! No-no! No, I tired! But I couldn’t. That’s why I’m here. Maybe we could attack them together? (He glares at him.) That-that’s a no.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is trying to explain himself to Monica.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I am so, so, so, so sorry!ScenesMonica: (not buying it) Uh-huh.ScenesChandler: And I will cook anything you want in here (points to the kitchen), and do anything in there! (Points to the bedroom.)ScenesMonica: (pointing to the kitchen) Yeah you will! (Points to the bedroom) And, are you kiddin’ me?!ScenesChandler: Come on Monica, it’s our Valentine’s Day. Please? Please-please, please?ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay. (They hug.)ScenesJanice’s Voice: (singing) My funny valentine, sweet comic valentine! You make me high over my heart!Scenes(Monica breaks the hug and starts for the bedroom.)ScenesChandler: So, are we going in there?ScenesMonica: I am!! (Enter her room and closes the door behind her.)ScenesJanice’s Voice: (singing) You’re look for laughable…(She does the now patented Janice laugh.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: The street in front of Central Perk, Ross is walking up and sees two women that look like Phoebe and Rachel from behind.]
rows.Content: Ross: Ah-ha, nowhere to run! (He starts to run towards them.)Scenes[Cut to Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting up by the window because two guys have their couch.]ScenesRachel: I don’t like sitting up here! I’m just gonna over… (She starts to get up.)ScenesPhoebe: (stopping her) No Rachel! They got here first!Scenes(Ross appears at the window behind them crouched behind a garbage can and ready to spring his attack on who he thinks are Phoebe and Rachel. The camera cuts to the exterior view and Phoebe and Rachel call the shots from inside.)ScenesPhoebe: Why is Ross doing that?ScenesRoss: DANGER!!!!ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Why is he jumping on those women!ScenesPhoebe: We should help him!ScenesRachel: I… Well, I don’t think they need any help.Scenes(Ross starts to scream and run away. He stops in front of the window of Central Perk to check the pursuit and notices Phoebe and Rachel inside looking at him. He mouths, "What?" Then realizes that the women he attacked are closing in so he screams and runs away.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Ross Dates A StudentScenesWritten by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler, Rachel, and Joey are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! I just got uh, my teacher evaluations! Check out what this one student wrote, "I loved Dr. Geller’s class. Mind blowing lectures! Dr. Geller, you are definitely the hottie of the paleontology department!ScenesChandler: Ahh, Hotties of the Paleontology Department, there’s a big selling calendar, eh?ScenesRachel: Who wrote it?ScenesRoss: Oh, I wish I knew, but the evaluations are all anonymous.ScenesJoey: Oh hey, do you still have their final exams?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Oh, ‘cause you can just match the evaluation to the exam with the same handwriting and boom, there’s your admirer. (Ross is stunned.)ScenesChandler: A hot girl’s at stake and all of the sudden he’s Rain Man.ScenesRachel: Okay, wait a minute, wait a minute, why are we so sure that this is a girl?ScenesRoss: It’s a girl! Anyway, it wou—it wouldn’t matter. Okay? Because I’m a teacher and she’s a student.ScenesChandler: Oh, is that against the rules?ScenesRoss: No, but it is frowned upon.ScenesChandler: I see.ScenesRoss: Besides, there’s a big age difference.ScenesJoey: Oh, well think of it like this, when you’re 90…ScenesRoss: I know when I’m 90 she’ll be like 80 and it won’t seem like such a big difference.ScenesJoey: No that’s not what I was going to say at all. No, what I was going to say is when you’re 90 you’ll still have the memory of what it was like to be with a 20-year-old.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler are eating breakfast as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Chandler! Y’know that girl you went to college with who-who became a movie director?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, Dana Keystone. She was in my Movement class.ScenesPhoebe: What’s a Movement class?ScenesMonica: It’s Chandler’s way of pretending he didn’t take mime.ScenesJoey: Oh well listen, anyway she’s directing the new Al Pacino movie. You gotta get me an audition!ScenesChandler: Oh, I don’t know man. I haven’t talked to her in like ten years.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, please-please Chandler I-I-I would owe you so much!ScenesChandler: You do owe me so much. You owe me three thousand, four hundred…ScenesJoey: Hey-hey dude, why are you changing the subject? Why? Will you make the call or what?ScenesChandler: Oh okay, I’ll-I’ll try.ScenesJoey: All right! Thanks! You’re the best! Now listen, the last day of auditions is Thursday. Okay? So I gotta get in there by Thursday. Okay? Just remember Thursday. Thursday. Can you remember Thursday?ScenesChandler: Yeah so, Tuesday?ScenesJoey: (angrily) Thursday! Look if you need help remembering think of like this, the third day. All right? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when? Huh? What day? Thursday! The third day! Okay?!ScenesChandler: (sarcastically) Thank you.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: (entering from the bathroom) Hey Mon? I’m gonna check my messages.ScenesChandler: You just thought of that in there?ScenesMonica: Yeah sure, nature called, she wanted to see who else did.Scenes(Rachel dials her number.)ScenesRachel: (on phone) Hello? (Shocked that someone answered.) Uh, Rachel. (To the gang.) Great, someone is in our apartment. Call the cops!ScenesMonica: You’re on the phone!ScenesRachel: (on phone) Oh my God! Oh my God! Thank you! (Hangs up) That was the fire department, there was a fire at our place!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! How bad was it?ScenesRachel: Well, he didn’t say, but it was a fire. I’m guessing not very good. Come on, we gotta go!ScenesMonica: Come on! (The girls all run out and Joey holds up Chandler by smiling.)ScenesChandler: What are you smiling about? What is so funny?ScenesJoey: The part I want to audition for is a fireman, this is so meant to be!

rows.Scenes: N.Y.U. Paleontology department, Ross is putting up the grades on the message board.]
rows.Content: Burt: (another professor) Wow! It looks like you were very generous with your grades this semester! (Ross frantically starts to change some as a female student, Elizabeth, approaches.)ScenesElizabeth: Professor Geller?ScenesRoss: (startled) Yeah?ScenesElizabeth: I wanted to say how much I enjoyed your class.ScenesRoss: Oh thank you. Thanks very much. (Leans up against the board and on a thumbtack.) Ow! (He pulls away.)ScenesElizabeth: Uh, I’m a little embarrassed about calling you a hottie on my evaluation…ScenesRoss: That was you?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah. I felt a little weird about it. You’re a teacher. I’m a student. But would you maybe want to go out with me sometime?ScenesRoss: Oh I, I don’t-I don’t think that would be the best idea.ScenesElizabeth: Oh, because I was thinking, the semester’s over; you’re not my teacher anymore.ScenesRoss: What time?ScenesElizabeth: (checks her grade) Oh, y’know what? Forget it, you already gave me an A.ScenesRoss: Gotcha. (Starts to leave.)ScenesElizabeth: I’m kidding!ScenesRoss: Oh! So-so seriously, what time?

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, everyone minus Ross are arriving to inspect the damage. The fire department is still there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Coming through! (Has to dodge a fireman) Oh! Coming through! (Sees a cute one.) Oh! Hello! Hi! (Smiles then realizes) No! Right! Coming through!Scenes(They start to look around seeing that the living room is undamaged.)ScenesMonica: Oh well, it’s not so bad.ScenesFireman #1: Yeah, most of the damage is pretty mostly contained in the bedrooms.ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesRachel: My God! (They both run into the bedrooms.)ScenesJoey: (to the fireman) Hey buddy, do you think I can borrow your uniform this Thursday?ScenesFireman #1: Excuse me?ScenesMonica: Joey! He’s working! (To Chandler) You would look good in that.Scenes(Phoebe and Rachel return)ScenesJoey: Oh, how bad is it?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s bad. It’s really bad. The only thing in there that isn’t burned is an ass. Which I do not remember buying!ScenesChandler: How’s your room Rach?ScenesRachel: Everything’s ruined. My bed. My clothes. Look at my favorite blue sweater. (Hold it up.)ScenesMonica: Isn’t that mine?ScenesRachel: Fine! I’m sorry for your loss! (Hands it back to her.)ScenesFireman #1: So uh, you’re not gonna be able to live here for a while, you ladies have a place to stay?ScenesRachel: (stands up) Wow! Oh-okay, look pal, I am not in the mood to be hit on right now! But if you give me your number I will call you some other time.ScenesMonica: (pulling Rachel back down) Yes, they can stay with us.ScenesChandler: Have you figured out what started the fire Mr. Fireman?ScenesFireman #1: Well uh, do either of you smoke?ScenesPhoebe: No, not usually. But yeah, I could use one right now.ScenesFireman #1: No-no-no, do you uh light candles? Burn incense?ScenesPhoebe: Yes! I do! All the time! I love them! Oh my God! I did it! It’s me! It’s me! I burned down the house! I burned down the house!ScenesRachel: Okay Phoebe calm down, there’s no need to place blame. Okay? (To the fireman) I warned her about those candles.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Chandler is on the phone as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: God, it’s great to catch up! I can’t believe how long it’s been!ScenesJoey: Chandler, is that… (Mimes someone using a movie camera and Chandler nods yes.)ScenesChandler: (on phone) Oh that’s great! Good for you.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey listen… (Chandler waves him away.)ScenesChandler: Okay! So yeah, maybe we can get together umm… (Joey mimes throwing something in the air, catching it, rolling it out, putting it in an oven and cutting it.) Can you hold for one second please? (To Joey) What?!ScenesJoey: When you’re off the phone, do you wanna get a pizza?ScenesChandler: (on phone) Hi! I’m back. (Goes to hang up the phone.) Yeah, that sounds great. (Listens) Okay. Well, we’ll do it then. (Listens) Okay, bye-bye. (He hangs up the phone and turns around to see Joey standing close to him and screams.)ScenesJoey: Hey listen, so when’s-when’s my audition? I mean I know it’s Thursday, but what time?Scenes(Monica enters.)ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: (To Joey) We didn’t get to the audition. I’m gonna take her to coffee and then we’ll do it then.ScenesJoey: Ah-ha!ScenesMonica: Wow! So, now you’re going on a date with this girl?ScenesChandler: Honey, it is not a date! I haven’t talked to her in ten years! You can’t just call up somebody you haven’t talked to in ten years and ask them for a favor. There are rules, y’know? You gotta, you got to put in some time.ScenesMonica: You’re right, I’m sorry. It’s not like you’re y’know, going out with an ex-girlfriend.ScenesChandler: No, we only went out once.ScenesMonica: You dated her!ScenesChandler: Not once!ScenesMonica: All right, well why don’t I go out with an ex-boyfriend and do Joey a favor?!ScenesJoey: Hey, you wanna do Joey a favor, maybe you go out with Joey. (He turns around to see Chandler glaring at him.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is having coffee with Dana.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (laughs) Oh that’s great, my friend Joey’s in the movie business.ScenesDana: Y’know who I ran into from school?
