Howie.ScenesChandler: (giggles) My friend’s name is Joey.ScenesDana: Apparently Howie’s editing now. Yeah, he-he-he calls me up and asks me if he can edit my new movie. Can you believe that?! Y’know I-I-I haven’t spoken to him in like ten years and he asks me for a favor!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’ve always hated that Howie.ScenesDana: No, no "How you doing?" Man, I mean not even a cup of coffee first!ScenesChandler: The nerve huh?ScenesDana: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Refill?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Monica is about to debut Hotel Monica (formerly known as Rachel’s Room) to Phoebe and Rachel.]
rows.Content: Monica: Now, this is last minute so I want to apologize for the mess. Okay?Scenes(They walk into a completely redecorated and repainted room. And of course, the room is immaculate. Only an obsessive-compulsive like Monica could find fault with the room.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! It sure didn’t look this way when I lived here.ScenesMonica: I know! Now look, there’s only one problem though. There’s only room for one, so I guess one of you will have to stay at Joey’s.ScenesPhoebe: Well, since the fire was kinda my fault I guess (To Rachel) you should get to stay here.ScenesRachel: Hey! Hey-hey, now this was no one’s fault Pheebs. Okay? It was an accident.ScenesPhoebe: Well no, it was my fault so you should get the nice room.ScenesRachel: Okay! (She jumps on the bed.)ScenesMonica: So Rach! You’re the first guest at Hotel Monica! Umm, you’ll just have to tell me how you like your eggs in the morning. And I thought I would bring them to you, y’know, in bed. Oh, you have been through so much.ScenesRachel: I have.

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey is showing Phoebe around.]
rows.Content: Joey: This right here is where I keep the pizza. (He points to the chair.) And uh that’s where the napkin is. (Points to the floor next to the chair.)ScenesPhoebe: What’s that smell?ScenesJoey: I know! (Shrugs his shoulders.)

rows.Scenes: A street, Ross is walking with Elizabeth on their date.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: Oh please! It was such a big class! You never even noticed me!ScenesRoss: What? Of course I did! You uh, you sat next to Sleepy Sleeperson.ScenesElizabeth: Who?ScenesRoss: Oh uh, I had trouble remembering everyone’s name, so I-I kinda came up with nicknames. Like the guy on the other side of you was Smelly von Brownshirt.ScenesElizabeth: Oh yeah. So umm, did you have a nickname for me?ScenesRoss: Umm, no. No.ScenesElizabeth: Yes you did! What was it?ScenesRoss: Umm, it’s Cutie McPretty.ScenesElizabeth: Ohh that’s so sweet!ScenesRoss: Listen, I gotta tell ya, I-I’m having a great time! Y’know how before you said it might be weird, the whole student teacher thing, and to be frank I thought it would be too, but it’s not. I mean it’s not at all.ScenesBurt: (exiting from a restaurant) Dr. Geller!ScenesRoss: (pushing Elizabeth into a doorway) Burt!

rows.Scenes: Phoebe and Rachel's, Phoebe and Rachel are cleaning up the mess.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So did you sleep well last night?ScenesRachel: I did.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: I did, Monica was so sweet she left a little mint on my pillow.ScenesPhoebe: Y’know what Joey left on my pillow?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: Gum!ScenesFireman #2: Well, we determined the cause of the fire.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah I know, it was my candle. My candle!ScenesFireman #2: No, there was an appliance left on in the bathroom. It’s looks like a curling iron.ScenesPhoebe: I don’t use a curling iron.ScenesFireman #2: Well someone does.Scenes(Phoebe looks at Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Well, don’t look at me! My hair’s straight! Straight! Straight! Straight!ScenesFireman #2: It could’ve been a hair straightener.ScenesRachel: Oh.

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey is now showing Rachel around.]
rows.Content: Joey: This is where I keep the pizza. (It’s the same location as before.) And—Hey! Where did the napkin go?! (The napkin is not in it’s spot.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Chandler's, Phoebe is reading and Monica runs over and turns on the lamp behind Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Monica: Now there you go! I wouldn’t want my best guest to strain her eyes!ScenesPhoebe: Thanks Monica!ScenesMonica: Does that smell bother you?ScenesPhoebe: What the smell from Joey’s? No, I can hardly smell it over here.ScenesMonica: Well you let me know if you can, because y’know I can bake a pie to cover it.ScenesPhoebe: I can smell it a little, bake the pie.ScenesMonica: Okay!ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello? (Listens) Oh yes, one minute please. (To Phoebe) It’s for you. It’s the fire inspector.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! (Takes the phone.) Hello? (Listens) Yeah this is Phoebe. (Listens) Really?!Scenes[Cut to Joey’s, he’s on the phone.]ScenesJoey: (in a funny voice) Yeah, so it turns out that it wasn’t the hair straightener that started the fire. (Rachel prompts him on what to say next.) No-no, it was the candles. It’s very not good leaving candles unattended. In fact, one of the first things they teach you in fire school is… (Phoebe suddenly enters.) Uhh… Uhh… Okay. Well, I have to go now. (Phoebe leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Ross is telling Monica and Joey about his date with Elizabeth.]
rows.Content: Ross: We had such a great time! She’s-she’s incredible! I thought the-the age difference might be a problem, but it wasn’t. It wasn’t at all. Elizabeth is very mature for her age. (Joey makes the international sign for big boobies.) (To Monica) A concept lost on some people!ScenesMonica: So it’s okay to date a student.ScenesRoss: Well, not really. I mean technically it’s-it’s not against the rules or anything, but it is frowned upon. Especially by that professor we ran into last night, Judgey von Holierthanthou.ScenesMonica: Well Ross, you be careful now. You don’t want to get a reputation as y’know Professor McNailshisstudents.ScenesRoss: Yeah. What-what should I do?ScenesJoey: Well Ross, it seems pretty clear. I mean what’s more important? What people think or how you feel, huh? Ross, you gotta follow your heart.ScenesMonica: Joey that is so sweet.Scenes(He turns his back to Monica and does the international sign for big boobies again.)ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey! So, how did it go with Dana? Any reason I should leave a block of time open say Thursday?ScenesChandler: I couldn’t do it.ScenesJoey: You couldn’t do it?!ScenesChandler: Hey, relax I just need more time. We’re going to dinner tonight.ScenesMonica: What?! You’re going out with her again!ScenesRoss: Going out with who?ScenesChandler: Uh, Dana Keystone from college.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! Wasn’t she uh… (Does the international sign for big boobies.)ScenesChandler: No, that was Dana Caplin.ScenesThe Guys: Ohhhh! (They all look up in a moment of reflection.)ScenesMonica: Joey! You didn’t even know her!ScenesJoey: Ah whatever!

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Chandler is having dinner with Dana.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Great story again! The yarns that you weave! Woo-hoo-hoo!ScenesDana: Y’know uh, actually I-I-I should get going.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no! Stay! Stay! Because you-you should you-you-you should stay!ScenesDana: Wow. Oh, I am really flattered, but I just I don’t feel that way about you.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, that’s not—No-no-no!ScenesDana: I’m sorry Chandler, y’know you are such a sweet guy and I, I don’t want to hurt you. Oh, I wish there was something I can do to make you feel better.ScenesChandler: No-no—Really?!ScenesDana: Of course!ScenesChandler: (breaking up) Well, it just hurts so bad. I uh…ScenesDana: Ohh, I’m sorry.ScenesChandler: Well maybe there is one thing you can do.ScenesDana: What?! Anything! Anything!ScenesChandler: Well, I umm, I mean this is just off the top of my head now, umm but I have this friend. This actor friend and he would kill me if he thought I was doing this umm, but umm would it be possible for him to get an audition for your movie say on Thursday?ScenesDana: Absolutely! But you-you would really feel better about me rejecting you if your actor friend can audition for my movie?ScenesChandler: Well, the heart wants what it wants. I’ll see you later. (He runs off and leaves her with the bill, which the waiter promptly delivers.)

rows.Scenes: Hotel Monica, Phoebe is on the bed playing her guitar as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey! How’s it goin’?ScenesPhoebe: Well, not much has changed in the last five minutes.ScenesMonica: Yes it has! I made cookies!ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s all right. I’m still full from your homemade potato chips.ScenesMonica: But you should eat them now because they’re hot from the oven.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Reaches for one.)ScenesMonica: (pulling the plate back) Oh-ho! But not in here! Can’t eat ‘em in bed, remember? No crumbies!ScenesPhoebe: (gritting her teeth) Okay, I’ll be out in a second.ScenesMonica: Okay!Scenes(Monica leaves and Phoebe closes the door behind her and tries to lock it.)ScenesMonica: (opening the door) What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: That doesn’t lock does it?

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey and Rachel are eating spaghetti in the living room while watching TV and Rachel drops some on the floor.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Joey! Sorry!ScenesJoey: No that’s all right. Don’t worry about it.ScenesRachel: Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!ScenesJoey: Rach! Hey! It’s fine! You’re at Joey’s!ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Look! (He throws some of his spaghetti on the floor.)ScenesRachel: I’ve never lived like this before.ScenesJoey: I know.Scenes(Rachel throws some of hers down.)ScenesJoey: All right, don’t waste it, I mean its still food. (He picks it up and eats it.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Elizabeth are deciding what to do on their second date.]
rows.Content: Ross: What do you want to do now? Huh? You wanna go get a drink?ScenesElizabeth: Uhh, I can’t.ScenesRoss: Oh, you have some studying to do?ScenesElizabeth: No, I have some turning 21 to do.ScenesRoss: Y’know I remember when uh, when I was in college, we used to… (He sees some of his colleagues enter and puts his head on her lap.)ScenesElizabeth: What are you doing?ScenesRoss: Nothing, I’m-I’m just, I’m so comfortable with you!ScenesElizabeth: Do you not want to be seen with me?ScenesRoss: What? No! Of course, of course I do! Are-are they gone?ScenesElizabeth: Uh no, they’re still here but I think I’m about to leave.ScenesRoss: What?! No! No! Wait! You’re right, this is stupid. Who cares what people think? I mean, I mean we like each other right? There’s nothing wrong with that. Come on. (They get up and go over to the table where his colleagues are sitting.) Burt? Lydia? Mel? This is Elizabeth.ScenesElizabeth: Hi!ScenesLydia: Aren’t you in my Popular Culture class?ScenesRoss: That’s right Lydia, Elizabeth here is a student and uh, we’re dating. And you may frown upon that, but we’re not gonna hide it anymore.ScenesMel: You are so fired.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesBurt: They’re gonna fire you! You can’t date a student! It’s against the rules.ScenesRoss: Really? Its not just frowned upon?

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey and Rachel are throwing huge spitballs at the entertainment center.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I love it at Joey’s!ScenesJoey: Hey, here you go. (Hands her another one.)ScenesChandler: (entering, sees Rachel’s throw) Ni-hi-ice!ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesChandler: (To Joey) So, you busy Thursday?ScenesJoey: Oh, very funny. I don’t know if you remember, but my audition was supposed to be Thursday. (Chandler doesn’t say anything until Joey figures it out.) You got me the audition?! Let’s hug it up! (They hug.)ScenesChandler: Okay. Okay. (Joey puts him down.) What are you gonna do to me if you get the part?ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey! Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Listen umm, yeah okay, I need to talk to you!ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: Now I know that they said that the umm, the hair straightener started the fire but I think I’m partly at fault. You see, I didn’t, I didn’t tell you but umm, but I-I had recently refilled the tissues and so y’know let’s just face it, that’s just kindling! So I think it’s better that I stay at Joey’s.ScenesRachel: No, no-no-no. Phoebe, this was my fault and besides y’know what? I’m fine here.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Oh umm, Chandler, Monica is looking for you.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah she said something about crumbies.ScenesChandler: No! No! No! I was so careful! (Runs out.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Okay, you have to switch with me! Monica is driving me crazy!ScenesJoey: That’s right, all the ladies want to stay at Joey’s.ScenesRachel: No! No! Phoebe, come on! I don’t want to switch! Please come on! I can throw wet paper towels here!ScenesPhoebe: No but at Monica’s you can eat cookies over the sink!ScenesRachel: I know. I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: All right fine! This looks like so much fun. (Examining the bowl of wet paper towels.)ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: God, what a mess. (She grabs the bowl and heads for Monica’s.)

rows.Scenes: Ross's apartment, Ross is looking at his handbook. Elizabeth is also there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Wow! It actually is in the handbook. I can’t date you or have a hot plate in my office. I can’t believe we have to stop seeing each other.ScenesElizabeth: For what it’s worth I did appreciate you standing up for me. It felt really nice. It kinda made me like you even more.ScenesRoss: I know, I know I really like you too. But we-we can’t date. It’s against the rules. It’s forbidden.ScenesElizabeth: Wow!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesElizabeth: Just hearing you describe it as forbidden, it’s really hot.ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Well I-I-I don’t care how hot it is it’s-it’s uh, it’s wrong.ScenesElizabeth: Stop it! (She starts to get all worked up.)ScenesRoss: (feeling it too) No! No! It’s wrong! It’s-it’s-it’s naughty. It’s taboo.ScenesElizabeth: Shut the book!Scenes(They frantically start making out.)ScenesRoss: Let’s also get a hot plate!Scenes(They start making out again.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey's apartment, Joey is eating pizza as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: So?!ScenesJoey: So?ScenesChandler: It’s Thursday! How was the audition?!ScenesJoey: Wh? Monday, one day. Tuesday, two day. Wednesday, when huh what? Thurs—(He gasps in horror.) Oh! (Runs out and Chandler just shakes his head. After a second Joey runs back in to grab a piece of pizza and runs back out.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s FridgeScenesTeleplay by: Gigi McCreery & Perry ReinScenesStory by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey and now Rachel's apartment, Joey has the fridge pulled out away from the wall and is in the process of pulling off the cooling grate behind it.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well that thing is clearing in the way! All right. Ah-ha! (He grabs a screwdriver and starts to attack the compressor, only he causes a small short circuit and shocks himself.) Ah-ah!! Damn fridge!Scenes(Rachel enters from her new room.)ScenesRachel: Hi Joey, how ya doin’?ScenesJoey: Great! Roomie!ScenesRachel: Huh, yeah I guess we are roommates now.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Well, now that you brought it up, our fridge is broken. We have to get a new one. Now, I checked around and your half is $400. Thanks a lot.ScenesRachel: I’m not paying for half of that! I’m only staying here until my apartment gets fixed.ScenesJoey: Look Rach, my parents bought this fridge just after I was born, okay? Now, I have never had a problem with it. Then you show up and it breaks! What does that tell ya’?ScenesRachel: That refrigerators don’t live as long as people.ScenesJoey: All right, now you know that the ATM will only lets you take out 300 at a time, I’ll take a check for the other hundred.ScenesRachel: You’re jokin’ right?ScenesJoey: Of course I’m jokin’! I don’t take checks.ScenesRachel: Thank God you’re pretty. (Exits.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesAll: Hi! Hey!ScenesRachel: Do you guys know any cute guys?ScenesChandler: Well, of course I do! My good friend Joey over here. (Pats Joey’s arm, Joey pats Chandler’s shoulder, and Chandler motions for Joey to say the same about him.)ScenesJoey: Oh, I’m sorry. Thank you Chandler.ScenesRachel: Anyway, there’s this big charity ball this weekend and Ralph Lauren bought a table, so I kinda have to go…ScenesMonica: What’s the charity?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, something either trees or disease—Ralph mumbles a lot.ScenesMonica: Does Ralph mumble when you’re not paying attention?ScenesRachel: Yeah! It’s weird. But the thing is need to find a date.ScenesPhoebe: Well, what kind of guy are you looking for?ScenesRachel: Well, someone that has his own tux, or has the ability to rent a tux.ScenesChandler: So he has to be a male who has at least $50.ScenesJoey: Ooh! So close.Scenes(Ross and Elizabeth enter.)ScenesRoss: Hey everybody!ScenesAll: Hi!ScenesRoss: Hey uh, this is Elizabeth.ScenesElizabeth: Oh hi!ScenesAll: Hi!ScenesElizabeth: I’m the student.ScenesChandler: (laughs) Isn’t she cute? (On Monica’s death stare) No!ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, this is probably none of my business, but weren’t you guys supposed to not be seen in public together?ScenesElizabeth: Oh, we’re not together.ScenesRoss: Oh no-no-no, we’re just two people who happen to run into each other here at the coffee house. (He winks at her.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, sly.ScenesElizabeth: Well, I really wanted to meet you guys, but I have to run. I’ll see you later?ScenesAll: Okay!ScenesElizabeth: Bye Ross.ScenesRoss: Bye.Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesElizabeth: Oops! I did not mean to run into you like that sir.ScenesRoss: Oh that is quite all right ma’am. (Elizabeth exits.)ScenesChandler: So, why is she leaving? Is it a school night and she has a lot of homework to do?ScenesRoss: Yes, her molecular epidemiology paper is due tomorrow.ScenesChandler: Oh, tell her good luck with that.ScenesRoss: Anyone else? Huh? Bring ‘em on!ScenesRachel: Oo! When’s her birthday?!ScenesRoss: I don’t know Rachel, why?ScenesRachel: Well, y’know it’s just been so long since I’ve been to Chuckie Cheese.ScenesMonica: Oh, I like Elizabeth.ScenesRoss: Well thanks!ScenesMonica: Yeah. In fact, I like her so much you tell her I want my cookies early this year! Y’know, a box of Thin Mints and some Tag-a-Longs.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey come on you guys, give him a break. Ross, seriously, how’s it going with her?ScenesRoss: Well, actually it’s been great. She’s 20 so she’s not looking for anything too serious, which is perfect for me right now.ScenesMonica: Well that is great. And seriously, she seems very nice.ScenesRoss: Thanks. I know you guys like to give me a hard time and all, but it really means a lot to me that you like her. Just knowing that you guys are…ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting) Okay, I got a good one. Okay, umm, what is she? Like 12?

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is sitting at the table and Monica is doing something in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Monica: Chandler, do you think we talk about our relationship enough?ScenesChandler: Yeah. Do we have any Fruit Roll-Ups?ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I just thought of the perfect guy for Rachel to take to her thing.ScenesChandler: Oh that’s so funny because we found someone too.ScenesPhoebe: Oh that’s good, I guess she’ll have a choice between my guy and your weirdo.ScenesChandler: Why would our guy be a weirdo?ScenesPhoebe: ‘Cause that’s just your taste.ScenesMonica: (laughs sarcastically) Rachel is not going to pick your stupid guy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah?ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: My guy is a lawyer who has volunteer work. And, he has one of these (She squeezes the skin on her chin together to form…)ScenesChandler: A face ass?ScenesPhoebe: A chin dimple!ScenesMonica: Well, uh y’know, our guy works with Chandler and he’s really nice and smart and he’s a great dresser!ScenesPhoebe: Have you seen your guy’s body?ScenesChandler: No, our guy is just a floating head.ScenesPhoebe: Well my guy is spectacular. Okay? He’s a massage client and one time umm, when he was on the table, I looked at it. And I mean all of it.ScenesMonica: You’re not supposed to look!ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, like there are police for that!ScenesChandler: (horrified) Wait! You look? You-you massaged me.ScenesPhoebe: I know. (Laughs.)ScenesMonica: All right fine, your guy may have a great body, but our guy is really funny.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Chandler funny?ScenesMonica: Our guy’s a great dancer!ScenesPhoebe: My guy is well read.ScenesChandler: Our guy has great hair.ScenesPhoebe: My guy has great teeth!ScenesChandler: Our guy smells incredible.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) Do you want our guy to be your guy?

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Chandler is entering to find Joey bingeing on the food from the fridge. Joey isn’t doing all that well.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesChandler: Well, you…don’t look good Joe.ScenesJoey: The fridge broke. I have to eat everything. Cold cuts, ice cream, limes—Hey, what was in that brown jar?ScenesChandler: That’s still in there?!ScenesJoey: Not anymore. So anyway, how do you want to pay me?ScenesChandler: Is this a service you’re providing me?ScenesJoey: No! No! No! For my new fridge—our new fridge!ScenesChandler: Our new fridge? I don’t live here anymore.ScenesJoey: So what? Look, suppose we were a divorced couple.ScenesChandler: Uh-huh.ScenesJoey: And I got custody of the kid, right? Now suppose the kid dies and-and I gotta buy a new kid.ScenesChandler: (not quite sure where Joey’s going and is a little worried) Okay…ScenesJoey: (pause) Give me $400!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s office, he’s unlocking his office door as Elizabeth walks up.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: Professor Geller?ScenesRoss: Hmm? (Turns around and sees that its Elizabeth) Oh, a student I don’t know.ScenesElizabeth: I was wondering if I could talk to you for a moment?ScenesRoss: Yes, yes of course, what-what would this be regarding?ScenesElizabeth: Making out in your office.ScenesRoss: Shh! (Laughs then composes himself) Of course, why don’t we go inside?Scenes(They go inside and Ross closes the door. When he turns around Elizabeth walks up to him, pushes him back against the door, and starts kissing him.)ScenesRoss: Oh-ooh!ScenesElizabeth: What?ScenesRoss: Doorknob! Doorknob!ScenesElizabeth: Oh! Sorry! Umm, I actually do need to talk to you.ScenesRoss: Oh, okay. What-what about?ScenesElizabeth: Spring vacation.ScenesRoss: Spring vacation.ScenesElizabeth: Yeah, we have time off and a lot of people are going on trips…Scenes(Another professor barges in.)ScenesProfessor Feesen: Professor Geller!ScenesRoss: (quickly jumping away from Elizabeth) Yes, professor Feesen-sen-stenlger… I’ll be with you in one moment. (To Elizabeth) So, I will take one box of the Thin Mints. (And he ushers Elizabeth out of the office.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Ross, Chandler, and Joey are entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: You don’t understand! Elizabeth was about to ask me to go on a trip with her! Is that taking it slow?! No, I’m not ready for this! Okay? What-what do I tell her?ScenesChandler: Just tell her the truth! Tell her you’re not ready.ScenesRoss: I can do that. Oh-oh, what if she gets upset?ScenesChandler: Then you distract her with a Barbie doll.ScenesJoey: Or! You can just, y’know… (He walks up close to whisper in Ross’s ear and when he gets there he pushes Ross into the fridge.)ScenesRoss: What the hell are you doing?ScenesJoey: What? What the hell am I doing? You just broke my fridge!ScenesRoss: What?! What? How do you, how do you even know its broken?!ScenesJoey: Oh-ho-ho, you think I don’t know what breaks my fridge? Excuse me! (He opens the door and feels inside.) Well what do you know! Broken! That’ll be $400!ScenesChandler: Joey, I saw you push him!ScenesJoey: (pause) You pushed him!ScenesRoss: Joey, I did not break this! Okay? (He opens the freezer and smells inside and recoils in disgust.) That has been broken for a while.ScenesJoey: All right. Chandler, do you remember how I told you about our fridge?ScenesChandler: Uh-huh.ScenesJoey: I still haven’t gotten a check for your half yet.ScenesRoss: Do not give him any money!ScenesJoey: I’m not talking to you! You broke my fridge!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s office, he’s opening the door to Elizabeth.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: You wanted to see me Professor Geller?ScenesRoss: Yes. Yes! Please, come in.Scenes(She does so, he closes the door, and she pushes him against the doorknob again.)ScenesRoss: Oo-oo!ScenesElizabeth: Doorknob?ScenesRoss: Yeah, it kinda grows on you. (They both laugh.) Actually, I wanted to finish talking to you about uh, spring vacation.ScenesElizabeth: Oh good.ScenesRoss: Look, I… (He has trouble sitting in his chair.) Look, I’m having a great time with you and I just don’t want us to move to fast or put to much pressure on us. So, I’m sorry I just don’t think we should go away together yet. It’s-it’s too soon.ScenesElizabeth: Ross, I think you misunderstood what I was saying. I just wanted to tell you that I’m going to Florida for a couple weeks.ScenesRoss: No. I think you misunderstood what I was saying. What I meant was…ScenesElizabeth: You are so adorable.ScenesRoss: That! Let’s talk about that.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! How did it go with Elizabeth?ScenesRoss: Huh? Oh-oh, it was fine. Uh, it was just a misunderstanding. She didn’t want me to go with her. She just wanted to let me know that she’s going to Florida for spring vacation.ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, is she going for spring vacation or is she going for spring break? (Does a little whooping/party noise.)ScenesRoss: What’s-what’s the difference?ScenesMonica: Well, spring vacation is doing nice things with your grandparents. Spring break you’re doing frat guys.ScenesRoss: Hey, y’know what? Not all spring breaks are like that.ScenesPhoebe: What did you do on yours?ScenesRoss: I went to Egypt with my dad.ScenesChandler: I can see it now, "Look dad, it’s the Sphinx!" (Does that party noise again.)ScenesRoss: Hey, I think Elizabeth is a little more serious than, "Spring break!" (Imitates the party noise.) All right? I mean she’s taken my class!ScenesMonica: And slept with the professor.ScenesRoss: I’m gonna call her.ScenesChandler: Yeah.Scenes(Ross leaves to do so and Rachel enters with a guy.)ScenesRachel: Hey! You guys umm, I want you to meet Sebastian.ScenesSebastian: Hi.ScenesRachel: We just uh, we just met at the newsstand. We both grabbed for the last Field & Stream. (Chandler’s shocked.) What? I read that.ScenesSebastian: Can I get you a cup of coffee?ScenesRachel: Oh yes! Thank you! (He does so and Rachel sits down on the couch.)ScenesPhoebe: Rachel, what the hell is this?!ScenesRachel: (shocked) What?ScenesPhoebe: You ask us to find you a guy and you come traipsing in here with your own!ScenesRachel: You found me a guy?ScenesMonica: Yes! We found you a really cute and funny guy from Chandler’s work!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah and I-I found you one too who is not a weirdo.ScenesRachel: Well, y’know what though you guys? I really appreciate that but I think I’m just gonna take Sebastian to the charity.ScenesChandler: Are you sure?! Because our guy smells incredible!ScenesMonica: Uh, would you stop it with that already?!Scenes(Sebastian returns with the coffee.)ScenesSebastian: Here you go. (Hands her, her cup.)ScenesRachel: Oh, thank you.ScenesSebastian: Sure.ScenesPhoebe: So, Sebastian, do you do any volunteer work?ScenesSebastian: Uh, no not really. Why?ScenesPhoebe: No reason, it’s just I know a single guy that cares about other people.ScenesChandler: Are you funny?ScenesSebastian: Excuse me?ScenesRachel: What are you guys doing?ScenesMonica: Are you funny? Tell us a joke!ScenesSebastian: Look, I just wanted to have coffee with Rachel.ScenesPhoebe: Well, so do a lot of people.ScenesSebastian: Actually, I uh, I gotta get going. (To Rachel) Give me a call sometime.ScenesRachel: Oh, but y’know, no, you didn’t give me your phone number.ScenesSebastian: Okay! See you later! (Exits.)ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Turns out he is kinda funny.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I cannot believe you guys! He was really nice and he left because of you!ScenesChandler: Yeah, but Sebastian? What is that? A cat’s name?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, y’know what I noticed Rachel? He scares easy. Is that the kind of guy you’d like to take to a ball? "Hey Sebastian, would you like to dance?" (Imitates him.) "Uhh, okay—I gotta go!ScenesMonica: All right guys stop it. Rachel, we’re very sorry that is a very insensitive thing for us to do. And y’know what? Let us make it up to you, we have two really great guys for you.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! What have you got to lose? Y’know you might even end up with someone really special (whispers) if you pick my guy.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesChandler: Okay, so you will meet our guys?ScenesRachel: Yes, I’ll meet ‘em.ScenesChandler: Okay now it doesn’t matter which one you choose, y’know? It’s completely up to you. Our guy is perfect, or you can go out with the guy Phoebe deemed not good enough to go out with herself.ScenesJoey: (entering) Pheebs! There you are! Okay, you broke my fridge; you owe me 400 bucks!ScenesPhoebe: Okay sure!ScenesJoey: Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, technically you owe me $600 for sending out happy thoughts on your last ten auditions.ScenesJoey: Call it even?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.Scenes(Ross returns.)ScenesChandler: (To Ross) Well, there you are! So what did Elizabeth say?ScenesRoss: Well, it turns out that she is going to Daytona for spring break woo-hoo. That means, that means wet T-shirt contests, guys doing shots off of girl’s bodies, waking up next to people you don’t even know…ScenesJoey: Man, she is going to have a great time! Is she staying at the Hotel Corona?ScenesChandler: You know the hotels?ScenesJoey: Sure! I was there! Spring Break ’81! Woo-hoo!ScenesMonica: In 1981 you were 13!ScenesJoey: So what? I drove down, sold T-shirts, had a blast. And y’know who knows how to party? Drunk college chicks.ScenesRoss: Okay, she can’t go.ScenesPhoebe: Ross, you can’t tell her not to go. You just started dating.ScenesRoss: Then what am I supposed to do?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing, you just have to be cool with it.ScenesRoss: Well, what is she goes down and-and sleeps with a bunch of guys?ScenesChandler: Well, maybe you don’t marry this one.

rows.Scenes: Elizabeth’s apartment, she is packing for her trip as Ross watches.]
rows.Content: Ross: I’m so glad you’re going on this trip!ScenesElizabeth: Yeah! I’ve been working so hard this semester. I really need to go crazy y’know, blow off some steam.ScenesRoss: Sure. Sure. Look I don’t, I don’t know if your plans are finalized yet, but umm, hey I-I know another great way to blow off steam.ScenesElizabeth: What?ScenesRoss: Are you into crafts at all?ScenesElizabeth: Ross, are you okay?ScenesRoss: Well, yeah, of-of course I’m okay! What? I’m just being supportive. Supportive of you and this whole trip, and-and (notices something) what-what is uh, what’s this? (He holds up a rather skimpy bathing suit.)ScenesElizabeth: It’s a bathing suit?ScenesRoss: To wear in front of people?ScenesElizabeth: Is that supportive?ScenesRoss: Is this?!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is reading as Monica and Chandler enter.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Good-good-good-good.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesMonica: We’re really glad you decided to meet our guy.ScenesRachel: Oh…ScenesMonica: You’re gonna like him so much. So umm, when do you want to meet him?ScenesRachel: I don’t know. I know I don’t work late tomorrow night.ScenesChandler: Tomorrow night is good. Tomorrow night is good, but uh, y’know what? Why put off something till tomorrow that you can do right now? (Laughs) Eldad come here! (He stands up from the next table.)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: Eldad, this is Rachel.ScenesEldad: How are you?ScenesRachel: Well-well a little blind sided but y’know good.ScenesChandler: Eldad, sit down. (To Rachel) Move over! Move over now!ScenesRachel: I—Ohh! (Moves over and lets Eldad sit on the couch.)ScenesChandler: There you go! There you are! (Rachel stares at Monica and Chandler)ScenesMonica: Okay! Okay! We can take a hint! (They start to leave but run into Phoebe with her guy in tow.) (To Phoebe) What are you doing here?!ScenesPhoebe: This is Patrick. (Points to him.)ScenesPatrick: Hi.ScenesChandler: Hi. (To Phoebe) Okay, you’re too late okay? Because she’s already with our guy.ScenesPhoebe: (looks) Oh my God, you’re right! I am too late; they’re sitting on the couch and talking! (To Patrick) Come on! (They go over to the couch.) Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: This is Patrick.ScenesRachel: Oh, hi.ScenesPatrick: Hi.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, this is the guy I was telling you about.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. And believe me, this suit does not do justice to what’s underneath it.ScenesRachel: Oh-okay, but Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRachel: I’m just sort of in the middle of something.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Okay! Yeah, that’s okay. (To Patrick) Have a seat. (Sits Patrick down next to Rachel.)ScenesMonica: No! You can’t do that!ScenesEldad: Maybe I should go!ScenesMonica: (stopping him) Sit down! We’re winning!ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know what? Maybe I should go!ScenesAll: (Chandler stops her) No-no-no-no! Have a seat! Have a seat!ScenesMonica: Rachel! Rachel! You haven’t touched Eldad’s hair!ScenesChandler: It is the softest hair! Touch it! (Both he and Monica do so.)ScenesRachel: Yeah, I’m good.ScenesPhoebe: Rachel? Patrick is really rich. (To Patrick) Give her some money.ScenesPatrick: Y’know what Phoebe? This isn’t really worth the free massage.ScenesMonica: That’s right Patrick, bye-bye!ScenesChandler: (To Rachel) Eldad is much more cooperative! And he can dance! (To Eldad) You dance for Rachel!Scenes(He starts to get up, but Rachel stops him.)ScenesRachel: No-no! Don’t dance for me! Please? Don’t! (She gets up to yell at her ‘friends.’) What is the matter with you guys?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay, let’s talk it out.ScenesRachel: I… Am I the only one that this is embarrassing for?ScenesEldad: I’m a little embarrassed. (Chandler shushes him.)ScenesRachel: I’ll tell ya who should be embarrassed! It’s you guys! Come on! This is ridiculous! Thank you very much, but I do not need you to get me a date!ScenesPhoebe: Then why did she ask us to…ScenesRachel: I am still talking!! And then you chase away the one guy that I actually liked! I mean, no offense to you guys. Really! I mean (To Patrick) congratulations on all the cash, (He nods) and-and y’know—(Feels Eldad’s hair)—Wow! You do have very soft hair! But I would much rather go to the ball all by myself than go through anymore of this! Good-bye! (Grabs her stuff, starts to leave, then turns back suddenly, and to Eldad) Now do you use some sort of special conditioner on that hair?!ScenesEldad: Yes, Papaya Extract.ScenesRachel: Thank you! (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: The airport, Elizabeth’s flight is about to leave and Ross is there to send her off.]
rows.Content: Ross: So uh, have a great time down there.ScenesElizabeth: I will.ScenesRoss: Yeah. And did you, did you pack that bathing suit?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah.ScenesRoss: It was pretty funny when I, when I hid it for a while, huh? Anyway, umm, I-I am worried about that bathing suit, not because it’s revealing which I’m fine with, no I’m concerned about your health, sun exposure.ScenesElizabeth: Oh, don’t worry I have plenty of sun block, it’s SPF-30.ScenesRoss: Well, if what’s in the bottle is actually 30. I mean sometimes you get 30, sometimes it’s-it’s get 4, and I swear to God more often than not it’s just milk.ScenesElizabeth: Ross, it’s going to be okay. I’m not going down there to hook up with a bunch of guys. I really like you. I like how things are going between us.ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah! I’m just going down there to relax and hang out with my friends.ScenesRoss: Okay. Cool.ScenesElizabeth: Oh hey! Here they are!Scenes(A group of about 10 guys and no women come running around the corner.)ScenesGuy: Elizabeth!Scenes(The guys pick up Elizabeth and carry her onto the plane as she waves bye.)ScenesRoss: Call me!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Rachel, Chandler, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Rachel, we’re sorry for pushing those guys on you.ScenesRachel: Oh that’s all right! Y’know, I ended up having a really good time. Y’know, the charity was a big success and they raised a lot of money and awareness.ScenesChandler: So what was it for anyway?ScenesRachel: I wanna say a disease.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: I just got this really weird message from Ross. He said turn on MTV.ScenesRachel: Huh. All right.Scenes(Rachel does so and it’s one of those dance party shows they have during spring break and we see…)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, look! That’s Elizabeth!Scenes(Suddenly Ross jumps in and starts dancing with her.)ScenesRachel: Oh-oh Professor Geller.ScenesJoey: Ahh, to be 13 again.ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenesWith Scenes Taken From Episodes Transcribed by: Mindy Mattingly Phillips, guineapig, Ruth Curran, Josh Hodge, and Me.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Phoebe is helping Joey rehearse for an audition. Phoebe is overacting her part.]
rows.Content: Joey: The reactor’s gonna blow in three seconds, we’re never gonna make it!ScenesPhoebe: You’ve got to get out of here! Save yourself!ScenesJoey: No! I won’t leave you!ScenesPhoebe: Don’t worry about me, I’m a robot! I’m just a machine!!ScenesJoey: No you’re not! Not to me!ScenesPhoebe: (she stops reading from the script) Oh my God.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesPhoebe: I am extremely talented!ScenesJoey: Yeah, you’re great! Okay, let’s take it from…ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting) No, I mean I was really acting my ass off.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I thought I was pretty good too.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, you’re solid. Yeah, you’re just no me.ScenesJoey: Y’know what? I think that’s enough for now. Yeah. I don’t want to be over rehearsed.ScenesPhoebe: (tremendously overacting) Fine! I’ll do it without you! (Joey gives her thumbs up) I don’t need you or anybody else! I’m gonna make it on my own! (Joey closes the door to his bedroom.) You’ll see!! You’ll all see!!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Joey is memorizing his lines. Chandler, Rachel, and Phoebe are there as well.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (To Joey) So uh, what’s this thing you’re auditioning for?ScenesJoey: Oh, it’s a new TV show. Yeah. I’m up for the part of Mac Macaveli or "Mac." Yeah, I’m a detective and I solve crimes with the help of my robot partner. He’s a, he’s a Computerized Humanoid Electronically Enhanced Secret Enforcer or-or "C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesRachel: So Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesJoey: That’s the title! Yeah! Y’know they really lucked out that the initials spell cheese.ScenesChandler: That is lucky.ScenesRachel: Huh—Wait so Joey if you get this, you’re gonna be like the star of your own TV show! I mean you’ll be like the Big Cheese! (To Phoebe) Or the Big Mac—Hey! You love those!ScenesJoey: Well, don’t get your hopes up, because probably not gonna happen.ScenesChandler: Now-now, why would you say that Joseph?ScenesJoey: I mean come on you guys! My own TV show? I just don’t know if I’m good enough.ScenesPhoebe: I am.ScenesRachel: Joey, what are you talking about? You’re a terrific actor.ScenesJoey: You really think so?ScenesRachel: Ugh, how can you even ask that question?!Scenes[And with that we go into the save the budget portion of the show, which features flashbacks from previous episodes. The first set of auditions feature high lights or low lights of Joey’s acting career. The first flashback is from The One With The Lesbian Wedding.]

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone is there to watch Joey's first scene as Dr. Drake Remoray.]
rows.Content: Chandler:  Whoa, she's pretty. (Mentioning the girl on TV)ScenesJoey:  Yeah, and oh she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.ScenesRachel:  I'm sorry, what?ScenesMonica:  What?ScenesRoss:  Excuse me?ScenesJoey:  It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this. (Does this intense look where it looks like he's smelling a fart.)ScenesChandler:  Oh, ok.ScenesJoey: (there's a gunshot on TV) There's my scene, there's my scene. [Joey on tv] "Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon.  I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..." (Does the smell-the-fart look.)Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With The Butt.  The gang is watching Joey in Freud!]ScenesJoey: (on stage in an Austrian accent) Vell, Eva, ve've done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.)ScenesAll you want is a dingle,ScenesWhat you envy's a schwang,ScenesA thing through which you can tinkle,ScenesOr play with, or simply let hang...Scenes[The next flashback is also from The One With The Butt and it's also on the soundtrack.  He's Joey telling everyone about his big break in Monica and Rachel's apartment.]ScenesJoey:  I play Al Pacino's butt. All right? He goes into the shower, and then- I'm his butt.ScenesMonica: (trying not to laugh) Oh my God.ScenesJoey:  C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's big!ScenesChandler: Oh no, it's terrific, it's- it's- y'know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into show business.ScenesJoey: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don't care! This is a big break for me!ScenesRoss: You're right, you're right, it is.ScenesMonica:  Yes.ScenesRoss:  So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?Scenes[Cut back to Joey about to leave for his audition for Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.]ScenesJoey: All right well, I’m outta here. Wish me luck.ScenesPhoebe: (overacting with a song this time) (singing) Gooood luck! Gooood luck! We all wish you good luuuuuuuuck!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah, whatever. (Exits.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Ross are playing chess and are both studying the board intently.]
rows.Content: Ross: It’s your turn.ScenesChandler: Oh, are we playing this?!ScenesJoey: (entering, dejectedly) Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey! How’d the audition go?ScenesJoey: Terrible! I messed up every line! I shouldn’t even be an actor!ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, are you doing that thing where you pretend it didn’t go well but it really did go well?ScenesJoey: Yeah, did I fool ya?ScenesRoss: Totally!ScenesChandler: So it did go well.ScenesJoey: Oh, it went amazingly well!ScenesRoss: Great!ScenesChandler: Oh that’s great!ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, it’s down to me and two other guys.ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesJoey: And I know both of them, they’re really good. One of them is the guy from those allergy commercials who’s always getting chased by those big flowers…ScenesRoss: Oh, I love that guy! (Laughs.)ScenesChandler: Oh-oh, what are you doing?ScenesRoss: (stops laughing) What am I doing?ScenesJoey: I’m just so nervous! Y’know? The callback isn’t until tomorrow at five. I feel like my head is going to explode!ScenesChandler: Well, it is overdue.ScenesRoss: Look, don’t worry. Okay? You’re gonna be fine.ScenesJoey: There’s just so much pressure. I mean no offense, but what you guys do is very different. I don’t know if you’d understand.ScenesRoss: Yeah, none of us have to deal with pressure at our jobs.Scenes[Thus starts another series of flashbacks all dealing with the pressure the rest of the Friends have to deal with in their jobs. The first flashback is from The One With The Stoned Guy.]

rows.Scenes: Chandler's office. He's on the phone, agitated.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (on phone) Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I'm looking at the WENUS and I'm not happy!Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With The Prom Video.  Monica is at a job interview at a new restaurant.]ScenesMonica:  Alright, well I'm tearing the lettuce.ScenesInterviewer:  Uh-huh. Is it dirty?ScenesMonica:  Oh-oh, no no don't worry, I'm gonna wash it.ScenesInterviewer:  Don't, I like it dirty.ScenesMonica:  That's your call.ScenesInterviewer:  So, uh, what are you going to do next?ScenesMonica:  Well, I thought that I would cut up the tomatos.ScenesInterviewer:  Are they, uh, firm?ScenesMonica:  They'r alright.ScenesInterviewer:  You sure they haven't gone bad? You're sure they're not very, very bad?ScenesMonica:  No really, they're OK.ScenesInterviewer:  You gonna slice them up real nice?ScenesMonica:  Actually, I was gonna do them jullienne.ScenesInterviewer:  Aaaahhhhhhh.ScenesMonica:  I'm outa here. [Monica leaves]Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With Rachel's Crush.]

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel’s new job.]
rows.Content: Rachel:  (on the phone) Monica, I’m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old woman put on a thong and she didn’t even buy it! (Pause) I’m telling you I’m quitting! That’s it! I’m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you get this message. (Hangs up.)Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With The Dozen Lasagnas, Phoebe is telling everyone but Rachel about the pass Paulo made on her.]ScenesMonica:  Well, what happened?ScenesPhoebe:  Well, he came in for a massage and everything was fine until... (The flashback shows Paulo lying face down on the massage table and slowly moving his hands up Phoebe's legs and grabbing her butt.)ScenesAll:  Ohhhhhh!ScenesRoss:  Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe:  And all of the sudden his hands weren't the problem anymore. (The flashback shows Paulo rolling over and showing Phoebe his equipment.)ScenesMonica:  Was it...ScenesPhoebe:  Oh, Boy Scouts could've camped under it!Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With Ross's Sandwich, Ross his confronting his boss about him eating Ross's sandwich.]ScenesRoss: You ate my sandwich?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: It was a simple mistake. It could happen to anyone.ScenesRoss: (getting upset) Oh-oh really?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: Now-now calm down. Come look in my office, some of it my still be in the trash.ScenesRoss: (jumping to his feet in anger) What?ScenesDr. Leedbetter: Well, it was quite large. I-I-I-I-I had to throw most of it away.ScenesRoss: You-you-you-you (trying to remain in control) threw my sandwich away!Scenes[Cut to an outside shot of the museum.]ScenesRoss:  (losing control, we hear him shout outside) MY SANDWICH?!!!Scenes[Cut to a shot of a park.]ScenesRoss: MY SANDWICH!!!!!! (Ross's scream scares a flight of pigeons away.)Scenes[Cut back to Central Perk.]ScenesJoey: I want this part so much! Y’know? If I don’t get this part I’m never gonna eat Macaroni and Cheese again!—No, I didn’t say that! That’s a lie.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Chandler is there talking to the chick and duck.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh come on guys, it’s not like I moved to Europe! I just moved across the hall! And we would have you over all the time if it weren’t for (struggles to get this out) Monica’s allergies. (The duck quacks.) You’re right, I could never lie to you. She hates you. (The phone rings.) Should I get that? (Laughs, then answers the phone.) Hello? (Listens) Uh no, Joey’s not here right now. Can I take a message? (Listens) Yeah, okay so the audition has been moved from 5:00 to 2:30? (Listens) Okay great. (Listens.) Bye. (Hangs up the phone and goes to write the message on the Magna-Doodle on the door but Monica walks in and forces him to jump out of the way.)ScenesMonica: (startled) Ahh! Aren’t you dressed yet?ScenesChandler: (looks down at his clothes) Am I naked again?!ScenesMonica: We’re supposed to meet my parents in 15 minutes.ScenesChandler: Yeah okay, I was just talking to the guys. Just look at them I mean, is it okay if they come visit?ScenesMonica: Wh?! What about my allergies?!ScenesChandler: Oh right, your allergies. (Monica leaves and to the chick and duck) All her, she hates you. (Chandler leaves without finishing the message for Joey.)

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Joey and Chandler are playing foosball and Joey scores a goal.]
rows.Content: Joey: Yes!! Ha-ha!! All right! Hey! How cool would it be if you could watch like a real life-sized version of this? Huh? I mean how crazy would that be?ScenesChandler: As crazy as soccer?Scenes(The phone rings and Joey answers it.)ScenesJoey: (on phone) Hello? (Listens) What are you talking about? The audition’s not ‘til 5:00! (Chandler suddenly remembers and looks at the unfinished message then tries to sneak over and finish it as Joey listens.) Well, nobody told me! (Listens) Who’d you talk to? (Listens and turns around to see Chandler trying to finish the message.) Nevermind! (Hangs up.)ScenesChandler: You mean you didn’t get it from this?ScenesJoey: The allergy guy got the part! Thanks!ScenesChandler: Well, maybe we can fix it y’know? Maybe we can send him some-some big-big flowers and scare him!ScenesJoey: How could you do this to me Chandler?! This part could’ve turned my whole career around!ScenesChandler: I messed up. Okay? I’m sorry, I really messed up.ScenesJoey: Hey, you don’t even live here anymore! What are you doing answering my phone? I have my machine!ScenesChandler: Which I bought for ya. Taught ya how to use it. You thought it was a copier. Look, if there was anything I could do, I would do it. Okay? But everybody’s allowed one mistake, right?Scenes[Joey just laughs as a third set of flashbacks featuring Chandler’s mistakes starts. The first flashback is from The One With The Prom Video.  It's Chandler telling Phoebe how much he hates the bracelet Joey bought him.  They're both at Central Perk.]ScenesChandler:  You know he coulda gotten me a VCR, he coulda gotten me a set of golf clubs, but no, he has to get me the woman repeller!  The eyesore from the Liberace house of crap!ScenesPhoebe:  It's not that bad.ScenesChandler:  Oh, yeah, easy for you to say, you don't have to walk around sporting some reject from the Mr. T collection. [Joey walks in behind Chandler]ScenesPhoebe:  Chandler, Chandler.ScenesChandler:  I pity the fool who puts on my jewelry, I do, I do. I pity the fool that. . . [turns around and sees Joey] Hi!Scenes[The next flashback is from The One Where Chandler Crosses The Line.  He's telling Joey that he kissed Cathy.]ScenesChandler:  Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and…ScenesJoey:  And what?! Did you sleep with her?!ScenesChandler:  No! No! No! I just kissed her.ScenesJoey:  What?!! That’s even worse!!ScenesChandler:  How is that worse?!ScenesJoey:  I don’t know! But it’s the same!ScenesChandler:  You’re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.ScenesJoey:  Over the line?! You-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!Scenes[Cut back to Joey and Rachel’s apartment.]ScenesChandler: Look, I’m not saying that you should magically forgive me! But you’re not perfect! You’ve made some errors in judgment too!ScenesJoey: Name one!Scenes[Chandler proceeds to point out Joey’s errors in this forth set of flashbacks. The first flashback is from The One With The Cat.   Chandler has just returned home to see that their apartment has been cleaned out and finds Joey trapped in the entertainment center.]ScenesChandler: (lets him out) What happened?!!ScenesJoey: (getting out) Awww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!ScenesChandler:  What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!ScenesJoey:  Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!ScenesChandler:  So--You got in voluntarily?!ScenesJoey:  I was tryin’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m gonna do?ScenesChandler:  BEND OVER?!!!Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With The Candy Hearts.  Joey and Chandler are waiting at a restaurant as Lorraine and her friend arrive.]ScenesChandler: Ok, now, remember, no trading. You get the pretty one, I get the mess.ScenesLorraine: Hi, Joey. (Sees Chandler.) Well well, look what you brought.ScenesChandler: ...And what did you bring?ScenesLorraine: She's checking the coats. Joey, I'm gonna go wash the cab smell off my hands. Will you get me a white Zinfandel, and a glass of red for Janice.ScenesChandler: Janice?Scenes(Lorraine leaves. Joey shakes his head as though to say, 'It can't be the same Janice.' Janice enters.)ScenesChandler: Janice?!ScenesJanice: Oh.... my.... God.Scenes[The next flashback is from The One With Ross's New Girlfriend.  Chandler is telling Ross and Joey that Joey's tailor took advantage of him.]ScenesChandler: Joey's tailor...took advantage of me.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: No way!  I've been going to the guy for 12 years.ScenesChandler: Oh come on!  He said he was going to do my inseam, and he ran his hand up my leg, and then, there was definite...ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: Cupping.ScenesJoey: That's how they do pants!  Ross, will you tell him? Isn't that how they measure pants?ScenesRoss: Yes, yes it is. In prison!Scenes[Cut back to the present.]ScenesJoey: I said name one!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Rachel are consoling Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can’t believe I did this! What an idiot!ScenesMonica: Oh, stop beating yourself up! People make mistakes! These things happen! There aren’t any message you’ve forgotten to give me are there? (Chandler has a disgusted look on his face.) Apparently you’re not very good at it! I…ScenesChandler: Do you think he’ll ever forgive me?ScenesRachel: Of course he will! But Chandler the most important thing is you forgive yourself!ScenesChandler: Y’know what? I-I kinda have.ScenesRachel: Already? That’s pretty bad what you did.ScenesMonica: Y’know what? He will forgive you. And I like to bring a pad with me when I go answer the phone just in case… (Chandler gets that disgusted look back.) Okay…ScenesChandler: You didn’t see how mad he was, y’know?ScenesRachel: I’m sure he will forgive you. Look, we have all been there! Y’know, you fight, you make up, it’s just the way it works.Scenes[We then go into another set of flashbacks of famous fights. The first is the second breakup of Ross and Rachel from The One With The Jellyfish.]ScenesRoss: It took two people to break up this relationship!!ScenesRachel: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!ScenesRoss: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!ScenesRachel: What?!!ScenesRoss: I fell asleep!ScenesRachel: (mocking him) You fell asleep?!ScenesRoss: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means ‘you are,’ Y-O-U-R means ‘your!’ScenesRachel: Y'know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!ScenesRoss: (starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)ScenesRachel: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!ScenesChandler: (coming out from behind the door) I KNEW IT!!!!Scenes[The next flashback is from The One After The Superbowl, Part II.  Monica and Rachel are fighting over who gets to see Jean-Claude Van Damme.]ScenesMonica: You had no right to go out with him.ScenesRachel: That is the most ridiculous...ScenesMonica: You sold me out.ScenesRachel: I did not sell you out.ScenesMonica: Yes you did.  You absolutely sold me...ScenesRachel: Would you let me talk. [flicks Monica on the forehead]ScenesMonica: Did you just flick me?ScenesRachel: OK, well, you wouldn't let me finish and I was jus- [Monica flicks her back] Ow. That hurt [flicks Monica]Scenes(They keep flicking each other. This turns into slapping each other.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh!  All right.  Now, let's not do this!Scenes(Rachel tackles Monica onto the couch.)ScenesPhoebe: Happy thoughts!  Happy thoughts!Scenes(They wrestle on the couch for a little while until Monica gets the upper hand and pulls Rachel off of the couch by her sock.  Monica removes Rachel's sock and starts beating her with it.)This leads to wrestling on the floor. This finally angers Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: OK, now I'm gonna kick some ass.Scenes(Phoebe grabs each of them by an ear.)ScenesMonica and Rachel: Ow! Ow! Ow!ScenesPhoebe: I know!  I know!  I know!ScenesPhoebe: Alright, now I will let go if you both stop.ScenesRachel: Fine!ScenesMonica: Fine!ScenesPhoebe: There we go.You know what, if we were in prison, you guys would be, like, my bitches.Scenes[The next flashback is from The One Where No One's Ready.  Joey is retaliating against Chandler hiding his underwear by wearing a whole bunch of clothes.]ScenesJoey: Okay, buddy-boy. Here it is. You hide my clothes, I'm wearing everything you own.ScenesChandler: Oh my God! ScenesJoey: Look at me! I'm Chandler! Could I be wearing any more clothes? Maybe if I wasn't going commando...Scenes(Chandler does this throat sound.)ScenesJoey: Yeah. Whew, it's hot with all of this stuff on. I ah, I better not do any, I don't know, lunges. (starts doing lunges)Scenes[The next flashback is from The One Where Eddie Moves In.   It's the sequence where Joey and Chandler are both saddened that they're not living together anymore. All By Myself is playing in the background.]Scenes[Joey's place. He goes to say something to Chandler in the other chair but no one's there. He goes to call Chandler but decides not to and throws the phone back down.]Scenes[Chandler's. He's playing foosball by himself.]Scenes[Joey's. Playing ping pong by himself.]Scenes[Chandler is sitting in front of a window while it's raining outside. We see Joey through a rainy window. The camera zooms out to show it's just his tabletop water sculpture.]

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Chandler is entering with a peace offering of a Joey Special, two pizzas.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Joey? Got you a Joey Special, two pizzas! Joe? (The phone rings and he answers it) (On phone) Hello? (Takes the phone away from his mouth when he realizes what he just did and yells.) Damnit! (Back on phone.) Hello? (Listens.) No, Joey’s not here right now, but I can take a message I think. (Listens) He’s still got a chance for the part?! Oh, that’s great news! (Listens) Well no obviously not for the actor who was mauled by his dog. (Listens) Oh well, that’s great. I will give Joey the message. Thank you! (Hangs up and goes to write the message on the Magna-Doodle.) Yes! (Reading what he’s writing) Okay, Mac audition at 2:00. Allergy actor attacked. (Pause) By dog not flowers.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Joey is entering to find Chandler waiting patiently for him.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Please tell me you got the message!ScenesJoey: What message?ScenesChandler: The actor playing Mac couldn’t do it, they needed to see you at 2 o’clock.ScenesJoey: What?! It’s 6 o’clock!ScenesChandler: Du-du-I wrote it, I wrote it on the board! I wrote it on the board, then I went all over New York City looking for ya! I went to Ross’s! I went to the coffeehouse! I went to any place that they made sandwiches!ScenesJoey: I can’t believe this Chandler!ScenesChandler: Sorry! I-I-I don’t know what to say.ScenesJoey: Well you-you-you-you might say congratulations! I saw the board! I went to the audition! I got the part!!ScenesChandler: (angrily) Is that supposed to be funny! I was really worried over here!ScenesJoey: Oh, well I’m uh…ScenesChandler: Y’know, sometimes that fake out thing is just mean!ScenesJoey: Oh wow! Okay man, I’m sorry. I did not mean to make you feel bad.ScenesChandler: Well that’s good. Because you didn’t! And I’m incredibly happy for ya!!ScenesJoey: (shocked) That’s mean! You really had me going there!ScenesChandler: Oh, we could do this all day.ScenesJoey: Yeah, you’re right. Okay look, listen, let’s talk about what a huge star I’m gonna be!ScenesChandler: You are gonna be a huge star! I’m gonna hug ya!ScenesJoey: You hug me!ScenesChandler: All right!Scenes[What follows is the final set of flashbacks that feature a whole lot of lovin’ between Chandler and Joey. There’s no words, just hugs and even the kiss from The One With The Monkey. All of this is set to the song, You’ve Really Got a Hold on Me!]Scenes[Cut back to the present, they are still in each other’s embrace.]ScenesJoey: Hey, do we do this too much?ScenesChandler: I think so. Yeah, get off me.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(They separate.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's apartment, Joey and Phoebe are reading a scene from Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.]
rows.Content: Joey: Come on C.H.E.E.S.E., I’m not leaving without you! Try routing your backup source through your primary CPU.ScenesPhoebe: (overacting badly) I can’t! My circuits are fried! They’re fried I tell you!!ScenesJoey: Wow! (Back to reading the scene.) Well then I’ll just have to carry you.Scenes(Suddenly Ross jumps up from behind the counter armed with a plastic gun. By the way, he’s overacting too.)ScenesRoss: That’ll be a neat trick, when you’re, (looks at the script) when you’re dead!ScenesJoey: Ross, you don’t have to yell.ScenesRoss: There was just an explosion, okay? My hearing would be impaired.ScenesPhoebe: I thought you were excellent! In fact for a minute there I was like, "Ooh, where’d Ross go?ScenesRoss: Thank you! And I have to say that first scene when you meet Mac…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Oh my God. I mean…ScenesJoey: Y’know what? I think that’s enough for today. Thanks for your help! (He grabs their scripts and heads for his room.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Ross) He’s holding us back.ScenesRoss: Totally.ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Ross Meets Elizabeth’s DadScenesTeleplay by: Scott SiveriScenesStory by: David J. LaganaScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, Rachel, Chandler, and Monica are there. Rachel is reading everyone’s horoscope.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay, Chandler!ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesRachel: And your horoscope says, "On the fifth a special someone is going to give you a gift.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) Oh, well thank you in advance. (Kisses her.)ScenesRachel: Op, but the twelfth brings a lover’s spat.ScenesMonica: (To Chandler) You are going to make a joke about my special present! Why would you do that?!ScenesRachel: Oh, wait and on the nineteenth a secret crush announces itself.Scenes(Phoebe winks and licks her lips while eyeing Chandler.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesChandler: Hey!!ScenesRachel: (ecstatic) Oh my God! It’s Joey Tribbiani of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!!!!!!Scenes(Everyone claps and cheers, Joey mimics looking about with a gun.)ScenesChandler: Oh that’s right. It’s your first day! So are you psyched to fight fake crime with your robot sidekick?ScenesJoey: Am I psyched? The lead in my own TV series? I’ve dreamed about this for years! Why have I not been preparing?!ScenesPhoebe: No! Joey, you’re going to be great!ScenesJoey: But I got to act with a robot Pheebs, and-and I don’t know anything about technology! I can’t even use Chandler’s computer except to find porn! And-and that’s only ‘cause it’s right there when you turn it on!ScenesMonica: I think our lover’s spat will start a little early this month.ScenesPhoebe: (in a sexy voice to Chandler) I’ll be waiting.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, time lapse. Phoebe is now looking at the covers of two different books.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Are you judging them by their covers? Because you’re really not supposed to do that.ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m just deciding which one to use—I’m gonna start writing another book!ScenesRachel: Be-because the last one was such a big seller?ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you must know I have written 14 books. And as I am the only one who has read them, I can tell you that they all have been very well received.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesRoss: What are you guys doing later?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Rachel and I have appointments to get our hair cut.ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) We do?ScenesPhoebe: I want to see what he wants first.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: (continuing) I just found out that Elizabeth’s dad wants to meet me.ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, hold the phone! You’re not Elizabeth’s dad?!ScenesRoss: Come on guys, I-I really want this guy to like me. It-it would really help me out if you guys were here to make me look good.ScenesAll: Of course we’ll help! Yeah! We’ll be here!ScenesRoss: Thanks!ScenesMonica: We know how tough those parent/teacher conferences can be.

rows.Scenes: Pier 59 Studios, it’s the set of Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E. The producer is showing Joey around the set.]
rows.Content: The Producer: (walking into Mac’s office) So uh, here’s your office set!ScenesJoey: Wow! Huh? (Picks up the phone) Mac Macaveli, Private Investigator!ScenesThe Producer: (checking his watch) Let’s get you into wardrobe for a fitting.ScenesJoey: Okay. Hey uh, when do I get to meet the robot?ScenesThe Producer: I’m sorry, why don’t we do that right now? He’s right here. (Points to a guy.)ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesThe Producer: Joey Tribbiani, this is…ScenesJoey: Oh wow! He’s so lifelike! (Starts touching the guy’s cheeks) Unbelievable! (He starts tugging on the guy’s ears.ScenesThe Producer: This is Wayne, the man who created and operates C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesJoey: (slaps Wayne on his cheek) How do you do there, Wayne? (Backs away.)ScenesThe Producer: I’ll let you two guys get acquainted, huh? (Walks away.)ScenesJoey: Okay. Sorry about that…(Mimics that cheek thing he just did.) Uh, so where’s C.H.E.E.S.E.?ScenesWayne: C.H.E.E.S.E. is right here. (He puts on his headset, picks up the controller, and wheels C.H.E.E.S.E. in. C.H.E.E.S.E. is just a plain old robot on tracks; he kinda looks like No. 5 in the movie Short Circuit.)ScenesC.H.E.E.S.E.: (Wayne with a computerized voice) Nice to meet you Mac!ScenesJoey: (laughs) This is like the temporary robot, right?ScenesWayne: No. Why?ScenesJoey: Well, I-I just, I just it was going to be like a really cool robot, y’know? Like the terminator or uh, when I first saw you.ScenesWayne: I spent two years developing this machine, it’s absolutely state of the art.ScenesJoey: I’m sorry, it just—I don’t know it doesn’t really look like it can do anything.ScenesWayne: It can do this. (He moves C.H.E.E.S.E.’s arm close to Joey’s special area and he jumps back.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is at the counter drinking coffee as Elizabeth enters with her dad, Paul. Elizabeth goes to kiss Ross, but he just kisses her on the forehead. By the way Paul is played by Bruce Willis. Yes, that Bruce Willis from Moonlighting, Die Hard, and Armageddon.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: This is my father, Paul Stevens. Dad, this is Ross Geller.ScenesRoss: It-it’s great to meet you Paul.ScenesPaul: I usually prefer Elizabeth’s boyfriends to address me as Mr. Stevens.ScenesRoss: Of course, of course, Mr. Stevens.ScenesPaul: So Ross, what your problem?ScenesRoss: Eh-wh—Excuse me?ScenesPaul: Why can’t you get a girlfriend your own age?ScenesRoss: That’s funny. Umm…. (Pause, then serious) It’s not funny.ScenesPaul: I don’t like you going out with my daughter Ross.ScenesRoss: Okay. I can, I can see that. Umm, but I think if you give me umm, one chance I can, I can change your mind.ScenesPaul: Okay.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPaul: Okay. I’ll give you one chance to change my mind. (Ross laughs in relief) You got one minute. (Ross suddenly gets worried.)ScenesElizabeth: Daddy!ScenesPaul: Fine! Two minutes. Go.ScenesRoss: This is—you—(Ross starts laughing.)ScenesPaul: (laughs then checking his watch) 1 minute 50 seconds.ScenesRoss: Okay, umm I want you to know that I have never done anything like this before. I mean, I mean I’ve been in um, relationships in general, uh but I have never done it with a student—I mean I not—not it! I mean, I mean I don’t—We haven’t done it. Uh, I mean, I mean, we’ve-we’ve-we’ve done stuff. (Paul is not amused.) Okay, okay, a joke, a joke—lighten the mood. Umm, two guys go into a bar. One of them is Irish.ScenesPaul: I’m Irish.ScenesRoss: And the Irish guy wins the joke!Scenes(Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe enter.)ScenesMonica: Ross!!ScenesChandler: Ross!ScenesMonica: How crazy that we’d run into you!ScenesRoss: Oh God, thank you! (Runs and gives all of them a group hug.) Umm, uh, Mr. Stevens I’d like you to meet my friends uh, this is Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler.ScenesPhoebe: You’re Elizabeth’s father, huh? I can see now where she gets her rugged handsomeness.ScenesMonica: (obviously attracted to him) Is-is-is there a-a Mrs. Stevens?ScenesChandler: There’s a Mr. Bing!ScenesPaul: No, unfortunately Lizzie’s mom passed away shortly after she was born. I raised her by myself.ScenesPhoebe and Monica: (sympathetic) Ohh!ScenesPaul: I get that a lot.ScenesRoss: Okay umm, why don’t we all take a seat, y’know? And uh, and I’ll get us all some uh some coffees—(He goes to pull out Elizabeth’s chair, but Paul steps in)—Yeah, why don’t you. (Paul pulls out her chair) Uh and you guys can talk about whatever, whatever you want. Y’know? Whatever pops into your head. (He turns his back to Paul and Elizabeth and points to himself for Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe. Then he goes to order the coffee.)ScenesMonica: Y’know, it is so strange seeing Ross here this time of day, ‘cause usually he’s got the children’s hospital.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Not looking for dates. (Monica turns in horror.)ScenesElizabeth: So uh, Monica is Ross’s sister.ScenesMonica: And he’s a great brother!ScenesPaul: I had a sister.ScenesMonica: Ohh!ScenesPaul: She passed away.ScenesMonica and Phoebe: (sympathetic) Ohh!ScenesPaul: Oh, you don’t have to do that every time.ScenesChandler: But uh Ross, Ross is a great guy! I was roommates with him in college. Uh, funny story… (He starts laughing then notices that Paul isn’t happy.) You’re roommate in college died didn’t he?ScenesPaul: A part of him did yes.ScenesRoss: (returning with the coffee) Okay here we are Paul, Elizabeth. (He sets down their cups.) So I hope you guys were finding something to talk about.ScenesChandler: Yes, we were just…Scenes(Rachel runs in.)ScenesRachel: Hi, I’m sorry I’m late but I am ready, ready to talk you up! When does Liz’s father get here?ScenesPaul: I’m already here.ScenesRachel: Oh! Ross is sooo great!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Phoebe is working on her book at the kitchen table, Monica is on the couch, and Chandler is entering from the bathroom carrying a package of toilet paper.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey honey, you got the kind with the little girl, you said we were gonna to get the kind with the baby.ScenesMonica: No, you said the baby creeps you out.ScenesChandler: No, the little girl creeps me out.ScenesMonica: You said the baby.ScenesChandler: Why would the baby creep me out?ScenesMonica: Why would the little girl creep you out?ScenesPhoebe: (writing frantically) You guys, I’m sorry, could you please talk a little slower?ScenesChandler: This is going in your book?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, it’s about relationships. Y’know? The traps, the pitfalls, what not to do, keep going. This stuff is great!ScenesMonica: What?! Excuse me!ScenesPhoebe: And how none of it matters when the people really love each other. (Chandler and Monica kiss.) And how people will believe anything you tell them as long as it’s a compliment.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is there alone as Paul enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (seeing him) Oh hi!ScenesPaul: Hi! Hi. (He’s looking around.) I think I left my keys here somewhere.ScenesRachel: Oh! Well let’s look for them. (Finds some under one of the couch cushions. It has a pink, fuzzy ball on the key chain.) Oh-oh-hey! Are these them?ScenesPaul: No.ScenesRachel: All right! (Throws them back under the cushion.)ScenesPaul: Oh, here they are right here. (Picks them up from underneath the corner of the couch.)ScenesRachel: Oh good.ScenesPaul: Thanks for your help. (Starts to leave.)ScenesRachel: (chasing after him) Oh, wait! Sorry, Mr. Paul? Mr. Paul?ScenesPaul: Just call me Paul.ScenesRachel: Paul. Umm, I just wanted you to know that Ross really is a great guy.ScenesPaul: Well maybe you can date him then that would save me the trouble of killing him. (Rachel laughs then starts looking at him.) Are you okay?ScenesRachel: You just don’t look old enough to have a twenty-year-old daughter.ScenesPaul: Well, we were very young when we had her.ScenesRachel: Oh. We?ScenesPaul: Well yeah, it usually, it takes two people to… (He taps his index fingers together.)ScenesRachel: Oh no! Yes! Of course, I know that! I just—I meant y’know are you still a ‘We’ or are you just ‘You?’ScenesPaul: I’m just me, my wife died shortly after Lizzie was born.ScenesRachel: (sympathetic) Ohh. So you raised her all on your own?ScenesPaul: Yes I did.ScenesRachel: Ohh. (She touches his arm for support and likes what she feels) Ooh!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Phoebe is still writing in her book, Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: How was your first day?ScenesJoey: Pretty great! Except I did get a little attitude from the robot.ScenesChandler: Damn those robots, they’re supposed to be our faithful servants!ScenesJoey: Anyway, it wasn’t the robot, it was the guy who controls him. Yeah, he doesn’t like me. He had C.H.E.E.S.E. knock over the sandwich right when I was reaching for one! Ohh!ScenesPhoebe: Well, why don’t you just get him fired?ScenesJoey: I may have to, I hate to do it, but I’m the star! Y’know? There’s a limit to how many sandwiches I can eat off the floor. (His cell phone rings) Excuse me. (Answers it, on phone) Joey Tribbiani.ScenesEstelle: (on the other end) Joe! I’m glad I found ya, I got an audition for ya!ScenesJoey: Wow!ScenesEstelle: The thing is it’s kinda on the Q.T. The actor who has the part doesn’t know he might be fired. It’s the lead in a series, Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesJoey: I’m the lead in Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.!!ScenesEstelle: Uh-oh!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Ross is entering looking for Joey, but instead he finds Paul and Rachel making out on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: Joey?!ScenesPaul: Hi Ross.ScenesRachel: I was just getting him to like you.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, scene is continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Ross: Joey?! Joey!! (He runs into his bedroom.)ScenesRachel: Ross, Joey is not here.ScenesRoss: Okay, I’ll just wait for him in here!ScenesRachel: Ross, it’s okay. You can come out.ScenesPaul: Yeah Ross it’s okay, it’s me, Mr. Stevens.ScenesRoss: (coming out of the bedroom) Oh! Oh my God! I didn’t even see you!ScenesPaul: Sure you did! You came in, you got all awkward, and you ran into the bedroom. You were shouting, "Joey! Joey!" Bye Rach. (Kisses her.)ScenesRachel: Bye!ScenesPaul: I’ll call you later. Bye Ross. (Leaves)ScenesRoss: What-what-what the—how da-how did-what the-how did-what?!ScenesRachel: Well, y’know he lost his keys so he was looking for them…ScenesRoss: (incredulous) In your mouth?!ScenesRachel: No! Downstairs! And we got to talking y’know, for like two hours, and I really liked him so I invited him up here for a cup of coffee.ScenesRoss: You were at the coffeehouse!ScenesRachel: Ross, what’s the big deal? So I kissed the guy!ScenesRoss: He is my girlfriend’s father, okay? It’s-it’s, it’s weird!ScenesRachel: Wh—You dated my sister!ScenesRoss: That was different!ScenesRachel: What? Why?!ScenesRoss: This is weird for me!ScenesRachel: Ross look, look this is good for you. Okay? Let’s face it, so far the guy’s not lovin’ ya! But I can turn that around! I got the inside track! We can all go out to dinner, y’know? And I can talk you up! Ross, the guy is a very, very successful lawyer!ScenesRoss: How is that important?ScenesRachel: Oh it’s important!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Joey is telling everyone about his impending termination at Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E.]
rows.Content: Joey: Apparently, there’s like a million guys out there that can play Mac, and there’s only this one robot and this one guy who controls it! I didn’t know he could get me fired! What am I going to do?ScenesMonica: Well y’know Joey, you’re a pretty charming guy.ScenesJoey: Thanks, but I kinda have a problem to deal with here.ScenesMonica: No sweetie, you’ve got to win over the guy that controls C.H.E.E.S.E.! You’ve got to kiss some serious robot ass!ScenesJoey: That’s not a bad idea. Yeah. Okay, but if I got to turn on the charm tomorrow I’m not wasting anymore of it over here with you guys. (Starts to leave, but stops and turns to Phoebe.) Well, actually I got a little bit saved for you Pheebs. (Exits.)ScenesChandler: So do you think uh, Joey’s more charming than me?ScenesMonica: Yeah! That’s why I’m sleeping with him on the side.ScenesChandler: Yeah, you wish. (Stops to think about it and gets depressed.)ScenesPhoebe: (writing in her book) "You wish.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, stop writing about us!ScenesPhoebe: I’m not writing about you! I’m writing about other people.ScenesChandler: Who?ScenesPhoebe: Marcia and Chester.ScenesMonica: Okay fine! Fine! Then you know what, I’ll just write about Phyllis! Hmm!ScenesChandler: Hmm.ScenesMonica: (writing on a piece of paper) Phyllis is sitting in a chair.ScenesChandler: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: I see what you’re doing!ScenesMonica: (still writing) Phyllis sees what I’m doing.ScenesChandler: Oh-oh.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I have tasted my own medicine and it is bitter!

rows.Scenes: Pier 59 Studios, Joey is walking up to C.H.E.E.S.E. and Wayne.]
rows.Content: Joey: Morning! Hey, how’s my favorite genius and my little robot buddy?! (Pats C.H.E.E.S.E. on the head.)ScenesWayne: Don’t touch him!ScenesJoey: Okay! (He yanks his hand away.) All right. Umm, all right Wayne, level with me. Okay? I-I keep hearing all these rumors that I might get fired. Okay, they even have actors coming in to read for my part! Come on man, you-you got to give me a second chance! I mean, I love-I love this little guy! (He grabs C.H.E.E.S.E.’s arm and pulls it off at the elbow.) Ah-ah!! (Wayne is shocked.) Okay, that’s why you didn’t want me to touch him right? Here you go! Okay? (Hands Wayne the arm and he goes to fix it. Meanwhile Joey starts to berate himself.) Stupid! I can’t believe it! God! (A very beautiful woman walks by.) (To her) Hey, how you doin’? (He and her go over to talk and Wayne looks on with envy.)

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Ross and Rachel are on their double date. Rachel is busy talking Ross up.]
