rows.Content: Rachel: So it seemed that my prom date had stood me up, so Ross selflessly, offered to take me.ScenesElizabeth: What a nice story!ScenesPaul: So Ross was in college and decided to jump at the chance to take a young girl to her high school prom.ScenesRachel: Wow! I definitely did not see that one backfiring! I’m gonna go to the bathroom.ScenesRoss: Yeah, take your time.Scenes(Rachel heads for the bathroom.)ScenesRoss: (to Paul) Just-just so you know I was a freshman and she was a senior. So it wasn’t as bad as-as…ScenesPaul: Ross, look, I know I’ve been giving you a lot of jabs and it’s partly because I’m very protective of Lizzie, and partly because well, they just keep coming to me. But I have to admit that after all the wonderful things that Lizzie has told me and the many, many, (pause) many stories that Rachel has told me that, well (pause) you’re not (pause) all bad.ScenesRoss: Not all bad.ScenesPaul: And anyhow, I’m sorry I was so harsh before, but you have to understand that I (pause) still look at Lizzie like she’s a twelve-year-old girl.ScenesRoss: Yeah. You know what? I know what you mean; I do that too.ScenesPaul: I beg your pardon?ScenesRoss: No! No! Not—I don’t mean I-I see her as a twelve-year-old girl! I mean I-I have a son, who’s umm six and I still think of him as a baby.ScenesPaul: You have a son?ScenesRoss: Yeah, well my-my ex-wife and I share custody of Ben and umm, uh, and just so you know, Carol and I are on excellent terms as I’m sure you are with your wife! (Realizes) Oh, I’m sorry! (To Elizabeth) It’s unbelievable!ScenesPaul: Don’t worry about it, I just didn’t realize you were married. (Rachel returns and hears that.)ScenesRachel: Oh we were, but that was just a (pause as the audience reacts), I mean that was just a big drunken mistake.ScenesRoss: You’re back.ScenesPaul: You two were married?!ScenesRachel: Oh! Whoops! I’m sorry, you were talking about Emily!Scenes(Ross slams his head down on the table.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Chandler are entering and they’re arguing.]
rows.Content: Monica: Chandler, we said we would meet at the coffeehouse at six.ScenesChandler: We said seven!ScenesMonica: We said six!ScenesChandler: The only way that I said six would be if the seven’s, let meet at seven, not at six.ScenesMonica: Yeah and if I had seven, maybe I would’ve said something like this, "Wow! My boyfriend’s such a wise ass—seven!ScenesPhoebe: (Turning around in the chair) Hi!ScenesChandler: Oh my good God.ScenesMonica: Ugh!ScenesPhoebe: I know what time you said.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Well actually, I know what time Chester and Marcia said.ScenesMonica: What time?ScenesPhoebe: Quite an interesting turn of events, suddenly it’s my book to the rescue, huh? (Reading her book) Ooh, very interesting. Yeah, well this certainly clears things up.ScenesChandler: (disgusted) What does it say?!ScenesPhoebe: I will tell you as soon as you thank me for writing my book.ScenesChandler: Thank you for writing your book. Its-its uh, great book and you are the queen of everything.ScenesPhoebe: Thanks! So are you.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) I told you I should not wear this color. (He’s wearing a reddish-orange sweater.)ScenesPhoebe: (reading from her book) Mon… (Pause as she restarts) Marcia and Chester are planning on seeing a movie on Sunday night. Marcia thinks they’re supposed to meet at six, Chester thinks it’s at seven.ScenesChandler: So you knew we were gonna miss the movie!ScenesPhoebe: That’s right.ScenesMonica: Inside of telling us you decided to write in your stupid book!ScenesPhoebe: (writing in her book) Marcia and Chester are mad at Phyllis.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Dressing Room, Joey and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Joey: I can’t believe I’m going to lose this job!ScenesChandler: Oh I’m so sorry man! Is there anything I can do?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Help me get this mini-fridge past the security guard.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Joey answers it to Wayne.)ScenesWayne: Hey Joey, I want to talk to you.ScenesJoey: Yeah? Well, I don’t want to talk to you Wayne! I hate you! You ruined my life! Oh, Chandler, Wayne. Wayne, Chandler. (They shake hands.)ScenesChandler: Hi, how are ya?ScenesWayne: Joey, Joey, I-I-I’ll g-get you your job back if you help me out.ScenesJoey: (incredulous) Why should I help you?!ScenesChandler: (whispering in Joey’s ear) The reason he just said.ScenesJoey: (happily) What do you need?ScenesWayne: I-I-I saw you on stage talking to that beautiful woman, y’know Sarah?ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesWayne: I wish I could talk to her.ScenesJoey: What are you in love with her or something?ScenesWayne: Yeah. Her. All of them. Anyone.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’ve been there my friend.ScenesWayne: Listen, I-I guarantee you keep your job if you can teach me how to talk to women like you do.ScenesJoey: Oh wow Wayne, it’s not really something you can teach y’know? It’s pretty much something you’re born with if you—(Off Chandler’s look)—You-you can teach it! I’ll show you right how to do it.

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Rachel is still trying to talk up Ross, not to much success.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I mean if you think about it, I mean Ross did learn something from each marriage.ScenesPaul: How to make the next one even shorter?ScenesRachel: Now wait a minute that’s not fair. He was married to me a hell of a lot longer than he was married to Emily, he just didn’t tell me. (Everyone looks at her, Ross not happily.) Maybe I have to pee again. (Gets up to try to use the bathroom.)ScenesPaul: Well, this is fun. So Ross, did you kill any of these wives?ScenesRoss: Y’know what? I-I-I… I-I have had enough of this! Y’know, I-I-I care a great deal about your daughter and I have treated her with nothing but respect! So if-if you’ve got a problem with me, frankly…ScenesPaul: Are you yelling at me?!ScenesRoss: God no!ScenesElizabeth: Y’know what daddy? If you don’t like Ross, that’s fine. It doesn’t matter to me, I’m gonna go out with him anyway.ScenesPaul: Really?! (She nods in the affirmative.)ScenesRoss: Well if it doesn’t matter to her, it doesn’t matter to me! (to Paul) Still not yelling!ScenesPaul: Wow. What can I say? (Pause, pointing at Ross) This doesn’t make me like you any better!ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I’m not so crazy about myself right now either.ScenesPaul: Then we agree?ScenesRoss: Uh yeah, I guess—Yeah! I guess so.ScenesPaul: Neither of us like Ross!ScenesElizabeth: I like Ross.ScenesRoss: Ohhh! Kids!ScenesRachel: (returning) Wait-wait-wait, I just thought of another story about how nice Ross is!ScenesRoss: That’s okay Rach, we’re not liking Ross right now.ScenesRachel: Oh! I’ve got a lot of those too!ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Mac’s Office, Mac is talking to C.H.E.E.S.E. about their case.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well, it turns out you were right C.H.E.E.S.E.ScenesC.H.E.E.S.E.: The shipment never made it through Omaha?ScenesJoey: You got it! And the rabbi’s beard, 100% horsehair. Nice catch C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Pauses as he waits for C.H.E.E.S.E.’s next line.) It’s your line C.H.E.E.S.E.! (Suddenly C.H.E.E.S.E. goes crazy and starts flinging it’s arms and advancing on Joey behind the desk.) Wayne! Wayne!!Scenes(The camera cuts to Wayne who’s busy making out with Sarah and rubbing C.H.E.E.S.E.’s controller on her back causing C.H.E.E.S.E. to go crazy. Joey starts throwing books at C.H.E.E.S.E. to get him to stop.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Paul’s The ManScenesTeleplay by: Sherry Bilsing & Ellen PlummerScenesStory by: Brian CaldirolaScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are there as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (dejected) Hi, you guys.ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesRachel: What’s the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Well it’s just—it’s one of those situations that I just hate. Y’know? A massage client gave me three tickets to the Helmet-Pelts exhibit at the Morgan Chase museum.ScenesJoey: (nodding knowingly) Now you’re thinking you gotta sleep with him.ScenesPhoebe: No! No! It’s just that he gave me three tickets and there are six of us!ScenesChandler: I’ll give up my ticket.ScenesJoey: Me too.ScenesPhoebe: Okay that’s so generous!ScenesChandler: And I think Ross is generous too.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Okay then it’s just us girls!ScenesMonica and Rachel: (less than enthused) Great.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: So what-what is the exhibit.ScenesPhoebe: It’s mostly just photographs of lesbian love scenes interspersed with video games and free sandwiches.ScenesJoey: Oh man! (Hits Chandler)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey Ross listen Chandler got you out of going to the lesbian sandwich museum this weekend!ScenesRoss: Thanks? But I have plans; Elizabeth and I are going out of town.ScenesMonica: Oh that’s great!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: I mean think about all the money that you’re gonna make!ScenesRoss: Why? What?ScenesMonica: Well, her father pays you for baby-sitting right?ScenesRoss: No, no, that’s funny. But maybe it’s time to move on, let it go, y’know? Stop it! Besides, Rachel is going out with Elizabeth’s father, so ah, he’s much older than she is. Looks like I’m not the only one interested in fossils, huh?ScenesRachel: I mean Ross all that does is remind us that you are interested in fossils.ScenesRoss: Okay, okay. Uh, well uh, Rachel is going to need to yell sweet nothings (Paul enters) in his ear.Scenes(And walks up right behind Ross, and standard sitcom joke 2B follows with the person being insulted standing right behind the person doing the insulting while the rest of the people become frightened and try to warn the insulter about the insultee’s presence.)ScenesChandler: Ross.ScenesRoss: Oh, come on you guys; that’s funny! Y’know? Because he’s need—he’s got like a hearing aide y’know, ‘cause-‘cause y’know, ‘cause he’s all old, and…Scenes(Paul reveals his presence by laughing, thus concluding standard sitcom joke 2B. Paul then pulls Ross aside to have a little chat with him and tells the rest of the group that he’ll just be one second.)ScenesPaul: Okay look, Ross, just so you know that since Lizzie likes you so much, I’ve decided to accept the fact that you’re going out with her.ScenesRoss: Really? That okay, that’s great.ScenesPaul: Yeah. But then I changed my mind. I’m funny like that. So I told Lizzie, now I’m telling you, I don’t want you seeing my daughter anymore.ScenesRoss: All right look, I-I realize it upsets you.ScenesPaul: Yes it does.ScenesRoss: But, Elizabeth and I are-are both adults and so I don’t think there’s really anything you can do about it.ScenesPaul: I’ll call the university and tell them about your relationship and have you fired.ScenesRoss: Ohh! A man with a plan!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: A Dry Cleaners, Joey is there with Phoebe and is trying to get his picture put back amongst the other celebrities hanging on the walls.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, this is so exciting! You get your picture back up on the wall of fame! Eek!ScenesJoey: I know. It was so cool when I was up there before. Me and Jim Belushi would just be crackin’ up about something… Then I get fired off of Days Of Our Lives and he takes me down. Now he’s just laughing at me. Look at him, that smug Belushi bastard, I’ll…ScenesPhoebe: (gasps) Ohh, okay maybe they put your picture back up they can put you next to Matt Lauer. Look at him, smiling at me. (Giggles) Yeah I know; we’d be great together!Scenes(The dry cleaner finishes with the customer in front of Joey and they approach the counter.)ScenesJoey: Hey! So I’m back.ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: Who are you?ScenesJoey: Joey Tribbiani! From the wall! (The dry cleaner doesn’t remember) Okay, maybe this will jog your memory, huh? (Holds his picture up in front of his face.) Huh? Okay eh-ah-anyway, I’m ready to go back up on the wall I’m the star of a new TV show.ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: (picking up a TV Guide) Show me in the table.ScenesJoey: Oh well, it’s not on TV yet.ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: Well, then it’s not on the wall yet.ScenesJoey: Okay, fine, I will bring you a tape, huh? (Walks away)ScenesPhoebe: So umm, now do you have any of Matt Lauer’s clothes here? Maybe? Just ones that haven’t been cleaned yet?Scenes(The dry cleaner just stares at her and she retreats.)

rows.Scenes: The Morgan Chase Museum, the girls are entering.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, I love museums!ScenesRachel: Umm.ScenesMonica: Soakin’ up all the culture.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Where do you want to start?ScenesRachel: Ooh, the gift shop!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Hey, and then lunch.ScenesRachel: Oh, wait yes, but I can’t eat too much. Paul is taking me out to dinner tonight, he said he has a big surprise planned.ScenesPhoebe: Oh wow. What, do you think maybe he’s gonna tell you that he’s gay?ScenesRachel: What?! No! Why?!ScenesPhoebe: No reason! That would just be a really big surprise, right?Scenes(A museum official enters with another man and woman.)ScenesThe Museum Official: (to the couple) You can put the aisle over here (points), and put the wedding ceremony right over here. (Points.)ScenesRachel: I didn’t know you could get married here.ScenesMonica: This would be a beautiful place to get married, yeah, but I wouldn’t put the aisle there and I would never have the ceremony there! (Points to both places.) I mean you’d have the ceremony under this big beautiful arch. (The arch at the entrance to the room.)ScenesThe Museum Official: (To Monica) May I help you?ScenesRachel: Oh sorry didn’t mean to interrupt. It’s just such a beautiful space; do you do a lot of weddings here?ScenesThe Museum Official: Yes. We’re very popular. There’s a two-year waiting list. Sorry! (She kinda storms out with the couple.)ScenesRachel: Monica, you should totally put your name down on the listScenesMonica: What?! Are you crazy?! I’m not getting married! I’m not even engaged.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but there’s a two-year wait. And then what if you get engaged in two years and then you got to wait another two years for this place. That’s four years. Chandler’s not gonna wait that long. He’s gonna find somebody else, y’know? Someone, someone who did put their name on the list. (Rachel agrees.)ScenesRachel: Yeah hon, it can’t hurt to put your name down! I mean in if two years if you’re not engaged you just don’t use it.ScenesMonica: Well, I mean I guess there is no harm in putting my name down.ScenesRachel: I’m gonna do it too!ScenesPhoebe: Me too!ScenesRachel: Really? Who would, who would you marry?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, I don’t have anyone right now. Y’know?ScenesRachel: Oh Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Don’t feel too sorry for me. At least my boyfriend isn’t gay.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, that stuff is…ScenesPhoebe: Don’t even get me started on yours!

rows.Scenes: The Dry Cleaners, Joey is trying to get his picture up again.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering) Hey! So, did you watch the tape of my show?ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: I did.ScenesJoey: All right, let’s get me back up there! (Holds out his picture.)ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: No! It don’t go up on the wall!ScenesJoey: What—But you saw the show!ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: Yes, it was very offensive to my people!ScenesJoey: Dry cleaners?ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: Russians! It showed them as terrorists and villains!ScenesJoey: Okay! Okay, look! You-you-you got Harrison Ford up there!ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: That’s right. Mr. Ford is a very good customer, he brings us a lot of clothes; you bring us nothing!ScenesJoey: Okay well that may be true. But, in-in okay, Air Force One the Russians were terrorists! And evil! And plus he kills a bunch of them! That-that-that’s offensive to Russians.ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: I’ve never seen it!ScenesJoey: Oh you should, it’s great.Scenes(The Dry Cleaner stares at him and Joey retreats.)

rows.Scenes: A Cabin in the Woods, Elizabeth is giving Ross a tour.]
rows.Content: Ross: This place is really beautiful!ScenesElizabeth: Yeah, I’ve been coming here since I was a kid. This used to be my Grandma’s.ScenesRoss: Wow! The only thing I got from my Grandmother was her eyes. I mean not-not her actual eyeballs, but, but people say that my eyes—Do-do you want to make out?ScenesElizabeth: Sure!Scenes(They fall to the couch and start to make out, but Ross stops suddenly.)ScenesElizabeth: Are you okay? What’s wrong?ScenesRoss: Ehh, I was just, I was just thinking about your father.ScenesElizabeth: Well, whatever works for ya…ScenesRoss: No. No-no uh, he just, he just really freaked me out before.ScenesElizabeth: Oh. Well, so we have to hide our relationship from one more person. Big deal. Besides, it’s kinda fun hiding.ScenesRoss: Yeah.Scenes(They start making out again.)ScenesElizabeth: (quietly) Hey umm, you brought protection right?ScenesRoss: (loudly) Why?! Are there like bears or something?! (Looks around and then sees that Elizabeth is shaking her head no and realizes what Elizabeth meant.) Ohh. Oh, protection. Yeah-no, yeah-no, that-that-that I forgot.ScenesElizabeth: I’ll just run to the store and get some.ScenesRoss: Oh no! Hey-hey, I’m the guy! I’ll get it.ScenesElizabeth: Do you know where the store is?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesElizabeth: Do you want to ride around town on my little pink bicycle?ScenesRoss: A little bit.ScenesElizabeth: (laughs) I’ll be back in ten minutes.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesElizabeth: Why don’t you get in the hot tub and I’ll meet you there.ScenesRoss: Ohh, okay.Scenes(Elizabeth leaves and Ross starts to remove his clothing right there in the middle of the living room where someone can see him. Of course, someone almost does, but he hears a door opening and…)ScenesRachel: (from another room) Oh my God, what a great surprise! This is such a beautiful house.Scenes(Ross with his pants around his ankles tries to run, but Dr. Geller forgets that he has his pants around his ankles and falls down trying to flee.)ScenesPaul: (To Rachel) Thank you, it’s my mom’s. So this is the kitchen.Scenes(Dr. Geller, the man with the Ph.D. in Paleontology, is trying to find a place to hide, but this supposedly intelligent man in the hands of clich�d scriptwriters runs around with his pants down around his ankles like one of the Three Stooges.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is reading the newspaper as the phone rings. He let’s the machine answer it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (on machine) You’ve reached Monica and Chandler’s, if you’re listening to this message, we’re probably screening. (to himself) Yeah we are.ScenesThe Museum Official: (on phone) Hi, this is Heldi from the Morgan Chase museum. I’m calling for Monica Geller. I want to let her know that there was a cancellation and if she’s still interested in having the Bing-Geller wedding at our facility, it is available… (Chandler runs to answer the phone.)ScenesChandler: (on phone) This is Chandler Bing! This is Chandler Bing! (Listens) Yes, the groom—No! Not the groom!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Paul’s Cabin, Paul and Rachel are sitting on the couch drinking wine and talking.]
rows.Content: Rachel: It’s so secluded up here.ScenesPaul: I know. I like it up here.ScenesRachel: I feel like we’re the only two people in the world. (She sets down her wine class, picks up a walnut, and knocks another one on the floor.) Oops. Sorry. (She reaches down to pick it up and Ross hands it to her. Ross is hiding under the couch and causes Rachel to scream.)ScenesPaul: What’s the matter honey? Did you see a little mouse?ScenesRachel: No-no! Big bear! Big bear outside! I think I-I—would you—actually, would you go check on that?ScenesPaul: Honey, we don’t have any bears here.ScenesRachel: Well, okay. Would-would you get me a Diet Coke?ScenesPaul: Okay. I’ll be right back. (Gets up and heads for the kitchen.)ScenesRachel: Okay. (After Paul leaves Rachel drops to the floor to confront Ross.) What?! What are you doing here?!ScenesRoss: What are you doing here?!ScenesRachel: I came with Paul!ScenesRoss: Yeah, I recognize the ankles!ScenesRachel: Get up!ScenesPaul: (entering) Here you go honey! (Rachel kicks Ross back under the couch.)ScenesRachel: Ahh. Thank you!ScenesPaul: Diet Coke. (Hands her the glass.)ScenesRachel: Op, ice. I need ice.ScenesPaul: Okay.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesPaul: I’ll be right back. (He goes to get the ice.)ScenesRoss: (under the couch) You and your ice.ScenesRachel: Ugh! Get out! Get out! Go! Come on! (Ross gets up and heads for the kitchen.) No! Not in there! He’s in there! (She points Ross to the door next to the kitchen.)ScenesRoss: (before entering) Did you really hear a bear?ScenesRachel: Go-go!ScenesPaul: (entering) Here you go honey. One Diet Coke with ice.ScenesRachel: Ohh, thank you.ScenesPaul: I’m so happy that you’re here.ScenesElizabeth: (entering) Here I am!ScenesPaul: (jumping up) Elizabeth! Oh look, Elizabeth’s here! Who are you talking to?ScenesElizabeth: Uh, you guys?ScenesPaul: How did you know we were here?ScenesElizabeth: Umm…ScenesRachel: Well, she-she ob-obviously saw the tire tracks that were leading up to the closed garage.ScenesElizabeth: Obviously.ScenesPaul: Elizabeth, what are you doing here?! (Motions that he brought Rachel here to be alone with her.)ScenesRachel: Did-did you come up here to work on that term paper or something?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah! Yep.ScenesRachel: Well, why do y’know go in that room (points to the room Ross is in) and do your homework?ScenesElizabeth: Ohh, I wouldn’t do it in there. That’s my dad’s bedroom.ScenesRachel: That’s your, that’s your dad’s bedroom. (Yelling) That’s your dad’s bedroom!ScenesPaul: Why are you yelling?ScenesRachel: Whoa, that Diet Coke just went straight to my head! Woo!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is sitting at the kitchen table staring at the phone as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi, honey.ScenesChandler: (gets up) See you later. (Starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: What? I-I bought groceries, I was gonna make you dinner!ScenesChandler: (angrily) Well next time ask! Or at least wait for me to ask! (He storms out.)Scenes(Monica puts the groceries down and goes to check the answering machine and hears.)ScenesThe Museum Official: (on machine) Hi, this is Heldi from the Morgan Chase museum. I’m calling for Monica Geller.ScenesMonica: Oh no!ScenesThe Museum Official: (on machine) I want to let her know that there was a cancellation and if she’s still interested in having the Bing-Geller wedding at our facility, it is available…ScenesMonica: Oh please, he didn’t hear it! He didn’t hear it!!ScenesChandler: (on machine) This is Chandler Bing! This is Chandler Bing! (The machine beeps off.)ScenesMonica: NOOOO!!!!!!!!

rows.Scenes: The Dry Cleaner’s, Joey has brought in a bunch of laundry in another attempt to get his picture on the wall, but the dry cleaner isn’t working right now. Instead, a beautiful woman is working.]
rows.Content: Female Clerk: Can I help you?ScenesJoey: Uh yeah, where-where’s the guy who decides who’s pictures go up on the wall?ScenesFemale Clerk: He’s not here right now.ScenesJoey: Oh, you’re kidding me! All-all right, well make sure you tell him that Joey Tribbiani stopped by to drop off all of these clothes. Okay? I’m an actor; I’m kinda getting my picture up there on the wall.ScenesFemale Clerk: Y’know, there are two people who could put your picture up there. (She makes eyes at him.)ScenesJoey: Oh really? Well, maybe you and I go out for drinks? (Pause) You’re the other one right? (She thinks about it for a second and nods yes.)

rows.Scenes: Paul’s Cabin, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Paul: So Lizzie, are-are-are you planning on staying the night?ScenesElizabeth: Oh no-no believe me, I’m leaving as soon as possible!ScenesPaul: Good. Good. Not that we don’t want you to stay, obviously you’re welcome—How much more homework do you have?ScenesElizabeth: Ahh, I just have one problem left that I do not know how to solve. Uhh, Rachel maybe you want to come upstairs and help me figure it out?ScenesRachel: Really? Okay. Okay, I-I’ll go upstairs. (to Paul) If-if you get me something from the car.ScenesPaul: What do you need from the car?ScenesRachel: Surprise me.ScenesPaul: (whispering) Okay. (Starts for the car.)ScenesRachel: (yelling) So you’re gonna be in the car, I will be upstairs, and that’s where everybody’s gonna be!Scenes(Rachel and Elizabeth go upstairs. Paul starts for the car, but notices his luggage is still out and decides to take in into the bedroom.)Scenes[Cut to his bedroom, Ross is listening at the door as Paul opens the door, trapping Ross behind it. With Paul’s back turned Ross coils up like a snake and slitters underneath the bed.]ScenesPaul: (standing in front of a mirror and to himself) Just relax. Just relax Paul, you’re doing great. (Ross moves a piece of luggage over so he can watch Paul.) She likes you. She… Maybe, she likes you. She likes you. Y’know why? Because you’re a (pause) neat guy. (Ross can’t believe what he’s hearing.) You are the man. You are (pause) the man! (He opens his shirt and looks at his chest.) I still got it. Nice and sexy. You’re just a love machine. (Starts singing) I’m just a love machine and I won’t work for nobody but you! Hey bab-y! (Flexes and grunts loudly.) Showtime. (Starts to leave and starts singing.) I’m just a love machine, yeah ba-by! (Grunts again and Ross is stunned.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there as Monica rushes in.]
rows.Content: Monica: Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesMonica: Have you seen Chandler?!ScenesPhoebe: No! Why?ScenesMonica: The woman from the museum called and said that there was a cancellation and that we could move up our wedding and Chandler heard! (Phoebe gasps.) I know! How bad is this?!ScenesPhoebe: Well for the regular guy, it’s bad, but Chandler, Oh dear God!ScenesMonica: I know! I know! And he totally freaked out and I can’t find him anywhere!ScenesPhoebe: What are you gonna do?ScenesMonica: Well, I’m never gonna listen to you again, that’s for sure! (Mimicking her.) "Y’know, harm can it do if you go and put your name down?ScenesPhoebe: Rachel said that!ScenesMonica: Well Rachel’s not here! (Runs out.)

rows.Scenes: The Dry Cleaner’s, Joey and Phoebe are entering to see if his picture is on the wall.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh! Here it is! (Noticing it next to the door.) Ooh, Joey! Why did you sign it, "Son of a bitch?" (Son of a bitch is written across the entire picture.)ScenesJoey: I didn’t do that! Who would’ve done that?!ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: (entering) Son of a bitch!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, maybe ask this guy.ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: You, get out of my shop!ScenesPhoebe: Well, what did he do?ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: He went out with my wife!ScenesPhoebe: Joey!ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa, I-I—Hey! I did not go out with your wife! (The same woman from before enters.) Okay? I went out with her! (Points at her.)ScenesThe Dry Cleaner: That’s my wife!!! Get out! (Starts yelling at him in Russian, and I’m betting he’s not saying pleasant things about him.)ScenesPhoebe: Well, we should go.ScenesJoey: Yeah.

rows.Scenes: Paul’s Bedroom, Elizabeth is entering.]
rows.Content: Elizabeth: Ross? Ross?ScenesRoss: Elizabeth! (He opens one of the bed stands that he has curled himself up into.) Okay. Okay. (She helps him out.) I’m gonna go out this window. (Points to the window next to him.) I’ll meet you at the front door. Just tell them you’re going home, okay?ScenesElizabeth: Okay!ScenesRachel: (yelling from the living room) Oh wait-wait-wait!! No! Don’t go in there! Don’t go in there! I need another soda!Scenes(Ross frantically starts to open the window as Paul enters and traps him halfway out the window.)ScenesPaul: Ross!ScenesRachel: Oh my God Ross! What in heaven’s name are you doing here?ScenesRoss: (to Elizabeth) And that is why we cannot see each other anymore.ScenesPaul: Ross. You and I are going to have to have a little talk.ScenesElizabeth: Daddy!ScenesPaul: You’re next!!ScenesElizabeth: Okay. I didn’t know he was here. (Runs over to Rachel.)ScenesPaul: Let me just see if I got this straight. I tell you to stay away from my daughter or I’ll have you fired. What you heard was, "Take my daughter, come up to my country house, and ruin my weekend with Rachel!ScenesRoss: Okay, please-please Paul, just let me explain…ScenesPaul: No, let me explain! Fired!!ScenesRoss: All right, fine! Fine! Have me fired! But uh, I want you to know that you and I are not all that different. I mean, I too am a neat guy. (Paul just looks at him.)ScenesPaul: (panicked) What?ScenesRoss: And I too am just a love machine. (Hums a little bit and mimics Paul’s flexing.)ScenesPaul: Ross, let me show you where the guest room is.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is pacing, waiting for Chandler to return. Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: (going over to him) I’m so sorry. Please, stop freaking out.ScenesChandler: I’m not freaking out. Why would I be freaking out? A woman named Heldi called and said we were getting married, but that happens everyday. (Does one of those Chandler noises.)ScenesMonica: Honey, we were at this beautiful place, and I-I-I just put our names down for fun! I mean, what’s the harm in that?ScenesChandler: Right here! (Clucks like a chicken for some reason.)ScenesMonica: Chandler, please don’t think I was trying to pressure you. Phoebe and Rachel…ScenesChandler: Phoebe and Rachel! So the people that knew about our wedding before me were you, Phoebe and Rachel, Heldi, and apparently some band called Starlight Magic 7 who are available by the way!ScenesMonica: It was a mistake. Please don’t take this to mean anything, because it doesn’t.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesChandler: Yes, if it really doesn’t mean anything, because you know that I’m just not ready…ScenesMonica: I know! I know.ScenesChandler: Okay. (They hug.)ScenesMonica: I’m gonna go tell Joey that (laughs) that you’re back. I was really worried about you. (Exits.)ScenesPhoebe: (entering from her room) Hey, did she buy it?ScenesChandler: Totally.ScenesPhoebe: So did Heldi show you the place?ScenesChandler: Yeah, it’s beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe you’re gonna ask Monica to marry you!ScenesChandler: I know.Scenes(They hug.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is going up to the counter.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey Gunther.ScenesGunther: Hey! Take these cappuccinos to table 11 and that guy over there (points) wants the biscotti.ScenesJoey: Oh uh, well I just came in for a cup of coffee to go.ScenesGunther: Do you still work here?ScenesJoey: No! No, I quit a long time ago. (Pause) Did I forget to you that one? I’m sorry.ScenesGunther: Oh that’s cool, I was gonna fire you anyway.ScenesJoey: Great! (Takes his coffee and leaves.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The RingScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Phoebe is at the sink and Chandler is looking at a ring brochure.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Pheebs, can you help me pick out an engagement ring for Monica? I can’t figure this out! It’s so hard! Should I get her a (turning to each page) Tiffany cut or a Princess cut or a—ah-ah! Paper cut!ScenesPhoebe: Now, have you told anyone else?ScenesChandler: No, I don’t want to tell anybody else because I don’t want Monica to find out.ScenesPhoebe: You told me.ScenesChandler: Well, it’s because I trust you, you’re one of my best friends, and you walked in on me when I was looking at ring brochures.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah well, once again not knocking pays off. I only wish you hadn’t been on the toilet.ScenesChandler: Me too.Scenes(Joey and Ross enter causing Chandler to quickly hide the brochure behind his back.)ScenesJoey: Hey. (Heads straight for the fridge.)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So Chandler, wanna go to the coffeehouse?ScenesChandler: Oh all right.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, coffeehouse.ScenesRoss: Oh perfect, we were just gonna see if you wanted to go.ScenesChandler: Oh well, we don’t because we got…the…other pl-place.Scenes(Joey returns with a piece of pizza as Chandler and Phoebe exit.)ScenesRoss: How rude.ScenesJoey: Oh, I’m sorry. You wanna bite? (Holds his piece out for him.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So how are things going with Paul?ScenesRachel: Good. Although y’know, he-he’s a private guy. Y’know, I wish I could get him to open up a little bit, share some feelings.ScenesPhoebe: That’s easy! You just have to think of him as a-as a jar of pickles that won’t open.ScenesRachel: So what are you saying; I should run him under hot water and bang his head against a table?ScenesPhoebe: No that’s what you do when you want to get the truth out of someone.ScenesPaul: (entering) Hi honey.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: (To Rachel) Watch this.ScenesPaul: (To Rachel) How are you?ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Hi Paul!ScenesPaul: Hi Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: So how are things going with you?ScenesPaul: Can’t complain.Scenes(Phoebe turns to Rachel and mimes remove a lid of a jar. Ross enters and Paul motions for Rachel to leave with him now.)ScenesPaul: (whispering) Come on.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Gets up and starts to leave with Paul.)ScenesPaul: (To Ross) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!Scenes(They shake hands and their lines overlap.)ScenesPaul: Ross!ScenesRoss: Great to see you!ScenesPaul: Good to see you too!ScenesRoss: How you doing?ScenesPaul: Good. Bye! (Starts to leave.)ScenesRoss: Okay! You take care!Scenes(Ross turns his back on Paul and makes a ‘I hate that guy’ face. Paul does the same thing.)ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, what-what was the deal with you and Chandler blowing us off before?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! That was so weird, huh?ScenesRoss: Phoebe, why’d you do it?ScenesPhoebe: I didn’t do it! It was Chandler! He’s… He’s mad at you!ScenesRoss: What?! Why?!ScenesPhoebe: Please, I think you know why.ScenesRoss: I can’t think of anything.ScenesPhoebe: Come on Ross, you’re a paleontologist, dig a little deeper.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, is it because Joey and I didn’t invite him to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago?ScenesPhoebe: Do you think that’s something that he’d be mad at you for?ScenesRoss: I guess it could.ScenesPhoebe: Well then I think that’s it.ScenesRoss: Well, if he’s angry, he really shouldn’t just cover it up. I-I wish he would just tell me the truth.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, if that’s what you want you then you really should run his head under hot water and bang his head against a table.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Paul and Rachel are getting ready to go out. Paul is entering from the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Paul: Honey I made a reservation at China Garden, is that okay?ScenesRachel: Yeah that’s great. But first, wait, talk to me, talk to me. Tell me about your day.ScenesPaul: It was fine.ScenesRachel: Okay. Hey, what are you thinking? What are you thinking right now?ScenesPaul: I’m thinking that you are looking really fine it that dress.ScenesRachel: Yeah that’s great Paul, but y’know I wanna know what—(Puts her hands on his shoulders)—Wow, those are really great! I just wanna know what, what is behind this-this strong, silent exterior. Y’know they say that still waters run deep and I wanna swim in yours.ScenesPaul: Are you talking about having sex?ScenesRachel: No Paul, I don’t know anything about you! Y’know, like-like your childhood! Tell me about your childhood!ScenesPaul: Normal.ScenesRachel: Okay, well then how about puberty! Come on, that’s always a painful time! Y’know your friends invite you to a slumber party and then they stick your hand in warm water while you’re sleeping so that you pee in your sleeping bag.ScenesPaul: Nope! That never happened to me!ScenesRachel: Well, you’re lucky you never met that bitch Sharon Majesky. Anyway, umm… The rest of you life, y’know? Any regrets?ScenesPaul: Nope.ScenesRachel: All right Paul, I’m not asking for a lot here. Okay? Just give me something. Anything!ScenesPaul: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPaul: Okay.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesPaul: When I was six years old.ScenesRachel: Hm-mmm.ScenesPaul: I wanted a big wheel. And instead my parents got me this little plastic chicken that you hop around on. It was embarrassing; kids made fun of me. That was a pretty tough year.ScenesRachel: That’s-that’s great! See? I already feel like I know you a little better! Thank you. Okay, come on. Now we can go eat. Let’s go. (Gets up to leave, but Paul doesn’t move.)ScenesPaul: It was horrible. They called me chicken boy.ScenesRachel: Oh!Scenes[Time Lapse, Paul is now weeping uncontrollably in Rachel’s arms.]ScenesPaul: And in fifth grade I got into a fight. Well, it wasn’t really a fight. Richard Darinvel bit me on the nose and, and I feel down. I still have a little scare right here (points to it) you can see it.ScenesRachel: Yeah. Yeah, I-I-I see the scare. Listen, Paul, I think this is really great that-that y’know, you shared your feelings. It’s really, it’s beautiful, but umm, what do you say we go share some food?ScenesPaul: Oh, I couldn’t eat now.ScenesRachel: What?! Wait! What are you talking about?! You love their Kung Pao Chicken!ScenesPaul: Chicken? (Pointing to himself.) Chicken boy!ScenesRachel: My God, I’m sorry! I’m sorry! I didn’t mean to do that! I wouldn’t do that!Scenes(Paul screams like a chicken and breaks down into tears again.)

rows.Scenes: A Jewelry Shop, Chandler and Phoebe are looking at engagement rings.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Nothin! This is the nine millionth ring store we’ve been too and I can’t find the perfect ring! (Goes over to another display counter and starts pointing at rings.) Ugly ring! Ugly ring! Ugly ring! (Notices that one of the jewelers is watching him.) It’s a beautiful selection. (The jeweler walks away slowly.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so maybe you don’t get her a ring. Maybe you-maybe you do something different. Y’know? Maybe you get her an engagement bracelet, y’know? Or an engagement tiara? Or—ooh! An engagement Revolutionary War musket! (Picks one up from the display in the corner.ScenesChandler: Y’know, I’m so glad I picked you to help me with this.ScenesPhoebe: Huh? Can you just imagine getting down on one knee and handing her this gorgeous piece of weaponry?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’m gonna stick with the ring. (Goes to another display counter.) Oh, this one’s nice! (Pointing to another ring.) I like this one! Sir? Uh, kind sir? Can I see this one?ScenesPhoebe: (coming over after returning the musket) Wait a minute, no, this is, this is the reason you brought me. Okay? I know how to haggle. So let me handle this from here on out.ScenesMale Jeweler: Can I help you?ScenesChandler: Uh-uh, yes. I would like to see that ring please.ScenesPhoebe: Or not, whatever.ScenesMale Jeweler: This ring is from the 1920s, it’s a one and a half carat diamond with sapphires on either side.ScenesChandler: Sir, can I ask you to umm, could you…hold out that ring and ask me to marry you?ScenesMale Jeweler: Okay. (Holds out the ring, deadpan.) Will you marry me?ScenesChandler: (choking up) Oh my God that’s it, that’s the ring! How much is it?ScenesPhoebe: Chandler, I-I will handle this! (To the jeweler) How much is it?ScenesMale Jeweler: 8,600.ScenesPhoebe: We will give you $10.ScenesMale Jeweler: (angrily) Are you interested in this ring?!ScenesChandler: Yes! Yes, but I can only pay $8,000.ScenesMale Jeweler: Okay, I can let it go at eight.ScenesPhoebe: We stand firm at $10.ScenesMale Jeweler: (ignoring her) How would you like to pay?ScenesChandler: Uh, credit card. (Reaches for it then realizes) Oh no! No-no, but I left my credit card with Joey. (To Phoebe) Okay, I’ll go get it. You guard the ring.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (To the jeweler) Listen, I’m sorry about before. Do you have anything her for $10.ScenesMale Jeweler: Uh yes, I have these two rather beautiful $5 bills. (Holds them up from his pocket.)ScenesPhoebe: I’ll give you $1 for them.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, remember how Chandler and Phoebe blew us off yesterday?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesRoss: Remember? You-you were eating pizza.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Okay. Well, apparently Chandler’s angry at us for not getting him a ticket to that Knicks game a couple of weeks ago.ScenesJoey: Oh, we’re supposed to just get him a ticket?! That guy is always mooching off of us!ScenesRoss: Yeah! Anyway, I-I still think we should try to patch things up, y’know? Like uh, maybe we could get him to get tickets to another Knicks game and invite him.ScenesJoey: Oh wow that’s a great idea! And I still have his credit card.ScenesGunther: (handing them the bill) Here you go.ScenesRoss: Oh. (Starts to get his money)ScenesJoey: Hey-hey-hey-ho-ho, I got this one. Here you go. (Hands Gunther Chandler’s card.) Y’know I gotta tell ya, sometimes I just—I don’t get Chandler. Y’know, me and him do stuff all the time without you and you don’t get all upset.ScenesRoss: All the time?ScenesJoey: All the time!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God! Oh my God!!ScenesMonica: Still crying?ScenesRachel: Like a little girl. I know. I know. I know. This is all my fault; I wanted him to open up. But God, I didn’t know that I was gonna unleash this-this weepy, clingy, moist monster!ScenesMonica: Y’know, I only know of two surefire ways to shut a man up. And one of them is sex.ScenesRachel: What’s the other one?ScenesMonica: I don’t know, I’ve never had to use the other one. I’m just saying y’know, if we’re having sex, he’s not gonna be talking.ScenesRachel: Oh that’s right. You’re the talker. (They both reflect on that briefly) Anyway uh, great idea! Umm, I gotta go to the store; I told him that I would buy him some more tissues.ScenesMonica: Oh, we have some…ScenesRachel: No you don’t!

rows.Scenes: The Jewelry Store, Phoebe is busy trying on virtually everything in the store. She’s got earrings, rings, bracelets, and enough necklaces to put Mr. T to shame on.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay umm, I’d also like to try on the tiara. (The male jeweler hands it to her.) Oh yeah. Okay. (Puts it on.) (To the jeweler) What do you think, too much?ScenesMale Jeweler: A tad.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Then, take the tiara back and let me hold the musket again. (He hands it to her and Phoebe poses in front of one of those small mirrors.) Something’s missing. It’s not… Okay oh, let me see the ring my friend picked out.ScenesMale Jeweler: (to the female jeweler) Where’s the 1920s princess cut ring.ScenesFemale Jeweler: I just sold it to that gentleman. (Points to the one walking out the store.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!! (She runs after him, but sets of the security system, which locks the store’s door and brings down a set of bars behind her, caging her in.) No! What?! Help me! Let me out! Now! (Points the musket at them.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Paul is still crying as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Paul: Rachel?ScenesChandler: No. How are ya Paul? (Starts to look for his credit card.)ScenesPaul: (acting manly to try and cover up his crying) Okay. Chandler, did your dad ever hug you?ScenesChandler: No, did he hug you?!ScenesPaul: No! No! It’s just that, my dad never did. I miss my dad.ScenesChandler: Well, you can see my dad in Vegas kissing other dads.ScenesPaul: Hey Chandler?ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesPaul: Would you…….Would you hug me?ScenesChandler: I’m a little busy here Paul.ScenesPaul: That’s exactly what my dad used to say! (Starts to breakdown again.)ScenesChandler: Okay, a quick one. Come on hug it out. (Paul rushes over and hugs Chandler tightly.) Oh hey! There you go. (The hug continues.) Okay. (The hug continues.)ScenesPaul: Five more seconds.ScenesChandler: Okay! (Pushes him away.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesPaul: Joey! (Goes over and hugs Joey and picks him off of his feet.)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa-hey-hey! (Motions to Chandler, "What’s going on?") Hi, Paul is it? (Paul nods yes and still hugging Joey.)ScenesChandler: Do you have my credit card?ScenesJoey: Yes, it’s in my… In…in my pocket. (Paul hasn’t dropped him yet.) (Chandler starts to reach for his front pocket.) My back pocket! My back pocket!ScenesChandler: Thank God! (Grabs his card.)ScenesJoey: Oh hey listen I got us tickets to a Knicks game tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh, I can’t go.ScenesJoey: Come on! It’ll be fun! Me, you, and Ross, and… Paul probably…

rows.Scenes: The Jewelry Store, Chandler is entering with his credit card and Phoebe is holding out another ring for him.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Chandler, I found the perfect ring. (Holding it out for her.)ScenesChandler: Oh, that’s uh, that’s pretty nice but I’m gonna go with the one I picked first.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God Chandler, the one you picked is gone. It’s over!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: Some guy bought it. I’m sorry. I tired to stop it but they (points to the jeweler) put me in jail!ScenesChandler: They put you in jail?ScenesPhoebe: The little jail between the doors!ScenesChandler: Phoebe, I asked you to guard the ring!ScenesPhoebe: I know, I’m sorry! But y’know, this ring is better! Monica never even saw the other ring.ScenesChandler: Yeah but when he proposed to me with the ring I got goose bumps.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe it was the guy.ScenesChandler: It was the ring!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is on the couch and Joey is entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey! So uh, was he excited about the tickets?ScenesJoey: No! He blew us off!ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesJoey: I know!ScenesRoss: I can’t believe it. (Pause) Can I tell you something? I’m a little mad at him now.ScenesJoey: Can I tell you something? Me too.ScenesRoss: Y’know what? He didn’t want to talk to us about being angry, well maybe we don’t talk to him at all!ScenesJoey: Ooooh! Freeze him out.ScenesRoss: That’s right!ScenesJoey: I like it!ScenesRoss: Eh? We’ll show him!ScenesJoey: From now on, it’s gonna be Joey and Ross, best friends. (They shake hands.) Okay! We’re gonna be the new Joey and Chandler.

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Paul is writing something as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi. I’m back.ScenesPaul: Hey! I have so much more to tell ya, I’ve written it all down!ScenesRachel: Ah that’s great. No actually that’s… (In a sexy voice) That’s great! That’s really great! Y’know, I gotta tell ya writing, I mean writing, gets me uh, gets me kinda hot.ScenesPaul: Wait! Wait! Listen! Listen to this! (Flips a couple pages and points to something.) Y’know what I wanted to be when I was that age?ScenesRachel: A lover?ScenesPaul: A surfer.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah surfer?ScenesPaul: I wanted to be one with the waves, y’know?ScenesRachel: Okay, hold on real quick, hold on a second let me just uh, (sits on the counter and buttons her sweater to show some cleavage) get a little more comfortable here. Wait, now wait a second, this isn’t too revealing is it?ScenesPaul: (barely glancing at her) No. What ever happened to that little dude. (Pause) So full of dreams…ScenesRachel: I don’t care about the little dude! I can’t! I cannot listen to anymore of this! Y’know, the only person who would want to listen to this is a mental health professional! And then it’s only because they get paid $100 an hour! Do you know how much money I could’ve made listening to you? $2,000! And do you know when I figured that out? While you were talking!ScenesPaul: What?! I can’t believe you’re trying to stifle me! When just 14 hours ago we figured out that that is exactly what my mother was trying to do to me!ScenesRachel: Oh… I’m sorry. I… I-I don’t mean—I didn’t mean to stifle you. I… This is all just a little overwhelming.ScenesPaul: Oh Rachel, I’m so sorry. I didn’t mean to overwhelm you. It’s just that, when those gates open, you… (Starts to breakdown.) Hard to close ‘em. But they are closed now. Believe me.ScenesRachel: I’m so glad, I’m so glad you shared. (Feeling his shoulder.) And I’m glad that you’re done. What do you say we umm… (Nods in the direction of the bedroom.)ScenesPaul: I would really like that. (They kiss.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Bedroom, Paul and Rachel are recovering.]
rows.Content: Paul: That was…so good. (Starts crying again.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is looking at the ring he bought and not liking it.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering from her room) Hey.ScenesChandler: I can’t believe I let you talk me into buying this stupid gumball machine looking ring!ScenesPhoebe: It’s not a stupid gumball machine looking ring! It’s a beautiful ring!ScenesChandler: No, it’s not! When I looked at the other ring I could see Monica’s face when I gave it to her, y’know? And I could see her saying yes. When I look at this ring, all I see is a ring! Unless I look at it really closely and then I can see my own eye. (Does so and laughs.) Look, this is the most important thing I’m gonna do in my life. I wanna make sure it’s perfect.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. There may be a way that we can get the other ring back. ‘Cause I heard the guy tell the jeweler where he was going to propose. So maybe we can get him to trade rings or something.ScenesChandler: I can’t do that.ScenesPhoebe: Well you certainly can’t give her that stupid gumball ring.

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Chandler and Phoebe are entering. This is the place where the guy who bought Chandler’s ring is going to propose.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: There he is! (Points.)ScenesChandler: Okay and he hasn’t proposed yet because she has no ring on her finger.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You’re good! After this, we should solve crimes.ScenesChandler: Yeah! Okay, go, go, go get him.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay. (Walks over to him.) Excuse me sir? Could you come with me please? You have a phone call.ScenesCustomer: Who is it?ScenesPhoebe: It is your office.ScenesCustomer: Do you know who at my office?ScenesPhoebe: John?ScenesCustomer: Oh John! Great!Scenes(She brings him over to Chandler.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Chandler) Here he is.ScenesChandler: (to him) Hi! Hi. Okay, there was a slight mix-up at the jewelry store, the ring you’re about to propose with was supposed to be held for me. So, I’m gonna need to have that back. (The guy isn’t sure.) But, in exchange I’m willing to trade you this beautiful, more expensive ring. (Looking at the ring.) Ew.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! I would trade.ScenesCustomer: It is beautiful, but I’m gonna use this one. Now, if you’ll excuse me.ScenesChandler: No-no! This is my fiancee (Phoebe) and her heart was set on that ring. You don’t want to break her heart now do you?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, do you want to break a dying woman’s heart?ScenesCustomer: You’re dying?!Scenes(Phoebe coughs.)ScenesChandler: Yeah, she’s dying… Of a cough apparently.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, and it is my dying wish to have that ring. See, if I’m not buried with that ring then my spirit is going to wander the nether world for all eternity…ScenesChandler: (interrupting her) Okay, that’s enough honey!ScenesCustomer: I don’t know. (Pause) Let me see the ring.ScenesChandler: Great! Okay, here. (Holds the ring up for him.)ScenesCustomer: (looks at it) All right. (Exchanges rings.)ScenesChandler: Thank you. Thank you. Thank you! (To his girlfriend) And you are about to marry a wonderful man! (She stunned and he’s horrified.) Hey! I’m marrying a dead woman!

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, Joey and Ross are watching TV as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Guys? (They ignore him.) I’ve got something important to tell ya. (Still nothing so he walks over and stands in front of the TV.) Guys? (They lean over to try and watch the TV, Chandler mimics them.) Guys?! (Pause) I’m gonna ask Monica to marry me.ScenesJoey: (To Ross) I think we gotta end the freeze out.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, is this, is this for real?ScenesChandler: Yeah, check out the ring. (Shows it to them.)ScenesJoey: Oh my God!!ScenesRoss: So you two are really serious?!ScenesChandler: Yep, pretty much.ScenesRoss: You-you’re gonna get married?! I mean… We’re gonna be brothers-in-law! (They hug.)ScenesJoey: And-and-and-and-and-and, and we’re gonna be friends again!ScenesChandler: (goes to hug him and stops short) Heyyyy—What?ScenesJoey: Oh it’s water under the bridge, forget it!ScenesChandler: Okay! (They hug.) I was gonna wait ‘til uh, it was official y’know? But I got so excited I just had to tell you guys because you’re my best friends.ScenesJoey: I think I’m gonna cry!ScenesRachel: (who has just entered) Ugh! No more crying! Please! I just dumped one cry baby, I’ll dump you too!Scenes(Ross and Joey urge Chandler to tell Rachel.)ScenesChandler: I’m gonna ask Monica to marry me.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh Chandler!! (Hugs him.) You guys are gonna be so happy!ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesJoey: (holding an empty tissue box) Where’s all the tissues?! (Throws the box down in disgust.)ScenesEnding Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey and Rachel's, continued from earlier. Chandler is showing Rachel the ring.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Check out the ring.ScenesRachel: (gasps) Nice! One and a half carat easy.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hi.ScenesRoss: Hey-hey Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRoss: Chandler’s gonna ask Monica to marry him!ScenesPhoebe: Oh I know, I helped pick out the ring.Scenes(Chandler laughs, turns, and sees that Ross and Joey aren’t happy.)ScenesRoss: You told her before you told us?ScenesChandler: Well, she walked in when I was looking at the ring brochures. You can understand that, right? (Ross and Joey look at each other and go back to watching the game on TV.) Guys? Guys? (Walks in front of them again.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The ProposalScenesPart I Written by: Shana Goldberg-Meehan & Scott SilveriScenesPart II Written by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesParts I and II Transcribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is showing Ross, Rachel, Joey, and Phoebe his engagement ring again.]
rows.Content: Ross: God that is the most beautiful engagement ring ever!ScenesRachel: Yeah? Well, you should know. You’ve bought like a billion of ‘em.ScenesRoss: Yeah, you didn’t get one.ScenesChandler: Okay, well tonight’s the big night.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!ScenesJoey: Okay listen, how are you gonna ask her?ScenesChandler: It is going to be perfect. I am taking her to her favorite restaurant. I’m going to get her a bottle of the champagne that she really loves; therefore knows how expensive it is. Then when the glasses are full, instead of proposing a toast I’m just gonna propose.ScenesRachel: Ohh…ScenesJoey: That sounds perfect!ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: You’re gonna mess it up let me do it.ScenesChandler: I’m not gonna mess it up.ScenesPhoebe: If she says no, can I have the ring?ScenesChandler: She’s not gonna say no.ScenesPhoebe: If!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!Scenes(Monica’s entrance makes Phoebe try to hide the ring by putting it in her mouth.)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (with her mouthful) Hi Monica.Scenes(Monica goes into her room.)ScenesChandler: (To Phoebe) Give me it!ScenesPhoebe: It’s gone.ScenesChandler: Phoebe!Scenes(She takes it out of her mouth and hands it to him as Monica returns from her room and this time forcing Chandler to put the ring in his mouth.)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: (with his mouthful) Hi Monica.Scenes(She goes into the bathroom.)ScenesPhoebe: (To Chandler) We’re practically kissing. (Makes a kissy face and winks at him.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey are there as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Are any of you guys free tonight? My boss is hosting this charity event for underprivileged kids and the more people I bring, the better I look. So, Monica? Chandler?ScenesChandler: (glaring at her) Well, Monica and Chandler can’t go. We’re going to dinner remember?!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, I’m so sorry.ScenesMonica: What’s the big deal?ScenesChandler: I just get mad when Rachel doesn’t remember where we’re going.ScenesJoey: Where are you going?Scenes(Chandler stares at him.)ScenesRachel: How about you guys? (Points to Phoebe and Joey.)ScenesPhoebe: Open bar?ScenesRachel: I think so.ScenesPhoebe: I can do that for the kids.ScenesJoey: Hey, y’know what? I’ll come too. I’m making money now; it’s about time I give something back.ScenesChandler: Well, you could also give back the money you owe me.ScenesJoey: Okay. Have a benefit.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey! Ross, listen can you come to a charity event tonight?ScenesRoss: Oh no, I have plans with Elizabeth.ScenesChandler: Oh, so you’re already doing your part for the kids.ScenesRoss: I’m sorry, it’s just one of my last nights together before she leaves for camp—to be a counselor!ScenesMonica: Ross let me ask you a question. All jokes aside, where is this relationship going?ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, all jokes aside? I didn’t agree to that!ScenesMonica: Do you really see this as a long-term thing?ScenesRoss: I don’t know.ScenesPhoebe: Y’know, you are 12 years older than her.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, does-does everyone feel this way?ScenesAll: Yeah! Yeah, sort of. I’m sorry.ScenesRoss: Uh-uh—Wow! Uh, I thought you guys were just like making jokes, I had no idea. What you know what? You guys are wrong. Uh yes, there is a chronological age difference but I never notice it. You know why? Because she is very mature. Besides, it doesn’t really matter to me what you guys think. I mean, I’m the one dating Elizabeth, not you!ScenesJoey: That’s not what she said last night. (Ross glares at him.)ScenesRachel: See? Now, he could date her.

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Chandler is practicing proposing.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Will you marry me? Will you marry me? (Makes like a gun with his fingers.) Hey, you marry me! (He gives up as Joey, Rachel, Phoebe, and Ross slink in all excited.) What’s going on little elves?ScenesJoey: It’s the big night! We wanted to wish you good luck!ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah you have the ring?ScenesChandler: Yeah, right here in my pocket. (Pats his pocket. Phoebe smiles, goes over to hug him, and removes the ring from his pocket.) Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oop! (Hands him back the ring.)ScenesChandler: Okay, now will you guys get out of here? I want this is to be a surprise and she’s gonna know.ScenesRoss: (to the rest of them) Yeah-yeah you guys. Get out of here!Scenes(Monica enters from the bedroom.)ScenesMonica: Hi guys.ScenesChandler: (To Monica) You are beautiful.ScenesMonica: Oh, thank you! (The gang exhibits signs of quiet apprehension and wears knowing glances.) (Monica giggles.) What’s going on?ScenesRachel: (breaking up) We’re just really…very excited about this charity event that we have to go to.

rows.Scenes: The Charity Event, they’re holding a silent auction, Rachel is looking at one of the items and Phoebe walks up and hands her a glass of wine.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Here.ScenesRachel: Oh! Thank you!ScenesPhoebe: So now what’s going on here?ScenesRachel: Uh well, uh this is a silent auction. They lay out all the stuff here and then you write down your offer and then the highest bid gets it.ScenesPhoebe: No, I know what a silent is I meant, what’s going on with your hair?ScenesRachel: (suddenly worried) Uh, wh-why?ScenesPhoebe: No! It’s nice!Scenes(Rachel’s boss, Mr. Thompson walks up.)ScenesMr. Thompson: Nice to see you Rachel.ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesMr. Thompson: So glad you brought someone.ScenesRachel: Someone? I brought people. Mr. Thompson, this is Phoebe. Phoebe, this is Mr. Thompson. (She introduces them.) He’s the head of my department.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hi. (They shake hands.)ScenesRachel: And I also brought my friend Joey…ScenesJoey: (behind them) Oh!! Shrimp toast! (Walks right past the little group on his way for the shrimp toast.)ScenesRachel: Well, y’know I-I don’t know where he is.ScenesMr. Thompson: Well, I hope you’re gonna bid on some things Rachel.ScenesRachel: Well, y’know what? Actually, I was about to bid on this lovely trip to Paris.ScenesMr. Thompson: Ohh, nice choice.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesMr. Thompson: Good luck.ScenesRachel: Thank you. (Mr. Thompson walks away and after he’s left.) Okay, (writing her bid down) twenty dollars.

rows.Scenes: Elizabeth’s Dorm Room, Ross is walking up to her door and knocks on it. Suddenly the door opens and Elizabeth drags him into the room.]
rows.Content: {Transcriber’s Note: Elizabeth has two friends in the room with her who are named in the credits, but not in this scene. So I’m just gonna guess since it doesn’t matter one way or the other. (The last part is to discourage e-mails, who cares if I got it right or not?)}ScenesZoe: Shut the door! Shut the door!! (Runs over and closes the door.)ScenesRoss: What’s-what’s going on?ScenesElizabeth: The guys across the hall are throwing water balloons at us.ScenesRoss: Oh, you have to call the police! That’s what I did to the kids in my building!ScenesElizabeth: No, it’s a water balloon fight! We started it!ScenesRoss: Oh! (Does a laugh/groan.) Listen umm, I, I just stopped by to see if you wanted to see this play tonight. Umm, it’s supposed to be excellent. The director is the same…ScenesElizabeth: (ignoring him and picking up a pitcher) Who drank all the Kamikazes?ScenesSarah: (approaching with two filled balloons in her hands) Nobody! We put them in here! (Indicates the aforementioned balloons causing both of them to scream in delight and start drinking from the balloons.)ScenesElizabeth: (To Ross) You want some?! (Starts to squirt the Kamikaze at him.)ScenesRoss: No! Okay! Okay! (Stops her.) Okay, look, can I, can I just-just talk to you for a second?ScenesElizabeth: Yeah, sure.ScenesRoss: Uh, so this play umm, what do you think? It’s-it’s gotten great reviews! Y’know the uh…Scenes(Suddenly the door opens and two guys come rushing in wielding water balloons.)ScenesFirst Dorm Guy: Attack!Scenes(They start lobbing the balloons in. Ross desperately tries to get out of the line of fire but is struck in the back. The girls all retreat to relative safety behind the couch.)ScenesSecond Dorm Guy: Put your balloons down!ScenesThe Girls: You put your balloons down!!ScenesFirst Dorm Guy: You put your balloons down!!Scenes(Both opposing camps start screaming at each other to drop their weapons and surrender. Finally, Ross steps in as a mediator.)ScenesRoss: (screaming) Everybody put their balloons down!!! (There is a temporary cease fire.) Now this is a nice suit!! (Shows everyone where he was hit.)

rows.Scenes: The Charity Event, Mr. Thompson is announcing the winners of the silent auction.]
rows.Content: Mr. Thompson: Our next item is the romantic trip to Paris. (Pause.) It goes to Emil Alexander high a high bid of 2,300.ScenesRachel: Ugh! So close!Scenes(Phoebe returns a with a tray full of different kinds of drinks.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey you guys! Look!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: I got me some drinks!ScenesRachel: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Open bar!ScenesRachel: Well now it’s an empty bar.ScenesPhoebe: You just can’t stand anyone else enjoying themselves can’t you?ScenesMr. Thompson: And finally, our biggest item of the night, the 22-foot gentleman’s day sailer sailboat. The winning bid was a whooping $20,000! (Joey suddenly gets excited.)ScenesJoey: I won! That was my guess!ScenesRachel: What?! What?! What?!ScenesJoey: I guessed 20,000!ScenesRachel: Joey! It is an auction! You don’t guess, you buy!ScenesJoey: What?! I don’t have 20,000!ScenesMr. Thompson: Congratulations on your new boat, Joey Tribbiani!!Scenes(Everyone applauds and he stands up slowly.)ScenesRachel: Joey! Sit down! (Pulls him down.)ScenesPhoebe: Forget her! You enjoy this!! (Pulls him back up and starts applauding again. Joey waves and does a salute.]

rows.Scenes: A Restaurant, Monica and Chandler are sitting at a table. Monica is checking her makeup as Chandler suddenly has a horrifying thought and starts patting down his pockets until he finds what he’s looking for and sighs in relief.]
rows.Content: Monica: What are you doing?ScenesChandler: (trying to cover up why his hand is over his heart) One nation, under God. Indivisible with liberty and justice for all. (Laughs.) I remembered it. (It’s a butchered version of the Pledge of Allegiance of the United States for our foreign friends.) The champagne is here. (The waiter is delivering it and pouring two glasses.)ScenesMonica: Are you okay?ScenesChandler: Yes! Yes! I’m good! Are you good? Are you good? Is everything—are you—are you perrr-perfect?!ScenesMonica: Yeah. I’m okay. I’m actually—I’m a little cold, can I have your jacket?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah. (Starts to take it off and then realizes) Uh, no you can’t have my jacket! Because then I would be cold! If you thought that you were going to be cold, you should’ve brought your own jacket. But uh, other than that, are you okay? Are you okay?ScenesMonica: (laughs) Are you sure you’re okay?ScenesChandler: Yes! I’m fine. In fact I’ve been fine for a long time now and I think, the reason is you.ScenesMonica: Ohh that’s sweet!ScenesChandler: Okay umm, before I meant you I had really little life and I couldn’t imagine growing old with…Scenes(As he’s talking Monica notices someone familiar has just entered the restaurant. Let’s see; I seem to remember him driving a Ferrari in Hawaii solving crimes as a private investigator and as a certain eye doctor in more recent times.)ScenesMonica: (interrupting him) Oh my God!ScenesChandler: (not knowing the true meaning of her exclamation) I know, but just let me say it.ScenesMonica: Oh my God, Richard. (Yep, Richard’s back.)ScenesChandler: What?! I’m Chandler! (She nods towards the doorway, Chandler turns and looks) Oh, that’s Richard!ScenesMonica: Oh God, maybe he won’t see us. Richard!Scenes(Monica smiles then acts shocked. Chandler can’t believe she just did that.)ScenesRichard: (approaching them with a woman in tow) Monica! Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey, hey! (Gets up and hugs him.) I don’t know why I did that!ScenesMonica: Hey, it’s good to see you!ScenesRichard: You too, you let uh, your hair grow long.ScenesMonica: Yeah—Oh that’s right. You, you always wanted me too. Hey, I see you got your mustache back.ScenesRichard: Well, my nose got lonely.ScenesChandler: (to Richard’s date) And uh, you don’t have a mustache which is good. (She just smiles.) I’m Chandler; I make jokes when I’m uncomfortable.ScenesRichard’s Date: Hi, I’m Lisa.ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesRichard: Oh, I’m sorry. (Introduces them.) Lisa, (nodding at each) Monica, Chandler. We used to date.ScenesChandler: Richard! No one supposed to know about us! (Richard just smiles at him.) See I, did it again.ScenesMonica: Chandler, wh-why don’t we sit down?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’ll sit down. (He slides back into his chair.)ScenesMonica: (to Richard) It’s good to see youScenesMatire'd: (to Richard) You’re table’s ready sir.ScenesRichard: Oh. Good to see you guys.ScenesChandler: Yes. (Thinking he’s gone.)ScenesMatire'd: (motioning to the empty table next to Monica and Chandler’s) Or if you prefer, this table is available.ScenesRichard: That might be fun. (Richard and Lisa sit down.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Charity Event, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are sitting at their table.]
rows.Content: Rachel: What were you thinking?!ScenesJoey: I didn’t know it was an auction!ScenesRachel: Wh?!ScenesJoey: I figured, take a guess, help a charity, free boat!ScenesRachel: Why would a charity give away a free boat?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know! Charity?ScenesRachel: Ugh!ScenesPhoebe: Well, just buy the damn boat! (She’s still working her way through her tray of booze.)ScenesRachel: Phoebe, don’t you think you’ve had enough to drink?ScenesPhoebe: I’m just helping the kids!ScenesRachel: How is you drinking helping the kids?ScenesPhoebe: Because the more I drink, the less there is for the kids to drink.ScenesMr. Thompson: (approaching) Mr. Tribbiani.ScenesJoey: Oh hi!ScenesMr. Thompson: Your generous contribution brings us a big step closer to building the youth center.ScenesJoey: Just out of curiosity, how-how much is that boat worth?ScenesMr. Thompson: I think it was valued at 19,000ScenesJoey: (To Rachel) Hey, I was pretty close. (She just glares at him.) Uhh, so bad news. Umm, I can’t buy the boat, I don’t have any money.Scenes(Mr. Thompson looks shocked and at Rachel, she suddenly starts laughing.)ScenesRachel: Joey! Joey, good one! (Mr. Thompson starts to laugh.)ScenesMr. Thompson: That’s good. Very good! (Walks away.)Scenes(After he’s left, Rachel stops laughing and glares at Joey again.)ScenesJoey: So uh listen, I think I’m gonna take off now. (Starts to get up.)ScenesRachel: (stopping him) Hey! You…can’t…leave Joey! You agreed to buy that boat, all right?! That is a contract! And plus if you leave, my boss is gonna kill me!ScenesJoey: Well, what am I gonna do Rach?! I don’t have that kind of money!ScenesRachel: I know. Okay. (Whispering and thinking.) Okay. Okay. All right. All right, this is what we’re gonna do, we are gonna go to the next highest bidder, and we are just gonna let them buy it, and then you’re just gonna pay the difference.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesJoey: Look, I don’t know why the kids need a youth center anyway! Y’know? They should just watch TV after school like I did and I turned out fine!ScenesRachel: Not great.

rows.Scenes: The Restaurant, Monica and Chandler’s and Richard and Lisa’s tables have been pushed together and they’re all eating and talking.]
rows.Content: Monica: And so, we’re hiding in the bathroom.ScenesRichard: And-and then I sneak out and before Monica can her parents come in.ScenesMonica: So I hide in the shower and the next thing you know they’re going at it right on the bathroom floor.ScenesLisa: (laughing) Oh my God!Scenes{Transcriber’s Note: For further reading on the above story, please check out The One Where Joey Moves Out.}ScenesChandler: I got a good one, I got a good one! I once walked in on both my parents making love to the same guy.Scenes(An awkward silence ensues.)ScenesRichard: It’s so great seeing you guys again. I’d like to make a toast. (Everyone raises their glasses) Uh, as a poet once said, "In the sweetness of friendship, let there be laughter and sharing of pleasures for in the due of little things the heart finds it’s morning and is refreshed.ScenesMonica: Ohh.ScenesChandler: What?!Scenes(They all drink.)

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica and Chandler are returning to find Ross is there waiting for them.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh my God, you guys!! (He’s excited about what he thought happened.)ScenesChandler: (stopping him from going any further) Before you say anything, have we got a story for you! Guess who we bumped into at dinner!ScenesRoss: Who?ScenesChandler: Richard!ScenesRoss: What? (Excited) A-ohh! (Realizes) Ohh. Oh that’s right that’s right. That’s Richard’s favorite place too.ScenesChandler: Oh you knew that. Good!ScenesMonica: I thought you were going out with Elizabeth.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I was but uh, she was a little busy with a water balloon fight.ScenesMonica: Oh Ross, sometimes grown-ups have commitments they just can’t get out of!ScenesRoss: Y’know, maybe she is too young for me. Y’know, when I was over there and she was running around with her friends, I felt like I was a baby-sitter. I finally started to see what you guys were talking about. I don’t know what to do.ScenesMonica: Why don’t you just weigh out the good stuff about the relationship against the bad stuff. I mean that’s what I did when I first (looks at Chandler and pauses) weighing stuff.ScenesRoss: Okay umm, bad stuff. Well, I’m-I’m 12 years older than she is.ScenesMonica: If the school finds out you’re fired.ScenesRoss: Hmm.ScenesMonica: She’s leaving for three months.ScenesChandler: For camp!ScenesRoss: Okay, good stuff. Umm, well she’s-she’s sweet and pretty and…ScenesMonica: Look Ross, the only question you need to ask is, "Do you see a future?" I mean like do you see yourself marrying her? (Ross pauses in consideration.) Oh my God! You did it already! You married her, didn’t you?!ScenesRoss: No! No! I…didn’t do that. It’s just… Okay, honestly no. I don’t, I don’t see a big future with her.ScenesMonica: Okay well I think…that’s your answer.ScenesRoss: I’ve got to talk to her. Ugh, I hate this part.ScenesChandler: Hey, you have to forget about Elizabeth. I mean if you’re not careful you may not get married at all this year!

rows.Scenes: The Charity Event, Rachel and Phoebe are sitting at the table as Joey approaches.]
rows.Content: Joey: Rach! Rachel! Okay, the next highest bidder is at table one.ScenesRachel: Oh great!ScenesJoey: (To Phoebe) Oh and uh the guy who got the Paris trip is at table four.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay.ScenesRachel: (To Phoebe) Why do you care about the guy who won the Paris trip?ScenesPhoebe: It’s a trip for two! (She gets up and takes off her blouse-type thingy she’s wearing over her dress.) Excuse me. (She walks over to table four.) Excuse me, is the person who won the Paris trip at this table?ScenesEmil Alexander: That was me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, en chante. (She holds out her hand for him to kiss it, but he only shakes it.)Scenes{Transcriber’s Note: Please correct my French here.}Scenes[Cut to Joey and Rachel approaching table one.]ScenesJoey: Uhh, excuse me is there a Mr. Bowmont at this table?ScenesMr. Bowmont: That’s me.ScenesJoey: Ahh, yes. (Pushes Rachel in front of himself so that she could do the talking.)ScenesRachel: Oh well, hello. This is your lucky day Mr. Bowmont, the uh gentleman day sailer as just become available again and I believe that you made a bid of $18,000.ScenesJoey: You-you have to pay that! It’s not just a guess.ScenesRachel: (To Joey) Okay. Okay. (Shushes him.)ScenesMr. Bowmont: I was actually relieved uh I didn’t win the boat. My wife would’ve killed me.ScenesRachel: Ohh…ScenesJoey: Are you kidding me?! She’s gonna this boat!ScenesRachel: Y-Yeah! What-what is your wife’s name?ScenesMr. Bowmont: It’s Pam.ScenesRachel: Pam! Oh God okay, just imagine this, "The Pam.ScenesJoey: Aw-awww!ScenesMr. Bowmont: I don’t think she’d like that.ScenesRachel: Okay, uh-uh imagine this, "The Mr. Bowmont.ScenesJoey: Oooooh…ScenesMr. Bowmont: I don’t think so dear.ScenesRachel: Okay look, let me paint you a little picture. (She sits down next to him.) All right, you are settin’ sail up the Hudson! You’ve got the wind in your h—(sees that he’s bald)—arms! You-you get all that peace and quiet that you’ve always wanted! You get back to nature! You can go fishin’! You can—ooh, you can get one of those little hats and have people call you captain, and then when you’re old, Cappy.ScenesMr. Bowmont: What the hell, it’s for a good cause! All right!ScenesJoey: No way! It’s mine!!ScenesRachel: (To Joey) What?! What?!ScenesJoey: All that stuff you just said? I want that!ScenesRachel: But Joey you don’t have $20,000!ScenesJoey: Who cares?! I-I’ll make payments, whatever it takes, I want the Mr. Bowmont!!

rows.Scenes: Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe's, Monica is taking out the garbage as Phoebe and Joey enter. Phoebe gasps.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oh my God, you’re back!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, let me see it! Let me see your hand! (Chandler is frantically trying to wave them off.)ScenesMonica: Why do you want to see my hand?ScenesPhoebe: I wanna see what’s in your hand. I wanna see the trash.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Chandler puts his face in his hands as Joey and Phoebe start to examine the trash.)ScenesPhoebe: Eww! Oh, it’s all dirty. You should throw this out.ScenesMonica: (suspiciously) Okay. (Exits to carry out Phoebe’s wishes.)ScenesChandler: (after the door closes) What did you guys just do?!ScenesPhoebe: What happened?ScenesChandler: Richard was there so I couldn’t do it!ScenesJoey: What?! Noooo… (Phoebe gasps.)ScenesChandler: I’m gonna do it tomorrow y’know, and-and surprise her, but now you’ve ruined it!ScenesJoey: We didn’t ruin it!ScenesChandler: Who walks into a room and asks to see a person’s hands?!ScenesPhoebe: Well, a palm reader, a manicurist, a hand doctor…ScenesJoey: Glove salesman!ScenesPhoebe: Good one! Yeah.ScenesChandler: This is terrible. What am I going to do?ScenesPhoebe: Look, she only suspects something okay? She doesn’t know for sure, so just throw her off the track.ScenesChandler: That’s right, I can throw her off. I can make her think marriage is the last thing on my mind.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Yeah! Convince her that-that you’re scared of commitment! Convince her that you’re a little coward!ScenesChandler: I can do that, I’ve had 30 years of practice.ScenesJoey: Hey, being you is finally gonna pay off! (They give each other fives.)ScenesMonica: (entering) I had to go all the way to the basement because some idiot keeps stuffing the trash chute with pizza boxes!ScenesJoey: That guy’s still doing that?!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey! (Sees Monica, gasps, and runs over to her.) Oh my God you’re here, let me see your hand!!ScenesPhoebe: No, you’re too late!!! She already took out the trash!!!

rows.Scenes: Outside of Elizabeth’s dormitory, Ross is exiting after breaking up with her and we can hear his thoughts.]
rows.Content: Ross: (in his head) Wow! I have never had such a healthy break-up! She was such a grown-up about it! She didn’t seem too immature for me! Did I just make a huge mistake?ScenesElizabeth: (sticking her head out her window) Ross! Wait!ScenesRoss: Elizabeth, thank God! I was just thinking about…ScenesElizabeth: You suck!!ScenesRoss: What?!Scenes(She throws a water balloon at him and hits him on the head and hits him again at the waist with another one.)ScenesRoss: Okay, break-up’s still on!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is looking out the window and Joey is sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, okay, here she comes! (Sits on the couch next to him.) How do I look? Do I look like a guy who doesn’t want to get married?ScenesJoey: Yeah! And also, a little like a French guy. (They both squint at each other.) I never noticed that before.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi guys!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesMonica: What are you up too?ScenesChandler: Oh, just hanging out, talkin’ about uh, websites. (Joey laughs.) Yeah, we saw this really interesting website about marriage and how totally unnecessary it is and how its just a way for the government to keep tabs on you.ScenesJoey: (laughs) Yeah, Big Brother.ScenesMonica: Well that’s a little crazy. Although I am y’know glad to hear that you’re branching out on what you look at on the Internet.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well… Y’know, it just got me thinking though, why would anybody ever want to get married huh?ScenesMonica: Why?! To celebrate your relationship! To solidify your commitment! To declare your love for one another to the world!ScenesChandler: Eh…ScenesMonica: Okay well that’s good to know.Scenes(We hear the backup horn of a truck and see through the window that the Mr. Bowmont has arrived.)ScenesJoey: (all excited) The Mr. Bowmont’s here!!! (Jumps over the back off the couch and runs out into the street.)

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Restaurant’s kitchen, she’s cooking as a waitress sticks her head in.]
rows.Content: Waitress: Hey Monica, there’s a customer who wants to complement the chef, should I let him in?ScenesMonica: Sure, I love this part! (Starts to look busy.)ScenesWaitress: (to the customer) Come on in.Scenes(The customer turns out to be…)ScenesRichard: Hi!ScenesMonica: Richard!ScenesRichard: Actually, I’m not here to complement the chef.ScenesMonica: Ohh… Oh, that’s okay I hate when people come back to complement the chef. Like I have nothing better to do! So what’s up?ScenesRichard: Well, it was great seeing you the other night.ScenesMonica: Oh, good to see you too.
